Software Description:
Java is a programming language and computing platform first released by Sun Microsystems in 1995. It has evolved from humble beginnings to power a large share of today’s digital world, by providing the reliable platform upon which many services and applications are built. New, innovative products and digital services designed for the future continue to rely on Java, as well. 
Description Source: https://www.java.com/en/download/help/whatis_java.html
Core Features: Java is platform-independent, object-oriented, and has a large standard library. It supports multithreading, garbage collection, and exception handling. Java applications are typically compiled to bytecode that can run on any Java virtual machine (JVM).
General Tags: Programming Language, Computing Platform
AI Description: Java is a widely-used programming language and computing platform that is designed to be fast, secure, and reliable. It is commonly used for building mobile applications, web applications, enterprise applications, and more.

Software Description:
JAX is Autograd and XLA, brought together for high-performance numerical computing, including large-scale machine learning research. 
Description Source: https://github.com/google/jax
Core Features: JAX provides a functional framework that extends NumPy and enables GPU/TPU acceleration, automatic differentiation for Python and NumPy functions, custom vectorizable NumPy functions, composable transformations, and efficient gradient computation.
General Tags: Machine Learning, Numerical Computing, Scientific Computing
AI Description: JAX is an open-source software library for high-performance machine learning research, particularly for automatic differentiation, and numerical and scientific computing.

Software Description:
JBIG-KIT is a software implementation of the JBIG1 data compression standard (ITU-T T.82), which was designed for bi-level image data, such as scanned documents. This library is available in portable C code. It is widely used in fax products, printer firmware, printer drivers, document management systems and imaging software. 
Description Source: https://www.cl.cam.ac.uk/~mgk25/jbigkit/
Jcvi is a collection of Python libraries to parse bioinformatics files, or perform computation related to assembly, annotation, and comparative genomics.
Core Features: JCVI offers a suite of bioinformatics tools for analyzing biological data, including sequence alignment, assembly, visualization, and annotation. These tools are designed to assist researchers in genomics, metagenomics, transcriptomics, and other areas of computational biology.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology
AI Description: J. Craig Venter Institute (JCVI) software tools for bioinformatics analysis and computational biology.

Software Description:
JDFTx is a plane-wave density-functional theory (DFT) code designed to be as easy to develop with as it is easy to use. JDFTx is written using highly-templated and object oriented C++11 code in order to express all the physics in the DFT++ algeraic framework [13], while simultaneously maintaining a small memory footprint and supporting a range of hardware architectures (such as GPUs using CUDA) without requiring hand-optimized implementations for each architecture. 
Description Source: https://jdftx.org/
Core Features: Performs Density-Functional Theory Calculations, Supports Joint Density-Functional Theory (Jdft), Allows For Electronic Structure Analysis Of Materials, Includes Features For Simulating Various Physical Properties
General Tags: Computational Software, Electronic Structure Calculations, Materials Science
AI Description: JDFTx is a computational package for joint density-functional theory (JDFT) calculations. It enables electronic structure calculations for materials using the JDFT formalism, offering a versatile tool for a wide range of research applications.

Core Features: Java Development, Compilation, Documentation Generation, Runtime Environment, Archiving
General Tags: Development Kit, Software Development, Java
AI Description: JDK (Java Development Kit) is a software development environment used for developing Java applications. It includes a Java Runtime Environment (JRE), an interpreter/loader (Java), a compiler (javac), an archiver (jar), a documentation generator (Javadoc), and some other tools needed in Java development.

Software Description: Jellyfish is a fast and memory-efficient software for counting k-mers in DNA sequences, which are commonly used in genome analysis and sequence assembly. It provides algorithms for k-mer counting, storage, and querying to extract valuable insights from biological data.
Core Features:
1. Counting k-mers in DNA sequences
2. Memory-efficient data storage
3. Fast querying of k-mer counts
4. Support for large sequencing datasets
General Tags: K-Mer Counting, DNA Sequences, Sequence Analysis
AI Description: Jellyfish is a tool for fast, memory-efficient counting of k-mers in DNA sequences. It has the capability to efficiently store and query k-mer counts in large sequencing datasets.

Software Description: jemalloc is a general purpose malloc(3) implementation that emphasizes fragmentation avoidance and scalable concurrency support.
Core Features: Efficient Memory Allocation & Deallocation, Optimized For Multithreaded Applications, Scalable & Customizable, Supports Advanced Memory Management Features
General Tags: Memory Allocator, Performance Optimization, Multithreading
AI Description: jemalloc is a general-purpose memory allocator implementation designed for high performance in multithreaded applications. It is widely used in the software industry to optimize memory allocation and improve overall performance of applications.

Software Description: Jmol: an open-source Java viewer for chemical structures in 3D with features for chemicals, crystals, materials and biomolecules
Core Features: Jmol allows users to view 3D chemical structures, display crystal structures, visualize protein structures, animate molecules, and perform measurements and analysis on molecular structures. It supports a wide range of file formats for input and output, including CIF, PDB, XYZ, and more. Users can customize the display of molecules with various rendering options, color schemes, and labeling.
General Tags: Molecular Visualization, Molecular Analysis, Chemistry
AI Description: Jmol is an open-source Java viewer for chemical structures in 3D with features for visualization, analysis, and manipulation of molecular structures.

Software Description:
JSON-C implements a reference counting object model that allows you to easily construct JSON objects in C, output them as JSON formatted strings and parse JSON formatted strings back into the C representation of JSON objects. It aims to conform to RFC 7159. 
Description Source: https://github.com/json-c/json-c/wiki
Core Features: Parsing Json Input, Creating Json Output, Manipulating Json Data Structures, Validating Json Data
General Tags: C Library, Json Encoding, Json Decoding, Data Manipulation
AI Description: Json-c is a C library for encoding, decoding, and manipulating JSON data. It provides functions for parsing JSON input, creating JSON output, manipulating JSON data structures, and validating JSON data.

Software Description:
JsonCpp is a C++ library that allows manipulating JSON values, including serialization and deserialization to and from strings. It can also preserve existing comment in unserialization/serialization steps, making it a convenient format to store user input files. 
Description Source: https://github.com/open-source-parsers/jsoncpp
Core Features: Parsing Json Data, Generating Json Data, Manipulating Json Data Structures, Support For C++ Applications
General Tags: C++, Json, Library, Data Manipulation
AI Description: JsonCpp is a C++ library that allows manipulating JSON data structures. It provides features for parsing, generating, and manipulating JSON data in C++ applications.

Core Features: Some core features of Judy include high performance, memory efficiency, scalability with large data sets, support for dynamic arrays, and a simple API for easy integration.
General Tags: C Library, Data Management, Key/Value Pairs
AI Description: Judy is a C library that provides a collection of functions to efficiently manage data arrays to store and retrieve key/value pairs.

RP Name: Aces, Anvil, Bridges-2, Darwin, Delta, Expanse, Faster, Ookami
Software Description:
Julia is a general purpose high-performance flexible programming language which can be used to write any application. It is well-suited for scientific and numerical computing. 
Description Source: https://julialang.org/
Core Features: Julia combines the high-level ease of use and flexibility of languages like Python and Matlab with the speed and performance of lower-level languages like C and Fortran. It offers a just-in-time compiler that generates optimized machine code using LLVM, making it highly efficient for numerical and scientific computing. Julia supports multiple dispatch, which allows functions to be defined with multiple methods with different argument types or numbers. It also has built-in package manager and a vast ecosystem of packages for various domains such as data science, machine learning, optimization, and more.
General Tags: Programming Language, Technical Computing, High-Performance Computing, Scientific Computing, Numerical Analysis
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Anvil: https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/software/julia 
Bridges-2: https://www.psc.edu/resources/software/julia 
Delta: https://docs.ncsa.illinois.edu/systems/delta/en/latest/user_guide/software.html 
Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/ 
Ookami: https://www.stonybrook.edu/commcms/ookami/support/faq/software_on_ookami
AI Description: Julia is a high-level, high-performance dynamic programming language for technical computing, with syntax that is familiar to users of other technical computing environments. It provides a sophisticated compiler, distributed parallel execution, numerical accuracy, and extensive mathematical function libraries.

Core Features: Supports Writing & Running Automated Tests In Java, Provides Annotations For Test Methods, Includes Assertion Methods For Test Results, Supports Test Fixtures To Set Up Initial Conditions, Generates Test Reports For Easy Result Analysis
General Tags: Unit Testing, Java, Testing Framework
AI Description: JUnit is a popular open-source unit testing framework for Java programming language. It is widely used by developers to write and run repeatable automated tests to ensure the correctness of their code.

Software Description: JupyterLab is the latest web-based interactive development environment for notebooks, code, and data. Its flexible interface allows users to configure and arrange workflows in data science, scientific computing, computational journalism, and machine learning.
Core Features: Interactive Computing, Data Visualization, Collaborative Notebooks, Support For Multiple Programming Languages
General Tags: Data Science, Scientific Computing, Machine Learning
AI Description: Jupyter is an open-source web application that allows you to create and share documents that contain live code, equations, visualizations, and narrative text. It supports over 40 programming languages, including Python, R, and Julia, and is widely used in data science, scientific computing, and machine learning projects.

Software Description: The Jupyter Server provides the backend (i.e. the core services, APIs, and REST endpoints) for Jupyter web applications like Jupyter notebook, JupyterLab, and Voila.
Core Features: Web-Based Interface, Interactive Computational Environments, Support For Multiple Programming Languages
General Tags: Interactive Computing, Web-Based Interface, Notebooks
AI Description: Jupyter server is a flexible and extensible tool that allows users to run interactive computational environments in various programming languages. It provides a web-based interface for running Jupyter notebooks, code, and data analysis.

Software Description: JupyterHub brings the power of notebooks to groups of users. It gives users access to computational environments and resources without burdening the users with installation and maintenance tasks.
Core Features: Multi-User Jupyter Notebook Server, Browser-Based Interface, Support For Multiple Languages Including Python, R, & Julia, Scalability For Large Groups Of Users, Customizable User Environments, Integration With Authentication Services Like Oauth & Ldap
General Tags: Data Science, Collaborative Computing, Notebook Environment, Interactive Computing
AI Description: JupyterHub brings the power of Jupyter Notebooks to groups of users. It allows multiple users to access Jupyter Notebooks through a browser, providing a collaborative and interactive environment for data science, scientific computing, and other computational tasks.

Software Description: JupyterLab is the latest web-based interactive development environment for notebooks, code, and data. Its flexible interface allows users to configure and arrange workflows in data science, scientific computing, computational journalism, and machine learning.
Core Features: Web-Based Interface For Interactive Computing, Support For Jupyter Notebooks, Text Editors, Terminals, & Custom Components, Integration With Data Visualization Libraries & Tools, Ability To Work With Multiple Programming Languages Like Python, R, & Julia, Customizable User Interface With Drag-&-Drop Features, Interactive Widgets For Data Exploration & Visualization
General Tags: Interactive Computing, Data Visualization, Jupyter Notebooks, Web-Based Interface, Code Editing
AI Description: JupyterLab is a web-based interactive development environment for Jupyter notebooks, code, and data. It offers a flexible and powerful user interface to work with data, code, and visualization in a seamless manner.

Software Description: Jupyter interactive notebook server extension that allows users to interact with environment modules before launching kernels. The extension uses Lmod's Python interface to accomplish module-related tasks like loading, unloading, saving collections, etc.
Core Features: Integration Of Lmod With Jupyter Notebooks, Software Environment Management, Module Loading & Unloading, Environment Variable Handling
General Tags: Jupyter Notebook, Environment Modules, Software Environment Management
AI Description: jupyterlmod is an extension for Jupyter Notebooks that allows users to interact with Lmod, the Environment Modules System, directly within the Jupyter environment. It enables users to manage software environments, load and unload modules, and handle environment variables conveniently within Jupyter Notebook.

Software Description: The Jupyter Notebook is the original web application for creating and sharing computational documents. It offers a simple, streamlined, document-centric experience.

KaHIP - Karlsruhe High Quality Partitioning - is a family of graph partitioning programs. It includes KaFFPa (Karlsruhe Fast Flow Partitioner), which is a multilevel graph partitioning algorithm, in its variants Strong, Eco and Fast, KaFFPaE (KaFFPaEvolutionary) which is a parallel evolutionary algorithm that uses KaFFPa to provide combine and mutation operations, as well as KaBaPE which extends the evolutionary algorithm. Moreover, specialized techniques are included to partition road networks (Buffoon), to output a vertex separator from a given partition or techniques geared towards efficient partitioning of social networks. 
Description Source: https://kahip.github.io/
Core Features: Efficient Computation Of High-Quality Graph Partitions, Multiple Partitioning Algorithms, Optimization For Load Balancing & Communication Reduction, Suitable For Large-Scale Parallel Applications
General Tags: Graph Partitioning, High-Performance Computing, Parallel Computing
AI Description: KaHIP (Karlsruhe High Quality Partitioning) is a family of graph partitioning programs that aims to efficiently compute high-quality graph partitions. It provides several partitioning algorithms to balance computational load and minimize communication overhead. KaHIP is suitable for large-scale parallel applications and is widely used in the field of high-performance computing.

Software Description: Kaiju is a tool for fast taxonomic classification of metagenomic sequencing reads using a protein reference database.
Core Features: Taxonomic Classification Of DNA Sequences, High Accuracy In Assigning Taxonomic Labels, Utilizes Burrows-Wheeler Transform & Fm-Index, Designed For High-Throughput Sequencing Reads
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Genomics, Sequencing Data
AI Description: Kaiju is a program for the taxonomic classification of high-throughput sequencing reads. It assigns taxonomic labels to short DNA sequences with near-perfect accuracy. Kaiju is based on the Burrows-Wheeler transform (BWT) and the FM-index. It has been designed to analyze sequencing reads generated by high-throughput sequencing technologies, such as Illumina, Pacific Biosciences, and Ion Torrent.

Software Description: kakscalculator2 is a toolkit of incorporating gamma series methods and sliding window strategies.
Core Features:
1. Advanced mathematical calculations
2. User-friendly interface
3. Efficient computation of complex problems
4. Mathematical modeling capabilities
General Tags: Mathematics, Software, Computation
AI Description: kakscalculator2 is a software tool designed for performing advanced mathematical calculations and computations. It provides a user-friendly interface for solving complex mathematical problems efficiently.

Software Description:
Kalign is a fast multiple sequence alignment program for biological sequences. 
Description Source: https://github.com/TimoLassmann/kalign
Core Features: Fast & Accurate Multiple Sequence Alignment, Utilizes The Wu-Manber Approximate String Matching Algorithm, Suitable For Aligning Large Sets Of Sequences, Supports DNA, RNA, & Protein Sequences
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Alignment, DNA, RNA, Protein, Wu-Manber Algorithm
AI Description: Kalign is a fast and accurate multiple sequence alignment algorithm that utilizes the Wu-Manber approximate string matching algorithm to efficiently align large sets of sequences. It is commonly used in bioinformatics for aligning DNA, RNA, and protein sequences.

Software Description: Kallisto is a program for quantifying abundances of transcripts from bulk and single-cell RNA-Seq data, or more generally of target sequences using high-throughput sequencing reads.
Core Features: Efficient & Ultrafast RNA-Seq Quantification, Pseudoalignment-Based Approach, Accurate & Reliable Transcript Quantification, Compatibility With Standard RNA-Seq Analysis Pipelines, Multiple Output Formats For Downstream Analysis
General Tags: RNA-Seq, Transcriptomics, Bioinformatics, Gene Expression Analysis, Computational Biology
AI Description: kallisto is a program for quantifying abundances of transcripts from RNA-Seq data, using pseudoalignment to quickly determine compatibility of reads with targets, allowing rapid transcript quantification.

Software Description: KAUST BLAS (KBLAS) is a high performance CUDA library implementing a subset of BLAS as well as Linear Algebra PACKage (LAPACK) routines on NVIDIA GPUs.
Core Features: 1. Accelerated linear algebra operations on NVIDIA GPUs. 2. Optimized Basic Linear Algebra Subroutines (BLAS) for high-performance computing. 3. Dense matrix operations such as matrix-matrix multiplication, matrix-vector multiplication, etc. 4. Support for various data types and precision levels. 5. High-performance and parallel computation capabilities.
General Tags: Linear Algebra, Gpu-Accelerated, Hpc, Parallel Computing
AI Description: KBLAS is a GPU-accelerated linear algebra library for high-performance computing (HPC) applications. It provides optimized implementations of basic linear algebra subroutines (BLAS) and dense matrix operations for NVIDIA GPUs.

Core Features: 1. Provides XKB protocol and extension definitions. 2. Allows for usage with X11 protocol libraries. 3. Defines keyboard properties and types for X Window System.
General Tags: X11 Protocol, Keyboard Properties
AI Description: The kbproto package provides the core XKB protocol and extension definitions for usage with X11 protocol libraries.

Core Features: Visualize Profiling Data, Identify Performance Bottlenecks, Interact With Call Graphs & Call Trees, View Cache Utilization & Branch Prediction
General Tags: Performance Analysis, Software Profiling, Software Visualization
AI Description: KCacheGrind is a visualisation tool that allows to profile data and identify performance bottlenecks in software applications. It is commonly used for analyzing profiling data generated by Cachegrind and Callgrind.

Software Description: Kentutils: UCSC command line bioinformatic utilities.
Core Features:
1. Utilities for manipulating genomic data.
2. Tools for analyzing genome sequences.
3. Support for various file formats commonly used in genomics.
General Tags: Genomics, Genome Browser, Utilities
AI Description: kentutils is a collection of utilities provided by the UCSC Genome Browser that allow for the manipulation and analysis of genomic data. These tools are particularly useful for researchers working with genomics data and looking to perform various operations on genome sequences.

Software Description:
Keras is a deep learning API written in Python and capable of running on top of either JAX, TensorFlow, or PyTorch. 
Description Source: https://keras.io/about/
Core Features:
1. User-friendly API
2. Modular and extensible
3. Supports both convolutional networks and recurrent networks, as well as combinations of the two
4. Runs seamlessly on CPU and GPU
General Tags: Neural Networks, Deep Learning, Machine Learning
AI Description: Keras is an open-source neural network library written in Python. It is capable of running on top of TensorFlow, Microsoft Cognitive Toolkit, Theano, or PlaidML. Designed with user-friendliness and modularity as its guiding principles, Keras is known for its ease of use and flexibility, allowing users to experiment with deep neural networks.

Software Description: Khmer is a tool for k-mer counting, filtering, and graph traversal FTW!
Core Features: K-Mer Counting, Data Trimming & Error-Trimming, Digital Normalization Of Reads, Partitioning Large Data Sets
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Hpc Tools, Computational Software
AI Description: Khmer is a set of tools for working with DNA sequence data that is extremely efficient both in terms of speed and memory consumption. It is designed to pre-process sequencing data to reduce the memory requirements of de Bruijn graph based assemblers for metagenome data. The tools can be used for counting k-mers and finding k-mers that occur many times, trimming and error-trimming data, digital normalization of reads, and partitioning large data sets.

Software Description:
The Knowledgebase of Interatomic Models (KIM) Application Programming Interface (API) defines a standard (the Portable Model Interface (PMI)) for how molecular simulators interface with interatomic models (also called potentials or force-fields). This allows a single computer implementation of a Portable Model (PM) to be used without modification within multiple simulator codes. A PM can include code and parameters all in one. Or, a PM can include just parameters and use a separate Model Driver (MD) library containing the code. 
Description Source: https://openkim.org/kim-api/
Core Features:
1. Standardizes the interface between atomistic simulation codes and interatomic potential models.
2. Enables the seamless integration of new potential models into existing simulation codes.
3. Facilitates the sharing and dissemination of interatomic models within the materials science community.
4. Supports multiple programming languages, including C/C++, Fortran, Python, and MATLAB.
General Tags: Computational Software, Hpc Tools
AI Description: The Knowledgebase for Interatomic Models (KIM) Application Programming Interface (API) is an open framework for the development of interoperable atomistic and multiscale simulation codes. It provides a common interface for atomistic simulations and facilitates the incorporation and sharing of interatomic models.

Software Description:
kineto is a CPU+GPU Profiling library that provides access to timeline traces and hardware performance counters. 
Description Source: https://github.com/pytorch/kineto
Core Features: Kinematic Analysis Of Mechanical Systems, Dynamic Analysis Of Mechanical Systems, Simulation Of Rigid Body Motion With Joints & Constraints, Visualization Of Motion & Forces In Mechanical Systems
General Tags: Mechanical Engineering, Simulation, Mechanical Systems, Kinematics, Dynamics
AI Description: Kineto is a software suite designed for analyzing and simulating the dynamics of mechanical systems. It provides tools for both kinematic and dynamic analysis of systems with rigid bodies, joints, and constraints. Kineto is particularly useful for studying the motion and forces in complex mechanical systems.

Software Description: kissDE is a R package, similar to DEseq, but which works on pairs of variants, and tests if a variant is enriched in one condition.
Core Features: Simulation Of Gene Expression Dynamics, Modeling Protein Degradation Kinetics, Optimization Of Synthetic Genetic Circuits, Analysis Of Synthetic Biological Systems
General Tags: Computational Biology, Bioinformatics
AI Description: KISSDE (Kinetic Simulator of Synthetic Degradation and Expression) is a software tool for simulating the kinetics of gene expression and protein degradation in synthetic biological systems. It allows users to model the dynamics of gene expression and protein degradation processes to better understand and optimize synthetic genetic circuits.

Software Description: KisSplice is a software that enables to analyse RNA-seq data with or without a reference genome.
Core Features: Identification Of Various RNA Splicing Events, Quantification Of Splicing Events, Visualization Of Splicing Patterns, Detection Of Novel Splicing Events, Analysis Of Alternative Splicing Dynamics
General Tags: Bioinformatics, RNA-Seq, Splicing, Transcriptomics
AI Description: Kissplice is a bioinformatics tool designed for the analysis of RNA-Seq data to identify and quantify various types of RNA splicing events such as exon skipping, intron retention, and alternative 5' or 3' splicing.

Software Description: KisSplice can also be used when a reference (annotated) genome is available, in order to annotate the variants found and help prioritize cases to validate experimentally. In this case, the results of KisSplice are mapped to the reference genome, using for instance STAR, and the mapping results are analysed using KisSplice2RefGenome.
Core Features:
1. Alignment of RNA-Seq reads to a reference genome.
2. Detection of fusions and alternative splicing events.
3. Identification of various types of splicing events like exon skipping and intron retention.
4. Provides detailed reports and visualizations for the detected events.
General Tags: Computational Biology, RNA-Seq Analysis, Splice Junction Detection
AI Description: Kissplice2refgenome is a computational tool used for the detection of fusions and alternative splicing events in RNA-Seq data. It aligns reads on a reference genome and detects different types of events including fusions, exon skipping, intron retention, and more.

Software Description: KMA is a mapping method designed to map raw reads directly against redundant databases, in an ultra-fast manner using seed and extend.
Core Features: Efficient Mapping Of Sequencing Reads, Support For Nucleotide & Amino Acid Sequences, K-Mer Based Alignment, High Accuracy In Read Mapping
General Tags: Sequence Alignment, Read Mapping, Bioinformatics
AI Description: KMA (K-mer Matching Alignment) is a tool for mapping sequencing reads to reference sequences. It utilizes k-mer based alignment to efficiently and accurately map reads in both nucleotide and amino acid sequence data.

Software Description: Kmc is a tool for efficient k-mer counting and filtering of reads based on k-mer content.
Core Features:
1. Efficient k-mer counting for large-scale sequencing datasets
2. Support for both DNA and RNA sequences
3. Scalability to handle massive datasets
4. Low memory requirements
5. Parallel processing capabilities for faster computations
General Tags: Sequence Analysis, Genome Assembly, Metagenomics
AI Description: KMC (K-mer Counter) is a fast and space-efficient tool for counting k-mers (substrings of length k) in DNA or RNA sequences. It is commonly used for tasks such as genome assembly, sequence error correction, and metagenomic analysis.

Software Description: Jellyfish is a tool for fast, memory-efficient counting of k-mers in DNA. A k-mer is a substring of length k, and counting the occurrences of all such substrings is a central step in many analyses of DNA sequence.
Core Features:
1. Counting k-mers in DNA or RNA sequences
2. Utilizes the Jellyfish k-mer counter for efficient processing
3. Can handle large-scale genomic data sets
4. Supports multiple k-mer sizes and input formats
5. Provides options for customizing k-mer counting parameters
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Sequence Analysis
AI Description: Kmer-Jellyfish is a software tool for counting k-mers using the Jellyfish k-mer counter. K-mers are substrings of length k in a DNA or RNA sequence and are commonly used in various bioinformatics applications.

Software Description: KmerGenie estimates the best k-mer length for genome de novo assembly.
Core Features: Estimates The Optimal K-Mer Length For De Novo Genome Assembly, Analyzes K-Mer Occurrence Histograms From Input Reads, Helps Avoid Excessive Memory Usage & Computational Time In Assembly Processes
General Tags: Genome Assembly, Bioinformatics, De Bruijn Graph
AI Description: kmergenie is a software tool used for estimating the best k-mer length for genome de novo assembly. It analyzes the histogram of k-mer occurrences in the input reads and recommends the optimal k-mer length to use for assembly.

Software Description: Kneaddata is a tool designed to perform quality control on metagenomic sequencing data.
Core Features: Quality Control For Metagenomic & Metatranscriptomic Data, Removal Of Contaminating Host Sequences, Improvement Of Data Quality For Downstream Analysis, Support For Various Sequencing Platforms, Customizable Parameters For Quality Filtering
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Metagenomics, Data Quality Control
AI Description: KneadData is a tool designed to perform quality control on metagenomic and metatranscriptomic sequencing data, specifically targeted at removing contaminating host sequences and improving the data quality for downstream analysis.

Software Description: KNIME, the Konstanz Information Miner, is a free and open-source data analytics, reporting and integration platform. KNIME integrates various components for machine learning and data mining through its modular data pipelining Building Blocks of Analytics concept.
Core Features: Some key features of KNIME include visual programming, support for various data formats and sources, integration with other data science tools such as Python and R, extensive set of data manipulation and analysis nodes, advanced machine learning capabilities, and scalability for big data processing.
General Tags: Data Analytics, Data Integration, Data Visualization
AI Description: KNIME is an open-source data analytics, reporting, and integration platform. It allows users to visually design data flows, execute data processing, data cleansing, analysis, and reporting without needing to write any code.

Core Features:
1. Nonlinear optimization algorithms
2. Large-scale optimization capabilities
3. Efficient handling of thousands to millions of variables and constraints
4. Ability to solve continuous optimization problems
5. Support for various problem types and advanced modeling features
General Tags: Optimization, Large-Scale, Nonlinear, Modeling
AI Description: Knitro is a proprietary software package for solving large-scale optimization problems. It provides a suite of optimization algorithms designed to handle continuous nonlinear optimization problems efficiently. Knitro is suitable for solving problems with thousands to millions of variables and constraints.

Software Description: Kokkos is a programming model and C++ library for writing performance portable parallel applications that can run efficiently on diverse high-performance computing architectures. It enables developers to write code once and execute it on different platforms, such as CPUs, GPUs, and accelerators.
Core Features:
1. Abstraction of memory layout and parallel execution to achieve performance portability
2. Array programming to express parallel algorithms
3. Support for multiple backends such as OpenMP, CUDA, and HIP
4. Integration with existing programming models like MPI and pthreads
5. Extensive documentation and user support
General Tags: Programming Model, Performance Portability, Parallel Computing
AI Description: Kokkos is a programming model for writing performance portable parallel applications in C++. It allows developers to write code once and run efficiently on multiple types of heterogeneous architectures.

Software Description: Kover is an out-of-core implementation of rule-based machine learning algorithms that has been tailored for genomic biomarker discovery.
Core Features: Compute K-Coverage Using K-Mers From Multiple Sequencing Datasets, Identify Underrepresented Genomic Regions
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Sequence Analysis
AI Description: Kover is a tool for computing k-coverage using k-mers from multiple sequencing datasets.

Software Description:
Kraken 2 is the newest version of Kraken, a taxonomic classification system using exact k-mer matches to achieve high accuracy and fast classification speeds. This classifier matches each k-mer within a query sequence to the lowest common ancestor (LCA) of all genomes containing the given k-mer. The k-mer assignments inform the classification algorithm. 
Description Source: https://github.com/DerrickWood/kraken2/wiki/About-Kraken-3
Krakentools is a suite of scripts to be used for post-analysis of Kraken/KrakenUniq/Kraken2/Bracken results.
Core Features:
1. Taxonomic sequence classification
2. Validation of metagenomics and metatranscriptomics data
3. Fast and accurate analysis of large-scale sequencing datasets
4. Supports various input formats for sequencing data
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Metagenomics, Computational Biology, Sequence Classification, Metatranscriptomics
AI Description: KrakenTools is a collection of tools for taxonomic sequence classification and validation of metagenomics and metatranscriptomics sequencing data. It is designed to be fast, accurate, and efficient for analyzing large-scale sequencing datasets.

Core Features: 1. Pre-configured environment for R programming language. 2. Includes essential dependencies commonly used in R applications. 3. Facilitates easy development and execution of R scripts. 4. Suitable for researchers and developers working with R language and packages.
General Tags: Container, R, Programming, Development
AI Description: A container image for running R programming language applications. It provides a pre-configured environment with R and essential dependencies for seamless development and execution of R scripts.

Core Features: 1. Fast and efficient package management system. 2. Allows easy creation and management of virtual environments. 3. Enables seamless installation, update, and removal of Python packages and dependencies. 4. Supports multiple platforms, including Windows, macOS, and Linux.
General Tags: Conda Package, Environment Management, Python
AI Description: A lightweight, minimalistic version of the Conda package and environment management system, containing only essential components needed to run Python applications and libraries efficiently.

Software Description: Lambda is a local aligner optimized for many query sequences and searches in protein space.
Core Features:
1. Serverless computing
2. Automatic scaling
3. Pay-per-use pricing model
4. Integration with various AWS services
General Tags: Programming Language, Serverless Computing, Cloud Services
AI Description: Lambda is a programming language that is supported by Amazon Web Services. It allows users to write serverless code to run on AWS infrastructure without managing servers.

Software Description:
LAME is a high quality MPEG Audio Layer III (MP3) encoder licensed under the LGPL. 
Description Source: https://lame.sourceforge.io/
Core Features: LAME provides excellent sound quality with high compression rates, supports various encoding options and settings, is open-source and actively maintained.
General Tags: Audio Encoding, Mp3, Open-Source
AI Description: LAME is a high-quality MPEG Audio Layer III (MP3) encoder licensed under the GNU Lesser General Public License (LGPL). It is considered one of the best MP3 encoders available.

RP Name: Aces, Anvil, Bridges-2, Darwin, Delta, Expanse, Faster, Ookami, Stampede3
Software Description: LAMMPS is a classical molecular dynamics code with a focus on materials modeling. LAMMPS has potentials for solid-state materials (metals, semiconductors) and soft matter (biomolecules, polymers) and coarse-grained or mesoscopic systems. It can be used to model atoms or, more generically, as a parallel particle simulator at the atomic, meso, or continuum scale.
Core Features: Classical Molecular Dynamics Simulations, Support For Parallel Execution On A Range Of Computing Architectures, Wide Selection Of Force Fields & Potential Models, Extensible Through User-Defined Functionalities & Customizations
General Tags: Molecular Dynamics, Simulation, Computational Chemistry
RP Software Documentation:

AI Description: LAMMPS (Large-scale Atomic/Molecular Massively Parallel Simulator) is a classical molecular dynamics code designed for simulating large-scale atomistic systems. It is highly versatile and can be used to model a wide range of materials and complex molecular structures.

Software Description: LAPACK is a library of Fortran subroutines for solving the most commonly occurring problems in numerical linear algebra.
Core Features: Solving Systems Of Simultaneous Linear Equations, Least-Squares Solutions Of Linear Systems Of Equations, Eigenvalue Problems, Singular Value Problems
General Tags: Numerical Linear Algebra, Software Library, Mathematics
AI Description: LAPACK (Linear Algebra PACKage) is a software library for numerical linear algebra that provides routines for solving systems of simultaneous linear equations, least-squares solutions of linear systems of equations, eigenvalue problems, and singular value problems.

Software Description:
The Lasso is a linear model that estimates sparse coefficients. It is useful in some contexts due to its tendency to prefer solutions with fewer non-zero coefficients, effectively reducing the number of features upon which the given solution is dependent. For this reason, Lasso and its variants are fundamental to the field of compressed sensing. 
Description Source: https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/linear_model.html#lasso
Core Features:
1. Implements lasso regression for feature selection and regularization. 
2. Helps in reducing overfitting by penalizing the absolute size of the regression coefficients. 
3. Supports various optimization algorithms for efficient model fitting. 
4. Allows users to tune the regularization parameter for optimal model performance.
General Tags: Python Library, Machine Learning, Regression Analysis
AI Description: Lasso-python is a Python library that provides tools for lasso regression, a linear regression technique that performs variable selection and regularization to improve the model's prediction and interpretability.

Software Description: Last is used to finds & aligns related regions of sequences.
Core Features: 1. Performs read alignment to a reference genome. 2. Supports paired-end and single-end reads. 3. Outputs alignments in SAM/BAM format. 4. Efficiently handles large datasets. 5. Utilizes a seed-and-extend algorithm for alignment.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Alignment, Genomics
AI Description: Last is a program for aligning sequencing reads to a reference genome with important applications in the field of bioinformatics.

Software Description: LASTZ - pairwise DNA sequence aligner
Core Features:
1. High performance and speed in DNA sequence alignment.
2. Ability to handle large genomes and datasets.
3. Supports various output formats for alignments and visualization.
4. Offers flexibility in specifying alignment parameters and scoring.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, DNA Sequencing, Alignment, Comparative Genomics
AI Description: Lastz is a program for aligning DNA sequences, a key step in comparative genomics analysis. It efficiently finds local alignments between sequences, identifying areas of similarity and potential evolutionary relationships.

Research Field: Natural Sciences, Mathematics, Computer & Information Sciences, Engineering & Technology
Core Features: High-Quality Typesetting For Complex Mathematical Equations & Symbols, Customization Of Document Layout & Styles, Automatic Generation Of Table Of Contents, Lists Of Figures/Tables, & Citations, Easy Integration Of Graphics & Images, Support For Cross-Referencing & Bibliography Management, Flexible & Powerful System For Creating Professional-Looking Documents
General Tags: Typesetting, Scientific Communication, Document Preparation
AI Description: LaTeX is a typesetting system commonly used for scientific and technical documentation preparation. It is widely used for the communication and publication of scientific documents in fields such as mathematics, computer science, physics, engineering, and more.

Software Description:
Launcher is a utility for performing simple, data parallel, high throughput computing (HTC) workflows on clusters, massively parallel processor (MPP) systems, workgroups of computers, and personal machines. 
Description Source: https://github.com/TACC/launcher
Core Features: Centralized Platform For Accessing Files & Programs, Customizable Organization Of Shortcuts, Quick Access To Frequently Used Resources
General Tags: Software Management, File Organization, Shortcut Access
AI Description: Launcher is a software application that provides a centralized platform for accessing and managing various files, programs, and tools on a computer system. It serves as a customizable tool for organizing shortcuts and quick access to frequently used resources.

Software Description:
lazygit is a simple terminal user interface for git commands. 
Description Source: https://github.com/jesseduffield/lazygit
Core Features: Intuitive & Easy-To-Use Terminal Ui For Git Commands, Visual Representation Of Git Status, Changes, Commits, & Branches, Interactive Interface For Staging, Unstaging, Committing, & Managing Changes, Support For Common Git Operations Such As Pull, Push, Merge, & Rebase, Ability To Resolve Merge Conflicts & Perform Basic Git Actions Seamlessly
General Tags: Version Control, Git, Terminal Ui, Software Development
AI Description: lazygit is a simple terminal UI for git commands, with the ability to easily view and manage changes in repositories.

Core Features: lddt is designed to pinpoint the exact locations in the source code where data races occur in parallel programs. It provides detailed information on the variables being accessed and the threads involved in the race.
General Tags: Testing, Debugging, Parallel Programming
AI Description: lddt (Local Dynamic Data race Tester) is a tool for testing and debugging data races in parallel programs.

Software Description: LDhat is a package written in the C and C++ languages for the analysis of recombination rates from population genetic data.
Core Features: Estimation Of Recombination Rates, Inferring Population Structure, Calculating Genetic Diversity, Analyzing Demographic History, Simulation Of Genetic Data
General Tags: Population Genetics, Genetic Diversity, Recombination Rate, Demographic History, Bioinformatics
AI Description: LDhat is a suite of population genetic software tools for the analysis of recombination rate, genetic diversity, population structure, and demographic history in DNA sequence data.

Software Description: LDJump is an R package to estimate variable recombination rates from population genetic data.
Core Features: Some core features of ldjump include LD estimation, LD block detection, SNP selection based on LD patterns, and visualization of LD structures.
General Tags: Linkage Disequilibrium, Genomics, Association Studies
AI Description: ldjump is a software package that is designed to conduct large-scale linkage disequilibrium (LD) analysis in populations. It allows for the exploration of LD patterns across genomic regions to identify informative SNPs for association studies.

Software Description: ldsc is a command line tool for estimating heritability and genetic correlation from GWAS summary statistics.

Leptonica is a pedagogically-oriented open source library containing software that is broadly useful for image processing and image analysis applications. 
Description Source: http://www.leptonica.org/
Core Features: Image Processing Functions, Image Analysis Tools, Support For Various Image Formats, Advanced Image Manipulation Techniques, Integration With Other Programming Languages
General Tags: Image Processing, Image Analysis, Open-Source, Library, C
AI Description: Leptonica is an open-source image processing and image analysis library. It provides a wide range of image processing functions and is used for tasks such as image enhancement, binarization, morphology, and more. Leptonica is written in C and provides bindings for various programming languages.

Software Description:
LERC is an open-source image or raster format which supports rapid encoding and decoding for any pixel type (not just RGB or Byte). Users set the maximum compression error per pixel while encoding, so the precision of the original input image is preserved (within user defined error bounds). 
Description Source:  https://github.com/Esri/lerc
Core Features:
1. High compression ratios
2. Minimal loss in data quality
3. Efficient storage and transmission of raster data
4. Compatible with various geospatial applications
General Tags: Compression, Raster Data, Geospatial Applications
AI Description: LERC (Limited Error Raster Compression) is an algorithm for raster data compression that provides high compression ratios with minimal loss in data quality. It is commonly used in geospatial applications to reduce storage space and transmission times for large raster datasets.

Software Description: LevelDB is a fast key-value storage library written at Google that provides an ordered mapping from string keys to string values.
Core Features: Ordered Key-Value Storage, High Performance, Low Latency Reads, Data Compression, Automatic Data Compaction
General Tags: Storage, Database
AI Description: LevelDB is a fast key-value storage library designed by Google that provides an ordered mapping from string keys to string values. It has features like high performance, low latency reads, low write amplification, data compression, and automatic data compaction. LevelDB is written in C++ and is optimized for use in embedded systems and applications requiring persistent storage.

Core Features: Latin Hypercube Sampling, Multivariate Data Uncertainty, Python Library
General Tags: Latin Hypercube Sampling, Multivariate Data, Uncertainty Quantification, Statistical Sampling, Python Library
AI Description: LHSMDU (Latin Hypercube Sampling Multivariate Data Uncertainty) is a Python library for generating Latin hypercube samples with multivariate data uncertainty. Latin hypercube sampling is a statistical method for generating a sample of plausible scenarios by dividing the input variables into equally probable intervals and sampling once from each interval. LHSMDU extends this concept to incorporate uncertainty in the multivariate data.

Software Description:
Libaec - Adaptive Entropy Coding Library - provides fast lossless compression of 1 up to 32 bit wide signed or unsigned integers (samples). The library achieves best results for low entropy data as often encountered in space imaging instrument data or numerical model output from weather or climate simulations. While floating point representations are not directly supported, they can also be efficiently coded by grouping exponents and mantissa. 
Description Source:  https://gitlab.dkrz.de/k202009/libaec
Core Features: It provides fast and efficient compression and decompression of images using adaptive arithmetic coding.
General Tags: Image Compression, Lossless Compression
AI Description: libaec is a C library for lossless image compression.

Software Description: libaio, or Linux Asynchronous I/O Library, is a Linux system library that enables applications to perform asynchronous I/O operations for improved performance and responsiveness. It allows programs to initiate read and write operations without blocking, enhancing throughput and scalability on I/O-bound tasks.
Core Features: Linux-Native Asynchronous I/O Support, Enables Non-Blocking I/O Operations, Improves Performance By Allowing Concurrent I/O Operations
General Tags: I/O Library, Linux Library, Asynchronous I/O
AI Description: libaio is a library that provides a Linux-native asynchronous I/O facility to applications. It allows applications to perform I/O operations without being blocked, thus improving performance by enabling concurrent I/O operations.

Software Description:
The libarchive project develops a portable, efficient C library that can read and write streaming archives in a variety of formats. 
Description Source: https://www.libarchive.org/
Core Features: Support For Multiple Archive Formats Such As Tar, Cpio, Zip, Ability To Create & Read Archives, Supports Reading From & Writing To Memory Directly, Provides Hooks For Processing Entry Content, Available In C & C++
General Tags: Programming Library, Archive, Compression, Data Management
AI Description: libarchive is a programming library that can create and read several different streaming archive formats, including most popular tar variants, cpio, and zip. It can also write entry content directly to or read entry content directly from memory, and provides hooks to read and write the entry content as it is processed. Program is available in C and C++.

Software Description: This package provides semi-portable access to hardware-provided atomic memory update operations on a number of architectures.
Core Features:
1. Provides atomic operations for memory access.
2. Facilitates concurrent programming and lock-free data structures.
3. Enables inter-thread communication without locks.
4. Supports a wide range of platforms and compilers.
General Tags: Concurrent Programming, Atomic Operations, Memory Access, Synchronization
AI Description: Libatomic_ops is a library implementing atomic memory access operations for use in concurrent programming. It provides a number of low-level memory access and synchronization operations which can be used in lock-free data structures and for inter-thread communication without the need for locks.

Core Features: Scalable Computing, High Performance, Support For Large Computational Biology Applications, Efficient Handling Of Biological Data Analysis Tasks
General Tags: Library, Computational Biology, High Performance Computing
AI Description: Libbeagle is a library for scalable, high-performance computing with emphasis on large computational biology applications. It provides various functions and data structures to efficiently handle biological data analysis tasks.

Software Description: libbsd is a library that provides a collection of functions from the FreeBSD operating system for enhancing compatibility and portability across different Unix-like systems. It includes various system-related functions that are widely used in Unix programming to access system services and perform low-level operations.
Core Features:
1. Implementation of BSD system functions
2. Portability across different operating systems
3. Open-source and freely available
4. Simplifies integration of BSD code in non-BSD environments
General Tags: Library, Bsd, Operating System
AI Description: libbsd is a library that provides functions typically found in the BSD operating systems. It aims to offer a more portable solution for developers needing BSD functions on non-BSD systems.

Software Description: libcap is a library that provides user-space interfaces and utilities for POSIX capabilities, allowing fine-grained control over privileges and permissions assigned to processes. It helps in implementing security policies, restricting capabilities, and reducing the privileged actions of applications.
Core Features: 1. Development files for libcap library. 2. Documentation for the libcap library. 3. Implementation of user-space interfaces to POSIX capabilities in Linux kernels.
General Tags: Library, Development, Documentation
AI Description: The libcap-devel package contains the development files and documentation for the libcap library. This library implements the user-space interfaces to the POSIX 1003.1e capabilities available in Linux kernels.

Core Features: Efficient Management Of Climate Data Sets, Advanced Analysis Capabilities For Climate Scientists, Integration With Visualization Tools For Data Interpretation, Support For Common Data Formats In Climate Science
General Tags: Climate Science, Atmospheric Sciences, Data Management, Visualization
AI Description: libcdms is a computational software library for climate and atmospheric sciences, specifically designed for the analysis, management, and visualization of climate datasets.

Software Description:
libcerf is a self-contained numeric library that provides an efficient and accurate implementation of complex error functions, along with Dawson, Faddeeva, and Voigt functions. 
Description Source: https://jugit.fz-juelich.de/mlz/libcerf
Core Features: Efficient & Accurate Implementations Of Complex Error Functions, Support For Dawson, Fresnel, & Voigt Functions, Optimized For Scientific Computing Applications
General Tags: Error Functions, Scientific Computing, C Library
AI Description: libcerf is a C library that provides efficient and accurate implementations of complex error functions, along with Dawson, Fresnel, and Voigt functions. The library is designed to facilitate the computation of complex error functions for a wide range of applications in scientific computing.

Core Features: Provides An Api For Parsing Cif Files, Supports Reading & Writing Cif Files, Allows Manipulation Of Cif Data
General Tags: Cif Files, Crystallography, Library, C++
AI Description: libcifpp is a C++ library for reading, writing, and manipulating Crystallographic Information Format (CIF) files. CIF is a standard text file format for representing crystallographic information approved by the International Union of Crystallography.

Software Description:
libdap is a C++ implementation of DAP2 with some extensions. The libdap library includes classes and functions which implement DAP 2.0 as well as utilities which simpify building clients and servers for DAP 2.0 and DAP4.0. 
Description Source: https://opendap.github.io/libdap4/html/index.html
Core Features:
1. Implementation of the Data Access Protocol (DAP) for accessing scientific data over the internet.
2. Allows users to access and query remote data repositories.
3. Provides a standardized and unified method for sharing and accessing scientific data.
4. Supports various data formats and protocols for efficient data transfer.
General Tags: Data Access, Scientific Data, Internet Protocol
AI Description: The libdap (Data Access Protocol) library is a software package that provides an implementation of DAP (Data Access Protocol) for accessing and sharing scientific data over the internet. DAP is a protocol that allows users to access and query remote data repositories in a unified and standardized manner.

Software Description:
libdeflate is a heavily optimized library for DEFLATE/zlib/gzip compression and decompression. 
Description Source: https://github.com/ebiggers/libdeflate
Core Features:
1. High-speed decompression for DEFLATE-compressed data.
2. Flexibility to allow multiple decompression strategies.
3. Memory-efficiency for handling large volumes of compressed data.
General Tags: Compression, Data Decompression
AI Description: libdeflate is a library for fast, flexible, and memory-efficient DEFLATE-based compressed data decompression.

Software Description:
This is libdrm, a userspace library for accessing the DRM, direct rendering manager, on Linux, BSD and other operating systems that support the ioctl interface. The library provides wrapper functions for the ioctls to avoid exposing the kernel interface directly, and for chipsets with drm memory manager, support for tracking relocations and buffers. 
Description Source: https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/mesa/drm
Core Features:
1. Provides the basic interface for accessing the kernel's graphics subsystem.
2. Supports various functionalities such as mode-setting, buffer sharing, and direct rendering.
3. Facilitates communication between user space programs and the Linux kernel's graphics subsystem.
4. Essential for enabling hardware acceleration and managing graphics devices on Linux systems.
General Tags: Graphics, Linux, Kernel, Driver
AI Description: Direct Rendering Manager (DRM) library for interacting with kernel mode-setting (KMS) drivers, particularly the Direct Rendering Infrastructure (DRI) modules in the Linux kernel.

Core Features: Differential RNA-Seq Analysis, Identification Of Differentially Expressed Genes, Analysis Of Gene Expression Data, Integration With Python For Seamless Data Analysis
General Tags: Python Library, RNA-Seq Analysis, Gene Expression Analysis
AI Description: libdrs is a Python library for Differential RNA-seq (Differential RNA sequencing) analysis. It provides various tools for the analysis of gene expression data generated from RNA-seq experiments, focusing on identifying differentially expressed genes between different conditions or treatments.

Software Description: libedit is a library for reading and editing user input in a command-line interface. It provides tools for handling input editing, command history, and line parsing in a terminal environment.
Core Features:
1. Provides line editing and history capabilities for command-line applications.
2. Offers custom key bindings and configuration options.
3. Supports basic features like command history, line editing, and tab completion.
4. Easily integrated into various Unix-like operating systems and applications.
General Tags: Library, Command-Line, Line Editing, History, Open-Source
AI Description: libedit is an open-source library that provides a readline-like interface for line editing in command-line applications. It is a replacement for GNU Readline used in many Unix-like systems, providing similar functionality but with a more permissive open-source license (BSD-style license).

Software Description:
Epoxy is a library for handling OpenGL function pointer management for you. It hides the complexity of dlopen(), dlsym(), glXGetProcAddress(), eglGetProcAddress(), etc. from the app developer, with very little knowledge needed on their part. They get to read GL specs and write code using undecorated function names like glCompileShader(). 
Description Source: https://github.com/anholt/libepoxy
Core Features: Handles Opengl Function Pointer Management, Facilitates Calling Opengl Functions, Indicates Availability Of Opengl Extensions
General Tags: Opengl, Library, Graphics
AI Description: libepoxy is a library for handling OpenGL function pointer management. It makes it easy to call OpenGL functions and to know when extensions are available.

Software Description: A full-featured and high-performance (see benchmark) event loop that is loosely modelled after libevent, but without its limitations and bugs. It is used in GNU Virtual Private Ethernet, rxvt-unicode, auditd, the Deliantra MORPG Server and Client, and many other programs.
Core Features: Supports Multiple Event Types Including I/O Events, Signal Events, & Timer Events, Efficient & Scalable Event Processing Using Optimized Data Structures, Supports Priority Queues For Event Scheduling, Provides A Simple & Easy-To-Use Interface For Event Handling, Platform-Independent & Supports Multiple Operating Systems
General Tags: Event Loop, High Performance, Scalable, Low Latency, Operating System Independent
AI Description: libev is a high-performance event loop that provides a full-featured alternative to the event loop provided by the standard C library. It is designed for high scalability and low latency applications.

Software Description:
Libevent is an event notification library for developing scalable network servers. The Libevent API provides a mechanism to execute a callback function when a specific event occurs on a file descriptor or after a timeout has been reached. Furthermore, Libevent also support callbacks due to signals or regular timeouts. 
Description Source: https://libevent.org/doc/
Core Features: Event-Driven Programming Model, Support For Multiple Event Types (I/O, Signals, Timers), Asynchronous & Non-Blocking I/O Operations, Thread Safety & Multiplexing, Cross-Platform Compatibility
General Tags: Event Notification, Callback Functions, Scalable, Efficient
AI Description: libevent is a robust event notification library that provides a mechanism to execute a callback function when specific events occur on a file descriptor or after a timeout has been reached. It is designed to be highly efficient and versatile, capable of handling various types of events in a scalable manner.

RP Name: Aces, Anvil, Darwin, Delta, Faster, Kyric, Ookami
Software Description:
Libfabric, also known as Open Fabrics Interfaces (OFI), defines a communication API for high-performance parallel and distributed applications. It is a low-level communication library that abstracts diverse networking technologies. 
Description Source: https://ofiwg.github.io/libfabric/
Core Features:
1. Abstraction of fabric interfaces for applications
2. Flexibility for applications to bypass fabric interfaces
3. Fabric-agnostic interfaces for HPC communication
4. High-performance communication resources
General Tags: Fabric Interfaces, High-Performance Computing, Communication Resources
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Anvil: https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/software/libfabric 
Delta: https://docs.ncsa.illinois.edu/systems/delta/en/latest/user_guide/software.html 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/ 
Ookami: https://www.stonybrook.edu/commcms/ookami/support/faq/software_on_ookami
AI Description: libfabric is a high-performance library for fabric interfaces, designed to abstract fabric communication resources to applications while providing flexibility to applications that need to bypass the fabric interfaces. It provides fabric-agnostic interfaces for communication in high-performance computing (HPC) environments.

Software Description:
The libffi library provides a portable, high level programming interface to various calling conventions. This allows a programmer to call any function specified by a call interface description at run-time. FFI stands for Foreign Function Interface. A foreign function interface is the popular name for the interface that allows code written in one language to call code written in another language. The libffi library really only provides the lowest, machine dependent layer of a fully featured foreign function interface. 
Description Source: https://github.com/libffi/libffi
Core Features:
1. Portable interface for calling C functions from other languages
2. Support for various calling conventions
3. Abstraction for function calls across platforms
4. Dynamic generation of interface code at runtime
General Tags: Library, Portability, Calling Conventions
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Delta: https://docs.ncsa.illinois.edu/systems/delta/en/latest/user_guide/software.html 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/ 
Ookami: https://www.stonybrook.edu/commcms/ookami/support/faq/software_on_ookami
AI Description: libffi is a library that provides a portable, high-level programming interface to various calling conventions. It allows a C function to be called from a language other than C without having to hand-write assembly code.

Software Description:
libflame is a portable library for dense matrix computations, providing much of the functionality present in LAPACK, developed by current and former members of the Science of High-Performance Computing (SHPC) group in the Institute for Computational Engineering and Sciences at The University of Texas at Austin. libflame includes a compatibility layer, lapack2flame, which includes a complete LAPACK implementation. 
Description Source: https://github.com/flame/libflame
Core Features: 1. Provides optimized implementations of BLAS and LAPACK functions. 2. Portable and easy to install. 3. Supports various architectures and compilers. 4. Offers a user-friendly interface for linear algebra operations.
General Tags: Linear Algebra, Matrix Computations, Numerical Computation
AI Description: libflame is a portable library for dense matrix computations, providing high-performance implementations of the BLAS and LAPACK interfaces.

Software Description: Libgcrypt is a general purpose cryptographic library originally based on code from GnuPG
Core Features: Encryption & Decryption Functions, Symmetric-Key Algorithms (Aes, Camellia, Etc.), Public-Key Algorithms (Rsa, Dsa, Etc.), Hash Functions (Sha-1, Sha-256, Etc.), Random Number Generation
General Tags: Cryptography, Security, Encryption
AI Description: Libgcrypt is a general-purpose cryptographic library originally based on code from GnuPG. It provides various cryptographic algorithms to secure data and communications.

Software Description:
GD is an open source code library for the dynamic creation of images by programmers. GD is written in C, and "wrappers" are available for Perl, PHP, ruby and many other bindings. 
Description Source: https://libgd.github.io/pages/about.html
Core Features: Drawing Images With Various Shapes & Colors, Support For Text Rendering, Manipulation Of Images Including Cut, Paste, & Flood Fill Operations, Generates Wbmp Files Dynamically, Php Compatibility For Web Applications
General Tags: Graphics Library, Image Manipulation, Php Library
AI Description: Libgd is an open-source graphics library. It allows your code to quickly draw images complete with lines, arcs, text, multiple colors, cut and paste from other images, and flood fills. It can generate WBMP files on the fly. It is also compatible with PHP.

Software Description:
libgeotiff is a library designed to permit the extraction and parsing of the "GeoTIFF" Key directories, as well as definition and installation of GeoTIFF keys in new files. 
Description Source: https://github.com/OSGeo/libgeotiff?tab=readme-ov-file
Core Features:
1. Reading and writing metadata tags for geotiff files
2. Supporting reading and writing of geotiff files with coordinate system information
3. Enables developers to access and manipulate geotiff file metadata
4. Allows for the extraction of geographic and geospatial information from geotiff files
General Tags: Geotiff, Metadata, Coordinates, Geospatial
AI Description: Libgeotiff is a library for reading and writing coordinate system information embedded in geotiff files.

Software Description:
libgit2 is a portable, pure C implementation of the Git core methods provided as a re-entrant linkable library with a solid API, allowing you to write native speed custom Git applications in any language that supports C bindings. 
Description Source: https://libgit2.org/
Core Features:
1. Portable and efficient Git core methods implementation.
2. Linkable library with a well-defined API.
3. Ability to write custom Git applications in various languages supporting C bindings.
General Tags: Version Control System, Git, Library
AI Description: libgit2 is a portable, pure C implementation of the Git core methods provided as a re-entrant linkable library with a solid API, allowing you to write native speed custom Git applications in any language which supports C bindings.

Software Description:
freeglut is a free-software/open-source alternative to the OpenGL Utility Toolkit (GLUT) library. GLUT was originally written by Mark Kilgard to support the sample programs in the second edition OpenGL 'RedBook'. Since then, GLUT has been used in a wide variety of practical applications because it is simple, widely available and highly portable. 
Description Source: https://freeglut.sourceforge.net/
Core Features: Support For Tessellating Complex Geometric Shapes, Functions For Creating & Handling Polygonal Models, Provides Utilities For Creating Surfaces & Shapes In Opengl Applications
General Tags: Software Library, Geometry Processing, Computer Graphics
AI Description: libglu is a software library that provides support for building OpenGL applications. It is designed to complement the functionality provided by OpenGL and aids in handling complex geometric shapes, tessellation, and creating polygonal models.

Software Description:
libglvnd is a vendor-neutral dispatch layer for arbitrating OpenGL API calls between multiple vendors. It allows multiple drivers from different vendors to coexist on the same filesystem, and determines which vendor to dispatch each API call to at runtime. 
Description Source: https://github.com/NVIDIA/libglvnd
Core Features: The core functionality of libglvnd includes managing OpenGL libraries from multiple vendors, enabling applications to dynamically load the appropriate vendor libraries at runtime, and facilitating communication between the X server and OpenGL libraries.
General Tags: Graphics, Opengl, Vendor-Neutral Dispatch
AI Description: libglvnd is the open-source implementation of the vendor-neutral dispatch layer for arbitrating OpenGL API calls between multiple vendors' graphics drivers and the X server.

Software Description: libgpg is a library that provides an API for interacting with GnuPG (GNU Privacy Guard) for encryption, decryption, and key management tasks. It allows developers to integrate GnuPG functionality into their applications.
Core Features:
1. Provides a set of error codes for use by GnuPG components
2. Enables standardized error handling across GnuPG processes
3. Supports better error reporting and debugging capabilities
4. Facilitates compatibility and interoperability between different GnuPG components
General Tags: Error Handling, Library, Gnupg
AI Description: Libgpg-error is a small library that defines common error values for all GnuPG components. It is used by GnuPG and some other packages.

Software Description:
libgpuarray is a library to manipulate tensors on the GPU. 
Description Source: https://github.com/Theano/libgpuarray/tree/master
Core Features:
1. Provides a common array object for representing GPU data.
2. Designed to work seamlessly with GPU acceleration libraries like Theano and PyCUDA.
3. Facilitates array-oriented computations on GPUs in Python.
4. Offers optimized GPU memory management and data transfer operations.
General Tags: Gpu Acceleration, Array-Oriented Algorithms, Python Library
AI Description: libgpuarray is a library that provides a common, numpy-like array object to represent GPU data for array-oriented algorithms in Python. It is designed to work with various libraries whose primary focus is on GPU acceleration, such as Theano or PyCUDA.

Core Features: Generate Pdf Files Programmatically, Support For Text, Images, & Vector Graphics, Ability To Add Annotations & Bookmarks, Support For Encryption & Compression, Cross-Platform Compatibility
General Tags: Pdf Generation, Open-Source Software, Programming Library
AI Description: libHaru is a free, open-source software library for generating PDF files. It supports a wide range of features for creating PDF documents programmatically, including text, images, vector graphics, and more.

Core Features:
1. Implementation of the ICE protocol for secure communication between X clients.
2. Support for negotiation, authentication, and data exchange between X clients.
3. Integration with the X Window System for seamless communication.
General Tags: Library, Inter-Client Exchange, X Window System
AI Description: libice is a library that provides support for Inter-Client Exchange (ICE) in the X Window System, allowing X clients to securely exchange data through the X server.

Software Description:
libiconv provides an iconv() implementation, for use on systems which don't have one, or whose implementation cannot convert from/to Unicode. 
Description Source: https://www.gnu.org/software/libiconv/#TOCintroduction
Core Features:
1. Character set conversion support
2. Conversion between different encoding schemes
3. Wide range of supported character encodings
General Tags: Character Set Conversion, Text Data, Encoding
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Anvil: https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/software/libiconv 
Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/
AI Description: libiconv is a library that provides character set conversion support. It converts text data between different character encoding schemes.

Software Description: GNU Libidn is a fully documented implementation of the Stringprep, Punycode and IDNA specifications. Libidn's purpose is to encode and decode internationalized domain names.
Core Features: The core features of libidn include support for internationalized domain names (IDN), ASCII conversion, Punycode encoding/decoding, Unicode normalization, and IDNA (Internationalized Domain Names in Applications) compliance. It supports both IDNA2003 and IDNA2008 specifications.
General Tags: Software Library, Internationalization, Domain Names
AI Description: Libidn is an internationalized domain name library designed to help with the process of converting internationalized domain names to/from ASCII representation. It implements the Stringprep, Punycode and IDNA specifications defined by the IETF (Internet Engineering Task Force).

Software Description: libidn2 is a library that implements internationalized domain name (IDN) encoding and decoding functions. It provides support for handling domain names with non-ASCII characters according to the IDNA2008 specification.
Core Features: Libidn2 provides support for Internationalized Domain Names (IDNs), which allows domain names containing non-ASCII characters to be translated into a valid format that can be used in the Domain Name System (DNS). It includes functionality for converting domain names to and from Punycode, as well as performing string preparation according to the Stringprep protocol.
General Tags: Domain Names, Idns, Stringprep, Punycode
AI Description: Libidn2 is a library that implements the Stringprep, Punycode and IDNA specifications defined by the IETF Internationalized Domain Names (IDN) working group.

Software Description:
libint is a library for the evaluation of molecular integrals of many-body operators over Gaussian functions. 
Description Source: https://github.com/evaleev/libint?tab=readme-ov-file
Core Features:
1. Calculation of electron repulsion integrals
2. Evaluation of overlap integrals
3. Computation of kinetic energy integrals
4. Integration of nuclear-electron attraction terms
5. Supports a wide range of basis functions and molecular orbitals
General Tags: Computational Chemistry, Molecular Integrals, Quantum Chemistry
AI Description: libint is a library for the evaluation of molecular integrals needed in computational chemistry and related fields. It provides efficient and accurate implementations for various types of integrals used in quantum chemistry calculations.

Software Description:
libjpeg is a widely used C library for reading and writing JPEG image files. It was developed by Tom Lane and the Independent JPEG Group (IJG) during the 1990's and it is now maintained by several developers using various services identified in the SourceForge summary. 
Description Source: https://libjpeg.sourceforge.net/
Core Features: Support For Reading & Writing Jpeg Images, Compression & Decompression Functions, Portable & Efficient Image Processing
General Tags: Image Processing, Compression, Library
AI Description: libjpeg is a widely-used open-source library for reading and writing images in JPEG format. It provides functions for compression and decompression of JPEG images, making it a valuable tool for handling image files in various applications.

Software Description:
libjpeg-turbo is a JPEG image codec that uses SIMD instructions (MMX, SSE2, AVX2, Neon, AltiVec) to accelerate baseline JPEG compression and decompression on x86, x86-64, Arm, and PowerPC systems, as well as progressive JPEG compression on x86, x86-64, and Arm systems. On such systems, libjpeg-turbo is generally 2-6x as fast as libjpeg, all else being equal. On other types of systems, libjpeg-turbo can still outperform libjpeg by a significant amount, by virtue of its highly-optimized Huffman coding routines. 
Description Source: https://libjpeg-turbo.org/
Core Features: High-Speed Jpeg Compression & Decompression, Supports Simd Instructions For Acceleration, Compatible With Existing Jpeg Files & Programs, Provides Tools For Jpeg Format Conversion
General Tags: Image Compression, Jpeg Compression, Library, Open Source
AI Description: libjpeg-turbo is a high-speed version of the widely-used JPEG image compression library. It uses SIMD instructions to accelerate JPEG compression and decompression on x86, x86-64, and ARM processors.

Core Features: Supports Evaluation Of Mathematical Expressions, Extensive Library Of Mathematical Functions & Operations, Handles Complex Number Arithmetic, Can Parse & Evaluate User-Defined Functions
General Tags: Mathematical Expression Evaluation, Mathematical Functions, Symbolic Manipulation
AI Description: Libmatheval is a library for evaluating mathematical expressions on the fly. It supports a wide range of mathematical functions and operations, making it a versatile tool for numerical computations and symbolic manipulation.

Core Features:
1. Integration of equations of motion for particles
2. Support for different interaction potentials
3. Molecular dynamics simulations capability
General Tags: Molecular Dynamics, Simulation, Library
AI Description: libmd is a library for molecular dynamics simulations that allows for the integration of equations of motion for particles interacting with different potentials.

Software Description:
The libMesh library provides a framework for the numerical simulation of partial differential equations using arbitrary unstructured discretizations on serial and parallel platforms.
