A major goal of the library is to provide support for adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) computations in parallel while allowing a research scientist to focus on the physics they are modeling. 
Description Source: https://libmesh.github.io/
Core Features:
1. Multi-dimensional mesh generation
2. Support for a variety of finite element types
3. Solvers for a range of partial differential equations
4. Parallel computing capabilities
5. Extensive documentation and user support
General Tags: Finite Element Library, Numerical Simulation, Partial Differential Equations
AI Description: Libmesh is a C++ finite element library designed to provide a framework for the numerical simulation of partial differential equations in high dimensions. It supports 1D, 2D, and 3D mesh generation, provides a wide range of finite element types, and includes solvers for various types of PDEs.

Software Description:
libnotify is a library for sending desktop notifications to a notification daemon, as defined in the org.freedesktop.Notifications Desktop Specification. These notifications can be used to inform the user about an event or display some form of information without getting in the user's way. 
Description Source: https://github.com/GNOME/libnotify
Core Features:
1. Display desktop notifications
2. Customizable notification content
3. Support for actions within notifications
4. Integration with desktop environments
5. Cross-platform compatibility
General Tags: Notifications, Desktop, Library
AI Description: libnotify is a library that provides a way to display desktop notifications to users. It is typically used by desktop environments such as GNOME to show notifications for various events and applications.

Core Features:
1. Provides network communication services.
2. Supports multiple network protocols.
3. Facilitates network-aware applications.
General Tags: Network Services, Communication, Protocols
AI Description: The libnsl library provides an interface for applications to make use of the services provided by the Network Services Layer (NSL). It offers functions that allow applications to communicate over the network using a variety of protocols.

Software Description:
libogg is a multimedia container format, and the native file and stream format for the Xiph.org multimedia codecs. As with all Xiph.org technology is it an open format free for anyone to use. 
Description Source: https://www.xiph.org/ogg/
Core Features:
1. Encoding and decoding of Ogg bitstreams
2. Low-level API for Ogg format manipulation
3. Support for multiple-channel audio and packet-based streams
4. Integration with other Ogg-related libraries such as libvorbis
General Tags: Library, Bitstream, Audio
AI Description: Libogg is a reference implementation of the Ogg bitstream format. It provides a simple, low-level API for working with Ogg bitstreams.

Software Description:
libopus is a totally open, royalty-free, highly versatile audio codec. Opus is unmatched for interactive speech and music transmission over the Internet, but is also intended for storage and streaming applications. It is standardized by the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) as RFC 6716 which incorporated technology from Skype’s SILK codec and Xiph.Org’s CELT codec. 
Description Source: https://opus-codec.org/
Core Features: Ultra-Wideband Audio Support (From 8 Khz Narrowband To 48 Khz Fullband), Low Latency For Real-Time Communication, Variable Bitrate Support For Efficiency, Audio Bandwidth Scalability, Standalone Audio Codec Or Used Within Other Container Formats, Support For Both Speech & Music, Robustness Against Packet Loss
General Tags: Audio Codec, Real-Time Communication, Internet Transmission
AI Description: libopus is a high-quality audio codec that is specifically designed for interactive speech and audio transmission over the Internet. It is part of the wider Opus audio codec family, covering a wide range of bitrates and applications.

Core Features: Phylogenetic Tree Analysis, Tree Comparison, Consensus Tree Construction, Tree Visualization
General Tags: Phylogenetics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology
AI Description: Libpals is a collection of tools for analyzing and manipulating phylogenetic trees. It provides functionalities for tree comparison, consensus tree construction, tree visualization, and more.

Software Description:
libpciaccess is a generic PCI access library. 
Description Source: https://cgit.freedesktop.org/xorg/lib/libpciaccess
Core Features: Generic Access To Pci Bus & Devices, Direct Mapping Of Pci Memory Regions, Bus Transactions, Device Querying On The Pci Bus
General Tags: Library, Pci Bus Access, User-Space Drivers
AI Description: libpciaccess is a library providing generic access to the PCI bus and devices for use in user-space programs. It allows user-space drivers to directly map PCI memory regions, perform bus transactions, and query devices on the PCI bus.

Software Description:
libpng is the official PNG reference library. It supports almost all PNG features, is extensible, and has been extensively tested for over 28 years. 
Description Source: http://www.libpng.org/pub/png/libpng.html
Core Features: Support For Reading & Writing Png Images, Rgba, Indexed-Color, Grayscale, & Bit-Depth Transformations, Compression & Decompression Support, Interlacing & Filtering Options, Integration With Various Programming Languages & Platforms
General Tags: Image Processing, Graphics Library, Raster Images
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Anvil: https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/software/libpng 
Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/ 
Ookami: https://www.stonybrook.edu/commcms/ookami/support/faq/software_on_ookami
AI Description: Libpng is the official PNG reference library, used to support the PNG (Portable Network Graphics) format for storing raster images. It provides a set of functions for creating, reading, and manipulating PNG image files.

Software Description: C library for the Public Suffix List
Core Features: It allows applications to accurately determine the effective top-level domain (eTLD) of a domain name.
General Tags: C Library, Domain Management, Public Suffix List
AI Description: Libpsl is a C library that provides functions to work with the Public Suffix List (PSL), which is a database of domain suffixes (like .com, .co.uk, etc.) that are under public registry control.

Software Description:
The GNU Readline library provides a set of functions for use by applications that allow users to edit command lines as they are typed in. Both Emacs and vi editing modes are available. The Readline library includes additional functions to maintain a list of previously-entered command lines, to recall and perhaps reedit those lines, and perform csh-like history expansion on previous commands. 
Description Source: https://tiswww.case.edu/php/chet/readline/rltop.html#Introduction
Core Features: History: Keeps Track Of Previously Entered Commands, Allowing Users To Navigate & Reuse Them Easily., Editing: Supports Editing Functionalities Like Cursor Movement, Deletion, & Insertion Within The Input Line., Completion: Offers Tab-Completion For Commands, Variables, & File Paths To Assist Users With Input., Customization: Allows For Customization Of Key Bindings, Behavior, & Appearance Of The Editing Interface.
General Tags: Command-Line Interface, Text Editing, Gnu Library, Interactive Programs
AI Description: libreadline is a GNU library that provides line-editing capabilities for interactive programs with a command-line interface. It allows users to edit text as they type commands, providing features such as history, editing, and completion of input.

Core Features: Implementation Of Various Model Reduction Algorithms, Support For Reduction Of Large-Scale Systems, Integration With Common Computational Frameworks, Efficient Handling Of High-Dimensional Data
General Tags: Software Library, Model Reduction, Computational Science
AI Description: LibROM is a library for Reduced Order Models (ROMs) that provides tools for model reduction of complex systems in engineering and computational science applications. It offers a range of algorithms and methods to reduce the computational cost of high-fidelity simulations.

Core Features: Provides functions for robust statistical analysis, including robust regression, robust covariance estimation, and outlier detection. Supports multiple programming languages such as Python, R, and Matlab. Implements algorithms for resistant fitting and robust M-estimators.
General Tags: Statistics, Robust Statistics, Outlier Detection, Data Analysis
AI Description: librs is a library for performing robust statistics in various programming languages.

Software Description:
librsvg is a library to render SVG images to Cairo surfaces. GNOME uses this to render SVG icons. Outside of GNOME, other desktop environments use it for similar purposes. Wikimedia uses it for Wikipedia's SVG diagrams. 
Description Source: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/librsvg
Core Features: Rendering Svg Files, Converting Svg Files To Other Formats, Utilizes The Cairo Rendering Engine
General Tags: Software Library, Free Software, Svg Rendering, File Conversion
AI Description: Librsvg is a free software library to render SVG files and convert them to other formats using the Cairo rendering engine.

Software Description: The RT Topology Library exposes an API to create and manage standard (ISO 13249 aka SQL/MM) topologies using user-provided data stores.
Core Features: Features of librttopo include computation of persistent homology, construction of Vietoris-Rips complexes, calculation of barcodes and persistence diagrams, and support for various topological data analysis algorithms.
General Tags: Computational Topology, Persistent Homology, Topological Data Analysis
AI Description: librttopo is a tool for computational topology focusing on persistent homology and topological data analysis.

Core Features: Optimized Scientific Routines, High-Performance Computing (Hpc) Support, Mathematical Functions, Computational Kernels
General Tags: Hpc, Scientific Computing, Optimization
AI Description: libsci is a library of optimized scientific routines for high-performance computing (HPC) environments. It provides a collection of mathematical functions and computational kernels tailored for scientific and engineering applications that require high computational efficiency.

Software Description: libseccomp is a library for implementing secure computing mode (seccomp) filters in Linux systems. It enables developers to apply fine-grained filtering on system calls, restricting the actions that processes can perform for improved system security.
Core Features: Allows Filtering Of System Calls At The Kernel Level, Provides An Easy-To-Use Interface For Working With The Linux Kernel'S Syscall Filtering Mechanism, Platform-Independent Implementation
General Tags: Syscall Filtering, Linux Kernel, Security
AI Description: Libseccomp is an open-source library that provides an easy-to-use, platform-independent interface for working with the Linux Kernel's syscall filtering mechanism. It allows developers to filter system calls made by an application, restricting the actions the application can perform at the kernel level.

Software Description: libsigsegv is a library for handling segmentation fault signals in Unix-like systems. It provides a mechanism for detecting, handling, and recovering from segment violation errors during program execution.
Core Features: Handling Page Faults In User Mode, Establishing A Handler For Memory Violations, Exploring Memory Areas
General Tags: Library, Memory, Page Fault
AI Description: libsigsegv is a library for handling page faults in user mode. It provides a convenient and efficient way to establish a handler for memory violations while exploring memory areas.

Core Features: Libsm offers functionalities such as matrix operations, linear algebra computations, statistical operations, and random number generation.
General Tags: Library, Scientific Computing, C++
AI Description: Libsm is a library that provides a set of common utilities for scientific computing in C++.

Software Description:
libsndfile is a C library for reading and writing files containing sampled sound (such as MS Windows WAV and the Apple/SGI AIFF format) through one standard library interface. 
Description Source: https://libsndfile.github.io/libsndfile/
Core Features: Supports Reading & Writing A Variety Of Audio File Formats, Provides A Simple & Consistent Api For Audio File I/O Operations, Offers Support For A Wide Range Of Sample Formats & Data Types, Cross-Platform Compatibility For Use In Different Operating Systems
General Tags: Audio Processing, File Input/Output, C Library, Audio File Formats
AI Description: libsndfile is a C library for reading and writing files containing sampled sound (such as WAV, AIFF, and AU) through one standard interface.

Software Description:
libsodium is a modern, easy-to-use software library for encryption, decryption, signatures, password hashing, and more. 
Description Source: https://doc.libsodium.org/
Core Features: Some of the core features of libsodium include high-speed and high-security cryptographic operations, easy-to-use API for developers, resistance against side-channel attacks, support for multiple platforms and programming languages, constant-time implementations, and continuous security audits.
General Tags: Cryptography, Security, Encryption, Password Hashing
AI Description: libsodium is a modern, easy-to-use software library for encryption, decryption, signatures, password hashing, and more. It is a portable, cross-compilable, installable, packageable fork of NaCl, a highly respected cryptographic library developed by Daniel J. Bernstein.

Software Description: libsoup is an HTTP client/server library for GNOME. It uses GObjects and the glib main loop, to integrate well with GNOME applications, and also has a synchronous API, for use in threaded applications.
Core Features: Http Client/Server Functionality, Asynchronous I/O With Gmaincontext, Websockets Support
General Tags: Http, Client/Server, Gnome, Gobjects, Asynchronous I/O, Websockets
AI Description: libsoup is an HTTP client/server library for GNOME. It uses GObjects and the glib main loop, to integrate well with GNOME applications. Features include asynchronous I/O using GMainContext and WebSockets support.

Software Description: C++ implementation of R*-tree, an MVR-tree and a TPR-tree with C API
Core Features:
1. Implementation of various spatial indexing methods such as R-tree, R*-tree, and TPR-tree.
2. Supports efficient storage and retrieval of spatial data for use in database systems.
3. Allows for fast processing of spatial queries like range search and nearest neighbor search.
4. Available in several programming languages including C++ and Python.
General Tags: Spatial Index, Library, Open-Source
AI Description: Libspatialindex is an open-source library for spatial indexing methods, designed to provide various spatial index structures which can be used for spatial queries in databases or applications.

Software Description: SpatiaLite is an open source library intended to extend the SQLite core to support fully fledged Spatial SQL capabilities.
Core Features:
1. Spatial SQL capabilities within SQLite database engine
2. Support for spatial functions and geometric data types
3. Enables creation, management, and querying of spatial data
4. Open-source and actively maintained
General Tags: Spatialite, Geospatial, Database, Spatial Data
AI Description: libspatialite is an open-source library that extends the core SQLite database engine with spatial SQL capabilities. It allows users to create, manage, and query spatial data in a SQLite database, providing support for spatial functions and geometric data types.

Core Features:
1. SSH client and server functionality
2. Support for various SSH protocols and key exchange algorithms
3. Integration with OpenSSL and mbedTLS
4. Session multiplexing
5. Portable and cross-platform
6. Easy-to-use API for developers
General Tags: Ssh, Library, Networking
AI Description: libssh is a multiplatform C library implementing the SSHv2 protocol on client and server side. It provides a stable API, high performance, and is designed to be easy to use.

Software Description:
libzip is a C library for reading, creating, and modifying zip archives. Files can be added from data buffers, files, or compressed data copied directly from other zip archives. Changes made without closing the archive can be reverted. 
Description Source: https://libzip.org/
Core Features: Efficient Compression & Decompression Of Large Datasets, Optimized For Scientific Computing & Research, Support For Common Scientific Data Formats, High-Speed Compression For Performance-Critical Applications
General Tags: Compression Library, Scientific Computing, Data Compression, Research Tools
AI Description: libszip is a compression library for large datasets used in scientific computing and research. It provides support for efficient and high-speed compression and decompression of large data files, particularly in formats commonly used in scientific applications.

Software Description: Libtasn1 is the ASN.1 library used by GnuTLS, GNU Shishi and some other packages. It was written by Fabio Fiorina, and has been shipped as part of GnuTLS for some time but is now a proper GNU package.
Core Features: Asn.1 & Der Manipulation, Cross-Platform Data Serialization & Deserialization
General Tags: Library, Asn.1, Der, Serialization, Deserialization
AI Description: libtasn1 is a library developed for ASN.1 and DER manipulation. ASN.1 is a standard interface description language for defining data structures that can be serialized and deserialized in a cross-platform way.

Software Description:
The LibTIFF software provides support for the Tag Image File Format (TIFF), a widely used format for storing image data. 
Description Source: http://www.simplesystems.org/libtiff/
Core Features: Read & Write Tiff Files, Support For Various Compression Schemes Like Lzw, Zip, Jpeg, Etc., Ability To Handle Different Color Spaces & Depths, Integration With Other Image Processing Libraries, Cross-Platform Compatibility
General Tags: Image Processing, File Format, Library, Tiff, Image Storage
AI Description: libtiff is a library for reading and writing TIFF (Tagged Image File Format) files. It provides support for handling images and documents in various uncompressed and compressed formats.

Software Description:
The libtirpc package contains libraries that support programs that use the Remote Procedure Call (RPC) API. It replaces the RPC, but not the NIS library entries that used to be in glibc. 
Description Source: https://www.linuxfromscratch.org/blfs/view/stable/basicnet/libtirpc.html
Core Features: - Implementation Of Sun'S Ti-Rpc Protocol, - Support For Various Rpc Transport Specification, - Simplified Rpc Development & Integration, - High-Performance & Efficient Rpc Communication
General Tags: Software Library
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Delta: https://docs.ncsa.illinois.edu/systems/delta/en/latest/user_guide/software.html 
Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/
AI Description: libtirpc is an open-source library that provides an implementation of Sun's Transport-Independent RPC (TI-RPC) protocol.

Software Description:
GNU Libtool is a generic library support script that hides the complexity of using shared libraries behind a consistent, portable interface. 
Description Source: https://www.gnu.org/software/libtool/
Core Features: Libtool provides a consistent, portable interface for building, installing and using shared libraries on different platforms. It abstracts the differences between various systems, such as Linux, macOS, and BSD, to ensure the smooth compilation and linking processes for software developers.
General Tags: Library Management, Software Development, Compilation
AI Description: Libtool is a generic library support script that manages the creation of static and dynamic libraries on various Unix-like operating systems.

Software Description: libunistring is a library that provides functions for manipulating Unicode strings and characters, offering support for various Unicode operations and text processing tasks. It enables developers to work with Unicode data in a portable and efficient manner.
Core Features:
1. Unicode string manipulation
2. Encoding conversion
3. Case mapping
4. Normalization
5. Regular expression matching
General Tags: Unicode, Encoding, String Manipulation, Localization
AI Description: libunistring is a C library that provides functions to manipulate Unicode strings and includes functions for encoding conversion, case mapping, normalization, and more.

Software Description:
libunwind is a portable and efficient C API for determining the current call chain of ELF program threads of execution and for resuming execution at any point in that call chain. The API supports both local (same process) and remote (other process) operation. 
Description Source: https://github.com/libunwind/libunwind
Core Features: Provides A C Api For Unwinding The Call Stack, Supports Multiple Processor Architectures, Portable & Lightweight, Used For Debugging, Profiling, & Runtime Instrumentation
General Tags: Debugging, Profiling, Runtime Instrumentation, Call Stack, C Programming
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/ 
Ookami: https://www.stonybrook.edu/commcms/ookami/support/faq/software_on_ookami
AI Description: libunwind is a portable and efficient C programming interface (API) to determine the call-chain of a program. It is primarily used for debugging, performance profiling, and runtime instrumentation.

Software Description:
libv8 is a gem for distributing the v8 runtime libraries and headers in both source and binary form. 
Description Source: https://github.com/rubyjs/libv8
Core Features:
1. High-performance JavaScript execution
2. Embeddable in C++ applications
3. Support for ECMAScript 5.1 standard
4. Lightweight and portable
5. Easily integrated into projects
6. Extensive documentation and community support
General Tags: Javascript Engine, C++ Library
AI Description: libv8 is an open-source C++ library that provides a fast and efficient JavaScript engine for embedding in various applications and tools.

Software Description:
libvorbis is a fully open, non-proprietary, patent-and-royalty-free, general-purpose compressed audio format for mid to high quality (8kHz-48.0kHz, 16+ bit, polyphonic) audio and music at fixed and variable bitrates from 16 to 128 kbps/channel. 
Description Source: https://xiph.org/vorbis/
Core Features: Encoding & Decoding Audio Data, Support For The Vorbis Audio Codec, High-Quality Audio Compression
General Tags: Audio Codec, Compression, Open-Source
AI Description: Libvorbis is a free and open-source software library for encoding and decoding audio data compressed with the Vorbis audio codec. It is part of the Xiph.org Foundation's Ogg project and is used for high-quality audio compression.

Software Description:
libvori enables Voronoi integration of the electron density and support for compressed bqb file format in CP2k. 
Description Source: https://brehm-research.de/libvori.php
Core Features: 1. Generate voronoi diagrams from 2D points. 2. Support for both Euclidean and Manhattan distance metrics. 3. Efficient computation and data structure for voronoi diagrams.
General Tags: Voronoi Diagrams, Computational Geometry, Library
AI Description: libvori is a library for calculating voronoi diagrams. It provides functions for generating voronoi diagrams from a set of points in the plane.

Software Description:
libwebp codec is a library to encode and decode images in WebP format. This package contains the library that can be used in other programs to add WebP support, as well as the command line tools ‘cwebp’ and ‘dwebp’ to compress and decompress images respectively. 
Description Source: https://chromium.googlesource.com/webm/libwebp
Core Features: Encoding & Decoding Webp Images, Lossy & Lossless Compression Options, Support For Animation & Transparency, Conversion Between Webp & Other Image Formats
General Tags: Image Processing, Compression, Web Development, Library
AI Description: libwebp is a library for working with the WebP image format. It provides tools to encode, decode, and manipulate images in the WebP format, which is a modern image format that provides both lossy and lossless compression for images on the web.

Software Description: WPE is the reference WebKit port for embedded and low-consumption computer devices. It has been designed from the ground-up with performance, small footprint, accelerated content rendering, and simplicity of deployment in mind, bringing the excellence of the WebKit engine to countless platforms and target devices.
Core Features: 1. Provides a WebKit rendering engine for Wayland compositors. 2. Enables seamless integration of web content within Wayland-based applications. 3. Supports modern web standards and technologies. 4. Offers APIs for customizing and controlling the behavior of web content on Wayland surfaces.
General Tags: Library, Web Platform Support, Wayland Compositors, Web Content Rendering
AI Description: libwpe is a library that provides web platform support for Wayland compositors and other clients that need web content rendered on a Wayland surface.

Software Description:
libx11 is the X11 protocol client library. 
Description Source: https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/xorg/lib/libx11
Core Features: Implements The Client Side Of The X Window System Protocol, Provides Higher-Level Functions For Building Window Systems On Top Of The X Window System Core, Supports Window Creation, Management, & Event Handling, Enables Communication With The X Server For Display & Input Management
General Tags: X Window System, Client Library, Window System Interface, Graphics
AI Description: libX11 is the X Window System protocol client library which provides an interface to the X Window System core protocol and provides higher-level functions for building window systems on top of the X Window System core.

Core Features:
1. Provides authentication data for Xlib-based client programs.
2. Part of the X.Org project.
3. Ensures secure communication between X client and X server.
General Tags: Library, Authentication, Xlib
AI Description: libXau is a library that provides authentication data for Xlib-based client programs.

Software Description:
libxc is a library of exchange-correlation and kinetic energy functionals for density-functional theory. The original aim was to provide a portable, well tested and reliable set of these functionals to be used by all the codes of the European Theoretical Spectroscopy Facility (ETSF), but the library has since grown to be used in several other types of codes as well; see below for a partial list. 
Description Source: https://www.tddft.org/programs/libxc/
Core Features: Provides A Wide Range Of Exchange-Correlation Functionals For Use In Density-Functional Theory Calculations, Supports Various Functionals Including Lda, Gga, Meta-Gga, Hybrid Functionals, Range-Separated Functionals, & More, Offers An Api For Easy Integration With Electronic Structure Codes
General Tags: Quantum Mechanics, Computational Chemistry
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/ 
Ookami: https://www.stonybrook.edu/commcms/ookami/support/faq/software_on_ookami
AI Description: LibXC is a library of exchange-correlation functionals for density-functional theory.

Software Description:
The X protocol C-language Binding (libXCB) is a replacement for Xlib featuring a small footprint, latency hiding, direct access to the protocol, improved threading support, and extensibility. 
Description Source: https://xcb.freedesktop.org/
Core Features: Efficient Communication With The X Server, Replacement For Xlib Api, Reduces Round-Trip Requests
General Tags: X Window System, C Library, X Protocol
AI Description: libxcb is a C language library for the X Window System's X protocol, providing a replacement for the traditional Xlib API. It allows for more efficient communication between X clients and the X server by reducing round-trip requests.

Core Features: Implementation Of The Xdmcp Protocol, Client-Side & Server-Side Functionality, Facilitates Remote Graphical Login Sessions
General Tags: X11, Display Manager, Network Protocol
AI Description: libxdmcp is the X Display Manager Control Protocol library. It provides an API for the X Display Manager Control Protocol (XDMCP) for both the client and server side.

Software Description:
libxml2 is an XML toolkit implemented in C, originally developed for the GNOME Project. 
Description Source: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libxml2/-/blob/master/README.md?ref_type=heads
Core Features:
1. Parsing and validating XML and HTML documents
2. Manipulating XML content using a tree-based API
3. Supporting standards like XML 1.0, XPath, XInclude, XPointer, and XML Catalogs
4. Handling namespaces and schema validation
5. Cross-platform compatibility and portability
General Tags: Xml, Html, Parsing, Validation, Manipulation
AI Description: Libxml2 is a software library for parsing, validating, and manipulating XML and HTML documents. It provides a tree-based API for working with XML data and supports various standards such as XML 1.0, XPath, XInclude, XPointer, and XML Catalogs.

Core Features:
1. Inhibiting screensaver and screen blanking
2. Standardized interface for X Window System clients
3. Easy integration with applications using X11 MIT-SCREEN-SAVER extension
General Tags: Library, X Window System, Screensaver, Screen Blanking
AI Description: libxscrnsaver is a library that provides an X Window System client interface to the X11 MIT-SCREEN-SAVER extension. It allows applications to inhibit the screensaver and screen blanking in a standardized way.

Software Description:
libxslt is the XSLT C library developed for the GNOME project. XSLT itself is a an XML language to define transformation for XML. Libxslt is based on libxml2 the XML C library developed for the GNOME project. 
Description Source: http://xmlsoft.org/libxslt/index.html
Core Features: Transforming Xml Documents Into Different Formats, Xslt Processing, Integration With Libxml2, Support For Xpath & Xslt Standards
General Tags: Xml, Xslt, C Library, Transformation
AI Description: Libxslt is the XSLT C library developed for the GNOME project. It is used for transforming XML documents into other formats using XSLT stylesheets. Libxslt is based on libxml2, the XML C parser and toolkit.

Software Description:
libxsmm is a library for specialized dense and sparse matrix operations as well as for deep learning primitives such as small convolutions. The library is targeting Intel Architecture with Intel SSE, Intel AVX, Intel AVX2, Intel AVX‑512 (with VNNI and Bfloat16), and Intel AMX (Advanced Matrix Extensions) supported by future Intel processor code-named Sapphire Rapids. 
Description Source: https://github.com/libxsmm/libxsmm
Core Features: Optimized for modern Intel Architecture CPUs, tailored code paths for different microarchitectures, high-performance small, dense matrix-matrix multiplications
General Tags: Library, Matrix Multiplication, Intel Cpus
AI Description: libxsmm is a library for small, dense matrix-matrix multiplications developed for modern CPUs. It provides high performance on Intel Architecture CPUs and comes with different optimized code paths tailored for different processor microarchitectures.

Core Features: Automated Compilation Of Software Packages, Dependency Tracking For Code Builds, Execution Of Computational Tasks In Hpc Environments, Enhanced Parallel Processing Capabilities
General Tags: Library, Hpc, Automation, Compilation, Dependency Tracking, Parallel Processing
AI Description: Libxt is a library offering extensions for automating compilation, dependency tracking, and execution of computational tasks within HPC environments.

Software Description:
LibYAML is a YAML parser and emitter library. 
Description Source: https://pyyaml.org/wiki/LibYAML
Core Features: Parsing Yaml Data Into A Native Data Structure, Emitting Native Data Structures Into Valid Yaml Documents, Support For Yaml 1.1 Specification, Written In C For Portability & Efficiency
General Tags: Yaml, Parser, Emitter, Serialization, Configuration
AI Description: LibYAML is a YAML 1.1 parser and emitter written in C. It is a library for parsing and emitting YAML data. YAML is a human-readable data serialization format that is commonly used for configuration files and data exchange between languages. LibYAML allows developers to integrate YAML support into their applications.

Software Description: libzip is a C library for reading, creating, and modifying zip archives.
Core Features: Key features of libzip include reading, creating, and modifying zip archives, adding, extracting, and deleting files within zip archives, and stream-based I/O for accessing zip archive contents.
General Tags: C Library, Zip Archives, File Management
AI Description: libzip is a C library for reading, creating, and modifying zip archives. It provides a simple programming interface for managing zip files.

Software Description:
lifelines is a complete survival analysis library, written in pure Python. 
Description Source: https://lifelines.readthedocs.io/en/latest/#
Core Features: Survival Analysis, Reliability Analysis, Lifetime Data Analysis, Data Preprocessing, Survival Function Estimation, Hazard Rate Estimation, Confidence Interval Estimation, Modeling & Prediction Of Survival Data, Visualization Tools
General Tags: Python Library, Survival Analysis, Lifetime Data Analysis, Reliability Analysis, Data Visualization
AI Description: Lifelines is a Python library for survival analysis, reliability, and lifetime data analysis. It provides tools for data preprocessing, estimating survival functions, hazard rates, and confidence intervals, as well as modeling, predicting, and visualizing survival data.

Software Description: Liftoff is an accurate GFF3/GTF lift over pipeline.
Core Features: Faster Build Times Compared To Xcode, Improved Reliability & Consistency In Building Projects, Automatic Parallelization Of Tasks For Maximizing Performance, Integrated Dependency Management For Efficient Project Builds, Support For Defining Custom Build Rules & Configurations
General Tags: Build System, Ios Development, Macos Development, Software Development, Apple Platforms
AI Description: Liftoff is a powerful build system for iOS and macOS projects. It is designed to be faster and more reliable than the built-in Xcode build system, providing a more efficient development experience for Apple platform developers.

Software Description: LiftoffTools is a toolkit to compare genes lifted between genome assemblies.
Core Features: The core features of liftofftools include liftoff data analysis, visualization of liftoff output, comparison of liftoff results, integration with other bioinformatics tools, and customization for specific research needs.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Genomics, Data Analysis, Sequencing Technologies
AI Description: liftofftools is a software tool designed for the analysis and visualization of liftoff data generated from sequencing technologies, particularly useful in genomics and bioinformatics research.

Software Description:
LIKWID stands for “Like I Knew What I’m Doing.” It is an easy to use yet powerful command line performance tool suite for the GNU/Linux operating system. While  LIKWID supported only x86 processors at the beginning, it has been ported to ARM (including Fujitsu A64FX)  and POWER8/9 architectures as well as to NVIDIA  and AMD GPGPUs. Some of its tools are even architecture agnostic. 
Description Source: https://hpc.fau.de/research/tools/likwid/
Core Features: Supports Performance Counter Profiling On Intel & Amd Processors, Command-Line Tools For Gathering Performance Data, Libraries For Accessing Hardware Performance Counters, Advanced Analysis & Visualization Capabilities
General Tags: Performance Analysis, Hpc, Performance Counter Profiling, Hardware Performance Counters
AI Description: LIKWID is a performance analysis tool suite designed to support HPC/PCP (performance counter profiling) on Intel and AMD processors. It offers a set of command-line tools and libraries that facilitate the collection of performance data and analysis on modern hardware architectures.

Software Description: Lima is the standard tool to identify barcode and primer sequences in PacBio single-molecule sequencing data.
Core Features: Quality Control Of Single-Cell Data, Normalization & Batch Correction, Dimensionality Reduction Techniques, Clustering Algorithms, Gene Expression Analysis, Cell Type Identification
General Tags: Single-Cell RNA-Seq, Data Analysis, Transcriptomics
AI Description: Lima is an open-source software tool developed for single-cell RNA-seq data analysis. It provides a user-friendly interface and a variety of algorithms for processing and analyzing single-cell transcriptomic data.

Core Features: Collaborative Engineering For Arm Architecture, Optimizing Open-Source Software, Working On Linux Kernel, Toolchain, & Graphics Stack
General Tags: Collaborative Engineering, Arm Architecture, Open-Source Software Optimization
AI Description: Linaro is a collaborative engineering organization that works on consolidating and optimizing open-source software for the Arm architecture, including the Linux kernel, toolchain, and graphics stack.

Software Description: LINKS is a genomics application for scaffolding genome assemblies with long reads, such as those produced by Oxford Nanopore Technologies Ltd.
Core Features: Text-based browsing, rendering tables and frames, background downloading, SSL connections, customization options
General Tags: Web Browser, Text-Based, Console-Based, Terminal-Based
AI Description: Links is a text-based web browser with support for rendering tables and frames, background downloading, font styles, colors, and SSL connections. It is customizable and highly configurable for browsing the web in a terminal or console environment.

Software Description:
Little CMS intends to be an OPEN SOURCE small-footprint color management engine, with special focus on accuracy and performance. It uses the International Color Consortium standard (ICC), which is the modern standard when regarding to color management. 
Description Source: https://github.com/mm2/Little-CMS
Core Features: Color Management Engine, Portable & Lightweight, Supports Icc Profiles, Open-Source
General Tags: Color Management, Software Development, Image Processing
AI Description: LittleCMS is a color management engine that provides simplified and portable fundamentals for the development and integration of color management components into various software applications.

Software Description:
LLDB is a next generation, high-performance debugger. It is built as a set of reusable components which highly leverage existing libraries in the larger LLVM Project, such as the Clang expression parser and LLVM disassembler. 
Description Source: https://lldb.llvm.org/
Core Features: LLDB provides a rich set of features for debugging, including support for breakpoints, watchpoints, expression evaluation, scripting support with Python, a command-line interface, and integration with IDEs like Xcode.
General Tags: Debugger, Llvm, C/C++, Objective-C
AI Description: LLDB is a powerful and modern debugger for C, C++, and Objective-C languages. It is part of the LLVM project and mainly used for debugging programs on macOS and iOS.

Software Description:
The LLVM Project is a collection of modular and reusable compiler and toolchain technologies. Despite its name, LLVM has little to do with traditional virtual machines. 
Description Source: https://llvm.org/
Core Features: LLVM provides a modern code generation infrastructure with a strong focus on compile-time, run-time, and language-agnostic components. It includes a wide range of compiler technologies, such as front-end parsing, optimization passes, and code generation. LLVM also offers a powerful intermediate representation (IR) that facilitates optimization and portability across different architectures.
General Tags: Compiler, Toolchain

AI Description: The LLVM Project is a collection of modular and reusable compiler and toolchain technologies. LLVM is used for developing compiler back-ends, static analysis tools, and JIT compilation engines.

Software Description:
LMDB is a universal Python binding for the LMDB ‘Lightning’ Database. Two variants are provided and automatically selected during install: a CFFI variant that supports PyPy and all versions of CPython >=2.7, and a C extension that supports CPython >=2.7 and >=3.4. Both variants provide the same interface. 
Description Source: https://lmdb.readthedocs.io/en/release/
Core Features: High Performance, Memory-Efficient, Crash-Proof, Key-Value Store, Embedded Applications Support
General Tags: Database, Key-Value Store, Memory-Mapped Files
AI Description: LMDB is an extremely fast, memory-efficient and crash-proof key-value store that is well-suited for embedded applications and high-performance web services. It is written in C and operates directly on memory-mapped files.

Software Description:
Lmod is a Lua based module system that easily handles the MODULEPATH Hierarchical problem. Environment Modules provide a convenient way to dynamically change the users’ environment through modulefiles. This includes easily adding or removing directories to the PATH environment variable. 
Description Source: https://lmod.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
Core Features:
1. Hierarchical module naming scheme for organizing modules 2. Support for software collections and version retention 3. Intelligent module handling to prevent conflicts 4. Easy-to-use commands for loading, swapping, unloading, and listing modules
5. Integration with cluster job submissions for seamless environment setup
General Tags: Module Management, Software Environment, Environment Module System
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Bridges-2: https://www.psc.edu/resources/software/lmod 
Delta: https://docs.ncsa.illinois.edu/systems/delta/en/latest/user_guide/software.html 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/ 
Stampede3: https://tacc.utexas.edu/use-tacc/software-list/
Version Info:
Aces: Lmod
Bridges-2: Lmod
Delta: Lmod
Faster: Lmod
Jetstream: Lmod
AI Description: Lmod is an environment module system that helps users manage their software environment by providing a convenient way to dynamically modify the user's environment through modulefiles. It supports multiple collections of modules that can be easily swapped in and out, allowing users to load the software packages and versions they need for their work.

Software Description: Lofreq is a fast and sensitive variant-caller for inferring SNVs and indels from next-generation sequencing data.
Core Features: Detection Of Low-Frequency Variants, Identification Of Somatic Mutations In Cancer Genomes, Optimized For Viral Populations, Statistical Models For Variant Calling
General Tags: Variant Calling, Ngs Data Analysis, Sequence Analysis, Somatic Mutations, Viral Populations
AI Description: LoFreq is a computational tool designed for the identification of rare sequence variants from next-generation sequencing data. It specifically focuses on the detection of somatic mutations in cancer genomes and low-frequency variants in viral populations.

Software Description: LongPhase is an ultra-fast program for simultaneously co-phasing SNPs and SVs by using Nanopore and PacBio long reads.
Core Features: Bayesian Model Selection, Parameter Inference, Radiogenic Isotopic Data Analysis, Age Estimation, Uncertainty Assessment
General Tags: Geochronology, Radiogenic Isotopes, Bayesian Statistics, Parameter Estimation
AI Description: longphase is a comprehensive software package for Bayesian model selection and parameter inference in the field of geochronology. It provides tools for analyzing radiogenic isotopic data with statistical methods to estimate the ages and uncertainties of geological events.

Software Description: LongQC is a tool for the data quality control of the PacBio and ONT long reads.
Core Features: Quality Assessment Of Long-Read Sequencing Data, Identification Of Sequencing Errors & Artifacts, Visualization Of Sequencing Metrics & Quality Scores, Detection Of Chimeric Reads & Adapter Sequences, Assessment Of Base-Call Accuracy & Read-Length Distribution
General Tags: Quality Control, Long-Read Sequencing, Bioinformatics
AI Description: LongQC is a quality control tool for long-read sequencing data, designed specifically for third-generation sequencing technologies like Pacific Biosciences (PacBio) and Oxford Nanopore Technologies. It aims to assess the quality of raw long-read sequencing data and provide users with detailed insights into the characteristics of the sequenced reads.

Core Features: Array-Oriented Programming, Automatic Differentiation, Gpu Support, Linear Equation Solving
General Tags: Programming, Optimization, Linear Algebra, Automatic Differentiation
AI Description: Loopy is a software tool for array-oriented programming with multiple inputs and outputs, offering automatic differentiation and GPU support. It enables users to express and solve linear equations in a highly optimized manner.

Software Description:
lowcharts is a tool to draw low-resolution graphs in terminal. 
Description Source: https://github.com/juan-leon/lowcharts
Core Features:
1. Easy-to-use interface for creating basic charts.
2. Supports line charts, bar charts, and scatter plots.
3. Lightweight and minimalistic design.
4. Open-source and customizable.
General Tags: Python Library, Data Visualization, Charting Library
AI Description: Lowcharts is a Python library for creating basic low-level charts with a simplistic and minimalistic interface. It aims to provide users with an easy-to-use tool for generating simple line charts, bar charts, and scatter plots.

Software Description: Lra is a sequence alignment program that aligns long reads from single-molecule sequencing (SMS) instruments, or megabase-scale contigs from SMS assemblies.
Core Features:
1. Perform linear regression analysis
2. Model the relationship between dependent and independent variables
3. Explore statistical significance of variables
4. Generate regression plots and diagnostics
General Tags: Linear Regression, Statistical Analysis, Open-Source
AI Description: LRA is a free and open-source software tool designed for linear regression analysis. It allows users to perform statistical analysis to model the relationship between a dependent variable and one or more independent variables.

Software Description: LTR_Finder is an efficient program for finding full-length LTR retrotranspsons in genome sequences.
Core Features:
1. Detection and characterization of LTR retrotransposons
2. Identification of LTR sequences and direct repeats
3. Prediction of target site duplications and primer binding sites
4. Classification of LTR families and annotation of LTR retrotransposons
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Genomics
AI Description: LTR_FINDER is a computational tool for the identification and annotation of long terminal repeat (LTR) retrotransposons in genomic sequences. These transposable elements have a significant impact on genome structure and evolution.

Core Features:
1. Prediction of LTR retrotransposons in genomic sequences
2. Utilizes machine learning algorithms for accurate identification
3. Annotation of LTR retrotransposons with relevant information
4. User-friendly interface for easy analysis
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Genomics, Machine Learning
AI Description: ltrpred is a software tool for predicting long terminal repeat retrotransposons in genomic sequences. It uses a machine learning approach to identify and annotate LTR retrotransposons.

Software Description: LTRpred(ict): de novo annotation of young and intact retrotransposons.

Lua is a powerful, fast, lightweight, embeddable scripting language. Lua combines simple procedural syntax with powerful data description constructs based on associative arrays and extensible semantics. Lua is dynamically typed, runs by interpreting bytecode for a register-based virtual machine, and has automatic memory management with incremental garbage collection, making it ideal for configuration, scripting, and rapid prototyping.
Core Features: Dynamic Typing, Garbage Collection, Coroutine Support, Extensibility Through C Api, Table-Based Data Structures
General Tags: Programming Language, Scripting Language, Embedded Systems

Ookami: https://www.stonybrook.edu/commcms/ookami/support/faq/software_on_ookami
AI Description: Lua is a lightweight, high-level, multi-paradigm programming language designed for embedded use in applications. It is known for its simplicity, efficiency, and flexibility.

Core Features:
1. Detects structural variants from paired-end short reads
2. Identifies deletions, insertions, inversions, and duplications
3. Provides information on the structural organization of the genome
4. Can be used for variant discovery and genotyping
General Tags: Genomic Analysis, Structural Variant Detection
AI Description: Lumpy is a structural variant caller that can detect various types of genomic variations using paired-end short reads, such as deletions, insertions, inversions, and duplications. It provides insights into the structural organization of a genome.

Software Description: Lumpy-sv is a general probabilistic framework for structural variant discovery.
Core Features: Probabilistic Framework For Structural Variant Discovery, Detection Of Various Types Of Structural Variations, Combining Multiple Variant Callers For Improved Accuracy
General Tags: Structural Variant Discovery, Probabilistic Framework, Bioinformatics
AI Description: LUMPY-SV is a general probabilistic framework for structural variant discovery. It includes several variant callers which can be combined to detect different types of structural variations in a reference genome.

Software Description: LVM2 (Logical Volume Manager 2) is a toolset that allows for logical volume management on Linux systems. It enables users to manage storage objects such as physical volumes, volume groups, and logical volumes, providing flexibility and scalability for storage allocation and management.
Core Features: Create & Manage Logical Volumes, Resize Logical Volumes On The Fly, Support For Snapshots & Thin Provisioning, Manage Multiple Physical Storage Devices As A Single Shared Pool
General Tags: System Tool, Storage Management, Disk Management
AI Description: Logical Volume Manager 2 (LVM2) is a system tool for managing logical volumes. It is typically used to manage disk storage space in a more flexible manner than traditional partitioning.

Research Field: Computer & Information Sciences, Other Computer & Information Sciences
Software Description: The lxml XML toolkit is a Pythonic binding for the C libraries libxml2 and libxslt. It is unique in that it combines the speed and XML feature completeness of these libraries with the simplicity of a native Python API, mostly compatible but superior to the well-known ElementTree API.
Core Features: Parsing Xml & Html Documents, Xpath & Xslt Support, Elementtree Api For Manipulating Xml Data, Validation & Schema Support
General Tags: Python Library, Xml Processing, Html Processing, Data Parsing
AI Description: lxml is a powerful and feature-rich library for processing XML and HTML in Python. It provides a simple and pythonic API for efficient handling of XML and HTML data.

Software Description: Lyveset is a method of using hqSNPs to create a phylogeny, especially for outbreak investigations.
Core Features: Variant Detection For Whole Genome Sequencing Data, Identifies Snvs & Indels, Uses Bayesian Algorithm For Variant Calling, Specifically Designed For Bacterial Genomes Analysis
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Genomics, Variant Detection, Microbial Genomics
AI Description: LyveSET is a microbial variant detection pipeline for Whole Genome Sequencing data. It identifies single nucleotide variants (SNVs), insertion and deletions (indels) using a Bayesian algorithm. LyveSET is primarily used for the analysis of bacterial genomes.

Software Description:
LZ4 is lossless compression algorithm, providing compression speed > 500 MB/s per core (>0.15 Bytes/cycle). It features an extremely fast decoder, with speed in multiple GB/s per core (~1 Byte/cycle). A high compression derivative, called LZ4_HC, is available, trading customizable CPU time for compression ratio. 
Description Source: https://lz4.org/
Core Features:
1. Very high-speed compression and decompression
2. Low memory usage
3. Single-pass mode for very fast compression at slightly reduced compression ratio
4. Frame format for data integrity checking
5. Block-independent compression for parallel decompression
6. Support for in-place decompression
General Tags: Compression, Data Compression, Lossless Compression
AI Description: LZ4 is a lossless data compression algorithm that offers extremely fast compression and decompression speeds. It is designed to be very efficient in terms of both processing power and memory usage.

Core Features: 1. Lossless compression using the LZMA algorithm. 2. Very safe integrity checking. 3. Similar user interface to bzip2 or gzip. 4. Fast decompression speeds. 5. Better compression ratio than bzip2.
General Tags: Compression, Data Archiving, Software Distribution
AI Description: Lzip is a lossless data compressor based on the LZMA algorithm, with very safe integrity checking and a user interface similar to the one of bzip2 or gzip. Lzip decompresses almost as fast as gzip and compresses better than bzip2, which makes it well suited for software distribution and data archiving.

Core Features: LZMA achieves high compression ratios and fast decompression speeds. It supports multiple compression settings and dictionary sizes. LZMA also offers integrity checking for compressed data.
General Tags: Compression, Data Compression, Algorithm
AI Description: LZMA is a high-compression data compression software program that employs the Lempel-Ziv-Markov chain algorithm (LZMA). It provides lossless data compression and decompression algorithms.

Core Features: High-Speed Compression & Decompression, Moderate Compression Ratios, Suitable For Applications Prioritizing Speed Over High Compression Ratios
General Tags: Data Compression, Algorithm, High-Speed
AI Description: Lempel-Ziv-Oberhumer (LZO) is a data compression algorithm that focuses on high-speed compression and decompression. It offers fast compression and decompression speeds with moderate compression ratios. LZO is commonly used in applications where speed is more critical than achieving the highest compression ratios.

Software Description:
GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor. It is mostly SVR4 compatible although it has some extensions (for example, handling more than 9 positional parameters to macros). GNU M4 also has built-in functions for including files, running shell commands, doing arithmetic, etc. 
Description Source: https://www.gnu.org/software/m4/
Core Features: Macro Processing Capabilities, Text Manipulation & Generation, Support For Defining & Calling Macros, Conditional Processing, Loop Constructs
General Tags: Macro Processor, Text Processing, Software Development, Build Process
AI Description: m4 is a general-purpose macro processor designed to be used with any programming language or data file format. It is commonly used to generate source code or text files and is often used as part of the build process for software development.

Software Description: Macrel is a pipeline to mine antimicrobial peptides (AMPs) from (meta)genomes.
Core Features: Prediction Of Molecular Binding Sites, Utilizes Evolutionary Conservation & Amino Acid Properties, Identification Of Ligand Binding Sites, Identification Of Protein-Protein Interaction Sites, Prediction Of Active Sites In Enzymes
General Tags: Molecular Binding Sites, Protein Structures, Evolutionary Conservation, Ligand Binding, Protein-Protein Interactions, Enzyme Active Sites
AI Description: Macrel is a computational tool used to predict molecular binding sites in protein structures based on evolutionary conservation and amino acid physicochemical properties. It can be utilized to identify potential ligand binding sites, protein-protein interaction sites, or active sites for enzymes.

Software Description: MACS2 is Model-based Analysis of ChIP-Seq for identifying transcript factor binding sites.
Core Features: Identification Of Transcription Factor Binding Sites, Analysis Of Histone Modification Enrichment, Utilizes Dynamic Poisson Distribution, Comparing Tag Position Density Profiles
General Tags: Chip-Seq Analysis, Transcription Factor Binding Sites, Histone Modification, Bioinformatics
AI Description: Model-based Analysis of ChIP-Seq (MACS) version 2 is a tool for identifying transcription factor binding sites and histone modification enrichment from ChIP-Seq data. It uses a dynamic Poisson distribution to effectively capture local biases in the genome while comparing the tag position density profiles between ChIP-Seq data and control samples.

Software Description: Macs3 is Model-based Analysis of ChIP-Seq for identifying transcript factor.
Core Features: Identification Of Protein-DNA Interaction Sites, Analysis Of Chip-Seq Data, Dynamic Poisson Distribution Modeling, Spatial Correlation Capture For Peak Detection
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Chip-Seq, Genomics, Computational Biology, Data Analysis
AI Description: MACS3 (Model-based analysis of ChIP-Seq) is a software tool specifically designed for identifying genome-wide protein-DNA interaction sites from ChIP-Seq data. It uses a dynamic Poisson distribution to model the background noise and captures the spatial correlation of the ChIP-Seq data to improve peak detection accuracy.

Software Description:
maeparser is a parser for Schrodinger Maestro files. 
Description Source: https://github.com/schrodinger/maeparser
Core Features:
1. Read and write Maestro files efficiently.
2. Extract molecular structures and properties from Maestro files.
3. Compatible with various molecular modeling tools and software.
4. Facilitates data extraction and manipulation for further analysis.
General Tags: Python Library, Molecular Data, Maestro Files
AI Description: maeparser is a Python library for reading and writing molecular data stored in Maestro files. It provides a simple interface for extracting structural information from Maestro files commonly used in molecular modeling and computational chemistry.

Software Description: MAFFT is a multiple alignment program for amino acid or nucleotide sequences.
Core Features: Some core features of MAFFT include progressive alignment, iterative refinement, support for large datasets, alignment extension, and compatibility with commonly used formats.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Alignment, Phylogenetics
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Anvil: https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/software/mafft 
Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/
AI Description: MAFFT is a multiple sequence alignment program for amino acid or nucleotide sequences. It offers a range of algorithms and options for improving alignment quality.

Software Description: Model-based Analysis of Genome-wide CRISPR-Cas9 Knockout (MAGeCK) is a computational tool to identify important genes from the recent genome-scale CRISPR-Cas9 knockout screens (or GeCKO) technology.
Core Features: High-Throughput Crispr-Cas9 Genetic Screen Analysis, Identification Of Essential Genes & Pathways, Gene Set Enrichment Analysis, Quality Control & Normalization Of Crispr Screening Data
General Tags: Crispr-Cas9, Genetic Screens, Essential Genes, Pathway Analysis
AI Description: MAGeCK is a computational model designed for the analysis of high-throughput CRISPR-Cas9 genetic screens to identify essential genes and pathways.

Software Description: Magic-BLAST is a tool for mapping large next-generation RNA or DNA sequencing runs against a whole genome or transcriptome.
Core Features: Mapping Next-Generation Sequencing Runs, Using Blast Algorithm For Read Mapping, Producing Output In Sam Format, High-Speed & Accuracy
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Ngs Analysis, Sequence Alignment, Read Mapping
AI Description: Magic-BLAST is a tool for mapping large next-generation RNA or DNA sequencing runs against a whole genome or transcriptome. It uses the BLAST algorithm to map reads quickly and accurately and produce output in a standard SAM format.

Software Description:
Magics is a plotting package to visualise meteorological data in GRIB, NetCDF, BUFR and ODB format. 
Description Source: https://github.com/ecmwf/magics
Core Features:
1. Visualization of meteorological data in 2D and 3D.
2. Offers various graphical elements like maps, wind fields, trajectories, symbols, etc.
3. Customizable features for creating publication-quality weather maps.
4. Supports interpolation methods for smooth data representation.
General Tags: Visualization, Meteorology, Meteorological Data, Weather Forecasting
AI Description: Magics is a software library for visualizing meteorological data. It provides a wide range of graphical elements for the simultaneous representation of 2D and 3D data, including maps, wind fields, trajectories, symbols, etc. Magics is commonly used in weather forecasting, climate research, and meteorological data analysis.

Software Description:
Magma is an open-source software platform that gives network operators an open, flexible and extendable mobile core network solution. 
Description Source: https://github.com/magma/magma
Core Features: Magma offers a wide range of capabilities including computations with matrices, algebraic structures, number theory, polynomial systems, and modular forms. It also supports visualization tools for exploring mathematical objects and structures.
General Tags: Mathematics, Algebra, Number Theory, Combinatorics
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Delta: https://docs.ncsa.illinois.edu/systems/delta/en/latest/user_guide/software.html 
Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/
AI Description: Magma is a software package designed for computations in algebra, number theory, algebraic geometry, and algebraic combinatorics. It provides a powerful tool for mathematical research and applications.

Core Features: Ngs Data Analysis, High-Throughput Genetic Data Processing, User-Friendly Interface, Advanced Analysis Tools
General Tags: Ngs Analysis, Genetic Data Processing, Bioinformatics
AI Description: MainMast is a software tool designed for high-throughput genetic data analysis, specifically focusing on Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) data. It provides researchers with a user-friendly interface and a suite of analysis tools to efficiently process and interpret genetic data.

Software Description: GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
Core Features: Dependency management, Automation, Build process management
General Tags: Build Automation, Software Development, Programming
AI Description: Make is a build automation tool that automatically builds executable programs and libraries from source code by reading files called Makefiles which specifies how to derive the target program.

Software Description: The makedepend package contains a C-preprocessor like utility to determine build-time dependencies.
Core Features:
1. Automatically generates dependencies for C source files.
2. Improves build process efficiency by tracking source file dependencies.
3. Integrates seamlessly with makefiles.
4. Facilitates tracking of changes in source files.
General Tags: Software Development, Build Automation, Dependency Management
AI Description: makedepend is a tool used in software development to automatically generate dependencies of C source files. It is commonly used in projects utilizing makefiles to track dependencies and streamline the build process.

Software Description: Texinfo uses a single source file to produce output in a number of formats, both online and printed (HTML, PDF, DVI, Info, DocBook, LaTeX, EPUB 3). This means that instead of writing different documents for online information and another for a printed manual, you need write only one document.
Core Features: 1. Formatting Texinfo documentation for various output formats. 2. Generating high-quality documentation with cross-references and indices. 3. Customizable templates for styling output documents. 4. Integration with build systems for automated documentation generation.
General Tags: Documentation, Formatting, Texinfo, Build Systems
AI Description: makeinfo is a program that formats and prints Texinfo documentation. Texinfo is a typesetting syntax used for generating documentation in a variety of output formats such as HTML, DVI, PDF, PostScript, and plain text.

Software Description: Maker is a portable and easily configurable genome annotation pipeline.
Core Features: Repeat identification, EST and protein alignment to a genome, gene predictions, gene annotation synthesis
General Tags: Genome Annotation, Bioinformatics
AI Description: MAKER is an easy-to-use genome annotation pipeline designed for small to large vertebrate genomes. It identifies repeats, aligns ESTs and proteins to a genome, produces ab initio gene predictions, and automatically synthesizes these data into gene annotations.

Software Description: Mako is a template library for Python that allows developers to generate dynamic content in various formats such as HTML, XML, or text files. It provides a powerful and flexible way to create templates and combine them with data to produce output.
Core Features:
1. Familiar syntax similar to Python
2. High performance through Python module compilation
3. Customizable template inheritance and variable substitutions
4. Supports embedding Python code directly in templates
5. Integration with various web frameworks like Flask and Django
General Tags: Template Library, Python, Web Development
AI Description: Mako is a template library written in Python. It provides a familiar, non-XML syntax that compiles into Python modules for maximum performance.

Software Description: Mamba is a fast, robust, and cross-platform package manager. It runs on Windows, OS X and Linux (ARM64 and PPC64LE included) and is fully compatible with conda packages and supports most of conda's commands.
Core Features: Efficiently resolves package dependency graphs, supports package installation, creation, update, removal, and environment management, enables users to quickly create isolated environments for different projects, supports package installation from various sources like Anaconda repositories and Conda-Forge, provides compatibility with Conda environments and configuration files, offers a clean and easy-to-use command-line interface.
General Tags: Package Manager, Dependency Resolver, Environment Management
AI Description: Mamba is a reimplementation of the high-performance package manager Conda that aims to be much faster in resolving package dependencies. It provides a simple and fast way to manage environments and packages for conda-enabled systems.

Software Description: Manta calls structural variants (SVs) and indels from mapped paired-end sequencing reads.
Core Features: Structural Variant Identification, Indel Calling, Genomic Rearrangement Characterization
General Tags: Structural Variant Calling, Genomic Analysis, Sequencing Data Analysis
AI Description: Manta is a structural variant and indel caller for mapped sequencing data, primarily for whole genome and exome resequencing. It identifies and characterizes genomic rearrangements in contrast to single nucleotide variants and small indels.

Core Features: Create Detailed Maps, Visualize Spatial Data, Analyze Geographic Information, Overlay Multiple Data Layers
General Tags: Mapping Software, Geographical Analysis, Cartography
AI Description: Map is a software tool used for creating, visualizing, and analyzing geographical maps. It is commonly used in cartography and geographic information systems (GIS).

Software Description: Mapcaller is an efficient and versatile approach for short-read mapping and variant identification using high-throughput sequenced data
Core Features: MapCaller offers variant calling capabilities, including single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs), insertions/deletions (indels), structural variations (SVs), and copy number variations (CNVs). It supports various sequencing technologies and can handle large-scale datasets efficiently.
General Tags: Genetic Variations, Sequencing Data, Variant Calling
AI Description: MapCaller is a software for calling and analyzing the genetic variations from sequencing data.

Software Description: mapDamage2 is a computational framework written in Python and R, which tracks and quantifies DNA damage patterns among ancient DNA sequencing reads generated by Next-Generation Sequencing platforms.
Core Features: Assessment Of DNA Damage Patterns, Identification Of Post-Mortem Nucleotide Misincorporations, Quantification Of DNA Fragmentation, Differentiation Between Ancient DNA & Modern Contamination
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Genomics, Ancient DNA, DNA Damage
AI Description: mapdamage2 is a software package that assesses DNA damage patterns from ancient DNA sequencing data. It is designed to identify and quantify post-mortem DNA damage patterns, such as nucleotide misincorporations and DNA fragmentation, to aid in distinguishing authentic ancient DNA sequences from modern contamination.

Software Description: MarginPolish is a graph-based assembly polisher.
Core Features: 1. Uses raw nanopore sequencing data to improve the accuracy of genome assemblies. 2. Implements a graph-based approach to correct errors in the assembly. 3. Can be used as a standalone tool or integrated into existing genome assembly pipelines.
General Tags: Genome Assembly, Nanopore Sequencing, Polishing
AI Description: MarginPolish is a tool for polishing genome assemblies by generating new consensus sequences based on raw nanopore sequencing data.

Core Features: High Performance, Scalability, Enterprise-Ready, Robust Sql Support, Open Source
General Tags: Database Management System, Rdbms, Open Source, Sql
AI Description: MariaDB is a popular open source relational database management system (RDBMS) that is a drop-in replacement for MySQL. It is known for its high performance, scalability, and robust SQL support. MariaDB is developed by the original creators of MySQL and is designed for enterprise environments, web applications, and mission-critical systems.

Software Description: Mash is a fast sequence distance estimator that uses MinHash.
Core Features: Estimates Genetic Distances Between Genomes, Uses Minhash Technique For Dimensionality Reduction, Computes Jaccard Distances Between DNA Sequences, Rapid Genome Comparisons
General Tags: Genome Distance Estimator, Minhash Technique, Jaccard Distances, DNA Sequences, Genome Comparisons
AI Description: Mash is a fast and flexible genome distance estimator that can accurately estimate the pairwise genetic distance between genomes. It uses a MinHash dimensionality reduction technique to efficiently compute Jaccard distances between large sets of DNA sequences, enabling rapid genome comparisons.

Software Description: Mashmap is a fast approximate aligner for long DNA sequences.
Core Features:
1. Reference-based mapping for highly-divergent sequences
2. Efficient alignment of large genomes
3. Detection of structural variations
4. Rapid identification of sequence similarities
5. Flexible and customizable options for mapping
General Tags: Mapping, Alignment, Genomics, Bioinformatics
AI Description: mashmap is a reference-based approximate mapping tool designed for highly-divergent sequences. It efficiently aligns large genomes, offering flexibility and speed in detecting structural variations and similarities.

Software Description: Mashtree is a tool to create a tree using Mash distances.
Core Features:
1. Constructs phylogenetic trees directly from pairwise Mash distances.
2. Builds hierarchical trees from Mash distance matrices in Newick tree format.
3. Fast and memory-efficient method for creating phylogenetic trees based on genomic similarity.
General Tags: Phylogenetic Trees, Genomic Similarity, Mash Distances
AI Description: Mashtree is a tool for constructing phylogenetic trees directly from pairwise Mash distances. It builds hierarchical trees from Mash distance matrices in Newick tree format. Mashtree provides a fast and memory-efficient method for creating phylogenetic trees based on genomic similarity.

Software Description: The MaSuRCA (Maryland Super Read Cabog Assembler) genome assembly and analysis toolkit contains of MaSuRCA genome assembler, QuORUM error corrector for Illumina data, POLCA genome polishing software, Chromosome scaffolder, jellyfish mer counter, and MUMmer aligner.
Core Features:
1. Hybrid assembly of genomes using both short and long reads.
2. Utilizes error correction protocols for long reads.
3. Implements mate pair and paired-end libraries for scaffolding.
4. Specifically optimized for long reads from PacBio and Nanopore technologies.
General Tags: Genome Assembly, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology
AI Description: MaSuRCA (Maryland Super-Read Celera Assembler) is a hybrid and hierarchical genome assembler specifically designed for long reads like those produced by Pacific Biosciences or Oxford Nanopore Technologies. It aims to assemble genomes at high accuracy and contiguity using a combination of short Illumina reads and long error-prone reads.

Software Description:
Mathematica is a mathematical computation program used in scientific, engineering, mathematical, and computing fields. It's a software system with built-in libraries for machine learning, statistics, symbolic computation, and more. Mathematica uses intelligent automation in every part of the system, from algorithm selection to plot layout and user interface design. 
Description Source: https://www.wolfram.com/mathematica/
Core Features: Symbolic & Numerical Computation, Data Analysis & Visualization, Programming Environment, Algorithms & Equation Solving, Machine Learning Capabilities
General Tags: Computational Software, Mathematics, Data Analysis, Programming, Visualization
AI Description: Mathematica is a computational software program used in scientific, engineering, mathematical and computing fields. It provides a wide range of tools for symbolic and numerical computations, visualization, data analysis, and programming.

Software Description: Matio is an open-source C library for reading and writing binary MATLAB MAT files. This library is designed for use by programs/libraries that do not have access or do not want to rely on MATLAB's shared libraries.
Core Features:
1. Reading and writing MATLAB MAT files in C and Fortran.
2. Supports Level 5 MAT files.
3. Supports most features of MAT 4 and MAT 5 MAT files.
General Tags: Matlab Mat Files, C, Fortran
AI Description: matio is a library for reading and writing MATLAB MAT files in C and Fortran. The library supports reading and writing Level 5 MAT files and supports most of the features of MAT 4 and MAT 5 MAT files.

RP Name: Aces, Anvil, Bridges-2, Darwin, Expanse, Faster, Jetstream, Ookami
Software Description: MATLAB is a programming and numeric computing platform used by millions of engineers and scientists to analyze data, develop algorithms, and create models.
Core Features: Algorithm Development, Data Analysis, Data Visualization, Mathematical Modeling, Simulation
General Tags: Programming Language, Technical Computing, Visualization, Mathematical Notation

Anvil: https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/software/matlab
