AI Description: MATLAB is a high-performance language for technical computing and visualization. It integrates computation, visualization, and programming in an easy-to-use environment where problems and solutions are expressed in familiar mathematical notation.

Software Description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and interactive visualizations in Python. Matplotlib makes easy things easy and hard things possible. 
Description Source: https://matplotlib.org/
Core Features:
1. Supports various plot types including line plots, bar plots, scatter plots, histograms, etc.
2. Allows for customization of plot aesthetics, including colors, styles, labels, and annotations.
3. Supports multiple backends for rendering, including interactive backends for use in GUI applications.
4. Integration with NumPy and Pandas data structures for easy data visualization.
5. Capable of creating publication-quality figures for scientific publications and presentations.
General Tags: Python Library, Data Visualization, Plotting Library
AI Description: Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and interactive visualizations in Python. It can be used to generate plots, histograms, power spectra, bar charts, error charts, scatterplots, etc. Matplotlib is highly customizable and offers a wide range of plotting options and styles.

Software Description: This project is meant as a zero configuration replacement for setuptools-rust and milksnake. It supports building wheels for python 3.5+ on windows, linux, mac and freebsd, can upload them to pypi and has basic pypy and graalpy support.
Core Features: Facilitates Building Python Packages With Rust Extensions, Enables Creation Of Python Wheels For Packages With Rust Code, Simplifies Distribution & Packaging Process For Hybrid Rust-Python Projects
General Tags: Python Packaging, Rust Programming Language, Build System, Python Extensions, Package Distribution
AI Description: Maturin is a Rust-native build system for Python packages that allows users to create wheels for their Python packages written in Rust. It aims to simplify the process of packaging and distributing Python extensions written in Rust, providing a seamless integration between Rust and Python ecosystems.

Software Description: Mauve is a system for constructing multiple genome alignments in the presence of large-scale evolutionary events such as rearrangement and inversion
Core Features: Mauve offers an interactive visualization tool for comparing multiple genomes, identifying large-scale genome rearrangements, and highlighting areas of conservation or variation. It can align draft genomes and has the ability to handle incomplete or noisy data.
General Tags: Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Genome Alignment
AI Description: Mauve is a computational tool used for multiple genome alignment. It is specifically designed for aligning and analyzing genomes with an emphasis on rearrangements.

Software Description:
Apache Maven is a software project management and comprehension tool. Based on the concept of a project object model (POM), Maven can manage a project's build, reporting and documentation from a central piece of information. 
Description Source: https://maven.apache.org/
Core Features: Dependency Management, Build Automation, Project Reporting, Plugin Management, Reusable Build Logic
General Tags: Build Automation, Dependency Management, Java Projects
AI Description: Apache Maven is a build automation tool used primarily for Java projects. It manages project dependencies and provides a standardized way to build, test, and deploy Java software projects.

Software Description: Maxbin2 is a software for binning assembled metagenomic sequences based on an Expectation-Maximization algorithm.
Core Features:
1. Binning of assembled metagenomic sequences to represent individual genomes in microbial communities.
2. High accuracy binning using Expectation-Maximization algorithm.
3. Ability to handle large dataset sizes efficiently.
4. Provides visualization tools for analyzing binning results.
5. Compatible with various sequencing technologies and assembly tools.
General Tags: Metagenomics, Microbiome, Bioinformatics, Genomics
AI Description: MaxBin2 is a software tool for binning assembled metagenomic sequences based on an Expectation-Maximization algorithm. It assigns contigs to discrete bins representing individual genomes in a microbial community.

Software Description: Maxquant is a quantitative proteomics software package designed for analyzing large mass-spectrometric data sets. It is specifically aimed at high-resolution MS data.
Core Features: Quantitative Proteomics Analysis, Label-Free & Stable Isotope-Labeled Protein Quantification, Identification Of Peptides & Proteins
General Tags: Proteomics, Mass Spectrometry, Data Analysis, Bioinformatics
AI Description: MaxQuant is a quantitative proteomics software package designed for analyzing large mass spectrometric data sets. It is used for label-free and stable isotope-labeled protein quantification, as well as identification of peptides and proteins.

Core Features:
1. High-speed buffering of data streams
2. Optimization of data transfer rate
3. Support for reading from and writing to various sources
4. Efficient I/O performance
General Tags: Data Streams, Buffering, Data Transfer, Optimization
AI Description: mbuffer is a tool for buffering data streams that offers high-speed I/O performance and better throughput. It provides an efficient way to read and write data to and from various sources while optimizing the data transfer rate.

Software Description: Midnight Commander (also known as mc) is a free cross-platform orthodox file manager and a clone of Norton Commander.
Core Features: Optimized Code Generation, Support For Various Platforms & Operating Systems, Compilation & Execution Of C Code, Interactive Interpreter Mode, Extensive Standard Libraries, Debugging Capabilities
General Tags: Compiler, Interpreter, C, Software Development
AI Description: MC is a popular C compiler and interpreter that is widely used for developing efficient and portable software.

Core Features: Genome Assembly, De Bruijn Graph Data Structure, Efficient Algorithms, Sequence Analysis
General Tags: Genomics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Sequence Analysis
AI Description: Mccortex is a software tool for assembling genomes quickly and efficiently by leveraging the compacted de Bruijn graph data structure.

Software Description: Mcl is short for the Markov Cluster Algorithm, a fast and scalable unsupervised cluster algorithm for graphs
Core Features:
1. Efficient clustering of network data
2. Scalable to large networks
3. Ability to identify dense regions in graphs
4. Parameterizable for different types of networks
5. Implementation available in various programming languages
General Tags: Clustering, Network Analysis, Graph Algorithms
AI Description: MCL (Markov Cluster Algorithm) is a clustering algorithm based on simulation of stochastic flow in graphs. It is commonly used for clustering network data to identify modules or communities of nodes with related functions or properties.

Core Features: The core features of mcoutbryk include the ability to perform Monte Carlo simulations of chemical systems, analyze molecular structures and properties, calculate thermodynamic properties, and visualize simulation results.
General Tags: Monte Carlo Simulations, Computational Chemistry, Simulation Software
AI Description: mcoutbryk is a simulation software designed for Monte Carlo simulations in the field of computational chemistry. It aims to provide researchers and scientists with a tool for performing accurate and efficient simulations of chemical systems using Monte Carlo methods.

Core Features: mcr offers a wide range of numerical methods and algorithms for solving differential equations, linear algebra problems, optimization tasks, and statistical analysis. It supports parallel computing and distributed computing for efficient processing of large-scale simulations. Additionally, mcr provides visualization tools for data analysis and result interpretation.
General Tags: Computational Software, Numerical Simulation, High-Performance Computing
AI Description: mcr is a computational software used for solving complex mathematical problems and conducting numerical simulations. It provides a high-performance computing environment for researchers and scientists to analyze, model, and solve mathematical equations and algorithms.

Software Description: MCScanX can be used to effectively analyze chromosome structural changes, and reveal the history of gene family expansions that might contribute to the adaptation of lineages and taxa.
Core Features:
1. Detection of collinear gene pairs in multiple genomes or subgenomes
2. Inference of syntenic relationships among genes
3. Visualization of gene synteny and evolutionary relationships
4. Identification of gene duplication and divergence events
General Tags: Gene Synteny, Genomic Analysis, Syntenic Relationships
AI Description: MCScanX is a toolkit specifically designed for detecting collinear gene pairs within multiple genomes or subgenomes and inferring the syntenic relationships among them. It allows for the analysis of gene synteny and evolutionary relationships, aiding in understanding gene duplication and divergence events.

Core Features: Compile-Time Fixed-Size Multidimensional Arrays, High-Performance Operations, Efficient Memory Layout & Access Patterns
General Tags: C++ Library, Multidimensional Array, Data Structure, High-Performance Computing
AI Description: mdspan is a C++ library that provides a multidimensional array data structure with a fixed size at compile time. It offers a high-performance alternative to traditional dynamically allocated multidimensional arrays.

Core Features: 1. Measures metadata performance of parallel file systems. 2. Includes tests for file creates, stat operations, and directory operations.
General Tags: Benchmarking, File System, Metadata
AI Description: MDTest is a file system metadata benchmark that includes tests to measure metadata operations, such as file creates, stat operations, and directory operations. It is often used to assess the metadata performance of parallel file systems.

Software Description: Medaka is a tool to create consensus sequences and variant calls from nanopore sequencing data.
Core Features: Real-time nanopore consensus sequence calling, High-accuracy consensus sequence generation, Utilizes neural network basecaller for improved accuracy
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Ngs Data Analysis, Nanopore Sequencing, Consensus Sequence Calling
AI Description: Medaka is a tool for nanopore consensus sequence calling in real-time. It is designed to provide a high-accuracy consensus sequence for a given set of nanopore reads.

Software Description:
Meep is a free and open-source software package for electromagnetics simulation via the finite-difference time-domain (FDTD) method spanning a broad range of applications. 
Description Source: https://meep.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
Core Features: Some core features of Meep include simulating electromagnetic fields in periodic and non-periodic environments, calculating transmission and reflection of structures, supporting various boundary conditions such as PML (perfectly matched layers), and analyzing photonic crystals and waveguides.
General Tags: Simulation, Electromagnetics, Fdtd
AI Description: Meep (or MIT Electromagnetic Equation Propagation) is a free finite-difference time-domain (FDTD) simulation software package developed at MIT to model electromagnetic systems.

Software Description: Megadepth is an efficient tool for extracting coverage related information from RNA and DNA-seq BAM and BigWig files.
Core Features: Quantification Of Sequencing Data From Bisulfite-Treated DNA, Accurate Measurement Of DNA Methylation Levels, Analysis & Visualization Of Methylation Data
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequencing Data Analysis, DNA Methylation Analysis, Computational Biology
AI Description: Megadepth is a software tool designed for precise and efficient quantification of sequencing data from bisulfite-treated DNA. It allows for accurate measurement of DNA methylation levels and offers various features for analyzing and visualizing methylation data.

Software Description: Megahit is a ultra-fast single-node solution for large and complex metagenomics assembly via succinct de Bruijn graph.
Core Features: Efficient Metagenome Assembly, Snp-Aware Assembly, Ultra-Fast Performance, High-Quality Draft Assemblies
General Tags: Metagenome Assembly, Bioinformatics, Sequencing Data, Snp-Aware, Draft Assemblies
AI Description: MEGAHIT is a highly efficient and ultra-fast single-nucleotide polymorphism (SNP)-aware metagenome assembly software tool. It is designed for the assembly of metagenomic sequencing data, providing users with high-quality draft assemblies.

Software Description: Megan is a computer program that allows optimized analysis of large metagenomic datasets. Metagenomics is the analysis of the genomic sequences from a usually uncultured environmental sample.
Core Features: 1. Taxonomic analysis and visualization of metagenomic data. 2. Functional analysis of microbial communities. 3. Comparative analysis of multiple samples. 4. Supports integration of various sequencing technologies, such as Illumina, Ion Torrent, and PacBio. 5. User-friendly interface for interactive exploration of results.
General Tags: Metagenomics, Microbiome, Bioinformatics
AI Description: MEGAN (MEtaGenome ANalyzer) is a comprehensive software package for analyzing large metagenomic data sets. It is designed to facilitate the exploration and taxonomic analysis of complex microbiomes.

Software Description: Meme is a collection of tools for the discovery and analysis of sequence motifs. Contents.
Core Features: Motif Discovery, Sequence Analysis, Statistical Modeling, Pattern Recognition
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Analysis, Motif Discovery, Biological Data Analysis
AI Description: The Multiple Em for Motif Elicitation (MEME) software is used for discovering motifs in a group of related DNA or protein sequences.

Software Description:
MEME discovers novel, ungapped motifs (recurring, fixed-length patterns) in your sequences (sample output from sequences). MEME splits variable-length patterns into two or more separate motifs. See this Manual for more information. 
Description Source: https://meme-suite.org/meme/tools/meme

An R interface to the MEME Suite family of tools, which provides several utilities for performing motif analysis on DNA, RNA, and protein sequences. memes works by detecting a local install of the MEME suite, running the commands, then importing the results directly into R. 
Description Source: https://github.com/snystrom/memes

MemoryViewer software gives system administrators comprehensive insight into the physical memory topology as well as the application memory utilization. 
Description Source: https://memverge.com/memoryviewer/
Core Features: Memory Tracking, Memory Visualization, Memory Analysis, Memory Optimization
General Tags: Memory Management, Software Development, Performance Analysis
AI Description: MemoryViewer is a software tool used for analyzing and visualizing memory usage and data structures within computer programs. It allows users to track memory allocation, deallocation, and usage patterns to optimize memory management.

Software Description: The MentorGraphics/tessent.2022.1 modulefile provides Mentor Graphics Tessent 2022.1. Design augmentation and linked applications that detect, mitigate and eliminate risks throughout the IC lifecycle,  helping customers address their debug, test, yield, safety, security, and optimization requirements for todayâs most complex SoCs.
Meraculous is a whole genome assembler for Next Generation Sequencing data, geared for large genomes.
Core Features: Specifically Optimized For Large & Complex Genomes, Utilizes High-Throughput Sequencing Data For Genome Assembly, Focuses On Accurate Reconstruction Of Genome Structure & Gene Content
General Tags: Genome Assembly, Bioinformatics
AI Description: Meraculous is a whole-genome shotgun assembler specifically designed for large and complex genomes. It aims to accurately reconstruct the genome structure and gene content using high-throughput sequencing data.

Software Description:
Mercurial is a free, distributed source control management tool. It efficiently handles projects of any size and offers an easy and intuitive interface. 
Description Source: https://www.mercurial-scm.org/
Core Features: Mercurial provides distributed revision control, fast operations, built-in merge algorithms, efficient handling of binary files, extensibility via Python scripts, and support for multiple workflows.
General Tags: Version Control, Software Development
AI Description: Mercurial is a free, distributed source control management tool. It efficiently handles projects of any size and offers an intuitive interface.

Software Description: Merqury is a tool to evaluate genome assemblies with k-mers and more.
Core Features:
1. Quantification of mappable k-mers
2. Addressing repeat resolution in noisy long-read assemblies
3. Handling high error rates
4. Analysis of repetitive regions in genomes
General Tags: Computational Tool, Genomics, Bioinformatics
AI Description: Merqury is a computational tool designed for efficient and accurate quantification of mappable k-mers in noisy long-read assemblies, with a focus on repeat resolution in the presence of high error rates.

Software Description: Meryl is a genomic k-mer counter (and sequence utility) with nice features.
Core Features:
1. Efficient k-mer counting
2. Analysis of genomic data
3. Scalable for large datasets
4. Insight generation for genome characteristics
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Genomics, K-Mer Counting
AI Description: Meryl is a software tool for k-mer counting and analysis in bioinformatics applications. It efficiently handles large-scale genomic data to provide insights into genome characteristics.

Software Description:
The Mesa project began as an open-source implementation of the OpenGL specification - a system for rendering interactive 3D graphics. Over the years the project has grown to implement more graphics APIs, including OpenGL ES, OpenCL, OpenMAX, VDPAU, VA-API, Vulkan and EGL. 
Description Source: https://docs.mesa3d.org/index.html
Core Features: Key features of Mesa include the ability to create and simulate agent-based models, support for multiple types of agents and environments, visualization tools for model output, and the flexibility to customize and extend the framework through Python programming.
General Tags: Agent-Based Modeling, Complex Systems, Simulation, Computational Modeling
AI Description: Mesa is an open-source agent-based modeling framework that allows users to create and analyze computational models of complex adaptive systems.

Core Features: Some core features of mesa-glu include: offering higher-level functionality than the base OpenGL API, supporting various complex geometric, tessellation, and matrix operations, providing tessellation and NURBS rendering, handling mipmapping and texture mapping functionalities, offering error checking and debugging tools, and creating geometric primitives.
General Tags: Graphics, 3D Graphics, Opengl, Graphics Library
AI Description: mesa-gl is an open-source implementation of the OpenGL specification, a system for rendering interactive 3D graphics, and a widely used and versatile graphics library. mesa-glu is the OpenGL Utility Library (GLU) component of Mesa, providing useful functions for building OpenGL applications.

Software Description:
Meson is an open source build system meant to be both extremely fast, and, even more importantly, as user friendly as possible. 
Description Source: https://mesonbuild.com/
Core Features: Cross-compilation support, automatic dependency management, integrated testing framework, easy-to-read syntax
General Tags: Build System, Software Development, Automation
AI Description: Meson is an open-source build system meant to be both extremely fast and as user-friendly as possible.

Software Description: Python build backend (PEP 517) for Meson projects
Core Features: Meson is optimized for simplicity and ease of use without sacrificing functionality. It supports multiple languages, cross-compilation, and out-of-source builds. Meson is also highly customizable and extensible through plugins.
General Tags: Build System, Automation, Software Development
AI Description: Meson is a high-productivity build system. It provides a simple syntax for describing how your project is build and a wide range of options to control the build process.

Software Description: Metabat is a robust statistical framework for reconstructing genomes from metagenomic data
Core Features: Metagenomic Binning, Single Genome Reconstruction, Utilizes A Mixture Model, Binning Contigs Based On Species Origin
General Tags: Metagenomics, Microbial Communities, Genome Reconstruction
AI Description: MetaBAT is a software tool for reconstructing single genomes from complex microbial communities for metagenomics analysis. It utilizes a mixture model to leverage the differential abundance of unique sequences to bin contigs according to their species origin.

Software Description: Metachip is a pipeline for Horizontal gene transfer (HGT) identification.
Core Features: Taxonomic Classification Of Microbial Communities, Functional Annotation Of Metagenomic Data, Comparative Analysis Of Microbial Diversity, Visualization Of Metagenomic Sequencing Results
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Metagenomics, High-Throughput Sequencing, Microbiome Analysis
AI Description: Metachip is a computational software tool designed for the analysis, visualization, and interpretation of high-throughput sequencing data from metagenomic studies. It allows researchers to perform taxonomic classification, functional annotation, and comparative analysis of microbial communities present in environmental samples.

Software Description: Metaphlan is computational tool for profiling the composition of microbial communities (Bacteria, Archaea and Eukaryotes) from metagenomic shotgun sequencing data (i.e. not 16S) with species-level.
Core Features: Microbial Community Profiling, Metagenomic Shotgun Sequencing Data Analysis, Clade-Specific Marker Genes, Taxonomic Abundance Quantification
General Tags: Metagenomics, Microbiome, Microbial Ecology, Bioinformatics
AI Description: MetaPhlAn is a computational tool for profiling the composition of microbial communities from metagenomic shotgun sequencing data. It relies on unique clade-specific marker genes to identify and quantify the presence of microbial species in a sample.

Software Description: Metaseq is a Python package for integrative genome-wide analysis reveals relationships between chromatin insulators and associated nuclear mRNA.
Core Features: RNA-Seq Data Analysis, Differential Gene Expression Analysis, Visualization Of Gene Expression Results, Functional Enrichment Analysis, Sample Clustering, Pathway Analysis
General Tags: RNA-Seq, Data Analysis, Bioinformatics, Python Library
AI Description: metaseq is a Python library for analyzing RNA-Seq data and differential expression analysis. It provides tools for visualizing gene expression results, exploring gene ontology, clustering samples, and identifying enriched pathways.

Software Description: Methyldackel is a (mostly) universal methylation extractor for BS-seq experiments.
Core Features:
1. Extracts methylation information from bisulfite sequencing data.
2. Identifies methylated and unmethylated cytosines at single-base resolution.
3. Supports analysis of DNA methylation patterns.
General Tags: DNA Methylation, Bisulfite Sequencing, Epigenetics
AI Description: MethylDackel is a program for extracting methylation information from bisulfite sequencing data. It identifies methylated and unmethylated cytosines at single-base resolution.

Software Description:
Methylpy is a pyhton-based analysis pipeline for (single-cell) (whole-genome) bisulfite sequencing data, (single-cell) NOMe-seq data, and differential methylation analysis. 
Description Source: https://pypi.org/project/methylpy/
Core Features: Preprocessing Of Bisulfite Sequencing Data, Identification Of Differentially Methylated Regions (Dmrs), Annotation Of Dmrs With Genomic Features, Visualization Of Methylation Patterns
General Tags: DNA Methylation, Bisulfite Sequencing, Epigenetics, Bioinformatics, Python Package
AI Description: methylpy is a Python package designed for the analysis of DNA methylation data obtained from bisulfite sequencing. It provides various tools for processing, analyzing, visualizing, and interpreting DNA methylation data.

Software Description: Metilene is a versatile tool to study the effect of epigenetic modifications in differentiation/development, tumorigenesis, and systems biology on a global, genome-wide level.
Core Features:
1. Identification of differentially methylated regions (DMRs) based on whole-genome bisulfite sequencing data. 
2. Detection of statistically significant changes in DNA methylation patterns between samples. 
3. Visualization of methylation levels and differential methylation patterns. 
4. Integration of genomic annotation data to provide biological context for identified DMRs.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Epigenetics, DNA Methylation, Genomics, Bisulfite Sequencing
AI Description: Metilene is a software tool for the analysis of whole-genome bisulfite sequencing data, primarily focusing on the identification of differentially methylated regions (DMRs) between biological samples.

Software Description:
METIS is a set of serial programs for partitioning graphs, partitioning finite element meshes, and producing fill reducing orderings for sparse matrices. The algorithms implemented in METIS are based on the multilevel recursive-bisection, multilevel k-way, and multi-constraint partitioning schemes developed in our lab. 
Description Source: https://github.com/KarypisLab/METIS
Core Features:
1. Graph and mesh partitioning algorithms
2. Hypergraph partitioning capabilities
3. Minimization of edge-cuts for balanced partition sizes
4. Efficient partitioning of large-scale graphs and meshes
General Tags: Computational Software, Graph Partitioning, Mesh Partitioning, Hypergraph Partitioning
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/

AI Description: Metis is a computational software library for partitioning graphs, meshes, and hypergraphs. It provides algorithms that can efficiently partition large graphs and meshes while minimizing the edge-cuts and balancing the partition sizes.

Software Description: MFEM is a modular parallel C++ library for finite element methods. MFEM can be viewed as a finite element toolbox that provides the building blocks for developing finite element algorithms in a manner similar to that of MATLAB for linear algebra methods.
Core Features:
1. Wide range of finite element spaces
2. High-order and variable-order discretizations
3. Parallel computing support
4. Many examples and applications
General Tags: Finite Element Method, C++ Library, Parallel Computing
AI Description: MFEM is a lightweight, general, scalable C++ library for finite element methods. Its features include a wide range of finite element spaces, high-order and variable-order discretizations, parallel computing support, and multiple examples and applications.

Software Description: MetaHipMer is a de novo metagenome short-read assembler. Version 2 (MHM2) is written entirely in UPC++ and runs efficiently on both single servers and on multinode supercomputers, where it can scale up to coassemble terabase-sized metagenomes.
Core Features: Monte Carlo Simulations For Lipid Bilayers, Simulation Of Liquid Crystal Membranes, Study Of Membrane Properties, Modeling Complex Systems
General Tags: Monte Carlo Simulation, Liquid Crystal Membranes, Bilayer Simulation
AI Description: mhm2 is a tool for simulating liquid crystal membranes using Monte Carlo techniques. It allows users to model complex lipid bilayers and study their properties in various conditions.

Software Description: MicrobeDMM is a suite of programs used for empirical Bayes fitting of DMM models.
Core Features: Prediction Of Microbial Community Dynamics, Simulation Of Microbial Growth & Interactions, Consideration Of Environmental Factors, Analysis Of Metabolic Pathways, Visualization Of Community Dynamics
General Tags: Microbial Community Dynamics, Metabolic Interactions, Simulation Tool, Bioinformatics
AI Description: MicrobeDMM is a software tool for the prediction of microbial community dynamics and metabolic interactions. It enables users to simulate the growth and interactions of multiple microbial species in a community, taking into account environmental factors and metabolic pathways.

Software Description: Minialign is a little bit fast and moderately accurate nucleotide sequence alignment tool designed for PacBio and Nanopore long reads.
Core Features: Ultrafast Multiple Sequence Alignment, Memory Efficient Handling Of Large Datasets, Highly Accurate Alignment Results, Support For DNA, RNA, & Protein Sequences, Advanced K-Mer Based Alignment Strategy, Progressive Alignment For Final Msa Generation
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Hpc Tools
AI Description: minialign is an ultrafast, memory efficient, and highly accurate tool for multiple sequence alignment (MSA) of biological sequences. It is designed to handle very large datasets with high throughput. The software employs a k-mer based approach for rapid pairwise alignment followed by progressive alignment to generate the final MSA.

Software Description: Miniasm is a very fast OLC-based de novo assembler for noisy long reads.
Core Features:
1. Assembles long noisy reads
2. Corrects reads errors and identifies overlaps between reads
3. Generates contigs using the OLC paradigm
4. Handles high error rates efficiently
General Tags: Assembly, Genome, Sequence Analysis
AI Description: Miniasm is a minimal-contig assembler that generates long noisy read assemblies using the Overlap-Layout-Consensus (OLC) paradigm.

Software Description:
Miniconda is a free minimal installer for conda. It is a small bootstrap version of Anaconda that includes only conda, Python, the packages they both depend on, and a small number of other useful packages (like pip, zlib, and a few others). If you need more packages, use the conda install command to install from thousands of packages available by default in Anaconda’s public repo, or from other channels, like conda-forge or bioconda. 
Description Source: https://docs.anaconda.com/free/miniconda/index.html
Core Features: Package Management System, Environment Creation & Management, Dependency Resolution
General Tags: Package Management, Dependency Management, Software Installation
AI Description: Miniconda is a free minimal installer for conda. It is a package management system that simplifies the installation and management of software packages. Miniconda allows users to create environments containing dependencies from a specified list of packages, making it easier to manage different projects with conflicting package requirements.

Software Description: Minimap2 is a versatile pairwise aligner for genomic and spliced nucleotide sequences.
Core Features: High Speed & Efficiency, Accurate Alignment Of Sequences To A Reference Genome, Support For Long-Read Sequences, Ability To Handle Noisy & Error-Prone Data, Multiple Output Formats, Indexing Of Reference Genomes For Faster Alignment
General Tags: Sequence Alignment, Bioinformatics, Genomics, Computational Biology
AI Description: Minimap2 is a versatile sequence alignment program that can be used for mapping DNA or cDNA sequences to a reference genome. It is known for its speed and accuracy, making it a popular choice for various bioinformatics applications.

Software Description: Minipolish is a tool for Racon polishing of miniasm assemblies.
Core Features: Polishing Long-Read Sequencing Data Assemblies, Improved Accuracy Of Assemblies, Works Well With Miniasm & Flye Assemblies
General Tags: Genome Assembly, Sequence Analysis, Bioinformatics
AI Description: minipolish is a software tool that is used for polishing assemblies of long-read sequencing data. It is particularly useful for polishing assemblies generated by tools like Miniasm or Flye.

Software Description: Miniprot aligns a protein sequence against a genome with affine gap penalty, splicing and frameshift.
Core Features: Protein Structure Prediction, Protein Folding Simulations, Structural Analysis, User-Friendly Interface
General Tags: Protein Structure Prediction, Molecular Modeling, Protein Folding, Structural Analysis, Bioinformatics
AI Description: Miniprot is a software tool for predicting and modeling protein structures, including protein folding, structure prediction, and structural analysis. It is designed to be user-friendly and efficient for researchers working in the field of protein structure prediction and molecular modeling.

Software Description: Mini zip and unzip based on zlib
Core Features: Creating Zip Archives, Reading Zip Archives, Updating Zip Archives, Cross-Platform Compatibility, Minimalistic Design
General Tags: Compression, Archiving, Library, Open Source
AI Description: Minizip is a minimalistic, open-source library that provides a simple API to create, read, and update zip files. It is a lightweight solution for working with zip archives in C or C++ projects.

Software Description: miRDeep2 discovers active known or novel miRNAs from deep sequencing data (Solexa/Illumina, 454, ...).
Core Features: Discovery Of Known & Novel Micrornas, Integration Of Sequencing Data Analysis, Prediction Of Mirna Secondary Structure, Quantification Of Mirna Expression Levels, Identification Of Mirna Targets
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology
AI Description: miRDeep2 is a computational tool for discovering known and novel microRNAs from small RNA sequencing data. It integrates standard sequencing data analysis with novel features like predicting the secondary structure of miRNAs, quantifying their expression levels, and identifying their targets.

Software Description: Mirtop is a ommand line tool to annotate with a standard naming miRNAs e isomiRs.
Core Features:
1. Annotation of microRNAs in small RNA sequencing data
2. Quantification of microRNA expression levels
3. Identification of microRNA-gene target interactions
4. Visualization of microRNA expression profiles
General Tags: Microrna Annotation, Small RNA Sequencing, Gene Regulation, Bioinformatics
AI Description: Mirtop is a software tool for the annotation and quantification of microRNAs in small RNA sequencing data. It assists in the identification of microRNA sequences and their corresponding gene targets.

Software Description: Mitofinder is a pipeline to assemble mitochondrial genomes and annotate mitochondrial genes from trimmed read sequencing data.
Core Features: Identification & Assembly Of Mitochondrial Genomes, Mitogenome Annotation, Comparative Analysis Of Mitochondrial Genomes, Visualization Tools For Mitochondrial Genome Data
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Genomics, Mitochondrial Genomes, Next-Generation Sequencing, Annotation
AI Description: MitoFinder is a bioinformatics tool designed for the identification and annotation of mitochondrial genomes from next-generation sequencing data. It facilitates the assembly, annotation, and comparative analysis of mitochondrial genomes.

Software Description:
The Intel® oneAPI Math Kernel Library (oneMKL) helps you achieve maximum performance with a math computing library of highly optimized, extensively parallelized routines for CPU and GPU. The library has C and Fortran interfaces for most routines on CPU, and SYCL interfaces for some routines on both CPU and GPU. 
Description Source: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/developer/tools/oneapi/onemkl.html#gs.4ofwv9
Core Features: Highly optimized mathematical library; Thread-safe functions; Implementations of BLAS, LAPACK, ScaLAPACK, FFT, sparse solvers, and more; Supports Intel processors for improved performance.
General Tags: Mathematical Library, Optimized Computations, Thread-Safe Functions
AI Description: Intel Math Kernel Library (Intel MKL) is a highly optimized, thread-safe, mathematical library for performing mathematical, statistical, and data analysis computations. It offers high-performance implementations of BLAS, LAPACK, ScaLAPACK, sparse solvers, FFT, and more for Intel processors.

Core Features:
1. Optimized mathematical functions for Intel processors
2. Accelerated linear algebra and FFT functions
3. Support for various numerical computations
4. Integration with other Intel performance libraries
5. Enhanced performance and scalability on Intel hardware
General Tags: Mathematics, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Systems, & Development
AI Description: mkl-service is part of the Intel Math Kernel Library (MKL) that provides optimized performance for mathematical, scientific, and engineering computations on Intel architectures. It provides a set of routines optimized for use with Intel processors.

Software Description:
The Intel® oneAPI Math Kernel Library (oneMKL) helps you achieve maximum performance with a math computing library of highly optimized, extensively parallelized routines for CPU and GPU. The library has C and Fortran interfaces for most routines on CPU, and SYCL interfaces for some routines on both CPU and GPU. 
Description Source: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/developer/tools/oneapi/onemkl.html#gs.4ofwv10
Core Features: mkl32 is a highly optimized, thread-safe mathematical library for Intel processors. It offers highly optimized, extensively threaded math routines for linear algebra, fast Fourier transforms, vector math, and statistics. This library is designed to improve application performance on Intel architecture-based systems.
General Tags: Mathematics, Computational Software, Hpc Tools
AI Description: Intel(R) Math Kernel Library for 32-bit applications

Software Description: mlflow 2.10.2 AI development environment
Core Features: Experiment Tracking To Record & Compare Parameters & Results, Nested Runs & Metrics For Complex Workflows, Model Packaging For Reproducibility & Sharing Models As Reusable Modules, Model Registry For Centralizing & Versioning Models
General Tags: Machine Learning, Data Science, Model Management, Experimentation, Model Deployment
AI Description: MLflow is an open-source platform for managing the end-to-end machine learning lifecycle. It enables tracking experimentation, packaging code into reproducible runs, and sharing and deploying models.

Software Description: Mlst is used to scan contig files against traditional PubMLST typing schemes.
Core Features: Characterizes Isolates By Sequencing Housekeeping Genes, Used For Investigating Genetic Relationships Between Isolates, Popular In Epidemiological & Population Biology Studies
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Microbiology, Genotyping, Epidemiology, Population Biology
AI Description: Multi-Locus Sequence Typing (MLST) is a molecular typing method that characterizes isolates by sequencing a set of housekeeping genes. MLST is widely used in microbial genotyping studies to investigate the genetic relationships between isolates and is particularly popular in epidemiological and population biology studies.

Software Description: Mmseqs2 is a software suite to search and cluster huge protein and nucleotide sequence sets.
Core Features: Ultra-Fast Sequence Searching, Sensitive Sequence Searching, Sequence Clustering, Memory-Efficient Index Data Structure
General Tags: Sequence Searching, Sequence Clustering, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology
AI Description: MMseqs2 is a software suite for fast and sensitive sequence searching. It enables ultra-fast and sensitive sequence search and clustering functionality using a versatile and memory-efficient index data structure.

Software Description: MOB-suite: Software tools for clustering, reconstruction and typing of plasmids from draft assemblies.
Core Features:
1. Annotates and visualizes mobile genetic elements in genomic and metagenomic data.
2. Identifies antibiotic resistance genes, virulence genes, and other key genomic features associated with mobile elements.
3. Provides tools for comparative genomics and phylogenetic analysis of mobile genetic elements.
4. Allows for the detection of potential horizontal gene transfer events in microbial genomes.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Genomics, Metagenomics
AI Description: mob_suite is a modular platform for annotating, visualizing, and analyzing genomic and metagenomic data for the detection of mobile genetic elements (MGEs) such as plasmids, integrative and conjugative elements (ICEs), and genomic islands.

Core Features: MOB-Suite offers a range of modules for detecting and analyzing mobile genetic elements (MGEs) such as plasmids, integrative and conjugative elements (ICEs), and prophages. It includes tools for MGE detection, classification, visualization, and comparative genomics.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Genomics, Metagenomics
AI Description: MOB-Suite is a toolset for comparative genomics and metagenomics studies, focusing on the analysis of mobility and mobilome evolution in bacterial genomes.

Software Description: Modbam2bed is a program to aggregate modified base counts stored in a modified-base BAM file to a bedMethyl file.
Core Features: Conversion of modBAM files to BED format, extraction of genomic regions containing modified bases, compatibility with various sequencing data files.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Data Conversion, Sequencing Data, Genomic Analysis
AI Description: modbam2bed is a tool designed to convert modBAM files (modified base BAM files containing information about modified bases detected in sequencing data) to BED files, which are commonly used for representing genomic regions in bioinformatics analyses.

Software Description: ModelTest-NG is a tool for selecting the best-fit model of evolution for DNA and protein alignments.
Core Features: Automated Selection Of Nucleotide Substitution Models, Compatibility With Popular Phylogenetic Software Packages, Support For Multiple Model Selection Strategies, Statistical Evaluation Of Model Adequacy
General Tags: Phylogenetics, Model Selection, Phylogenetic Inference, Nucleotide Substitution Models
AI Description: ModelTest-NG is a software for the selection of nucleotide substitution models in phylogenetics. It uses model selection strategies to automatically choose the best-fit nucleotide substitution model for a given dataset, which is essential for accurate phylogenetic inference.

Software Description: ModelTest-NG is a tool for selecting the best-fit model of evolution for DNA and protein alignments.
Core Features:
1. Reconstruction of modular trees of mRNA transcripts 
2. Identification of alternative splicing events 
3. Visualization of modular organization of alternative splicing events 
4. Analysis of transcriptome data 
5. Modular representation of splicing events
General Tags: Transcriptomics, Alternative Splicing, Modular Trees, Data Analysis
AI Description: ModTree is a software tool for the reconstruction of modular trees of mRNA transcripts and alternative splicing events. It is designed to identify and visualize the modular organization of alternative splicing events within a transcriptome.

Core Features: Some core features of module-git include distributed version control, branching and merging capabilities, efficient handling of large projects, support for non-linear development workflows, and secure collaboration tools.
General Tags: Version Control, Distributed Version Control, Collaboration, Software Development
AI Description: module-git is a version control system designed to efficiently handle large projects, providing powerful branching, merging, and collaboration features. It allows multiple developers to work on the same codebase concurrently and maintain a complete history of changes.

Core Features: Display Information About Loaded Modules, Show Dependencies Between Modules, Assist In Managing Software Configurations, Troubleshoot Software Dependency Issues
General Tags: Software, Dependency Management, Software Configuration
AI Description: module-info is a software tool that provides information about loaded modules and their dependencies in a computing environment. It helps users to manage and troubleshoot software dependencies and configurations.

Core Features: Some core features of MOE include molecular visualization, protein modeling and analysis, docking simulations, quantum mechanics calculations, molecular dynamics simulations, homology modeling, and pharmacophore modeling.
General Tags: Molecular Modeling, Molecular Simulation, Protein Modeling, Docking, Quantum Mechanics, Pharmacophore Modeling
AI Description: MOE (Molecular Operating Environment) is a comprehensive molecular modeling and simulation software that provides tools for molecular visualization, protein modeling, docking, QSAR analysis, and more.

Software Description: mold is a high-performance drop-in replacement for existing Unix linkers.
Core Features:
1. Molecular dynamics simulations for biomolecular systems
2. Protein-ligand interactions analysis
3. Visualization of molecular structures and trajectories
4. Calculation of thermodynamic properties
5. Analysis of protein folding and dynamics
General Tags: Computational Software, Molecular Dynamics, Biophysics, Chemistry
AI Description: Mold is a computational software tool developed for conducting molecular dynamics simulations in the field of biophysics and computational chemistry. It is designed to model the behavior of biomolecules and study their interactions at the atomic level.

Core Features: Molden allows users to visualize molecular structures in 3D, display molecular orbitals, electron densities, and electrostatic potential maps, analyze vibrational modes and frequencies, and perform various types of molecular calculations.
General Tags: Molecular Visualization, Chemistry, Molecular Modeling
AI Description: Molden is a molecular visualization program specifically designed for the display and analysis of molecular structures. It provides various tools for visualizing molecular orbitals, electron densities, and other properties of chemical systems.

Core Features: Molecular Dynamics Simulations, Quantum Chemistry Calculations, Biomolecular Analysis, Visualization Tools
General Tags: Molecular Modeling, Simulation, Python Library, Quantum Chemistry, Biomolecular Analysis
AI Description: MolMod is a versatile python library designed for molecular modeling and simulation. It provides a wide range of tools and functionalities for molecular dynamics simulations, quantum chemistry calculations, and biomolecular analysis.

Core Features: 1. Estimation of historical effective population sizes and divergence times. 2. Incorporation of multiple populations and complex demographic scenarios. 3. Inference of demographic events using allele frequency spectra data. 4. Incorporation of recombination rate variation and linked selection.
General Tags: Demographic Inference, Allele Frequency Spectra, Msmc Models
AI Description: momi (MOran models for Inference) is a Python package designed for inferring demographic histories from genetic data using multiple sequentially Markovian coalescent (MSMC) models. It provides a framework for fitting demographic models to multi-population allele frequency spectra (AFS) data.

Software Description:
Project MONAI is a set of open-source, freely available collaborative frameworks built for accelerating research and clinical collaboration in Medical Imaging. The goal is to accelerate the pace of innovation and clinical translation by building a robust software framework that benefits nearly every level of medical imaging, deep learning research, and deployment. 
Description Source: https://monai.io/
Core Features: Domain-Specific Transformations & Dataloaders For Medical Image Processing, Utilities For Handling Medical Image Metadata & Visualization, Integration With Pytorch & Deep Learning Libraries, Scalable Infrastructure For Reproducible Medical Imaging Research
General Tags: Deep Learning, Medical Imaging, Pytorch, Open Source
AI Description: MONAI (Medical Open Network for AI) is a PyTorch-based, open-source framework for healthcare imaging. It provides domain-optimized foundational capabilities for developing medical imaging deep learning algorithms. MONAI enables the reproducible and scalable research for the development of novel imaging technologies and clinical applications.

Software Description: momi (MOran Models for Inference) is a Python package that computes the expected sample frequency spectrum (SFS), a statistic commonly used in population genetics, and uses it to fit demographic history.
Core Features: 1. Display output from the computer's graphics card. 2. Allow users to interact with the computer and its software. 3. Show visual information in various resolutions and colors. 4. Can be integrated with speakers, USB hubs, and other functionalities.
General Tags: Technology, Display, Computer Hardware
AI Description: A monitor is an electronic visual display for computers. It usually consists of a screen, circuitry, and casing. The display device in modern monitors is typically a thin film transistor liquid crystal display (TFT-LCD) or a flat panel LED display, while older monitors used a cathode ray tube (CRT). Monitors are used to display output from the computer's graphics card, allowing users to interact with the computer and its software.

Core Features: MOOSE offers a wide range of capabilities including support for parallel computing, flexible input file format, automatic mesh adaptation, nonlinear solvers, and the ability to couple multiple physics phenomena. It also includes a library of predefined finite element kernels for common physics problems.
General Tags: Simulation, Multiphysics, Finite Element Method
AI Description: MOOSE (Multiphysics Object-Oriented Simulation Environment) is a finite element simulation framework designed for solving complex multiphysics and multiscale engineering problems. It provides a flexible and extensible platform for researchers and engineers to develop and deploy simulation tools for a wide range of applications.

Software Description: Mothur is an open source software package for bioinformatics data processing.
Core Features:
1. Quality control of sequencing data
2. OTU (operational taxonomic unit) clustering
3. Taxonomy assignment
4. Diversity analysis
5. Phylogenetic tree construction
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Microbial Communities, High-Throughput Sequencing
AI Description: Mothur is a software package for bioinformatics analysis of microbial communities. It provides a suite of tools for processing high-throughput sequencing data, including quality control, alignment, taxonomy assignment, and diversity analysis.

Software Description: Motif refers to both a graphical user interface (GUI) specification and the widget toolkit for building applications that follow that specification under the X Window System on Unix and other POSIX-compliant systems. It was the standard toolkit for the Common Desktop Environment and thus for Unix.
Core Features: Motif Discovery, Motif Analysis, Conserved Pattern Identification, Biological Sequence Analysis
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Sequence Analysis
AI Description: Motif is a software tool used for motif discovery and motif analysis in biological sequences. It is commonly employed in bioinformatics and computational biology to identify conserved patterns or motifs within nucleotide or protein sequences.

Software Description: The mOTU profiler is a computational tool that estimates relative taxonomic abundance of known and currently unknown microbial community members using metagenomic shotgun sequencing data.
Core Features: Import & Process Animal Tracking Data, Visualize Movement Trajectories, Analyze Movement Patterns, Identify Stopover Sites & Migration Routes, Generate Reports & Statistics
General Tags: Animal Movement Data Analysis, Migration Studies, Movement Pattern Analysis, Animal Tracking
AI Description: Motus is a software tool designed for the analysis of animal movement data, particularly in the context of migration studies. It provides a platform for researchers to process, visualize, and analyze tracking data of individual animals to understand their movement patterns and behaviors.

Software Description: Gnu Mpc is a C library for the arithmetic of complex numbers with arbitrarily high precision and correct rounding of the result.
Core Features: 1. Secure computation: Enables computation on private data without revealing the data to any of the parties involved. 2. Privacy-preserving protocols: Utilizes cryptographic techniques to ensure that the inputs remain confidential during computation. 3. Collaboration support: Facilitates cooperation between multiple parties in executing computations while maintaining privacy.
General Tags: Cryptographic Protocol, Secure Computation, Privacy-Preserving, Collaborative Computation

Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Anvil: https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/software/mpc 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/
AI Description: MPC, short for Multi-Party Computation, is a cryptographic protocol that allows multiple parties to jointly compute a function over their inputs while keeping those inputs private. It ensures data privacy and security in collaborative computations.

RP Name: Aces, Anvil, Darwin, Expanse, Faster, Kyric, Ookami
Software Description:
The MPFR library is a C library for multiple-precision floating-point computations with correct rounding. MPFR has continuously been supported by the INRIA and the current main authors come from the Caramba and AriC project-teams at Loria (Nancy, France) and LIP (Lyon, France) respectively; see more on the credit page. MPFR is based on the GMP multiple-precision library. 
Description Source: https://www.mpfr.org/
Core Features: 1. Provides high-precision floating-point computation. 2. Guarantees accurate results with correct rounding. 3. Supports all IEEE 754 floating-point formats. 4. Offers functions for elementary mathematical functions for high precision computation.
General Tags: Arbitrary-Precision Arithmetic, Floating-Point Computation, Mathematical Library

Anvil: https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/software/mpfr

Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/

AI Description: The GNU MPFR (Multiple Precision Floating-Point Reliable) library is a C library for arbitrary-precision arithmetic on floating-point numbers that guarantees correctly rounded results.

Software Description: MPI defines a protocol and library specifications for message passing and data communication between multiple nodes in a parallel computing environment.
Core Features: Allows Communication & Data Exchange Between Parallel Processes, Supports Creation Of Parallel Applications For Distributed Memory Systems, Facilitates Coordination & Synchronization Of Parallel Tasks, Scalable & Efficient For Large-Scale Parallel Computing
General Tags: Hpc, Parallel Computing, Message Passing, Scalable Computing
AI Description: Message Passing Interface (MPI) is a standardized and portable message-passing system designed to enable scalable, parallel computing on a wide variety of parallel computers. It is widely used in the field of high-performance computing (HPC) to develop parallel programs that can run efficiently on distributed memory architectures.

Research Field: Computer & Information Sciences, Other Computer & Information Sciences
Software Description:
Mpi4py provides Python bindings for the Message Passing Interface (MPI) standard. It is implemented on top of the MPI specification and exposes an API which grounds on the standard MPI-2 C++ bindings. 
Description Source: https://pypi.org/project/mpi4py/
Core Features: Enables Parallel Computing In Python, Supports Mpi Operations & Functionalities, Facilitates Communication Between Processes In Parallel Applications
General Tags: Parallel Computing, Message Passing Interface, Python Library
AI Description: MPI for Python (mpi4py) provides bindings of the Message Passing Interface (MPI) standard for the Python programming language. It allows Python programs to directly interact with MPI parallel computation functionalities.

Software Description: MPICH is a high-performance and widely portable implementation of the Message Passing Interface (MPI) standard (MPI-1, MPI-2 and MPI-3).
Core Features: Implements The Mpi Standard For Message Passing Interface, High-Performance Parallel Computing Capabilities, Portability Across Diverse Platforms & Architectures, Support For Large-Scale Parallel Applications
General Tags: Mpi Implementation, Parallel Computing, High Performance Computing
AI Description: MPICH is a high-performance and widely portable implementation of the Message Passing Interface (MPI) standard. It enables parallel computing on a wide variety of platforms and architectures.

Core Features: mpip automates the installation process for MPI libraries, reducing the time and effort required to set up MPI on HPC clusters. It supports popular MPI implementations such as Open MPI and MPICH.
General Tags: Software Utility, Hpc, Mpi Libraries, Cluster Management, Installation Tool
AI Description: mpip is a small utility that helps to install and manage MPI libraries on HPC clusters by simplifying the process of downloading, configuring, building, and installing MPI libraries.

Software Description: MrBayes is a program for Bayesian inference and model choice across a wide range of phylogenetic and evolutionary models. MrBayes uses Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) methods to estimate the posterior distribution of model parameters.
Core Features: 1. Bayesian inference for phylogenetics and evolutionary biology. 2. Markov chain Monte Carlo methods for estimating model parameters. 3. Support for various nucleotide and protein models. 4. Visualizations of phylogenetic trees and model parameter distributions.
General Tags: Bayesian Inference, Phylogenetics, Evolutionary Biology
AI Description: MrBayes is a program for Bayesian inference and model choice across a wide range of phylogenetic and evolutionary models. It employs Markov chain Monte Carlo methods to estimate the posterior distribution of model parameters.

Core Features: Conducts Causal Inference Through Mendelian Randomization, Utilizes Genetic Instrumental Variables For Analysis, Incorporates Network Modeling For Complex Trait Relationships
General Tags: Causal Inference, Mendelian Randomization, Network Modeling, Genetic Instrumental Variables
AI Description: MRNET (Mendelian Randomization using Network models) is a software package for performing causal inference through Mendelian randomization and network modeling. It allows researchers to investigate causal relationships between traits by leveraging genetic instrumental variables and network structures.

Core Features:
1. Fast and efficient physics simulation
2. Support for complex dynamical systems
3. High-fidelity modeling capabilities
4. Integration with various domains such as robotics and computational systems
5. Advanced control algorithms
6. Real-time simulation capabilities
General Tags: Physics Engine, Simulation, Robotics
AI Description: MuJoCo is a physics engine for detailed, efficient and accurate simulation of complex dynamical systems. It is designed for high-fidelity modeling and simulation of computational and robotic systems in various domains.

Core Features: Integration With The Mujoco Physics Engine, Simplified Python Interface For Interacting With Mujoco Simulations, Support For Robotic Simulations & Control Tasks, Efficient Computation Of Physics-Based Simulations
General Tags: Physics Engine, Robotic Simulations, Control Tasks, Simulation Environment
AI Description: mujoco-py is a Python library that provides a simplified interface to the MuJoCo physics engine for robotic simulations and control tasks. It allows users to create, manipulate, and control dynamic systems in a simulated environment.

Core Features: Calculates The Number Of Combinations For Choosing Items With Repetition From A Set, Handles Scenarios Where Each Item Can Be Chosen Multiple Times, Supports Efficient Computation For Large Numbers Of Items & Repetitions
General Tags: Python Library, Combinatorics, Mathematics
AI Description: multichoose is a Python library that implements the concept of multichoose, which calculates the number of ways to choose a certain number of items from a set where each item can be chosen multiple times.

Software Description: Multiqc is a reporting tool that parses summary statistics from results and log files generated by other bioinformatics tools.
Core Features: Aggregates Results From Various Bioinformatics Tools Into A Single Report, Supports A Wide Range Of Analysis Tools & File Formats, Generates Interactive & Visually Appealing Reports For Easier Data Interpretation, Customizable Report Templates & Modules For Adding Extra Functionality
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Data Analysis, Reporting Tool
AI Description: MultiQC is a reporting tool that collects statistics from multiple bioinformatics analyses and generates a single report. It helps in summarizing the output from various bioinformatics tools in a standardized and consolidated format.

Software Description:
MUMmer is a system for rapidly aligning entire genomes, whether in complete or draft form. For example, MUMmer 3.0 can find all 20-basepair or longer exact matches between a pair of 5-megabase genomes in 13.7 seconds, using 78 MB of memory, on a 2.4 GHz Linux desktop computer. 
Description Source: https://mummer.sourceforge.net/
Core Features: Whole-Genome Alignment, Alignment Of Draft Genomes, Alignment Of Protein-Coding Sequences
General Tags: Genome Alignment, Sequence Alignment, Bioinformatics
AI Description: MUMmer is a system for rapidly aligning entire genomes, whether in complete or draft form. It can also align a wide range of sequences, including protein-coding sequences.

Software Description: Mummer4 is a versatile alignment tool for DNA and protein sequences.
Core Features: MUMmer's core features include suffix tree data structures for linear-time whole-genome alignment and alignment of multiple sequences, identification of exact matches, similarity regions, single base pair differences, and large-scale structural differences.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Alignment, Genomics
AI Description: MUMmer is a bioinformatics software system for the rapid alignment of very large DNA and amino acid sequences.

Software Description:
MUMPS (MUltifrontal Massively Parallel Sparse direct Solver) can solve very large linear systems through in/out-of-core LDLt or LU factorisation. 
Description Source: https://mumps-solver.org/index.php
Core Features:
1. Direct solver for large sparse linear systems.
2. Parallel processing for efficient computation.
3. Scalable for high-performance computing environments.
4. Suitable for a wide range of scientific and engineering applications.
5. Compatible with various platforms and architectures.
General Tags: Linear Algebra, Sparse Matrices, Computational Science, Engineering
AI Description: MUMPS (MUltifrontal Massively Parallel sparse direct Solver) is a software package for the parallel solution of large sparse systems of linear equations arising from computational science and engineering applications.

Core Features: muparser allows users to easily parse and evaluate mathematical expressions involving variables, functions, and operators. It supports a wide range of mathematical functions, custom-defined functions, and user-defined operators. muparser provides high performance and efficiency in parsing mathematical expressions.
General Tags: Mathematical Expression Parser, Math Library, C++ Library

Software Description: Muscle is a modified progressive alignment algorithm which has comparable accuracy to MAFFT, but faster performance.
Core Features: Some core features of MUSCLE include progressive alignment, iterative refinement, support for protein and nucleotide sequences, various output formats, and the ability to handle large datasets efficiently.
General Tags: Sequence Alignment, Bioinformatics
AI Description: MUSCLE (Multiple Sequence Comparison by Log-Expectation) is a software package for multiple sequence alignment. It offers high accuracy and speed, making it a popular choice for aligning large datasets of biological sequences.

Software Description: An implementation of the C standard library built on top of the Linux system call API, including interfaces defined in the base language standard, POSIX, and widely agreed-upon extensions.
Core Features: Lightweight & Fast C Library, Secure & Reliable Implementation, Optimized For Modern Unix Systems, Ideal For Embedded Systems & Resource-Constrained Environments
General Tags: C Library, Embedded Systems, Performance Optimization, Resource-Constrained Environments
AI Description: musl is a lightweight, fast, simple, and secure C library that targets modern Unix systems. It is designed for embedded systems, performance-critical applications, and other resource-constrained environments where a small footprint is essential.

Software Description: MuST is software package designed for performing ab initio electornic structure calculations for metals, alloys, and nanostructures. It is an all-electron DFT code based on multiple scattering theory, also known as KKR method, and Green function techniques.
MutMap is a powerful and efficient method to identify agronomically important loci in crop plants.
Core Features: 1. Identify mutations linked to phenotypic traits through bulked segregant analysis. 2. High-throughput sequencing data analysis. 3. SNP calling and variant analysis for mapping mutations. 4. Visualization of genomic data and mutation mapping results.
General Tags: Genetics, Genomics, Mutation Mapping, Bulk Segregant Analysis
AI Description: MutMap is a computational tool used in genetics and genomics research for identifying mutations through bulked segregant analysis. It is commonly used in plant genetics to map mutations associated with phenotypic traits.

Software Description: The MVAPICH2 software, based on MPI 3.1 standard, delivers the best performance, scalability and fault tolerance for high-end computing systems and servers using InfiniBand, Omni-Path, Ethernet/iWARP, RoCE(v1/v2), Cray Slingshot 10 and 11, and Rockport Networks networking technologies.

Software Description: Mykrobe analyses the whole genome of a bacterial sample, all within a couple of minutes, and predicts which drugs the infection is resistant to.
Core Features: Predicts Antimicrobial Resistance In Bacterial Pathogens, Identifies Bacterial Species Using Genomic Data, Guides Clinicians In Selecting Effective Antibiotics
General Tags: Genomics, Bacterial Pathogens, Antimicrobial Resistance, Species Identification
AI Description: mykrobe is a software tool designed for the prediction of antimicrobial resistance and species identification in bacterial pathogens using genomic data. It helps in guiding clinicians to select the most effective antibiotics for treating infections caused by resistant bacteria.

Software Description: N50 is a command line tool to calculate assembly metrices.
Core Features: Calculates N50 Value For Genome Assemblies, Quality Assessment Of Genome Assembly, Evaluation Of Contig Or Scaffold Lengths In Genomics
General Tags: Genomics, Assembly Quality, Bioinformatics
AI Description: n50 is a metric commonly used in genomics to assess the assembly quality of a set of contigs or scaffolds. It represents the contig or scaffold length where at least 50% of the total genome size is contained in contigs or scaffolds of equal or greater length.

Software Description: Nanofilt is a tool for filtering and trimming of Oxford Nanopore Sequencing data.
Core Features:
1. Quality filtering and trimming of Nanopore sequencing data
2. Adapter removal
3. Length filtering to remove short reads
4. Basecall quality filtering
5. Dynamic trimming based on quality scores
6. Support for both single-end and paired-end reads
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Analysis, Nanopore Sequencing

Software Description: Nanolyse is a tool to remove reads mapping to the lambda phage genome from a fastq file.
Core Features: Structural Variation Analysis, Nanopore Sequencing Data Processing, Quality Control, Variant Calling
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Hpc Tools
AI Description: Nanolyse is a software tool for analyzing and processing nanopore sequencing data, with a focus on structural variation analysis.

Software Description: Nanoplot is a plotting tool for long read sequencing data and alignments.
Core Features: Plotting Tool For Long Read Sequencing Data, Quality Control Plot Generation, Visualization Of Sequencing Data Characteristics, Support For Nanopore Sequencers Like Minion
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Genomics, Sequencing Data, Quality Control, Visualization
AI Description: NanoPlot is a plotting tool specifically designed for visualization of long read sequencing data generated by Nanopore sequencers like MinION. It can create quality control plots to help users assess the quality and characteristics of the sequencing data.

Software Description:
Nanopolish is a software package for signal-level analysis of Oxford Nanopore sequencing data. Nanopolish can calculate an improved consensus sequence for a draft genome assembly, detect base modifications, call SNPs and indels with respect to a reference genome and more. 
Description Source:  https://github.com/jts/nanopolish
Core Features: Basecalling Of Raw Oxford Nanopore Signal Data, Alignment Of Nanopore Reads To A Reference Genome, Variant Calling To Detect Single Nucleotide Variants & Indels, Methylation Detection From Nanopore Sequencing Data
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Nanopore Sequencing, Variant Calling, Signal Analysis
AI Description: Nanopolish is a software package for signal-level analysis of Oxford Nanopore sequencing data. It provides tools for basecalling, mapping, and variant calling from raw nanopore signal data.

Software Description:
Netwide Assembler (NASM) is an asssembler for the x86 CPU architecture portable to nearly every modern platform with code generation for many platforms old and new. 
Description Source: https://www.nasm.us/
Core Features: Support For 80X86 & X86-64 Architectures, Cross-Platform & Portable, Intel Syntax Support, Wide Range Of Object File Formats
General Tags: Assembler, Cross-Platform, X86, Programming
AI Description: NASM (Netwide Assembler) is an 80x86 and x86-64 assembler designed for portability and modularity. It supports a range of object file formats, including Linux and Windows executables, and generates code compatible with Intel syntax.

Core Features: Provides quantitative analysis of molecular electronic structure based on Natural Bond Orbitals, facilitates interpretation of molecular properties, aids in understanding chemical reactivity and stability, supports visualization of electron density distributions, allows for analysis of intermolecular interactions.
General Tags: Chemistry, Molecular Biology, Computational Chemistry
AI Description: Natural Bond Orbital (NBO) analysis is a popular method for understanding chemical bonding in molecules. It provides insight into the nature of chemical bonds, bond strengths, and electron delocalization.

Software Description: Ncbi-amrfinderplus and the accompanying database identify acquired antimicrobial resistance genes in bacterial protein and/or assembled nucleotide sequences as well as known resistance-associated point mutations for several taxa.
Core Features: Identification Of Antimicrobial Resistance Genes, Classification Of Resistance Mechanisms, Utilizes Curated Amr Gene Sequence Database, Web-Based Interface
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Hpc Tools, Computational Software
AI Description: NCBI AMRFinderPlus is a web-based tool that enables the identification of antimicrobial resistance (AMR) genes in bacterial genomes. It uses a curated database of AMR gene sequences to accurately detect and classify known resistance mechanisms.

Software Description: NCBI Datasets is a new resource that lets you easily gather data from across NCBI databases.
Core Features:
1. Search and download various biological datasets from NCBI.
2. Filter datasets based on specific criteria, such as organism, data type, and more.
3. Automate data retrieval processes through scripting.
4. Efficiently manage and download large-scale biological data.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Data Retrieval, Biological Datasets
AI Description: The ncbi-datasets tool from NCBI (National Center for Biotechnology Information) provides a command-line interface to access and download various datasets available through NCBI, allowing users to search, filter, and download biological data efficiently.

Software Description: Ncbi-genome-download is a script to download genomes from the NCBI FTP servers.
Core Features: Downloading Genome Assemblies & Annotation Data From Ncbi, Filtering By Taxonomy Or Assembly Criteria, Parallel Downloading For Faster Retrieval
General Tags: Genomics, Bioinformatics
AI Description: ncbi-genome-download is a command-line tool to download genome assemblies and annotation data from the NCBI's Assembly database.

Software Description: table2asn is a command-line program that creates sequence records for submission to GenBank.
Core Features: Converts Sanger Sequencing Results & Assembly Annotations To Asn.1 Format, Automates Creation Of Sequence Records With Annotations & Metadata, Ensures Compatibility With Genbank Submission Standards
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Annotation, Genbank Submission
AI Description: NCBI Table2ASN is a tool provided by the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) for converting simple Sanger sequencing results and assembly annotations into ASN.1 format, which is required for submission to GenBank. It automates the process of creating sequence records with annotations and metadata that are compatible with GenBank submission standards.

Software Description:
NCBI VDB is the SRA Toolkit and SDK from NCBI is a collection of tools and libraries for using data in the INSDC Sequence Read Archives. 
Description Source: https://github.com/ncbi/ncbi-vdb
Core Features: 1. Downloading and managing data from NCBI databases. 2. Validating sequence data integrity. 3. Transforming data formats for compatibility with third-party software tools. 4. Analyzing biological sequences for research purposes.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Data Management, Data Analysis
AI Description: NCBI-vdb is a collection of software tools for managing data from the NCBI Sequence Read Archive, the GenBank flatfile sequence databases, as well as a framework for loading data into third-party caller software. It provides tools for downloading, validating, transforming, and analyzing biological sequence data.

Software Description:
The NVIDIA Collective Communication Library (NCCL) implements multi-GPU and multi-node communication primitives optimized for NVIDIA GPUs and Networking. NCCL provides routines such as all-gather, all-reduce, broadcast, reduce, reduce-scatter as well as point-to-point send and receive that are optimized to achieve high bandwidth and low latency over PCIe and NVLink high-speed interconnects within a node and over NVIDIA Mellanox Network across nodes. 
Description Source: https://developer.nvidia.com/nccl
Core Features: 1. High-performance collective communication primitives for multiple GPUs. 2. Topology-aware algorithms for efficient communication patterns. 3. Optimized for NVIDIA GPUs with CUDA support. 4. Supports various communication operations like all-reduce, broadcast, reduce, etc.
General Tags: Cuda, Parallel Computing, Multi-Gpu Communication, Gpu Programming, Hpc

Integration with NVIDIA GPU hardware to leverage optimized communication paths.

Software Description:
Ncdu is a disk usage analyzer with an ncurses interface. It is designed to find space hogs on a remote server where you don’t have an entire graphical setup available, but it is a useful tool even on regular desktop systems. 
Description Source: https://dev.yorhel.nl/ncdu
Core Features: Interactive Disk Usage Viewer, Lightweight & Fast Scanning, Allows Navigation Through Directory Hierarchy, Delete Files & Directories From Within The Interface
General Tags: Disk Utility, Disk Usage Analyzer, Terminal Tool, Storage Management
AI Description: ncdu (NCurses Disk Usage) is a disk utility for analyzing disk usage in a terminal environment. It provides a fast way to see what directories are using the most space on a filesystem.

Core Features: Support For Ftp, Ftps, & Http Protocols, Bookmarking For Easy Navigation, Recursive File Transfer & Directory Mirroring, Scriptable Automation With Batch Processing, Remote File Editing & Permission Management
General Tags: Ftp Client, Command-Line Interface, File Transfer, Automation
AI Description: ncftp is a powerful and easy-to-use command-line FTP client for various operating systems. It provides a wide range of features for transferring files over FTP protocols.

Software Description: NCL is an interpreted language designed specifically for scientific data analysis and visualization.
Core Features: NCL provides a comprehensive set of functions for data analysis, visualization, and interpolation. It supports a wide range of data formats and has powerful plotting capabilities, including maps, contour plots, and animations.
General Tags: Scientific Data Analysis, Data Visualization, Atmospheric Sciences
AI Description: The NCAR Command Language (NCL) is a scripting language designed specifically for the analysis and visualization of scientific data. It is widely used in the atmospheric and related sciences.

Software Description:
The NCO toolkit manipulates and analyzes data stored in netCDF-accessible formats, including DAP, HDF4, HDF5, and, most recently, Zarr. NCO exploits the geophysical expressivity and logic of many CF (Climate & Forecast) metadata conventions, the flexible description of physical dimensions translated by UDUnits, the network transparency of OPeNDAP, the storage capabilities (e.g., compression, chunking, groups) of HDF (the Hierarchical Data Format), many powerful mathematical and statistical algorithms of GSL (the GNU Scientific Library), and the lossy and lossless compression codecs provided by the CCR (Community Codec Repository). 
Description Source: https://nco.sourceforge.net/
Core Features:
1. Handling and manipulation of netCDF and HDF4 files
2. Data extraction, subsetting, and filtering
3. Statistical analysis and visualization of climate data
4. Data format conversion and interoperability
5. Automation of data processing tasks
General Tags: Data Manipulation, Data Analysis, Climate Data, Netcdf, Hdf4

Stampede3: https://tacc.utexas.edu/use-tacc/software-list/
AI Description: NCO (NetCDF Operators) is a suite of programs designed to help manipulate and analyze netCDF and HDF4 files. It provides a range of powerful tools for processing and analyzing climate and weather data stored in netCDF format.
