Software Description:
The ncurses (new curses) library is a free software emulation of curses in System V Release 4.0 (SVr4), and more. It uses terminfo format, supports pads and color and multiple highlights and forms characters and function-key mapping, and has all the other SVr4-curses enhancements over BSD curses. SVr4 curses became the basis of X/Open Curses. 
Description Source: https://invisible-island.net/ncurses/announce.html
Core Features: ncurses enables the creation of text-based interfaces with functionalities such as windows, panels, menus, and dialog boxes. It provides capabilities for handling keyboard input, color, and cursor positioning on the terminal. It allows for the development of interactive and visually appealing terminal applications.
General Tags: Programming Library, Text-Based User Interfaces, Terminal Applications

Software Description:
Ncview is a visual browser for netCDF format files. Typically you would use ncview to get a quick and easy, push-button look at your netCDF files. You can view simple movies of the data, view along various dimensions, take a look at the actual data values, change color maps, invert the data, etc. It runs on UNIX platforms under X11, R4 or higher. 
Description Source: https://cirrus.ucsd.edu/ncview/
Core Features: Visualization Of Data Stored In Netcdf Format, Plotting Of Variables Such As Temperature, Humidity, Wind Vectors, & More, Zooming, Panning, & Slicing Through Data, Overlaying Multiple Variables For Comparison, Customizing Plots With Different Color Maps & Annotations
General Tags: Data Visualization, Netcdf, Earth System Data
AI Description: ncview is a visual browser for netCDF format files used for earth system data. It provides functionalities for viewing, analyzing, and interacting with data stored in netCDF files.

Core Features: Compare Two Nmap Xml Output Files, Identify The Differences In Host Status, Open Ports, Service Versions, & Scan Details, Generate A Report Highlighting The Variances Between The Scans
General Tags: Network Security, Network Monitoring, Penetration Testing, Cybersecurity
AI Description: ndiff is a command-line tool for comparing two Nmap XML output files. It parses the XML files and identifies the differences in the scan results, including changes in host status, open ports, service versions, and other scan details.

Software Description:
The Unidata network Common Data Form (netCDF) is an interface for scientific data access and a freely-distributed software library that provides an implementation of the interface. The netCDF library also defines a machine-independent format for representing scientific data. Together, the interface, library, and format support the creation, access, and sharing of scientific data. 
Description Source: https://docs.unidata.ucar.edu/netcdf-c/current/
Core Features: Supports Array-Oriented Scientific Data, Self-Describing & Machine-Independent Data Formats, Efficient Data Storage & Access, Can Store Multiple Data Variables In A Single File, Supports Data Subsetting & Data Compression, Tools For Data Manipulation & Visualization
General Tags: Scientific Data, Data Storage, Data Access, Data Formats, Data Manipulation, Data Visualization

Software Description:
NetCDF-C++4 is a C++ library providing an interface to the Network Common Data Form (netCDF), which is a set of software libraries and machine-independent data formats for the creation, access, and sharing of array-oriented scientific data. Software Description:
netcdf4-python is a Python interface to the netCDF C library. This module can read and write files in both the new netCDF 4 and the old netCDF 3 format, and can create files that are readable by HDF5 clients. 
Description Source: https://unidata.github.io/netcdf4-python/
Core Features: Read & Write Netcdf Files In Both Classic & Netcdf 4 Formats, Support For Various Data Types (E.G., Floats, Integers, Strings), Efficient Handling Of Large Datasets, Integration With Popular Scientific Python Libraries Like Numpy, Ability To Work With Multidimensional Data Arrays, Metadata Support For Maintaining Information About The Data
General Tags: Python Library, Netcdf, Scientific Data Handling, Array-Oriented Data, Data Storage & Access
AI Description: NetCDF4 is a Python interface to the netCDF version 4 library. NetCDF is a set of software libraries and self-describing, machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and sharing of array-oriented scientific data.

Core Features: netcdff provides a set of interfaces for reading and writing netCDF files in Fortran programs. It allows for easy manipulation of multidimensional data and metadata stored in netCDF format.
General Tags: Software Library, Fortran, Netcdf
AI Description: netcdff is a software library for accessing and creating netCDF format data files in Fortran.

Software Description:
LAPACK is written in Fortran 90 and provides routines for solving systems of simultaneous linear equations, least-squares solutions of linear systems of equations, eigenvalue problems, and singular value problems. The associated matrix factorizations (LU, Cholesky, QR, SVD, Schur, generalized Schur) are also provided, as are related computations such as reordering of the Schur factorizations and estimating condition numbers. 
Description Source: https://www.netlib.org/lapack/
Core Features:
1. Linear equation solving
2. Least-squares solutions
3. Eigenvalue problems
4. Singular value problems
General Tags: Numerical Computing, Linear Algebra, Library, Numerical Analysis
AI Description: Netlib LAPACK (Linear Algebra PACKage) is a widely-used library for numerical linear algebra. It provides routines for solving systems of simultaneous linear equations, least-squares solutions of linear systems of equations, eigenvalue problems, and singular value problems.

Software Description:
ScaLAPACK is a library of high-performance linear algebra routines for parallel distributed memory machines. ScaLAPACK solves dense and banded linear systems, least squares problems, eigenvalue problems, and singular value problems. 
Description Source: https://www.netlib.org/scalapack/

Nettle is a cryptographic library that is designed to fit easily in more or less any context: In crypto toolkits for object-oriented languages (C++, Python, Pike, ...), in applications like LSH or GNUPG, or even in kernel space. 
Description Source: https://www.lysator.liu.se/~nisse/nettle/
Core Features: Implements Various Cryptographic Algorithms Like Aes, Arcfour, Blowfish, Md5, Low-Level & General-Purpose Cryptographic Library, Designed For High Performance & Portability
General Tags: Cryptography, Security, Library
AI Description: Nettle is a cryptographic library that is designed to be low-level and general-purpose, offering several cryptographic algorithms such as AES, ARCFOUR, Blowfish, and MD5.

Software Description:
NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks. 
Description Source: https://networkx.org/
Core Features: Creation & Manipulation Of Complex Networks Or Graphs, Data Structures For Representing Various Types Of Networks, Algorithms For Analyzing & Processing Network Data, Visualization Tools For Displaying Networks
General Tags: Python Library, Graph Theory, Network Analysis, Data Visualization
AI Description: NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study of complex networks or graphs. It provides data structures for representing many types of networks, algorithms for analyzing them, and visualization tools to display them.

Core Features: NEURON allows users to create and simulate computational models of individual neurons and networks of neurons. It provides a high level of flexibility in model design and parameterization, along with detailed visualization tools to analyze simulation results.
General Tags: Neuroscience, Computational Modeling, Simulation, Neural Networks, Neuron Modeling
AI Description: NEURON is a simulation environment for modeling individual neurons and networks of neurons. It offers flexibility and power which makes it a widely used tool in computational neuroscience.

Software Description: NeuSomatic: Deep convolutional neural networks for accurate somatic mutation detection
Core Features: Detection Of Somatic Mutations, Single-Cell & Bulk Sequencing Data Analysis, Utilizes Neural Network Model For Classification, High Accuracy In Mutation Identification
General Tags: Computational Biology, Genomics, Bioinformatics, Data Analysis, Somatic Mutations
AI Description: NeuSomatic is a computational framework for detecting somatic mutations in single cell and bulk sequencing data. It utilizes a neural network model trained on both single-cell and bulk sequencing data to accurately identify somatic mutations.

Core Features: Parsing & Converting Newick Tree Files, Tree Traversal & Manipulation, Phylogenetic Tree Comparison & Analysis, Visualization Of Phylogenetic Trees, Support For Various Tree Formats
General Tags: Phylogenetics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Phylogenetic Trees, Command-Line Tools
AI Description: Newick Utils is a collection of command-line tools for processing Newick tree files used in phylogenetics and computational biology. It provides various utilities for manipulating, analyzing, and visualizing phylogenetic trees represented in the Newick format.

Software Description: Nextalign is a viral genome sequence alignment tool for command line.
Core Features:
1. Rapid and accurate alignment of viral genomes
2. Identification of mutations and genetic variations
3. Annotation of important features such as amino acid changes
4. Visualization of aligned sequences and mutations
5. Support for analyzing SARS-CoV-2 and related viruses
General Tags: Viral Genome Analysis, Sequence Alignment, Mutation Analysis
AI Description: Nextalign is a software tool for viral genome alignment and analysis, focusing on SARS-CoV-2 and other related viruses. It is designed to help researchers and clinicians analyze the mutations and genetic variations in viral genomes.

Software Description: Nextclade is a tool that identifies differences between your sequences and a reference sequence, uses these differences to assign your sequences to clades, and reports potential sequence quality issues in your data.
Core Features: - Alignment Of Sars-Cov-2 Genomes, - Mutation Analysis & Identification, - Phylogenetic Tree Generation, - Clade Assignment, - Quality Control Checks, - Visualization Of Results
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Genomics, Viral Genomes, Phylogenetics, Sars-Cov-2
AI Description: Nextclade is a bioinformatics tool designed for the analysis of SARS-CoV-2 viral genomes. It provides a range of functionalities to help in the understanding of the genetic diversity and mutations in the virus, aiding in tracking its spread and evolution.

Software Description: NextDenovo is a string graph-based de novo assembler for long reads (CLR, HiFi and ONT).
Core Features:
1. De novo transcriptome assembly
2. Hybrid approach combining OLC and DBG strategies
3. Utilizes de Bruijn graphs for sequence reconstruction
4. Suitable for RNA-seq data analysis
5. Handles data in the absence of a reference genome
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Transcriptome Assembly, De Novo Assembly
AI Description: NextDenovo is a software tool designed for de novo transcriptome assembly from RNA-seq data. It leverages de Bruijn graphs and utilizes a hybrid approach combining both OLC (Overlap-Layout-Consensus) and DBG (De Bruijn Graph) strategies to efficiently reconstruct the transcriptome in the absence of a reference genome.

Software Description:
Nextflow enables scalable and reproducible scientific workflows using software containers. It allows the adaptation of pipelines written in the most common scripting languages. 
Description Source: https://www.nextflow.io/
Core Features: Declarative & Data-Driven Workflow Definition Using A Domain-Specific Language (Dsl), Support For Various Execution Environments Including Local, Cluster, & Cloud Computing, Efficient Handling Of Data Dependencies & Task Parallelization, Integration With Container Technologies Like Docker & Singularity, Built-In Support For Various Bioinformatics Tools & Libraries, Monitoring & Resume Capabilities For Fault-Tolerant Workflows
General Tags: Workflow Manager, Computational Biology, Data Science
AI Description: Nextflow is a powerful workflow manager that enables the writing of parallel and scalable computational workflows using native, containerized, or cloud-enabled execution environments.

Software Description: NextPolish is used to fix base errors (SNV/Indel) in the genome generated by noisy long reads, it can be used with short read data only or long read data only or a combination of both.
Core Features: Error Correction For Long Reads, Utilizes Noise Model & Expectation-Maximization Algorithm, Improves Read Accuracy For Better Downstream Analysis
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Long-Read Sequencing, Error Correction
AI Description: NextPolish is a versatile and efficient tool for correcting long reads generated by third-generation sequencing technologies. It uses a noise model and an expectation-maximization algorithm to polish raw reads, improving their accuracy for downstream analysis.

Software Description: A community effort to collect a curated set of analysis pipelines built using Nextflow and tools to run the pipelines.
Core Features:
1. Community-curated Nextflow pipelines
2. Best practices workflows for genomics and transcriptomics analyses
3. Highly optimized and scalable
4. Easy to use and customize for specific research needs
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Workflow Management, Nextflow, Genomics, Transcriptomics
AI Description: NF-core is a collection of community curated Nextflow pipelines available for genomics, transcriptomics, and other bioinformatics analyses. It provides a collection of best practices workflows that are highly optimized, scalable, and easy to use.

Core Features: NGC offers a wide range of GPU-accelerated containers and models for deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and MXNet. It simplifies the setup and configuration of complex software environments by providing pre-configured containers with optimized performance for NVIDIA GPUs. Users can quickly deploy and scale applications in the cloud or on-premises.
General Tags: Cloud Computing, Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Hpc
AI Description: NGC is a cloud-based hub that provides users with a comprehensive catalog of GPU-optimized software for deep learning, machine learning, and HPC applications. It offers a platform for easy deployment and integration of GPU-accelerated applications in various domains.

Software Description: This is an implementation of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol version 2 in C. The framing layer of HTTP/2 is implemented as a reusable C library. On top of that, we have implemented an HTTP/2 client, server and proxy. We have also developed load test and benchmarking tools for HTTP/2. An HPACK encoder and decoder are available as a public API.
Core Features: 1. Implementation of HTTP/2 protocol. 2. Optimized header compression algorithm. 3. Provides HTTP/2 server, client, and proxy. 4. Open-source and actively maintained.
General Tags: Http/2, Web Protocol, Networking
AI Description: nghttp2 is an open-source implementation of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol version 2 (HTTP/2) and its header compression algorithm. The project also include a HTTP/2 server, client, and proxy.

Software Description: nghttp3 is an implementation of RFC 9114 HTTP/3 mapping over QUIC and RFC 9204 QPACK in C. It does not depend on any particular QUIC transport implementation.
Core Features:
1. Implementation of HTTP/3 and QUIC protocols
2. Low-level API for interacting with HTTP/3 and QUIC connections
3. Written in C programming language
General Tags: Http/3, Quic, Networking, Protocol
AI Description: nghttp3 is an implementation of HTTP/3 and QUIC protocol in C programming language. It provides a low-level API for developers to interact with HTTP/3 and QUIC connections.

Core Features: NGS platforms offer high sequencing throughput, high accuracy, scalability for different project sizes, and the ability to detect genomic variations, gene expression levels, and epigenetic modifications.
General Tags: Ngs, Next-Generation Sequencing, Genomics
AI Description: NGS (Next-Generation Sequencing) refers to high-throughput sequencing technologies that allow for rapid and cost-effective sequencing of DNA and RNA. NGS has revolutionized genomics research, enabling various applications in areas such as genetics, personalized medicine, and evolutionary biology.

Software Description: Ngs-bits - Short-read sequencing tools.
Core Features: NGS-bits offers functionalities for quality control, read mapping, variant calling, and downstream analysis of NGS data. It supports popular sequencing platforms and file formats, allowing users to efficiently analyze their genomic data.
General Tags: Ngs, Next-Generation Sequencing, Bioinformatics
AI Description: NGS-bits is a software suite designed for analysis of next-generation sequencing (NGS) data. It provides a variety of tools and algorithms for processing and interpreting NGS data.

Core Features: Estimation Of Individual Admixture Proportions, Identification Of Ancestral Populations Contributing To A Target Population, Model-Based Approach For Genetic Admixture Analysis
General Tags: Genetic Admixture, Population Genetics, Ancestral Populations, Genomics
AI Description: NGSadmix is a software tool used for analyzing genetic admixture, which is the result of mixing genetic material from different ancestral populations within a population or individual. It is specifically designed to estimate individual admixture proportions and infer the number of ancestral populations contributing to a target population.

Software Description: ngsLD is a program to estimate pairwise linkage disequilibrium (LD) taking the uncertainty of genotype's assignation into account.
Core Features: Ngs Data Processing, Genetic Variation Analysis, Gene Expression Analysis, Genomic Feature Identification
General Tags: Ngs, Bioinformatics, Genomics, Sequencing
AI Description: NGSld is a software package for the analysis of Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) data. It provides tools for processing and analyzing large-scale sequencing data, with a focus on identifying genetic variations, gene expression patterns, and other genomic features.

Software Description: Ngsutils is suite of software tools for working with next-generation sequencing datasets.
Core Features: Some core features of ngsutils include quality control, trimming, filtering, alignment, format conversion, manipulation of NGS data, statistics generation, and visualization.
General Tags: Ngs, Bioinformatics, Sequencing, Data Analysis
AI Description: ngsutils is a collection of software tools for working with next-generation sequencing (NGS) data. It provides various utilities for handling NGS data, performing analysis, and extracting useful information.

Software Description: Call it TCP/2. One More Time.' ngtcp2 project is an effort to implement RFC9000 QUIC protocol.
Core Features:
1. Implements the QUIC protocol.
2. Provides APIs for building QUIC servers and clients.
3. Supports version negotiation for QUIC.
4. Offers integration with OpenSSL for cryptographic functions.
General Tags: Quic Protocol, C Library, Networking
AI Description: ngtcp2 is a C library implementation of the QUIC protocol (IETF draft) for building QUIC servers and clients.

Software Description:
NiBabel provides read and write access to common neuroimaging file formats, including: ANALYZE (plain, SPM99, SPM2 and later), GIFTI, NIfTI1, NIfTI2, CIFTI-2, MINC1, MINC2, AFNI BRIK/HEAD, ECAT and Philips PAR/REC. In addition, NiBabel also supports FreeSurfer’s MGH, geometry, annotation and morphometry files, and provides some limited support for DICOM. 
Description Source: https://nipy.org/nibabel/
Core Features:
1. Read and write NIfTI-1 and NIfTI-2 image files.
2. Access to Analyze (SPM99, SPM2, and MRIcro) image files.
3. Compatible with both Python 2 and Python 3.
4. Provides tools for working with header information and metadata in the imaging files.
5. Integration with NumPy for array manipulation and data processing.
General Tags: Python Library, Neuroimaging, Medical Imaging, File Format, Nifti
AI Description: NiBabel is a Python library that provides read and write access to some common medical and neuroimaging file formats, including NIfTI-1, NIfTI-2, and Analyze. It aims to simplify the process of working with neuroimaging data in Python.

Software Description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed to run builds as fast as possible. 
Description Source: https://github.com/ninja-build/ninja
Core Features:
1. Speed optimization for build processes.
2. Integration with higher-level build systems like CMake.
3. Limited parallel execution of commands for better performance.
General Tags: Build System, Software Development, Automation
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/ 
Ookami: https://www.stonybrook.edu/commcms/ookami/support/faq/software_on_ookami
AI Description: ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from other build systems in that it is designed to have its input files generated by a higher-level build system (like CMake) and will not execute commands in parallel by default.

Software Description:
JSON for modern C++. 
Description Source: https://json.nlohmann.me/
Core Features: Parsing & Serializing Json Data, Support For Various Data Types Including Strings, Numbers, Arrays, & Objects, Flexible & Intuitive Api, Header-Only Library For Easy Integration
General Tags: Json Library, C++
AI Description: nlohmann_json is a JSON library for modern C++. It provides a simple and efficient way to work with JSON data in C++ programs.

Software Description:
NLopt is a free/open-source library for nonlinear optimization, providing a common interface for a number of different free optimization routines available online as well as original implementations of various other algorithms. 
Description Source: https://nlopt.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
Core Features:
1. Support for various optimization algorithms
2. Numerical optimization routines for constrained and unconstrained problems
3. Ability to handle both gradient-based and derivative-free optimization
4. Integration with several programming languages for ease of use
General Tags: Optimization, Library, Open-Source
AI Description: NLopt is an open-source library for nonlinear optimization problems. It provides a common interface for several different optimization algorithms, allowing users to easily switch between them.

Core Features: NLTK offers tools for text processing, text classification, tokenization, stemming, tagging, parsing, and semantic reasoning. It provides access to over 50 corpora and lexical resources such as WordNet. NLTK is designed to support education and research in natural language processing, linguistics, and cognitive science.
General Tags: Python Library, Text Processing, Natural Language Processing
AI Description: NLTK, or Natural Language Toolkit, is a leading platform for building Python programs to work with human language data. It provides easy-to-use interfaces to over 50 corpora and lexical resources such as WordNet, along with a suite of text processing libraries for classification, tokenization, stemming, tagging, parsing, and semantic reasoning.

Software Description: PM2 is an umbrella software suite for high-performance runtime systems. Modules may be installed and used together or separately.
Core Features:
1. Measure of dispersion for data sets
2. Quantifies variability and spread of data
3. Normalizes the mean absolute differences
4. Useful in data analysis and comparisons
General Tags: Statistics, Data Analysis, Data Normalization
AI Description: nMAD (normalized mean absolute deviation) is a measure of dispersion for a set of data points. It is used to quantify the variability or spread of the data. nMAD is calculated as the mean of the absolute differences between each data point and the mean of the data, divided by a constant factor for normalization.

Core Features: Asynchronous & Event-Driven, Cross-Platform, Highly Scalable, Large Ecosystem Of Open-Source Libraries
General Tags: Javascript, Server-Side Scripting, Cross-Platform
AI Description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside of a web browser. It allows developers to use JavaScript for server-side scripting and runs scripts server-side to produce dynamic web page content before returning this content to the client's web browser.

Software Description:
Node.js® is an open-source, cross-platform JavaScript runtime environment. 
Description Source: https://nodejs.org/en

Core Features: Visual Application Design, Drag-&-Drop Interface, No-Code Development, Web & Mobile Application Creation
General Tags: Visual Development, No-Code Platform, Application Design, Web Development
AI Description: nostack is a platform that allows users to visually design and build custom web and mobile applications without writing code. It provides a visual interface for drag-and-drop creation of applications.

Software Description:
Netscape Portable Runtime (NSPR) provides a platform-neutral API for system level and libc-like functions. The API is used in the Mozilla clients, many of Red Hat’s and Oracle’s server applications, and other software offerings. 
Description Source: https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/nspr/index.html
Core Features:
1. Abstraction of operating system features such as threads, processes, sockets, and files.
2. Extensive support for cross-platform development.
3. Platform-independent interfaces for common functions.
4. Portable and lightweight.
General Tags: Platform-Abstraction, Cross-Platform, Api, System-Level Functions
AI Description: nspr (Netscape Portable Runtime) provides a platform-neutral API for system level and libc-like functions. nspr is a platform abstraction library for C/C++. It provides many useful APIs for cross-platform development.

Software Description:
Network Security Services (NSS) is a set of libraries designed to support cross-platform development of security-enabled client and server applications. Applications built with NSS can support SSL v3, TLS, PKCS #5, PKCS #7, PKCS #11, PKCS #12, S/MIME, X.509 v3 certificates, and other security standards. 
Description Source: https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/security/nss/index.html
Core Features:
1. SSL and TLS encryption support
2. Cross-platform compatibility
3. Cryptographic libraries for secure communication
4. Open-source implementation
5. Secure client-server applications development
General Tags: Security, Network, Encryption
AI Description: Network Security Services (NSS) is a set of libraries designed to support cross-platform development of security-enabled client and server applications. It provides a complete open-source implementation of cryptographic libraries supporting Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocols.

Software Description:
nsync is a C library that exports various synchronization primitives, such as mutexes. 
Description Source: https://github.com/google/nsync
Core Features:
1. Synchronize files and directories between local and remote locations.
2. Efficiently mirror data to ensure consistency across locations.
3. Support for various protocols for remote synchronization.
4. Command-line interface for easy automation and integration into scripts.
General Tags: File Synchronization, Data Mirroring, Command-Line Tool
AI Description: Nsync is a command-line tool for synchronizing files and directories between two locations. It allows users to easily mirror data between local and remote locations, ensuring that the contents are up to date in both places.

Core Features: Arbitrary length integer arithmetic, arbitrary precision floating-point arithmetic, number theory algorithms, efficient implementations, portable and high-performance.
General Tags: Arbitrary Length Integers, Number Theory, High-Performance Computing, C++ Library
AI Description: ntl is a high-performance, portable C++ library providing data types for arbitrary length integers and floating-point numbers. It aims to offer efficient implementations for the fundamental algorithms in number theory.

Core Features: 1. Compiles Python source code to optimized C code for better performance. 2. Enables the creation of standalone executable programs. 3. Compatible with major Python versions. 4. Supports many Python language features and libraries.
General Tags: Python Compiler, Source Code Optimization, Executable Program Generation
AI Description: Nuitka is a Python compiler written in Python. It helps in compiling Python source code to C code, thereby making it possible to create standalone executable programs from Python scripts.

Software Description:
Null does absolutely nothing. It's meant simply as a place holder in your dot file initialization. Available on IACS at Stony Brook Ookami. 
Description Source: https://operations-api.access-ci.org/wh2/resource/v4/resource/id/urn:ogf.org:glue2:access-ci.org:ApplicationHandle:module:undefined.null.ookami.sbu.access-ci.org.b385d2a1d8ac22cbd565481de2ec750f/.

numactl is simple NUMA policy support. It consists of a numactl program to run other programs with a specific NUMA policy and a libnuma shared library ("NUMA API") to set NUMA policy in applications. 
Description Source: https://github.com/numactl/numactl
Core Features: The core features of numactl include setting the NUMA policy for a process, controlling memory placement and binding of processes to specific NUMA nodes, providing NUMA affinity control to specific CPUs, and migrating processes between NUMA nodes.
General Tags: Numa, Memory Management, Performance Optimization
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Anvil: https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/software/numactl 
Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/
AI Description: Numactl is a set of tools that allows you to have more control over NUMA (Non-Uniform Memory Access) systems. It provides utilities for memory placement and migration of processes and controlling the NUMA policy of a process.

Software Description:
Numba is an open source JIT compiler that translates a subset of Python and NumPy code into fast machine code. 
Description Source: https://numba.pydata.org/
Core Features: 1. Just-in-time (JIT) compilation for improving the performance of Python and NumPy code. 2. Support for parallel computing with multi-threading. 3. Seamless integration with NumPy arrays and functions. 4. Easy to use and efficient optimization techniques like loop unrolling and vectorization.
General Tags: Jit Compiler, Python Optimization, Numpy Optimization
AI Description: Numba is an open-source just-in-time (JIT) compiler that translates a subset of Python and NumPy code into fast machine code.

Core Features: Accelerated Numerical Expression Evaluation For Numpy Arrays, Optimized For Performance & Memory Usage, Multi-Threaded Capabilities For Improved Speed Using Multiple Cpu Cores
General Tags: Numerical Computation, Numerical Expressions, Array Operations, Performance Optimization, Multi-Threading
AI Description: Numexpr is a fast numerical expression evaluator for NumPy. With it, expressions that operate on arrays (like '3*a+4*b') are accelerated and use less memory than doing the same calculation in Python. In addition, its multi-threaded capabilities can make use of all your cores in a CPU.

Software Description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing in Python. It is a Python library that provides a multidimensional array object, various derived objects (such as masked arrays and matrices), and an assortment of routines for fast operations on arrays, including mathematical, logical, shape manipulation, sorting, selecting, I/O, discrete Fourier transforms, basic linear algebra, basic statistical operations, random simulation and much more. 
Description Source: https://numpy.org/doc/stable/user/whatisnumpy.html
Core Features: Multidimensional Array Operations, Mathematical Functions, Linear Algebra Operations, Random Number Generation, Statistical Analysis
General Tags: Scientific Computing, Numerical Computing, Data Analysis, Mathematics
AI Description: NumPy is a fundamental package for scientific computing with Python. It contains functionality for multidimensional arrays, high-level mathematical functions such as linear algebra operations, Fourier transformations, and random number generation. NumPy can be utilized to solve linear algebraic equations, perform statistical analysis, create software simulations, and much more.

Core Features: Support For Nvidia Gpu Accelerated Video Encoding & Decoding, Integration With Nvidia Video Codec Sdk, Access To Low-Level Apis For Efficient Video Processing Operations, Samples & Documentation For Developers
General Tags: Video Processing, Gpu Acceleration, Software Development Kit, Video Codec, Nvidia
AI Description: NVIDIA Video Codec SDK includes software development kits, samples, and documentation for encoding, decoding, and transcoding video and audio content. It provides low-level APIs for enabling applications to utilize NVIDIA GPU hardware accelerated video processing capabilities.

Core Features: Gpu-Accelerated Bioinformatics Algorithms, High-Performance DNA Sequence Analysis, Parallel Processing With Nvidia Gpus, Support For Large-Scale Genomic Data, Efficient Manipulation Of DNA Sequences
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Gpu Acceleration, Genomic Data Processing, DNA Sequence Analysis
AI Description: nvbio is a GPU-accelerated library of high-performance bioinformatics algorithms designed to leverage the parallel processing power of NVIDIA GPUs. It offers various tools for DNA sequence analysis and manipulation, allowing for faster and more efficient processing of large-scale genomic data.

Core Features:
1. GPU-accelerated compression and decompression algorithms.
2. Support for multiple compression formats such as LZ4, Zstandard, and Snappy.
3. Optimized for NVIDIA GPUs to leverage parallel processing power.
4. High performance and low latency compression and decompression.
General Tags: Compression, Gpu-Accelerated, Cuda, Data Processing
AI Description: nvcomp is a CUDA library providing GPU-accelerated compression and decompression algorithms. It aims to provide fast and efficient data compression techniques for GPU computing.

RP Name: Aces, Anvil, Bridges-2, Delta, Expanse, Faster
Software Description:
The NVIDIA HPC Software Development Kit (SDK) includes the proven compilers, libraries and software tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance and portability of HPC applications. 
Description Source: https://developer.nvidia.com/hpc-sdk
Core Features: NVHPC includes a suite of compilers such as NVIDIA HPC compilers and NVIDIA CUDA compilers, libraries including NVIDIA cuBLAS, cuFFT, cuDNN, cuSOLVER, CUDA Toolkit, and tools like NVIDIA Nsight Systems and NVIDIA Visual Profiler.
General Tags: Hpc, Gpu Acceleration, Compilers, Libraries, Development Tools

Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Anvil: https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/software/nvhpc 
Bridges-2: https://www.psc.edu/resources/software/nvhpc 
Delta: https://docs.ncsa.illinois.edu/systems/delta/en/latest/user_guide/software.html 
Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/
AI Description: NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive, integrated suite of compilers, libraries, and tools for the development and optimization of GPU-accelerated high-performance computing (HPC) applications.

Software Description:
The NVIDIA HPC Software Development Kit (SDK) includes the proven compilers, libraries and software tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance and portability of HPC applications. 
Description Source: https://developer.nvidia.com/hpc-sdk
Core Features: The NVIDIA HPC SDK includes optimizing Fortran, C, and C++ compilers, math libraries, and software development tools to help developers maximize application performance.
General Tags: Hpc, Compiler, Math Library, Software Development
AI Description: NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries, and tools for accelerating HPC applications on GPU-accelerated systems.

Core Features:
1. Design of GPUs for gaming, cryptocurrency, and professional markets.
2. Creation of SoCs for mobile computing and automotive markets.
3. Development of high-performance computing solutions.
4. Provision of software solutions for AI, deep learning, and data analytics.
General Tags: Graphics Processing Units, High-Performance Computing, Deep Learning, Data Analytics
AI Description: NVIDIA Corporation is an American technology company that designs graphics processing units (GPUs) for the gaming, cryptocurrency, and professional markets, as well as system on a chip units (SoCs) for the mobile computing and automotive market.

Software Description:
The NVIDIA Container Toolkit enables users to build and run GPU-accelerated containers. The toolkit includes a container runtime library and utilities to automatically configure containers to leverage NVIDIA GPUs. 
Description Source: https://docs.nvidia.com/datacenter/cloud-native/container-toolkit/latest/index.html
Core Features:
1. Manage NVIDIA container runtimes
2. Configure NVIDIA GPU settings within containers
3. Interact with NVIDIA container environments through a command-line interface
4. Facilitates the usage of NVIDIA GPUs for accelerated computing tasks in containers
General Tags: Container Runtime Management, Gpu Settings Configuration, Command-Line Interface, Accelerated Computing
AI Description: NVIDIA Container CLI is a command-line tool provided by NVIDIA that enables users to manage and interact with NVIDIA container runtimes. It allows for the configuration of various NVIDIA GPU-related settings within container environments.

Research Field: Computer & Information Sciences, Other Computer & Information Sciences
Software Description:
NVSHMEM™ is a parallel programming interface based on OpenSHMEM that provides efficient and scalable communication for NVIDIA GPU clusters. NVSHMEM creates a global address space for data that spans the memory of multiple GPUs and can be accessed with fine-grained GPU-initiated operations, CPU-initiated operations, and operations on CUDA® streams. 
Description Source: https://developer.nvidia.com/nvshmem
Core Features:
1. GPU-accelerated implementation of the OpenSHMEM standard.
2. High-performance parallel programming model.
3. Enables development of applications on GPU clusters.
4. Supports asynchronous communication and shared memory operations.
General Tags: Gpu-Accelerated, Openshmem, Nvidia Gpus
AI Description: nvshmem is a GPU-accelerated implementation of the OpenSHMEM standard designed for NVIDIA GPUs. It provides a high-performance, parallel programming model for developing applications on GPU clusters.

Software Description:
NVTOP stands for Neat Videocard TOP, a (h)top like task monitor for AMD, Intel and NVIDIA GPUs. It can handle multiple GPUs and print information about them in a htop-familiar way. 
Description Source: https://github.com/Syllo/nvtop
Core Features: Real-Time Monitoring Of Nvidia Gpu Metrics, User-Friendly Command-Line Interface (Cli), Display Of Gpu Utilization, Memory Usage, Temperature, Power Consumption, & More, Support For Multiple Gpus On A Single System, Color-Coded Display For Easy Visualization Of Gpu Performance
General Tags: System Monitoring, Gpu Monitoring, Nvidia Gpu, Command-Line Interface, Performance Optimization
AI Description: nvtop is an NVIDIA GPU system monitoring tool with a user-friendly CLI interface. It provides real-time monitoring of GPU utilization, memory usage, temperature, power consumption, and other important metrics.

Software Description:
NWChem provides many methods for computing the properties of molecular and periodic systems using standard quantum mechanical descriptions of the electronic wavefunction or density. Its classical molecular dynamics capabilities provide for the simulation of macromolecules and solutions, including the computation of free energies using a variety of forcefields. These approaches may be combined to perform mixed quantum-mechanics and molecular-mechanics simulations. 
Description Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/nwchemgit/nwchem/Capabilities.md
Core Features: Quantum Chemical Calculations, Classical Molecular Dynamics Simulations, Electronic Structure Calculations, Ab Initio Molecular Simulations, Density Functional Theory Calculations
General Tags: Computational Chemistry, High-Performance Computing, Open-Source Software
AI Description: NWChem is an open-source computational chemistry package designed for high-performance simulations of large-scale molecular systems. It provides various tools and algorithms for both classical and quantum chemical calculations.

Core Features: Quality Control Of Metagenomic Data, Taxonomic Assignment Of DNA Sequences, Diversity Analysis Of Environmental Samples, Support For Handling Large-Scale Datasets
General Tags: Metagenomics, Bioinformatics, Microbiome Analysis, High-Throughput Sequencing
AI Description: Obitools3 is a comprehensive package for analyzing and processing metagenomic data. It includes a variety of tools for quality control, taxonomic assignment, and diversity analysis of DNA sequences obtained from environmental samples.

Software Description:
The Intel® oneAPI DPC++/C++ Compiler provides optimizations that help your applications run faster on Intel® 64 architectures on Windows* and Linux*, with support for the latest C, C++, and SYCL language standards. This compiler produces optimized code that can run significantly faster by taking advantage of the ever-increasing core count and vector register width in Intel® Xeon® processors and compatible processors. 
Description Source: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/docs/dpcpp-cpp-compiler/get-started-guide/2024-0/overview.html
Core Features: Opencl Framework For Fpga Acceleration, Utilizes The Power Of Field-Programmable Gate Arrays (Fpgas), Accelerates Applications Through Opencl Programming
General Tags: Opencl, Fpga, Acceleration
AI Description: oclfpga is an OpenCL framework for FPGA acceleration. It allows users to utilize the power of Field-Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGAs) for accelerating applications through OpenCL programming.

Software Description:
GNU Octave is a high-level interpreted language, primarily intended for numerical computations. It provides capabilities for the numerical solution of linear and nonlinear problems, and for performing other numerical experiments. It also provides extensive graphics capabilities for data visualization and manipulation. GNU Octave is normally used through its interactive interface (CLI and GUI), but it can also be used to write non-interactive programs. The GNU Octave language is quite similar to Matlab so that most programs are easily portable. 
Description Source: https://wiki.octave.org/FAQ#What_is_Octave?
Core Features: High-Level Language For Numerical Computations, Linear & Nonlinear Problem Solving Capabilities, Extensive Graphics Capabilities For Data Visualization, Large Library Of Functions For Numerical Computations
General Tags: Numerical Computations, Data Visualization
RP Software Documentation:
Anvil: https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/software/octave 
Bridges-2: https://www.psc.edu/resources/software/octave 
Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/ 
Ookami: https://www.stonybrook.edu/commcms/ookami/support/faq/software_on_ookami
AI Description: Octave is a high-level interpreted language, primarily intended for numerical computations. It provides capabilities for the numerical solution of linear and nonlinear problems and has extensive graphics capabilities for data visualization and manipulation.

Software Description: odgi provides an efficient and succinct dynamic DNA sequence graph model, as well as a host of algorithms that allow the use of such graphs in bioinformatic analyses.
Core Features: Efficient Graphical Representation Of Variation Graphs, Dynamic Histogram-Based Organization, Interactive Visualization Of Large-Scale Structural Variant Graphs
General Tags: Graph Visualization, Structural Variation Analysis, Genomics
AI Description: odgi is a succinct graphical representation of variation graphs. It provides methods for dynamic histogram-based organization and interactive visualization of large-scale structural variant graphs.

Core Features: Automatic Layout Of Diagrams & Graphs, Support For Various Graph Drawing Tasks, Implementation Of A Wide Range Of Algorithms & Data Structures
General Tags: Graph Drawing, Layout Algorithms, C++ Library
AI Description: OGDF (Open Graph Drawing Framework) is a C++ library for the automatic layout of diagrams and graphs. It provides a wide range of algorithms and data structures for various graph drawing tasks.

Core Features: Comprehensive Collection Of Open-Source Hpc Software Components, Best Practices For Hpc System Development, Testing, & Deployment, Community-Driven Effort, Collaboration With Key Stakeholders In The Industry
General Tags: Hpc, High Performance Computing, Open-Source, Collaborative, Community-Driven
AI Description: OpenHPC is a collaborative, community-driven effort to provide a comprehensive and cohesive open-source HPC stack to the community. Through close collaboration with key stakeholders across the industry, OpenHPC aims to provide a reference collection of open-source HPC software components and best practices to enable the development, testing, and deployment of HPC systems. Ultimately, building on the resecarch outputs from various related fields.

Core Features: Unified Programming Model For Heterogeneous Computing, Support For Cpus, Gpus, Fpgas, & Accelerators, Optimized Performance & Productivity, Cross-Architecture Development & Deployment
General Tags: Heterogeneous Computing, Unified Programming Model, Accelerated Computing, Performance Optimization
AI Description: OneAPI is a unified programming model that aims to simplify development across diverse architectures such as CPUs, GPUs, FPGAs, and other accelerators. It provides a single programming interface for developers to efficiently target and deploy applications in heterogeneous computing environments.

Software Description: Open Neural Network Exchange (ONNX) is an open ecosystem that empowers AI developers to choose the right tools as their project evolves. ONNX provides an open source format for AI models, both deep learning and traditional ML. It defines an extensible computation graph model, as well as definitions of built-in operators and standard data types. Currently we focus on the capabilities needed for inferencing (scoring).
Core Features: 1. Model Interoperability: ONNX allows AI models to be exchanged between different frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, and more. 2. Efficient Inference: ONNX provides optimized runtimes for deploying models on various hardware platforms. 3. Extensible Ecosystem: The ONNX community continuously develops new tools and libraries that support the format. 4. Model Versioning: ONNX supports different versions of the model, making it easier to maintain and update models.
General Tags: Ai, Machine Learning, Deep Learning
AI Description: ONNX (Open Neural Network Exchange) is an open-source format for AI models. It enables interoperability between different frameworks, making it easier to move models between various tools and platforms.

Software Description: ONNX Runtime inference can enable faster customer experiences and lower costs, supporting models from deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch and TensorFlow/Keras as well as classical machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, LightGBM, XGBoost, etc. ONNX Runtime is compatible with different hardware, drivers, and operating systems, and provides optimal performance by leveraging hardware accelerators where applicable alongside graph optimizations and transforms.

OPARI2, the successor of Forschungszentrum Juelich's OPARI, is a source-to-source instrumentation tool for OpenMP and hybrid codes. It surrounds OpenMP directives and runtime library calls with calls to the POMP2 measurement interface.
Core Features: 1. Automatic parallelization of OpenMP codes. 2. Instrumentation for performance analysis. 3. Automatic generation of OpenMP regions. 4. Support for various analysis tools. 5. Integration with compilers and build systems.
General Tags: Parallelization, Performance Analysis, Openmp
AI Description: OPARI2 (OpenMP Parallelizer and Runtime Instrumentation) is a tool for the parallelization and instrumentation of OpenMP programs. It helps to analyze and optimize the performance of parallel codes that use OpenMP directives.

Core Features: Data Ingestion & Storage, Data Indexing & Querying, Data Processing & Analysis, Data Visualization, Integration With Python Ecosystem
General Tags: Earth Observation, Data Management, Data Analysis, Data Visualization, Open Source
AI Description: Open Data Cube (ODC) is an open-source software package that helps in the management, analysis, and visualization of large environmental and Earth observation data sets. ODC Core provides the foundational components and functionalities for working with satellite and Earth observation data.

Software Description:
Open Babel is a chemical toolbox designed to speak the many languages of chemical data. It’s an open, collaborative project allowing anyone to search, convert, analyze, or store data from molecular modeling, chemistry, solid-state materials, biochemistry, or related areas. 
Description Source: https://openbabel.org/

RP Name: Aces, Anvil, Bridges-2, Darwin, Delta, Expanse, Faster, Kyric, Ookami
Software Description:
OpenBLAS is a high-performance library for dense linear algebra operations, optimized for high-speed and efficient execution on various hardware architectures. OpenBLAS is widely used in scientific computing, engineering, and machine learning for operations such as matrix multiplication, solving linear systems, and other vector and matrix operations, offering significant performance improvements over generic BLAS implementations. 
Description Source: https://www.openblas.net/
Core Features: Optimized Blas Functions, Support For Various Mathematical Operations On Matrices, High Performance & Efficiency, Multi-Threading Support For Parallel Processing
General Tags: Linear Algebra, Blas Library, Optimized Functions, Open Source

AI Description: OpenBLAS is an open-source implementation of the Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms (BLAS) library with optimized functions for matrix operations and linear algebra computations. It provides fast and efficient routines for common linear algebra operations.

Core Features: Distributed Tracing, Metrics Collection, Performance Monitoring, Integration With Various Backends & Frameworks
General Tags: Monitoring, Distributed Tracing, Performance, Python
AI Description: OpenCensus is a set of libraries for various programming languages that helps developers collect performance and tracing data from their applications. The opencensus-python library specifically provides support for Python applications to enable monitoring and distributed tracing.

Software Description:
OpenCV (Open Source Computer Vision Library) is an open source computer vision and machine learning software library. OpenCV was built to provide a common infrastructure for computer vision applications and to accelerate the use of machine perception in the commercial products. Being an Apache 2 licensed product, OpenCV makes it easy for businesses to utilize and modify the code. 
Description Source: https://opencv.org/about/
Core Features: Image Processing, Object Detection, Object Tracking, Machine Learning Algorithms
General Tags: Computer Vision, Image Processing, Machine Learning, Open Source
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Bridges-2: https://www.psc.edu/resources/software/opencv 
Delta: https://docs.ncsa.illinois.edu/systems/delta/en/latest/user_guide/software.html 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/
AI Description: OpenCV (Open Source Computer Vision Library) is an open-source computer vision and machine learning software library. It provides a wide range of functionalities for real-time computer vision, including image processing, object detection, object tracking, and machine learning algorithms.

Software Description:
OpenEXR provides the specification and reference implementation of the EXR file format, the professional-grade image storage format of the motion picture industry. 
Description Source: https://openexr.com/en/latest/
Core Features:
1. Supports high dynamic-range and floating-point pixel data
2. Can store multiple images, layers, and auxiliary channels
3. Lossless compression algorithms
4. Extensible metadata capabilities
5. Cross-platform and open-source
General Tags: Image, File Format, High Dynamic-Range, Hdr, Image Data
AI Description: OpenEXR is a high dynamic-range (HDR) image file format developed by Industrial Light & Magic (ILM) for use in computer imaging applications. It is used for the interchange of high-fidelity image data between different software applications.

RP Name: Aces, Anvil, Bridges-2, Expanse, Faster, Ookami
Software Description:
OpenFOAM is the free, open source CFD software developed primarily by OpenCFD Ltd since 2004. It has an extensive range of features to solve anything from complex fluid flows involving chemical reactions, turbulence and heat transfer, to acoustics, solid mechanics and electromagnetics. 
Description Source: https://www.openfoam.com/
Core Features:
1. Finite volume discretization for solving fluid flow problems
2. Ability to solve a wide range of physical problems including incompressible and compressible flows, heat transfer, turbulence modeling, and multiphase flows
3. Extensive library of pre-built solvers and utilities
4. Customizability through programming interface and source code access
5. Parallel processing capabilities for high-performance computing (HPC)
General Tags: Computational Fluid Dynamics, Open-Source Software, Finite Volume Method, Hpc

Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Anvil: https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/software/openfoam

Anvil: 8-20210316

AI Description: OpenFOAM (Open Source Field Operation and Manipulation) is a free, open-source computational fluid dynamics (CFD) software package developed by the OpenFOAM Foundation. It is widely used for simulating complex fluid flows in various industries and academic research.

Software Description:
OpenFold is a faithful but trainable PyTorch reproduction of DeepMind's AlphaFold 2. 
Description Source: https://github.com/aqlaboratory/openfold
Core Features: Some core features of openfold include molecular dynamics simulations, energy minimization algorithms, force field calculations, and visualization tools for protein structures. It also provides functionalities for analyzing protein folding kinetics and stability.
General Tags: Computational Software, Molecular Dynamics Simulations, Protein Folding, Structural Analysis
AI Description: openfold is a computational software tool designed for protein folding simulations and structural analysis. It allows researchers to study the folding pathways of proteins and investigate their three-dimensional structures.

Software Description: OpenImageIO is a library for reading and writing images, and a bunch of related classes, utilities, and applications.
Core Features: Support For A Wide Range Of Image Formats, Efficient Image Reading & Writing Capabilities, Color Management Functionalities, Image Processing & Manipulation Tools, Cross-Platform Compatibility
General Tags: Image Processing, Color Management, Library, Image Formats, Cross-Platform
AI Description: OpenImageIO is a library for reading and writing images, and a bunch of related functionality, like dealing with image formats and color management.

Software Description:
OpenJDK is a free, Open-Source version of the Java Development Kit for the Java Platform, Standard Edition (Java SE). 
Description Source: https://openjdk.org/
Core Features: Free & Open-Source Implementation Of Java Se, Support For Java Applications Development, Regular Updates & Bug Fixes, Compatibility With Various Operating Systems
General Tags: Open-Source, Java Development, Software Development, Programming
AI Description: OpenJDK (Open Java Development Kit) is a free and open-source implementation of the Java Platform, Standard Edition (Java SE). It is developed under the OpenJDK project as a collaboration between several companies and the open-source community.

Software Description:
OpenJPEG is an open-source JPEG 2000 codec written in C language. It has been developed in order to promote the use of JPEG 2000, a still-image compression standard from the Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG). Since may 2015, it is officially recognized by ISO/IEC and ITU-T as a JPEG 2000 Reference Software. 
Description Source: https://www.openjpeg.org/
Core Features: Supports Encoding & Decoding Of Jpeg 2000 Images, High-Performance Codec With Efficient Memory Usage, Compliant With Part 1 Of The Jpeg 2000 Standard (Itu-T T.800 | Iso/Iec 15444-1)
General Tags: Jpeg 2000 Codec, Image Processing Software, Open-Source Software
AI Description: OpenJPEG is an open-source JPEG 2000 codec written in C language. It aims to provide an open-source toolkit for JPEG 2000 encoding and decoding. OpenJPEG is free software licensed under the BSD-2-Clause.

Software Description:
OpenLDAP Software is an open source implementation of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol. 
Description Source: https://www.openldap.org/
Core Features: Ldap Server Implementation, Secure Authentication & Access Control, Scalable Directory Services, Cross-Platform Support, High-Performance, Open-Source
General Tags: Ldap, Directory Services, Authentication, Access Control, Open Source
AI Description: OpenLDAP is an open-source implementation of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) that provides a platform-independent, stable, and high-performance LDAP server suite. It is designed to provide robust, scalable, and secure directory services for managing user authentication, access control, and directory information.

Software Description:
OpenMM is a high-performance toolkit for molecular simulation. Use it as an application, a library, or a flexible programming environment. We include extensive language bindings for Python, C, C++, and even Fortran. 
Description Source: https://openmm.org/
Core Features: Efficient Implementation Of Molecular Dynamics Algorithms, Support For Cuda & Opencl For Gpu Acceleration, Python & C++ Apis For Easy Integration & Extensibility, Extensive Support For Various Force Fields & Integrators, Integration With Popular Simulation & Visualization Tools
General Tags: Molecular Dynamics, Biomolecular Simulations, Computational Chemistry, Biophysics, Gpu Acceleration
AI Description: OpenMM is a widely-used open-source toolkit for molecular dynamics simulation. It provides a high-performance, flexible, and easy-to-use platform for the development of computationally intensive simulations of biomolecular systems.

RP Name: Aces, Anvil, Bridges-2, Darwin, Delta, Expanse, Faster, Kyric, Ookami
Software Description:
The Open MPI Project is an open source implementation of the Message Passing Interface (MPI) specification that is developed and maintained by a consortium of academic, research, and industry partners. Open MPI is therefore able to combine the expertise, technologies, and resources from all across the High Performance Computing community in order to build the best MPI library available. 
Description Source: https://www.open-mpi.org/
Core Features:
1. Support for parallel computing using the MPI standard.
2. Scalability and performance optimization for HPC applications.
3. Fault tolerance and resilience features for handling node failures.
4. Interoperability with different programming languages like C, C++, and Fortran.
5. Dynamic process management and load balancing capabilities.
General Tags: Mpi Library, Parallel Computing, High Performance Computing, Distributed Memory System

Anvil: https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/software/openmpi
