Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/ 
Ookami: https://www.stonybrook.edu/commcms/ookami/support/faq/software_on_ookami
AI Description: OpenMPI is an open-source Message Passing Interface (MPI) library that allows parallel computing on a distributed memory system. It enables high performance computing (HPC) by facilitating communication and coordination between processes running on multiple nodes.

Software Description:
The Open MPI Project is an open source implementation of the Message Passing Interface (MPI) specification that is developed and maintained by a consortium of academic, research, and industry partners. Open MPI is therefore able to combine the expertise, technologies, and resources from all across the High Performance Computing community in order to build the best MPI library available. 
Description Source: https://www.open-mpi.org/

The Open MPI Project is an open source Message Passing Interface implementation that is developed and maintained by a consortium of academic, research, and industry partners. Open MPI is therefore able to combine the expertise, technologies, and resources from all across the High Performance Computing community in order to build the best MPI library available. 
Description Source: https://www.open-mpi.org/

Core Features: Key features of OpenMX include electronic structure calculations, molecular dynamics simulations, and optimization algorithms for nano-scale materials. It can handle various materials including molecules, surfaces, and nanoscale structures.
General Tags: Computational Chemistry, Materials Science
AI Description: OpenMX is a software package for nano-scale material simulations based on density functional theories, norm-conserving pseudopotentials, and pseudo-atomic localized basis functions.

Software Description:
OpenPGM is an open source implementation of the Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) specification in RFC 3208 available at www.ietf.org. PGM is a reliable and scalable multicast protocol that enables receivers to detect loss, request retransmission of lost data, or notify an application of unrecoverable loss. 
Description Source: https://code.google.com/archive/p/openpgm/
Core Features: Open-Source Implementation Of The Pgm Protocol, High Performance, Reliable & Scalable Multicast Communication
General Tags: Multicast Communication, Network Protocols, Open Source Software
AI Description: OpenPGM is an open-source implementation of the Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) protocol for reliable and scalable multicast communication. It offers high performance and reliability for applications requiring multicast messaging.

Core Features: Supports various MPC protocols, efficient and secure data combination, privacy-preserving computations, open-source and customizable for different applications.
General Tags: Mpc, Privacy-Preserving Computations, Data Security, Open-Source
AI Description: OpenPMIX is an open-source package specifically designed for multi-party computation (MPC) applications, providing efficient and secure protocols for combining data from multiple parties without revealing individual inputs. It supports a range of MPC protocols and functionalities for privacy-preserving computations.

Software Description:
The OpenSceneGraph is an open source high performance 3D graphics toolkit, used by application developers in fields such as visual simulation, games, virtual reality, scientific visualization and modelling. Written entirely in Standard C++ and OpenGL it runs on all Windows platforms, OSX, GNU/Linux, IRIX, Solaris, HP-Ux, AIX and FreeBSD operating systems. 
Description Source: https://www.openscenegraph.com/
Core Features: Cross-Platform Support For Windows, Macos, & Linux, Support For Shaders, Textures, Lighting, & Effects, Integration With Other Libraries Like Opengl, Openal, & Qt, Various File Format Support Including Obj, Osg, Fbx, & Collada, Extensive Documentation & Community Support
General Tags: 3D Graphics, Virtual Reality, Simulation, Visualization, Gaming
AI Description: OpenSceneGraph (OSG) is an open-source high-performance 3D graphics toolkit that is widely used in the fields of virtual reality, simulation, visualization, and gaming. It provides a powerful scene graph API for rapid development of interactive 3D graphics applications.

Software Description:
OpenSees is a software framework for developing applications to simulate the performance of structural and geotechnical systems subjected to earthquakes. A number of OpenSees applications are released on this website. 
Description Source: https://opensees.berkeley.edu/
Core Features:
1. Finite element analysis of structural and geotechnical systems
2. Advanced material models for concrete, steel, soil, and other materials
3. Real-time simulation and hybrid simulation capabilities
4. Parallel processing for efficient analysis of large-scale models
5. Extensive library of pre-built examples and documentation
General Tags: Simulation, Finite Element Analysis, Earthquake Engineering, Structural Analysis, Geotechnical Engineering
AI Description: OpenSees is an open-source software framework developed for simulating the seismic response of structural and geotechnical systems. It is widely used in civil engineering for earthquake engineering research, structural analysis, and performance-based design.

Core Features:
1. Enhanced support for symmetrical multiprocessing (SMP) systems.
2. Provides a set of standard symmetric memory operations that enable efficient remote memory access.
3. Supports various symmetric memory regions and communication capabilities.
4. Offers flexible programming interface and communication synchronization mechanisms.
5. Compatible with widely-used programming languages and compilers.
General Tags: Parallel Programming, High-Performance Computing, Distributed Memory Programming
AI Description: OpenSHMEMX is a portable implementation of the OpenSHMEM API designed to provide a high-performance, flexible, and scalable parallel programming model for symmetric multiprocessing (SMP) and massively parallel processing systems. It extends the original OpenSHMEM and aims to simplify the development of parallel applications.

Software Description:
OpenSSH is the premier connectivity tool for remote login with the SSH protocol. It encrypts all traffic to eliminate eavesdropping, connection hijacking, and other attacks. In addition, OpenSSH provides a large suite of secure tunneling capabilities, several authentication methods, and sophisticated configuration options. 
Description Source: https://www.openssh.com/
Core Features: Secure Remote Login, Secure File Transfer, Public Key Authentication
General Tags: Ssh, Secure Networking, Utilities
AI Description: OpenSSH is a suite of secure networking utilities based on the SSH protocol, providing encrypted communication sessions over a computer network using the SSH protocol. It offers secure remote login, secure file transfer, and public key authentication functionalities.

Research Field: Computer & Information Sciences, Other Computer & Information Sciences
Software Description:
OpenSSL software is a robust, commercial-grade, full-featured toolkit for general-purpose cryptography and secure communication. 
Description Source: https://www.openssl.org/
Core Features: Implementation Of Ssl & Tls Protocols, Support For A Wide Range Of Cryptographic Algorithms, Secure Cryptographic Libraries, Large Variety Of Functions For Secure Communication
General Tags: Cryptography, Security, Encryption, Networking
AI Description: OpenSSL is a robust, commercial-grade, and full-featured toolkit for the Transport Layer Security (TLS) and Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocols. It is also a general-purpose cryptography library.

Software Description: OpenSubdiv is a set of open source libraries that implement high performance subdivision surface (subdiv) evaluation on massively parallel CPU and GPU architectures.
Core Features:
1. High-performance subdivision surface evaluation
2. Support for complex and detailed geometry
3. Open-source and actively maintained
4. Efficient rendering and animation capabilities
General Tags: Subdivision Surface, Rendering, Animation
AI Description: OpenSubdiv is an open-source library that provides high-performance subdivision surface evaluation on massively parallel hardware. It generates high-quality surfaces, enabling detailed and complex geometry to be efficiently rendered and animated.

Software Description:
AdaptiveCpp is the independent, community-driven modern platform for C++-based heterogeneous programming models targeting CPUs and GPUs from all major vendors. AdaptiveCpp lets applications adapt themselves to all the hardware found in the system. This includes use cases where a single binary needs to be able to target all supported hardware, or utilize hardware from different vendors simultaneously. 
Description Source: https://github.com/AdaptiveCpp/AdaptiveCpp
Core Features:
1. Compatibility with heterogeneous systems
2. Simplified parallel programming with C++
3. Targeting GPUs, FPGAs, and other accelerators
4. Open-source implementation
5. Enables single-source C++ programming for various devices
General Tags: Programming Model, Heterogeneous Systems, Accelerators
AI Description: openSYCL is an open-source implementation of the SYCL standard, which is a higher-level programming model for developing C++ applications on heterogeneous systems with various accelerators such as GPUs, FPGAs, and other specialized processing units. It enables developers to write single-source C++ code that can target a variety of hardware accelerators without the need for low-level programming.

Core Features:
1. Real-time ray tracing: OptiX enables real-time ray tracing by leveraging the power of NVIDIA GPUs.
2. Programmable pipeline: Developers can create custom ray tracing applications with a programmable pipeline using CUDA.
3. Scalability: OptiX is designed for scalability, allowing developers to efficiently utilize multiple GPU cores for parallel processing.
4. Ray tracing effects: Supports advanced ray tracing effects such as shadows, reflections, refractions, and global illumination.
General Tags: Ray Tracing, Gpu-Accelerated, Real-Time Rendering
AI Description: OptiX is a GPU-accelerated ray tracing engine from NVIDIA that provides a programmable ray tracing pipeline for developers to build high-performance ray tracing applications.

Software Description:
Optuna is an automatic hyperparameter optimization software framework, particularly designed for machine learning. It features an imperative, define-by-run style user API. Thanks to our define-by-run API, the code written with Optuna enjoys high modularity, and the user of Optuna can dynamically construct the search spaces for the hyperparameters. 
Description Source: https://optuna.readthedocs.io/en/stable/
Core Features: Automated Hyperparameter Optimization, Distributed Optimization, Support For Multiple Machine Learning Frameworks (E.G., Pytorch, Tensorflow, Scikit-Learn), Integration With Jupyter Notebooks, Visualization Of Optimization Results, Pruning Of Unpromising Trials
General Tags: Machine Learning, Hyperparameter Optimization, Automated Machine Learning, Optimization Framework
AI Description: Optuna is an open-source hyperparameter optimization framework to automate hyperparameter search with a variety of flexible and powerful features for machine learning model training.

Software Description:
ORCA is a flexible, efficient and easy-to-use general purpose tool for quantum chemistry with specific emphasis on spectroscopic properties of open-shell molecules. It features a wide variety of standard quantum chemical methods ranging from semiempirical methods to DFT to single- and multireference correlated ab initio methods. 
Description Source: https://www.kofo.mpg.de/en/research/services/orca
Core Features: Orca offers a wide range of quantum chemical methods, including Density Functional Theory (DFT), ab initio Hartree-Fock, and many post-Hartree-Fock methods. It can perform geometry optimizations, transition state searches, and molecular dynamics simulations. Orca also supports a variety of spectroscopic properties calculations, such as NMR chemical shifts, electronic circular dichroism (ECD) spectra, and UV/Vis spectra.
General Tags: Quantum Chemistry, Computational Chemistry, Quantum Mechanics
AI Description: Orca is a flexible, efficient, and powerful quantum chemistry software written by Frank Neese and co-workers. It provides accurate and reliable computational simulations of molecular structures and properties based on quantum mechanical methods.

Software Description: Orthofinder is a fast, accurate and comprehensive platform for comparative genomics. It finds orthogroups and orthologs, infers rooted gene trees for all orthogroups and identifies all of the gene duplication events in those gene trees. It also infers a rooted species tree for the species being analysed and maps the gene duplication events from the gene trees to branches in the species tree. OrthoFinder also provides comprehensive statistics for comparative genomic analyses.
Core Features:
1. Phylogenomic orthology inference
2. Gene set inference
3. Fast and accurate results
4. User-friendly interface
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Phylogenomics, Orthology, Gene Set Inference
AI Description: OrthoFinder is a fast and accurate tool for phylogenomic orthology and gene set inference.

Core Features: Standardizes Communication Functions In Telecommunication Or Computing Systems, Defines Seven Abstraction Layers For Communication Protocols, Facilitates Interoperability Between Different Systems, Establishes A Clear Structure For Network Communication
General Tags: Networking, Communication, Protocol, Standardization
AI Description: OSI (Open System Interconnection) is a conceptual framework that standardizes the functions of a telecommunication or computing system into seven abstraction layers. It facilitates communication between different systems by defining a set of protocols to be used at each layer.

Software Description:
MPI microbenchmarks that are part of the OMB package in the C, Java, and Python programming languages for various parallel programming models like MPI, OpenSHMEM, UPC, UPC++, and NCCL. 
Description Source: https://mvapich.cse.ohio-state.edu/benchmarks/
Core Features: 1. Contains a range of micro-benchmarks to measure various aspects such as latency, bandwidth, and message rate. 2. Supports MPI and OpenMP implementations for evaluating parallel performance. 3. Enables detailed performance analysis for HPC systems and networks. 4. Provides scalability testing capabilities for parallel computing applications.
General Tags: Performance Evaluation, Hpc, Benchmarking
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Delta: https://docs.ncsa.illinois.edu/systems/delta/en/latest/user_guide/software.html 
Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/
AI Description: OSU Micro-Benchmarks is a suite of parallel micro-benchmarks written in C with MPI and OpenMP implementations, designed for evaluating the performance of parallel computing systems and HPC networks.

Software Description: The OTF2 library provides an interface to write and read trace data.
Core Features:
1. Scalable storage and analysis of trace data
2. Support for event traces
3. Efficient transfer and processing of trace data
4. Accessibility for HPC applications
General Tags: Trace Format, Event Traces, Hpc Applications
AI Description: OTF2 is a trace format for event traces. It is mainly used for the scalable and efficient storage, transfer, and analysis of trace data generated by HPC applications.

Software Description: Provides a way to load and enumerate PKCS#11 modules. Provides a standard configuration setup for installing PKCS#11 modules in such a way that they're discoverable. Also solves problems with coordinating the use of PKCS#11 by different components or libraries living in the same process.
Core Features: Manages Pkcs#11 Modules, Enables Multiple Applications To Use The Same Module, Provides A Serialized View Of The Module'S State, Handles Sharing Access To The Module State Among Applications
General Tags: Library, Pkcs#11, Module Management
AI Description: p11-kit is a library to manage PKCS#11 modules. It enables multiple applications to use the same PKCS#11 module in parallel, ensures that applications get access to the same serialized view of the module's state, and handles sharing access to the module state among applications.

Software Description:
The p4est software library enables the dynamic management of a collection of adaptive octrees, conveniently called a forest of octrees. p4est is designed to work in parallel and scales to hundreds of thousands, even millions, of processor cores. It is actively maintained and used by researchers worldwide. 
Description Source: https://www.p4est.org/
Core Features:
1. Parallel framework for dynamic load balancing
2. Adaptive mesh refinement capabilities
3. Support for solving partial differential equations on unstructured grids
4. Enables efficient parallel numerical simulations
General Tags: Computational Software, Library
AI Description: p4est (parallel framework for dynamic load balancing and adaptive mesh refinement) is a software library that provides support for dynamic load balancing and adaptive mesh refinement in parallel numerical simulations. It is particularly useful for solving partial differential equations on unstructured grids efficiently.

Software Description:
p7zip is a port of 7za.exe for POSIX systems like Unix (Linux, Solaris, OpenBSD, FreeBSD, Cygwin, AIX, ...), MacOS X and also for BeOS and Amiga. 
Description Source: https://p7zip.sourceforge.net/
Core Features: Supports Creating & Extracting 7Z, Xz, Gzip, Tar, Zip, & Other Archive Formats, High Compression Ratio With The Use Of The Lzma Algorithm, Can Be Used In Automation Scripts & Batch Processing, Cross-Platform Compatibility On Windows, Linux, & Macos
General Tags: File Archiver, Compression Software, Command-Line Tool, Open-Source Software
AI Description: p7zip is a command-line file archiver that supports the 7z compression format and various other archive formats. It is based on the open-source LZMA compression algorithm.

Software Description: PM2 is an umbrella software suite for high-performance runtime systems. Modules may be installed and used together or separately.
Core Features: Parallel Discrete Element Method (Dem) Simulations, Modeling Of Granular & Multiphase Flows, Large-Scale Simulation Capabilities, Suitable For Engineering & Scientific Applications
General Tags: Dem, Granular Flows, Multiphase Flows, Simulation Software
AI Description: PadicoTM is a parallel discrete element method software package tailored for large-scale simulations of granular and multiphase flows. It is designed to efficiently model the behavior of particulate materials in various engineering and scientific applications.

Software Description:
PAML is a package of programs for phylogenetic analyses of DNA or protein sequences using maximum likelihood. It may be used to estimate parameters and test hypotheses to study the evolutionary process. 
Description Source: http://abacus.gene.ucl.ac.uk/software/paml.html
Core Features: Key features of PAML include phylogeny inference, evolutionary rate estimation, branch-site and branch-specific models, selection analysis, divergence time estimation, and codon models. It allows users to perform various tests and analyses to understand the evolutionary mechanisms underlying sequence data.
General Tags: Phylogenetics, Evolutionary Analysis, Maximum Likelihood, Phylogenetic Inference
AI Description: PAML (Phylogenetic Analysis by Maximum Likelihood) is a package of programs for phylogenetic analysis of DNA or protein sequences using maximum likelihood. It provides a wide range of tools for evolutionary analysis and inference in a phylogenetic context.

Software Description: Panacota is a software providing tools for large scale bacterial comparative genomics.
Core Features: Analysis Of Single Molecule Positional Data, Creation Of Heatmaps, Statistical Analysis, Visualization Of Chromatin Organization
General Tags: Chromatin Analysis, Single Molecule Analysis, Statistical Analysis, Visualization
AI Description: Panacota is a tool for analyzing and visualizing positional data of single molecules in chromosomes. It allows users to create heatmaps and perform various statistical analyses to understand the spatial organization of chromatin.

Software Description: Panaroo is updated pipeline for pangenome investigation.
Core Features: Visualization Of Pangenomes, Interactive Exploration Of Gene Presence & Absence, Comparison Of Multiple Microbial Species, Identification Of Core & Accessory Genes, Detection Of Genomic Variations
General Tags: Pangenome Analysis, Microbial Genomics, Bioinformatics, Genome Visualization
AI Description: Panaroo is a pangenome visualization tool that allows users to compare and analyze pangenomes from microbial species. It provides an interactive and intuitive interface for exploring gene presence and absence within pangenomes.

Core Features: Data Manipulation, Data Analysis, Data Cleaning, Data Transformation, Data Visualization
General Tags: Python Library, Data Manipulation, Data Analysis, Structured Data, Tabular Data
AI Description: pandas is an open-source data manipulation and analysis library for Python. It provides data structures and functions that are designed to make data analysis fast and easy in Python. pandas is well-suited for working with structured data, such as tabular data, time series, and observational data.

Software Description: Pandaseq is a program to align Illumina reads, optionally with PCR primers embedded in the sequence, and reconstruct an overlapping sequence.
Core Features:
1. Alignment of Illumina reads
2. Reconstruction of overlapping sequences
3. Optional incorporation of PCR primers in sequences
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Alignment, Illumina Reads
AI Description: PANDASEQ is a program to align Illumina reads, optionally with PCR primers embedded in the sequences, and reconstruct an overlapping sequence.

Software Description: Pandora is a tool for bacterial genome analysis using a pangenome reference graph (PanRG). It allows gene presence/absence detection and genotyping of SNPs, indels and longer variants in one or a number of samples.
Core Features: 1. Inference of gene function from diverse biological data sources. 2. Statistical model for integrating multiple data types. 3. Supports large-scale data sets. 4. User-friendly interface for analysis.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Analysis, Gene Function Prediction
AI Description: Pandora is a bioinformatics software tool designed for the sequence-based inference of gene function from large-scale biological data sets. It uses a statistical model to identify gene functions by integrating various types of data, such as gene expression profiles, protein-protein interactions, and evolutionary conservation.

Software Description:
pango is a library for layout and rendering of text, with an emphasis on internationalization. Pango can be used anywhere that text layout is needed; however, most of the work on Pango so far has been done using the GTK widget toolkit as a test platform. Pango forms the core of text and font handling for GTK. 
Description Source: https://github.com/GNOME/pango
Core Features: 1. Support for multiple languages and writing systems. 2. Font fallback mechanism for displaying missing characters. 3. Bi-directional text support. 4. Advanced text layout capabilities, such as complex script rendering.
General Tags: Text Layout, Font Handling, Internationalization
AI Description: Pango is a library for layout and rendering of text, with an emphasis on internationalization. It forms the core of text and font handling for the GTK+ toolkit and is used by a variety of other open-source projects, including GNOME desktop environment.

Software Description: Pangolin is software package for assigning SARS-CoV-2 genome sequences to global lineages.
Core Features:
1. Lineage assignment for SARS-CoV-2 sequences.
2. Phylogenetic tree-based lineage determination.
3. Monitoring the viral evolution and spread.
4. Integration with various bioinformatics tools and databases.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Analysis, Viral Evolution
AI Description: Pangolin is a software tool developed for assigning lineages to SARS-CoV-2 sequences. It uses a phylogenetic tree-based approach to assign viral lineages based on the mutation profiles of the sequences. Pangolin is widely used in tracking the evolution and spread of the SARS-CoV-2 virus.

Software Description: Pangraph is a bioinformatic toolkit to align genome assemblies into pangenome graphs.
Core Features: Creation & Manipulation Of Directed Acyclic Graphs, Visualization Of Dags, Analysis Of Network Structures, Efficient Algorithms For Graph Operations
General Tags: Python Library, Directed Acyclic Graphs, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Network Analysis
AI Description: Pangraph is a Python library for creating, visualizing, and analyzing directed acyclic graphs (DAGs) with a focus on computational biology and bioinformatics applications. It provides a set of tools and algorithms to work with complex network structures efficiently.

Software Description: Pangenome-based Phylogenomic Analysis (PanPhlAn) is a strain-level metagenomic profiling tool for identifying the gene composition and in-vivo transcriptional activity of individual strains in metagenomic samples.
Core Features: Pangenome Analysis, Microbial Genomics, Strain-Specific Gene Identification, Metagenomic Profiling
General Tags: Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Microbiome Analysis
AI Description: PanPhlAn is a computational tool for profiling the gene content of microbial pangenomes and reconstructing strain-specific gene sets.

RP Name: Aces, Anvil, Darwin, Delta, Expanse, Kyric, Ookami, Stampede3
Software Description:
The Performance Application Programming Interface (PAPI) supplies a consistent interface and methodology for collecting performance counter information from various hardware and software components, including most major CPUs, GPUs, accelerators, interconnects, I/O systems, and power interfaces, as well as virtual cloud environments. Industry liaisons with AMD, Cray, Intel, IBM, NVIDIA, and others ensure seamless integration of PAPI with new architectures at or near their release. 
Description Source: https://icl.utk.edu/papi/
Core Features: 1. Abstraction of hardware-specific details for performance monitoring. 2. Support for a wide range of hardware performance counters. 3. Portable across different platforms and architectures. 4. Integration with various performance analysis tools.
General Tags: Performance Monitoring, Api, Hardware Counter
RP Software Documentation:

Anvil: https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/software/papi 
Delta: https://docs.ncsa.illinois.edu/systems/delta/en/latest/user_guide/software.html 
Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Ookami: https://www.stonybrook.edu/commcms/ookami/support/faq/software_on_ookami 
Stampede3: https://tacc.utexas.edu/use-tacc/software-list/

Anvil: 6.0.0.1
Delta: 7.0.1.1
Expanse: A6F2Xfv, Dlskqjh, ...
Faster: 7.0.1
Kyric: 5.7.0
AI Description: PAPI (Performance Application Programming Interface) is a portable and efficient API that provides a consistent interface and methodology for collecting performance counter data from the underlying hardware.

Software Description:
Parabricks is a free software suite for performing secondary analysis of next generation sequencing (NGS) DNA and RNA data. It delivers results at blazing fast speeds and low cost. Parabricks can analyze 30x WGS (whole human genome) data in about 15 minutes, instead of 30 hours for other methods. 
Description Source: https://docs.nvidia.com/clara/parabricks/latest/index.html
Core Features: Gpu Acceleration For High Performance, Speeds Up Genomic Analysis Pipelines, Supports Variant Calling, Mapping, & Assembly Tasks, Optimized For Accuracy & Efficiency In Processing Raw Sequencing Data
General Tags: Genomic Analysis, DNA Sequencing, Variant Calling, Gpu Acceleration
AI Description: Parabricks is a GPU-accelerated toolkit that assists in fast and accurate genomic analysis. It is designed to efficiently process raw sequencing data, such as those generated by DNA sequencing technologies, for tasks like variant calling, mapping, and genome assembly.

Software Description:
ParaFly provides a simple mechanism for running a predefined list of unix commands in parallel using multithreading. Failed processes are captured and reported. Successfully executed processes are noted. If the process is rerun, only those previously incompleted or failed processes will be executed. 
Description Source: https://parafly.sourceforge.net/
Core Features:
1. Task parallelization and distribution
2. Multi-core processing support
3. Scalability for distributed computing
4. Integration with Python ecosystem
5. Resource management and allocation
General Tags: Parallelization, Distributed Computing, Python Library
AI Description: Parafly is a Python library for parallelizing and distributing task execution across multiple cores or nodes, aimed at improving computational efficiency for high-performance computing applications.

Software Description: This project is a modified version of DeepMind's AlphaFold2 to achieve high-throughput protein structure prediction.
Core Features:
1. RNA secondary structure prediction
2. Deep learning models
3. Neural networks
4. Primary sequence input
General Tags: RNA Secondary Structure Prediction, Deep Learning, Neural Networks
AI Description: Parafold is a software tool for RNA secondary structure prediction using deep learning models. It utilizes neural networks to predict RNA secondary structures from primary sequences.

Software Description:
Parallel processing made simple and fast and runs any code in parallel processes(> use all CPUs), Threads(> speedup blocking operations), or Ractors(> use all CPUs). 
Description Source: https://github.com/grosser/parallel
Core Features: Execute Commands In Parallel, Distribute Jobs On Multiple Processors, Supports For-Loops, Mapping Functions, & Piping Output, Flexible & Efficient Task Scheduling, Control Resource Allocation & Job Execution Parameters
General Tags: Parallel Computing, Command-Line Tool, Task Scheduling
Version Info:
Anvil: 20200822
Delta: 20220522
Expanse: Kn7Agtl, Sqru6Rr
Faster: 20190922, 20220722
AI Description: GNU Parallel is a command-line tool for Unix-like operating systems that allows the user to execute shell scripts or commands in parallel. It is designed to simplify parallel job execution on single or multiple processors without the need for complex scripting.

Software Description: Parallel-fastq-dump is the parallel fastq-dump wrapper.
Core Features: Parallelizes The Download & Extraction Process Of Fastq Files From Sra, Improves Download Speed By Utilizing Multiple Threads, Supports Efficient Retrieval Of Data From The Sequence Read Archive, Reduces The Time Taken For Downloading Large Datasets
General Tags: Sra, Fastq Files, Data Download, Parallel Processing
AI Description: parallel-fastq-dump is a tool for parallelizing the download and extraction of FASTQ files from the Sequence Read Archive (SRA) in order to significantly reduce the download time.

Software Description:
PnetCDF (Parallel netCDF) is a high-performance parallel I/O library for accessing files in format compatibility with Unidata's NetCDF, specifically the formats of CDF-1, 2, and 5. 
Description Source: https://parallel-netcdf.github.io/
Core Features: Parallel I/O For Netcdf Files, High-Performance I/O In Parallel Environments, Optimized For Big Data Applications With Large Datasets, Supports Parallel Reads & Writes, Scalable & Efficient Storage & Retrieval Of Data
General Tags: High-Performance I/O, Big Data, Parallel Computing
AI Description: Parallel-NetCDF is a library providing high-performance I/O in parallel environments for big data applications with large scientific datasets. It offers parallel I/O capabilities for NetCDF files, which are commonly used in climate modeling, weather forecasting, and other scientific disciplines.

Core Features: High-Performance Computing, Parallel Computation, RNA Secondary Structure Prediction
General Tags: Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Hpc Tools
AI Description: ParallelFold is a software tool designed for predicting RNA secondary structures in a parallel and high-performance computing environment. It implements efficient algorithms for parallelization to accelerate the prediction process.

Core Features:
1. Efficiently performs global, semi-global, and local pairwise sequence alignments.
2. Utilizes SIMD optimizations for optimized performance.
3. Supports various sequence alignment algorithms like Smith-Waterman-Gotoh and Needleman-Wunsch.
4. Written in C for easy integration into existing codebases.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Software, Hpc Tools
AI Description: Parasail is a SIMD C library for global, semi-global, and local pairwise sequence alignments. It is optimized for typical x86 and x86-64 architectures, automatically detecting and using AVX, AVX2, and/or SSE4.1 vectorization as well as the KNC instruction set when available. Parasail includes the Smith-Waterman-Gotoh algorithm for local alignments and the Needleman-Wunsch algorithm for global alignments.

RP Name: Aces, Anvil, Darwin, Delta, Expanse, Faster
Research Field: Physical Sciences, Engineering & Technology, Natural Sciences, Computer & Information Sciences, Other Natural Sciences
Software Description:
ParaView is an open-source, multi-platform scientific data analysis and visualization tool that enables analysis and visualization of extremely large datasets. 
Description Source: https://docs.paraview.org/en/latest/UsersGuide/introduction.html
Core Features: Supports Various Data Formats Including Vtk, Xml, Hdf5, & Several Others, Render Large Data Sets With Interactive Exploration Capabilities, Offers Advanced Visualization Techniques Like Volume Rendering, Contouring, & Vector Field Visualization, Support For Scripting With Python, Parallel Processing Capabilities For Faster Computation
General Tags: Visualization, Data Analysis, Open-Source, Multi-Platform

AI Description: ParaView is an open-source, multi-platform data analysis and visualization application. It is designed to handle large data sets and offers a wide range of visualization techniques to analyze and interact with the data.

Software Description: Parliament2 identifies structural variants in a given sample relative to a reference genome.
Core Features: Key features include symbolic model checking, support for developing scalable algorithms, bug checking, and verification of complex systems.
General Tags: Symbolic Model Checking, Scalable Algorithms, Bug Checking, System Verification
AI Description: Parliament2 is a fork of the Parliament tool that provides a toolkit for developing scalable symbolic model checking algorithms.

Software Description:
ParMETIS is an MPI-based parallel library that implements a variety of algorithms for partitioning unstructured graphs, meshes, and for computing fill-reducing orderings of sparse matrices. ParMETIS extends the functionality provided by METIS and includes routines that are especially suited for parallel AMR computations and large scale numerical simulations. 
Description Source: http://glaros.dtc.umn.edu/gkhome/metis/parmetis/overview
Core Features: Mpi-Based Parallel Graph Partitioning, Sparse Matrix Reordering, High-Performance Capabilities, Optimized For Large, Sparse Graph Problems
General Tags: Graph Partitioning, Sparse Matrix Ordering, Scientific Computing, Parallel Computing
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Delta: https://docs.ncsa.illinois.edu/systems/delta/en/latest/user_guide/software.html 
Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/ 
Stampede3: https://tacc.utexas.edu/use-tacc/software-list/
Version Info:
Aces: 4.0.3
Delta: 4.0.3
Expanse: Efd2Nv3, Fftjkx6, ...
Faster: 4.0.3
AI Description: ParMETIS is an MPI-based parallel graph partitioning and sparse matrix ordering library designed for efficiently solving large, sparse graph problems. It provides high-performance graph partitioning, matrix reordering, and fill-reducing matrix ordering capabilities for a wide range of scientific computing applications.

Core Features: PARPACK provides efficient routines for solving symmetric and non-symmetric eigenvalue problems, including the ability to calculate a subset of eigenvalues based on target values (a generalized eigenvalue problem) and to find the Schur factorization of a matrix.
General Tags: Eigenvalue Problems, Sparse Matrices, Numerical Linear Algebra
AI Description: PARPACK is a software library for solving large scale eigenvalue problems. It is specifically designed to compute a few eigenvalues and corresponding eigenvectors of large sparse matrices.

Software Description: Parsnp is used to align the core genome of hundreds to thousands of bacterial genomes within a few minutes to few hours.
Core Features: Core-Genome Alignment, Snp Detection, Whole-Genome Sequencing Data Analysis, Comparative Genomics Studies, Evolutionary Relationship Analysis
General Tags: Genomics, Bioinformatics, Sequencing, Evolutionary Biology
AI Description: parsnp is a software tool used for rapid core-genome alignment and SNP detection in whole-genome sequencing data. It is particularly designed for comparative genomics studies to identify genetic variations and evolutionary relationships among bacterial genomes.

Software Description: PASA, acronym for Program to Assemble Spliced Alignments (and pronounced 'pass-uh'), is a eukaryotic genome annotation tool that exploits spliced alignments of expressed transcript sequences to automatically model gene structures, and to maintain gene structure annotation consistent with the most recently available experimental sequence data.
Core Features:
1. Integration of various sources of evidence such as RNA-Seq reads, ESTs, and protein alignments to annotate gene structures. 
2. Automated identification of alternatively spliced isoforms. 
3. Improvement of gene structures through iterative alignment and assembly steps. 
4. Built-in support for visualization of gene structures and associated evidence.
General Tags: Genome Annotation, Gene Structure, RNA-Seq, Eukaryotic Genomes
AI Description: PASA (Program to Assemble Spliced Alignments) is a eukaryotic genome annotation tool that uses multiple sources of experimental evidence to identify and improve gene structures. PASA Pipeline is a comprehensive software tool that automates and streamlines the process of gene structure annotation and improvement.

Software Description: PASTA: Ultra-Large Multiple Sequence Alignment for Nucleotide and Amino-Acid Sequences.
Core Features: PASTA incorporates the SATé (SATé-I and SATé-II) algorithm and transitivity to align sequences by breaking the alignment problem into smaller subproblems, which are then joined together to build the final alignment. It allows for the alignment of large datasets and can handle a wide range of sequence types.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Sequence Alignment
AI Description: PASTA (Practical Alignment using SATé and TrAnsitivity) is a multiple sequence alignment program that uses a divide-and-conquer strategy to improve the scalability and accuracy of alignment.

Software Description: PatchELF is a small utility to modify the dynamic linker and RPATH of ELF executables.
Core Features: PatchELF allows users to easily modify the dynamic linker and run-time library paths in executables, making it useful for managing dependencies and ensuring proper execution of programs.
General Tags: Dependency Management, Executable Modification, Dynamic Linker Paths
AI Description: PatchELF is a simple utility for modifying the dynamic linker and run-time library paths in executable files.

Software Description:
GNU paxutils is a suite of archive utilities: it will provide cpio, tar and POSIX pax archivers. 
Description Source: https://www.gnu.org/software/paxutils/
Core Features: Inspect Elf Binary Files, Display Information About Elf Files, Modify Elf File Attributes, Detect Security Issues In Elf Binaries
General Tags: Elf Files, Binary Analysis, Security Tools, Linux
AI Description: pax-utils is a set of utilities that enable examination and manipulation of ELF (Executable and Linkable Format) files created for Linux systems. These tools are primarily used for analyzing and modifying various attributes of ELF binaries.

Software Description: pblat is parallelized blat with multi-threads support.
Core Features:
1. Parallel alignment of biological sequences to a reference genome
2. Utilizes the BLAT algorithm for high-speed sequence alignment
3. Scalable performance for large-scale genomic analysis tasks
4. Supports various input formats and options for customization
5. Enables efficient detection of sequence similarities and variations
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Alignment, Genomics, Parallel Computing
AI Description: pblat (Parallel BLAT) is a software tool that efficiently aligns biological sequences to a reference genome by using the BLAT algorithm in a parallel computing framework. It is specifically designed for high-throughput sequence analysis tasks, offering improved speed and scalability for large-scale genomic analyses.

Software Description: Pbmm2 is a minimap2 frontend for PacBio native data formats.
Core Features: Optimized For Pacbio Long Reads, Graph-Guided Mapping Approach, Highly Accurate Alignments, Efficient Mapping To Reference Genomes
General Tags: Long Read Aligner, Graph-Guided Mapping, Reference Genome Mapping, Bioinformatics
AI Description: pbmm2 is a long read aligner designed for PacBio single molecule sequencing reads, utilizing a graph-guided mapping approach to accurately and efficiently align long reads to a reference genome.

Software Description: pbptyper is a tool to identify the Penicillin Binding Protein (PBP) of Streptococcus pneumoniae assemblies.
Core Features:
1. Rapid and accurate genotyping of bacterial pathogens
2. High-throughput analysis of MinION nanopore sequencing data
3. Portable and scalable approach
4. Simultaneous typing of multiple bacterial isolates
General Tags: Genotyping, Bacterial Pathogens, Minion Nanopore Sequencing, High-Throughput Analysis
AI Description: pbptyper is a tool for high-throughput genotyping of bacterial pathogens based on MinION nanopore sequencing data. It utilizes a portable and scalable approach to rapidly and accurately type multiple bacterial isolates simultaneously.

Software Description: PCAngsd is a program that estimates the covariance matrix and individual allele frequencies for low-depth next-generation sequencing (NGS) data in structured/heterogeneous populations using principal component analysis (PCA) to perform multiple population genetic analyses using genotype likelihoods.
Core Features:
1. Utilizes genotype likelihoods for demographic inference.
2. Can handle low-coverage sequencing data.
3. Provides tools for population structure analysis.
4. Supports various statistical methods for inferring population parameters.
General Tags: Population Genetics, Genomic Data Analysis
AI Description: PCAngsd is a Python-based software tool used for the estimation of demographic history from whole-genome sequencing data. It is designed to infer the demographic history of populations, particularly focusing on the estimation of historical population size changes and divergence times.

Core Features: Extract Detailed Information On Pci Buses & Devices, Query & Manipulate Pci Device Configuration Registers, View & Modify Pci Device Identifiers & Capabilities, Identify & Manage Pci Devices For Driver Compatibility
General Tags: Pci Management, System Utilities, Linux Tools
AI Description: pciutils is a set of utilities for displaying information about PCI buses in the system and devices connected to them. It provides various tools for configuration, diagnostics, and monitoring of PCI devices in Linux systems.

Software Description:
The PCRE library is a set of functions that implement regular expression pattern matching using the same syntax and semantics as Perl 5. NOTE:This version of PCRE is now at end of life, and is no longer being actively maintained. New Projects should use PCRE2 instead. 
Description Source: https://www.pcre.org/
Core Features: Support For Perl-Style Regular Expressions, Pattern Matching Capabilities, Compatible With Many Programming Languages
General Tags: Regular Expressions, Pattern Matching, Library
AI Description: Perl Compatible Regular Expressions (PCRE) is a library for pattern matching with regular expressions. It implements the functionality of the regular expression library in Perl and provides support for Perl-style regular expressions in many programming languages.

Software Description:
PCRE2 is a set of functions that implement regular expression pattern matching using the same syntax and semantics as Perl 5. PCRE has its own native API, as well as a set of wrapper functions that correspond to the POSIX regular expression API. NOTE: This is the current version of the PCRE library. 
Description Source: https://www.pcre.org/
Core Features:
1. Implementing Perl-compatible regular expressions
2. Compatible with Perl 5 API
3. Regular expression matching engine supporting Perl-style patterns
4. Additional features compared to Perl, such as matching up to 2^16 code units
General Tags: Regular Expressions, Text Processing, Pattern Matching
AI Description: PCRE2 is a C library implementing Perl-compatible regular expressions. It is a reimplementation of PCRE but with a different API that is designed to be compatible with Perl 5. It provides a regular expression matching engine that supports Perl-style patterns while also providing some features not found in Perl, such as matching up to 2^16 code units.

Software Description: PDAL is a C++ library for translating and manipulating point cloud data.
Core Features:
1. Point cloud data manipulation
2. Geospatial data processing
3. Support for LiDAR data
4. Integration with GIS software
5. Pipeline workflow creation
General Tags: Point Cloud, Geospatial Data, Lidar, Gis, Data Processing
AI Description: PDAL is an open-source library for point cloud processing and data management. It offers a variety of tools and pipelines for manipulating geospatial data in the form of point clouds.

Software Description: Program Database Toolkit (PDT) is a framework for analyzing source code written in several programming languages and for making rich program knowledge accessible to developers of static and dynamic analysis tools. PDT implements a standard program representation, the program database (PDB), that can be accessed in a uniform way through a class library supporting common PDB operations.
Core Features: PDT analyzes multiple programming languages, builds abstract syntax trees, control-flow graphs, program dependence graphs, and call graphs; provides a rich API for programmatic access to analyzed programs; supports interactive development of program analysis methods; and enables the development of new program understanding tools.
General Tags: Software, Programming, Source Code, Analysis
AI Description: Program Database Toolkit (PDT) is a framework for analyzing source code written in several programming languages and for making rich program knowledge accessible to developers, analysts, and creating tools for source code understanding.

Software Description:
PDtoolkit covers the most common steps in probability of default (PD) rating model development and validation. The main procedures available are those that refer to univariate, bivariate, multivariate analysis, calibration and validation. Along with accompanied 'monobin' and 'monobinShiny' packages, 'PDtoolkit' provides functions which are suitable for different data transformation and modeling tasks such as: imputations, monotonic binning of numeric risk factors, binning of categorical risk factors, weights of evidence (WoE) and information value (IV) calculations, WoE coding (replacement of risk factors modalities with WoE values), risk factor clustering, area under curve (AUC) calculation and others. 
Description Source: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/PDtoolkit/index.html
Core Features: Data Cleaning & Preprocessing, Tabular Data Analysis, Feature Selection, Visualization Tools
General Tags: Python Library, Exploratory Data Analysis, Data Preprocessing, Feature Selection, Visualization
AI Description: pdtoolkit is a Python library for exploratory data analysis and preprocessing of tabular data. It provides various tools and functions for data cleaning, transformation, feature selection, and visualization.

Software Description: Peakranger is a multi-purporse software suite for analyzing next-generation sequencing (NGS) data.
Core Features: 1. Identification of transcription factor binding sites from ChIP-Seq data. 2. Dynamic programming approach for accurate modeling. 3. Comprehensive analysis of enriched regions. 4. Visualization tools for peak identification and visualization.
General Tags: Peak Finding, Transcription Factor Binding, Chip-Seq Data Analysis
AI Description: PeakRanger is a peak-finding algorithm specifically designed for the accurate identification of transcription factor binding sites from ChIP-Seq data. It utilizes a dynamic programming approach to accurately model and detect enriched regions, providing a comprehensive analysis of transcription factor binding patterns.

Software Description: PEPPER is a genome inference module based on recurrent neural networks that enables long-read variant calling and nanopore assembly polishing in the PEPPER-Margin-DeepVariant pipeline.
Core Features:
1. Utilizes deep learning models for variant calling
2. Accurately identifies SNPs and indels from sequencing data
3. Built on top of Google's DeepVariant technology
4. Offers improved accuracy compared to traditional variant calling methods
5. Scalable for large-scale genomic analyses
General Tags: Variant Calling, Deep Learning, Genetic Variants
AI Description: Pepper is a variant calling tool built on top of Google's DeepVariant that utilizes deep learning models to accurately call single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) and indels from high-throughput sequencing data. It provides improved accuracy and scalability for identifying genetic variants.

Core Features: Cpu Profiling, Memory Profiling, Identification Of Performance Bottlenecks, Code Optimization, Performance Analysis
General Tags: Performance Analysis, Optimization, Profiling
AI Description: Perftools is a collection of performance analysis tools designed to help developers optimize their software by identifying performance bottlenecks and areas for improvement. It includes a suite of profiling tools that can be used to analyze CPU and memory usage, as well as identify hotspots in code.

Core Features:
1. CPU profiler for sampling performance data
2. Memory profiler for tracking memory allocation and deallocation
3. Lightweight and easy to use
4. Suitable for basic performance analysis tasks
General Tags: Performance Analysis, Profiling, Linux
AI Description: perftools is a collection of performance analysis tools for Linux-based systems. perftools-base is the base package of perftools which includes basic performance analysis tools for profiling CPU and memory usage.

Core Features: Perftools-lite offers functionalities such as profiling, tracing, performance analysis, and visualization tools. It includes features like CPU and memory profiling, function-level profiling, heap profiling, thread profiling, real-time tracing, and performance visualization.
General Tags: Performance Analysis, Profiling, Tracing
AI Description: Perftools lite is a set of performance analysis tools designed for lightweight profiling and tracing of applications. It provides insights into the performance of software applications to help optimize and improve efficiency.

Core Features:
1. Event-based performance analysis
2. Lightweight and efficient performance data collection
3. Identification of performance bottlenecks
4. Optimization of code performance
5. Monitoring and measuring parallel application execution behavior
General Tags: Performance Analysis, Parallel Applications, Optimization
AI Description: Perftools Lite (PTL) provides a framework for lightweight performance analysis of parallel applications. It allows users to collect and analyze performance data to identify bottlenecks and optimize code performance. PTL focuses on event-based performance analysis to monitor and measure the execution behavior of parallel applications.

Core Features: Performance Analysis For Gpu Applications, Insightful Metrics For Optimization, Visualization Tools For Performance Data
General Tags: Performance Analysis, Gpu Applications, Metrics, Visualization
AI Description: Perftools-lite-gpu is a lightweight performance analysis tool designed for GPU applications. It allows developers to analyze the performance of their GPU-accelerated applications by providing insightful metrics and visualizations.

Core Features: Profiling Of Applications Utilizing High Bandwidth Memory (Hbm), Analysis Of Memory Access Patterns, Cache Behavior Monitoring, Performance Optimization For Hbm Systems
General Tags: Performance Analysis, Memory Profiling, Hbm Systems, High Bandwidth Memory, Optimization
AI Description: PerfTools-Lite-HBM is a performance analysis tool specifically designed for profiling applications running on High Bandwidth Memory (HBM) systems. It provides insights into memory access patterns, cache behavior, and overall performance characteristics of HBM-enabled applications.

Core Features: Analyzing Loop-Level Performance, Identifying Loop Optimizations, Detecting Dependencies Within Loops, Pinpointing Performance Bottlenecks
General Tags: Performance Monitoring, Optimization, Debugging
AI Description: The perftools-lite-loops software is a performance monitoring tool that focuses on analyzing loop-level performance in applications. It is designed to provide detailed insights into loop optimizations, dependencies, and potential performance bottlenecks in code.

Core Features: Code Optimization, Performance Profiling, Runtime Statistics Collection, Identifying Performance Bottlenecks, Function Call Trace Analysis
General Tags: Performance Optimization, Code Profiling, Software Performance, Debugging
AI Description: perftools-preload is a tool designed to optimize and profile code performance by collecting runtime statistics, such as CPU utilization, memory usage, and function call traces. It is particularly useful for identifying performance bottlenecks and optimizing code for improved efficiency.

Software Description:
Perl is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over 36 years of development. Perl runs on over 100 platforms from portables to mainframes and is suitable for both rapid prototyping and large scale development projects. 
Description Source: https://www.perl.org/about.html
Core Features:
1. Rich set of built-in functions and modules for text manipulation and regular expressions.
2. Platform-independent and supports multiple operating systems.
3. Object-oriented programming capabilities.
4. Extensive library of third-party modules available through Comprehensive Perl Archive Network (CPAN).
5. Strong community support and active development.
General Tags: Programming Language, Text Processing, Scripting, Web Development, System Administration
AI Description: Perl is a high-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming language known for its powerful text-processing features and used for a wide range of tasks including web development, system administration, and network programming.

Software Description: BioPerl is a collection of Perl modules that facilitate the development of Perl scripts for bioinformatics applications. It provides software modules for many of the typical tasks of bioinformatics programming.
A set of common packages from CPAN
A set of common packages from CPAN
Core Features:
1. Includes a variety of Perl modules and libraries from CPAN.
2. Simplifies the process of installing and managing multiple Perl modules as a single bundle.
3. Provides access to a wide range of functionalities and tools for Perl programming.
General Tags: Software Bundle, Perl Modules, Code Libraries
AI Description: A collection of Perl modules and libraries available on CPAN (Comprehensive Perl Archive Network) bundled together for easy installation and management.

Software Description: A set of common packages from CPAN
Core Features: Installs Multiple Cpan Modules At Once, Manages Dependencies Efficiently, Streamlines The Installation Process
General Tags: Perl, Cpan, Dependency Management, Module Installation
AI Description: perl-bundle2-cpan is a Perl module that allows for the installation of multiple CPAN modules in one go, making it easier to manage dependencies and streamline the process of installing Perl modules.

RP Name: Aces, Anvil, Delta, Expanse, Faster, Ookami, Stampede3
Software Description:
PETSc, the Portable, Extensible Toolkit for Scientific Computation, is for the scalable (parallel) solution of scientific applications modeled by partial differential equations (PDEs). It has bindings for C, Fortran, and Python (via petsc4py). 
Description Source: https://petsc.org/release/
Core Features: Scalable Solution Of Scientific Applications Modeled By Partial Differential Equations, Efficient Numerical Computations On High-Performance Computers, Portable & Extensible Toolkit, Support For Parallel Computing, Integration With Other Computational Software
General Tags: Scientific Computing, Computational Science, Numerical Analysis

Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Anvil: https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/software/petsc
