Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/ 
Ookami: https://www.stonybrook.edu/commcms/ookami/support/faq/software_on_ookami 
Stampede3: https://tacc.utexas.edu/use-tacc/software-list/
AI Description: PETSc, the Portable, Extensible Toolkit for Scientific Computation, is a suite of data structures and routines for the scalable (parallel) solution of scientific applications modeled by partial differential equations.

Core Features: Implementation Of Particle Filtering Algorithms, Data Analysis & Visualization Tools, Support For Bayesian Inference, Statistical Signal Processing Capabilities
General Tags: Particle Filtering, Statistical Signal Processing, Bayesian Inference, Data Analysis, Visualization
AI Description: pftoolsv3 is a software suite that provides a collection of tools for analyzing and visualizing data related to particle filtering methods. It is designed to assist researchers and practitioners in the field of statistical signal processing and Bayesian inference.

Software Description: pggb builds pangenome variation graphs from a set of input sequences.
Core Features:
1. Performance evaluation of computational applications
2. Benchmarking for comparing performance metrics
3. Identification of bottlenecks in code
4. Optimization strategies for improving efficiency
General Tags: Performance Evaluation, Benchmarking, Computational Applications
AI Description: pggb is a software tool used for conducting performance evaluation and benchmarking of computational applications. It allows users to analyze the performance of their codes, identify bottlenecks, and optimize for better efficiency.

Software Description:
The NVIDIA HPC Software Development Kit (SDK) includes the proven compilers, libraries and software tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance and portability of HPC applications. 
Description Source: https://developer.nvidia.com/hpc-sdk
Core Features:
1. High performance optimizing compilers
2. OpenMP and OpenACC parallel programming support
3. Compatibility with multicore CPUs and NVIDIA GPUs
4. Extensive optimization capabilities
5. Debugging and profiling tools
6. Comprehensive set of performance analysis features
General Tags: Hpc, Compilers, Parallel Programming
AI Description: PGI Compilers & Tools are the essential HPC development tools for scientists, researchers, and engineers. PGI products deliver world-class performance across a wide range of applications and provide a full-featured, performance optimizing OpenMP and OpenACC parallel programming environment for multicore CPUs and NVIDIA GPUs.

Software Description: PHAST is a freely available software package for comparative and evolutionary genomics.
Core Features: Phylogenetic Comparative Genomics, Evolutionary Conservation Analysis, Detection Of Accelerated Evolution, Spatial & Temporal Models, Multiple Sequence Alignment Analysis
General Tags: Genomics, Phylogenetics, Evolutionary Biology, Bioinformatics
AI Description: PHAST (PHylogenetic Analysis with Space/Time models) is a software package for comparative and evolutionary genomics. It is designed for analyzing patterns of evolutionary conservation and acceleration in multiple alignments of genomic sequences.

Software Description: Phd2fasta is a tool to convert Phred ‘phd’ format files to ‘fasta’ format.
Core Features: Converts DNA sequencing trace files in PHD format to the commonly used FASTA format. Retains sequence information and quality scores for downstream analysis. Simple and straightforward conversion process for users.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Analysis
AI Description: phd2fasta is a tool used for converting DNA sequencing trace files in PHD format to the FASTA format, making it easier to work with DNA sequences in bioinformatics analysis.

Software Description:
Parallel HDF5 is a unique technology suite that makes possible the management of extremely large and complex data collections. 
Description Source: https://support.hdfgroup.org/HDF5/whatishdf5.html
Core Features:
1. Read and write PHDF5 files
2. Manipulate large datasets efficiently
3. Parallel I/O support for distributed storage systems
General Tags: Parallel I/O, Phdf5, Hdf5, Large Datasets
AI Description: ph5util provides utilities for reading, writing, and manipulating PHDF5 files. PHDF5 is a parallel I/O file format based on the HDF5 file format and is used for storing large datasets efficiently across distributed storage systems.

Software Description: Practical Haplotype Graph (PHG) is a general, graph-based, computational framework that can be used with a variety of skim sequencing methods to infer high-density genotypes directly from low-coverage sequence.
Core Features: Analyze Genome-Wide Markers, Case-Control Population Hybrid Design, Detect Genomic Regions With Different Allele Frequencies, Incorporate Ancestry Information, Account For Linkage Disequilibrium
General Tags: Genomics, Population Genetics, Allele Frequency Analysis, Linkage Disequilibrium, Ancestry Information
AI Description: PHG (Population Hybrid Graphs) is a software package for analyzing genome-wide markers in a case-control population hybrid design. It is designed for detecting genomic regions that differ in allele frequency between cases and controls, considering ancestry information and accounting for linkage disequilibrium.

Software Description: PhiPack: PHI test and other tests of recombination
Core Features: Estimation Of Selection Pressure At Individual Sites, Identification Of Positive Selection On Specific Branches, Detection Of Recombination Events
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology
AI Description: Phipack is a software package for the analysis of site-specific amino acid substitutions within multiple sequence alignments. It uses statistical methods to estimate selection pressure at individual sites, identify positive selection on specific branches of a phylogenetic tree, and detect recombination events.

Core Features: PHP code is usually processed on a web server by a PHP interpreter implemented as a module, a daemon process, or as a Common Gateway Interface (CGI) executable. On a web server, the result of the interpreted and executed PHP code — which may be any type of data, such as generated HTML or binary image data — would form the whole or part of an HTTP response. Various web template systems, web content management systems, and web frameworks exist which can be employed to orchestrate or facilitate the generation of that response and PHP code.
General Tags: Programming Language, Web Development
AI Description: PHP is a popular general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited to web development. It is a server-side scripting language embedded in HTML.

Software Description: phrap is a program for assembling shotgun DNA sequence data.
Core Features:
1. DNA sequencing data assembly
2. Alignment of sequencing reads
3. Generation of consensus sequences
4. Error correction and base calling
5. Support for various sequencing technologies
General Tags: DNA Sequencing, Genomics, Assembly
AI Description: Phrap is a software for assembling shotgun DNA sequencing data. It is commonly used in genomics research for aligning and assembling DNA sequencing reads into longer contiguous sequences.

Software Description: The phred software reads DNA sequencing trace files, calls bases, and assigns a quality value to each called base.
Core Features: Base calling, quality score assignment, error rate estimation, confidence measures for base calls.
General Tags: DNA Sequencing, Base Calling, Quality Assessment
AI Description: Phred is a base-calling software used for analyzing DNA sequencing chromatograms. It assigns quality scores to each base call, providing information about the accuracy and reliability of the sequencing data.

Software Description:
PHYLIP is a free package of programs for inferring phylogenies. It is distributed as source code, documentation files, and a number of different types of executables. 
Description Source: https://phylipweb.github.io/phylip/
PhyloFisher is a software package written in Python3 that can be used for the creation, analysis, and visualization of phylogenomic datasets that consist of eukaryotic protein sequences.
Core Features: Identifying Evolutionarily Conserved Elements In Non-Coding RNA Sequences, Phylogenetic Approach For Accurate Inference, Detection Of Functional Elements Within RNA Sequences, Visualization Of Conservation Patterns
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Phylogenetics, Non-Coding RNA
AI Description: PhyloFishEr is a software tool designed for the computational inference of evolutionarily conserved elements in non-coding RNA sequences. It employs a phylogenetic approach to identify conserved regions that are likely to have functional importance.

Software Description: PhyloSuite is an integrated and scalable desktop platform for streamlined molecular sequence data management and evolutionary phylogenetics studies.
Core Features: Data Preparation & Processing For Phylogenetic Analysis, Sequence Alignment & Trimming, Model Selection & Identification, Phylogeny Estimation Using Multiple Methods, Visualization Of Phylogenetic Trees, Automated Workflow For Efficient Analysis
General Tags: Phylogenetic Analysis, Bioinformatics, Evolutionary Biology, Phylogenomics, Sequence Alignment
AI Description: PhyloSuite is a comprehensive and user-friendly phylogenetic analysis toolkit that integrates multiple bioinformatics tools for data preparation, alignment, model selection, phylogeny estimation, tree visualization, and more. It aims to streamline the phylogenomic workflow and provide a one-stop solution for researchers working in the field of evolutionary biology and phylogenetics.

Software Description:
TeNPy (short for ‘Tensor Network Python’) is a Python library for the simulation of strongly correlated quantum systems with tensor networks. 
Description Source: https://pypi.org/project/physics-tenpy/

Picard is a set of command line tools for manipulating high-throughput sequencing (HTS) data and formats such as SAM/BAM/CRAM and VCF. These file formats are defined in the Hts-specs repository. See especially the SAM specification and the VCF specification. 
Description Source: https://broadinstitute.github.io/picard/
Core Features:
1. Processing and manipulation of HTS data
2. Quality control and metrics generation
3. Data format conversion and manipulation
4. Read group and sample information handling
5. Sequence dictionary operations
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Ngs, Hts, Sequencing Data, Sam, Bam, Vcf
AI Description: Picard is a set of command line tools for manipulating high-throughput sequencing (HTS) data and formats such as SAM/BAM/CRAM and VCF. It is primarily used for processing and analyzing next-generation sequencing (NGS) data in genomics.

Software Description: Picrust2 is a software for predicting functional abundances based only on marker gene sequences.
Core Features: Metagenome Functional Content Prediction, Marker Gene Surveys Analysis, Evolutionary Modeling For Gene Content Prediction, Metabolic Potential Inference For Microbial Communities
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Metagenomics, Microbiome Analysis, Functional Gene Prediction
AI Description: PICRUSt2 (Phylogenetic Investigation of Communities by Reconstruction of Unobserved States 2) is a software package designed for predicting metagenome functional content from marker gene surveys of microbial communities. It leverages evolutionary modeling to predict the gene content of microbial taxa in a community and their metabolic potentials.

Software Description:
pigz, which stands for parallel implementation of gzip, is a fully functional replacement for gzip that exploits multiple processors and multiple cores to the hilt when compressing data. pigz was written by Mark Adler, and uses the zlib and pthread libraries. 
Description Source: https://zlib.net/pigz/
Core Features: Parallel Compression Using Multiple Processors/Cores, High Compression/Decompression Speed, Integration With Gzip & Gunzip Utilities, Multi-Threading Support
General Tags: Compression, Parallel Processing, Utility, Command-Line Tool
AI Description: pigz, which stands for parallel implementation of gzip, is a compression utility that uses multiple processors and cores to compress files quickly and efficiently. It is compatible with gzip and gunzip, allowing for seamless integration with existing gzip workflows.

Research Field: Computer & Information Sciences, Software Engineering, Systems, & Development
Software Description: Pillow is a Python Imaging Library (PIL) fork that provides extensive image processing capabilities in Python. It allows users to create, open, manipulate, and save various image file formats, making it a versatile tool for image editing, processing, and enhancement.
Core Features:
1. Image processing and manipulation
2. Image file format support
3. Basic drawing and graphics operations
4. Color manipulation
5. Image enhancement
6. Image filtering
7. Image transformations
General Tags: Image Processing, Python Library
AI Description: Pillow is a powerful Python Imaging Library (PIL) replacement that adds image processing capabilities to your Python interpreter.

Software Description: Pillow is a Python Imaging Library (PIL) fork that provides extensive image processing capabilities in Python. It allows users to create, open, manipulate, and save various image file formats, making it a versatile tool for image editing, processing, and enhancement.
Core Features: Simd Support For Accelerated Image Processing, Enhanced Performance For Image Manipulation Tasks, Compatibility With Python Imaging Library (Pil) For Easy Transition
General Tags: Image Processing, Python Library, Optimization
AI Description: pillow-simd is an optimized fork of Python imaging library (PIL) with SIMD support, designed to enhance image processing capabilities with improved performance.

Software Description: Pilon is an automated genome assembly improvement and variant detection tool.
Core Features: Error Correction In Draft Assemblies, Utilizes Multiple Sources Of Information (E.G. Read Mapping, Alignments, & A Reference Genome), Automatic Implementation Of Corrections, Support For Various File Formats Such As Sam/Bam, Vcf, & Fasta
General Tags: Genome Assembly, Genomics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology
AI Description: Pilon is a software package that automates the improvement of draft assemblies of microbial genomes, using information from multiple sources to correct draft assemblies.

Software Description: Pindel is used to detect breakpoints of large deletions, medium sized insertions, inversions, tandem duplications and other structural variants at single-based resolution from next-gen sequence data.
Core Features:
1. Detects various types of structural variants such as insertions, deletions, duplications, inversions, and translocations.
2. Utilizes split-read and paired-end mapping information for accurate SV detection.
3. Supports various sequencing platforms including Illumina, SOLiD, 454, and Ion Torrent.
4. Provides visualization options for reported variants and breakpoints.
5. Allows customization for specific analysis requirements through various parameters.
General Tags: Structural Variant Detection, Sequencing Data Analysis
AI Description: Pindel is a comprehensive tool for the detection of structural variants (SVs) in mapped sequencing data.

Software Description: PM2 is an umbrella software suite for high-performance runtime systems. Modules may be installed and used together or separately.
Core Features: Efficient Parallel Input & Output Management, Optimization For High-Performance Computing Environments, Enhanced Io Performance For Large Datasets, Python Package For Easy Integration
General Tags: Python Library, Hpc Tool, Io Management
AI Description: Pioman is a Python package that provides tools for parallel input and output (IO) management. It aims to optimize IO performance in high-performance computing (HPC) environments by enabling efficient reading and writing of large datasets. Pioman is particularly useful for scientific simulations and data analysis workflows that involve heavy IO operations.

Software Description: Pirate is a pangenome analysis and threshold evaluation toolbox.
Core Features: Pirate allows users to deconstruct complex networks into smaller motifs and graphlet structures, providing insights into network properties such as connectivity, clustering, and centrality. It offers various algorithms for motif detection and analysis, as well as visualization tools to aid in the interpretation of network structures.
General Tags: Network Analysis, Complex Networks, Motif Detection, Graphlet Structures
AI Description: Pirate is a software tool for analyzing complex networks, specifically focusing on network motifs and graphlet structures. It is widely used in computational biology, bioinformatics, and social network analysis.

Software Description: piscem is a rust wrapper for a next-generation index + mapper tool (still currently written in C++17).

Pixman is a low-level software library for pixel manipulation, providing features such as image compositing and trapezoid rasterization. Important users of pixman are the cairo graphics library and the X server. 
Description Source: https://www.pixman.org/
Core Features:
1. Pixel manipulation operations
2. High-performance software acceleration for rendering
3. Supports various image formats and colorspaces
4. Portable and platform-independent
5. Used by projects requiring quality rendering such as X server and Cairo
General Tags: Pixel Manipulation, Rendering, Software Library, Performance
AI Description: Pixman is a low-level software library for pixel manipulation, providing software acceleration for numerous rendering operations. It is used primarily by projects requiring high-quality rendering such as the X server, Cairo, the GTK+ toolkit, and more.

Research Field: Computer & Information Sciences, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Systems, & Development
Software Description: pixy is a command-line tool for painlessly estimating average nucleotide diversity within (π) and between (dxy) populations from a VCF.
Core Features: Static Analysis Of C/C++ Source Code, Detection Of Security Vulnerabilities, Identification Of Potentially Unsafe Code Patterns, Integration With Build Systems For Continuous Analysis
General Tags: Static Analysis, Security, C/C++, Runtime Analysis
AI Description: Pixy is a runtime program analysis tool that detects vulnerabilities in software applications written in C or C++. It uses static analysis techniques to scan the source code and identify potential security issues.

Software Description:
pkg-config is a helper tool used when compiling applications and libraries. It helps you insert the correct compiler options on the command line so an application can use gcc -o test test.c `pkg-config --libs --cflags glib-2.0` for instance, rather than hard-coding values on where to find glib (or other libraries). It is language-agnostic, so it can be used for defining the location of documentation tools, for instance. 
Description Source: https://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/pkg-config/
Core Features:
1. Provides a way to query compiler and linker flags required for libraries.
2. Helps in determining the correct flags to use when compiling and linking against libraries.
3. Supports multiple libraries and their dependencies.
4. Simplifies the build process for developers by automating the retrieval of necessary information for the build environment.
General Tags: Compilation, Library Management, Build Process
AI Description: pkg-config is a helper tool used when compiling applications and libraries. It helps to manage compiler and linker flags for libraries in the system. It simplifies the process of compiling and linking against libraries.

Software Description:
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags for development frameworks. It is similar to pkg-config from freedesktop.org, providing additional functionality while also maintaining compatibility. 
Description Source: http://pkgconf.org/
Core Features:
1. Management of build and link flags
2. Provides a uniform and system-agnostic API
3. Replaces the functionality of pkg-config
4. Lightweight and efficient
5. Easy to use and integrate into the build process
General Tags: Package Configuration, Build Flags, Link Flags, System-Agnostic
AI Description: pkgconf is a package configuration system. It helps to provide a uniform and system-agnostic API for the management of build and link flags. It replaces the functionality of pkg-config.

Software Description:
pkgconfig is a Python module to interface with the pkg-config command line tool for Python 3.3+. It can be used to find all pkg-config packages, check if a package exists, check if a package meets certain version requirements, return the version, among other functionality. 
Description Source: https://github.com/matze/pkgconfig/tree/master
Core Features: Facilitates Specifying Compilation Options, Provides Compiler Options Needed To Use A Library, Offers Information About Installed Libraries
General Tags: Compilation, Library Management, Software Development
AI Description: pkg-config is a helper tool used when compiling applications and libraries. It helps in specifying compilation options by providing the compiler options needed to use a library. It also provides information about installed libraries.

Software Description: PlasmidFinder identifies plasmids in total or partial sequenced isolates of bacteria.
Core Features: In Silico Detection Of Plasmids, Identification Of Plasmid Replicon Sequences, Comparison To A Database Of Known Plasmids
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Genomics, Microbiology, Bacterial Genomics, Plasmid Detection
AI Description: PlasmidFinder is a tool for in silico detection of plasmids in bacterial genomes. It identifies plasmid replicon sequences by comparing input DNA sequences to a predefined database of known plasmids.

Software Description: Platon: identification and characterization of bacterial plasmid contigs from short-read draft assemblies
Core Features: Platon offers functionalities for crystal structure visualization, analysis, and validation. It assists in the building and refinement of molecular structures, as well as in the interpretation of structural data. The software also aids in the identification of structural features, symmetry operations, and hydrogen bonding patterns. Platon includes tools for generating publication-ready graphics and reports.
General Tags: Crystallography, Structure Determination, X-Ray Diffraction
AI Description: Platon is a versatile software package used for crystallography. It can be employed for structure determination of small molecules from single crystal X-ray diffraction data.

Software Description: Platypus-variant is a tool designed for efficient and accurate variant-detection in high-throughput sequencing data.
Core Features: Platypus offers high sensitivity and specificity in variant calling, supports positional quality scores, supports multi-sample calling, integrates with SAM/BAM and VCF formats, enables rapid analysis of genetic variations, and provides visualization tools for analyzing variants.
General Tags: Variant Detection, Sequencing, Bioinformatics
AI Description: Platypus is a highly flexible variant detection and visualization software for short-read sequencing. It is particularly designed for calling single nucleotide variants (SNVs), small insertions and deletions (indels), and larger deletions from mapped short-read data.

Software Description:
PLINK is a free, open-source whole genome association analysis toolset, designed to perform a range of basic, large-scale analyses in a computationally efficient manner. 
Description Source: https://zzz.bwh.harvard.edu/plink/
Core Features: Quality Control Of Genotypic Data, Data Management & Manipulation, Statistical Analysis For Association Studies, Batch Processing Capabilities
General Tags: Genetic Analysis, Genomic Data Analysis, Gwas, Genetic Epidemiology
AI Description: PLINK (whole-genome association analysis toolset) is an open-source whole genome association analysis toolset designed to perform a range of basic, large-scale analyses in a computationally efficient manner. It enables users to carry out a variety of tasks, such as quality control, data management, and statistical analysis of genotypic data.

Software Description: Plink2 is a whole genome association analysis toolset.
Core Features:
1. Quality control of genotype data
2. Data management
3. Powerful association analysis methods
4. Population stratification analysis
5. LD-based clumping procedures
6. Support for quantitative phenotypes
7. Support for gene-gene interaction testing
General Tags: Genomics, Association Analysis, Genotype-Phenotype Data

Software Description:
The Process Management Interface (PMI) has been used for quite some time as a means of exchanging wireup information needed for inter-process communication. Two versions (PMI-1 and PMI-2) have been released as part of the MPICH effort, with PMI-2 demonstrating better scaling properties than its PMI-1 predecessor. 
Description Source: https://pmix.github.io/standard
Core Features:
1. Process management and coordination
2. Data exchange amongst parallel processes
3. Resource management
4. Scalability and performance optimization
General Tags: Process Management, Parallel Computing, High-Performance Computing, Data Exchange, Resource Management, Scalability
AI Description: The Process Management Interface (PMIx) is an abstract interface for managing the data and resources associated with managing parallel processes. It provides a framework and services for coordinating data exchange and interaction amongst parallel processes in high-performance computing environments.

Software Description:
PnetCDF is a high-performance parallel I/O library for accessing Unidata's NetCDF, files in classic formats, specifically the formats of CDF-1, 2, and 5. CDF-1 is the default NetCDF classic format. CDF-2 is an extended format created through using flag NC_64BIT_OFFSET to support 64-bit file offsets. The CDF-5 file format, an extension of CDF-2 and created through using flag NC_64BIT_DATA, supports unsigned data types and uses 64-bit integers to allow users to define large dimensions, attributes, and variables (> 2B array elements). 
Description Source: https://parallel-netcdf.github.io/
Core Features: 1. Support for parallel I/O operations on NetCDF files. 2. High scalability for large-scale scientific computing applications. 3. Improved I/O performance for reading and writing NetCDF files in parallel. 4. Integration with parallel environments such as MPI for distributed computing.
General Tags: Parallel I/O, Netcdf Files, Scalability, Performance
AI Description: PnetCDF is a parallel I/O library for accessing NetCDF files in parallel. It is specifically designed to address the scalability and performance limitations of serial NetCDF I/O by providing parallel I/O support.

Software Description:
PoCL is a portable open source (MIT-licensed) implementation of the OpenCL standard. Description Source: http://portablecl.org/
Core Features: Opencl Standard Implementation, Supports Cpus, Gpus, & Fpgas, Portability Across Different Hardware Architectures, Parallel Programming Support
General Tags: Opencl, Parallel Computing, Hardware Acceleration

It enables developers to write parallel programs that can be executed efficiently across different hardware platforms.

Software Description:
pybind11 is a lightweight header-only library that exposes C++ types in Python and vice versa, mainly to create Python bindings of existing C++ code. Its goals and syntax are similar to the excellent Boost.Python library by David Abrahams: to minimize boilerplate code in traditional extension modules by inferring type information using compile-time introspection. 
Description Source: https://github.com/pybind/pybind11
Core Features: 1. Efficient inter-process communication between C++ and Python. 2. Direct access to C++ data structures and functions in Python. 3. Simplified interface for exposing C++ code to Python by binding native types, functions, and classes. 4. Support for various Python versions including 2.7 and 3.x.
General Tags: Software Development, Python Library, C++ Integration, Header-Only Library
AI Description: pybind11 is a lightweight header-only library that exposes C++ types in Python and vice versa, mainly to create Python bindings for C++ libraries. It provides seamless interoperability between C++11 and Python without the need for boilerplate code or external tools.

Software Description:
Pycairo is a Python module providing bindings for the cairo graphics library. It depends on cairo >= 1.15.10 and works with Python 3.8+ and PyPy3. Pycairo, including this documentation, is licensed under the LGPL-2.1-only OR MPL-1.1. 
Description Source: https://pycairo.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
Core Features:
1. Integration with Python: Pycairo provides seamless integration with Python, allowing developers to easily leverage the advanced graphics capabilities of Cairo within Python applications.
2. 2D Vector Graphics: Users can create high-quality 2D vector graphics and illustrations using Pycairo, enabling the development of visually appealing charts, diagrams, and UI elements.
3. Extensive Drawing Capabilities: The library offers a wide range of drawing capabilities, including paths, text, images, and transformations, giving developers the flexibility to create complex and detailed graphics.
4. Cross-Platform Support: Pycairo supports multiple platforms, including Windows, macOS, and various Unix-based operating systems, ensuring portability across different environments.
General Tags: Python, Graphics, 2D Graphics, Illustrations
AI Description: Pycairo is a set of Python bindings for the Cairo graphics library. It allows Python applications to use the powerful vector graphics capabilities provided by Cairo for creating high-quality 2D graphics and illustrations.

Core Features:

Software Description: Pyranges are collections of intervals that support comparison operations (like overlap and intersect) and other methods that are useful for genomic analyses.
Core Features: Key features include creating, manipulating, and analyzing genomic intervals, performing set operations such as intersection, union, difference, and complement on ranges, supporting both one-dimensional and two-dimensional ranges, integrating with pandas DataFrames, enabling fast and memory-efficient operations on large datasets, and providing a user-friendly API for genomic data processing.

AI Description: PyRanges is a Python library for working with genomic ranges. It provides an efficient and intuitive way to manipulate genomic intervals and perform set operations on them.

Pyro-API simplifies the process of building and training probabilistic models using Pyro by providing an intuitive and high-level API.

Software Description:
Pysam is a Python package for reading, manipulating, and writing genomics data such as SAM/BAM/CRAM and VCF/BCF files. It's a lightweight wrapper of the HTSlib API, the same one that powers samtools, bcftools, and tabix. 
Description Source: https://github.com/pysam-developers/pysam
Core Features: Read & Write Sam/Bam Files, Manipulate Read Alignments, Analyze Sequence Data, Integration With Samtools Utilities
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Analysis, Sam/Bam Files, Python Module
AI Description: Pysam is a Python module that provides access to read, write, manipulate, and analyze SAM/BAM files used in bioinformatics. It allows seamless integration of SAMtools, a set of utilities for interacting with and post-processing short DNA sequence read alignments in SAM, BAM, or CRAM format.

Core Features:
1. Partial-order alignment (POA) for accurate sequence alignment.
2. Divide-and-conquer strategy for efficient alignment.
3. Compatible with long read sequences.
4. Python library for ease of integration and usage in bioinformatics workflows.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Alignment, Partial-Order Alignment, Python Library
AI Description: PySpoa is a Python library for partial-order alignment (POA) that provides tools for performing accurate sequence alignment. Based on a divide-and-conquer strategy, PySpoa efficiently aligns sequences without global constraint and is especially useful for long read sequences in bioinformatics applications.

Core Features:

3. Access to a wide range of statistical algorithms for Bayesian analysis. 
4. Integration with Python for data manipulation and visualization.
General Tags: Bayesian Statistics, Probabilistic Programming, Mcmc Methods, Statistical Inference
AI Description: PyStan is the Python interface for Stan, a probabilistic programming language for Bayesian statistical inference. PyStan allows users to define Bayesian models in Stan language and perform Bayesian analysis using Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) methods.

Software Description: Optimizing compiler for evaluating mathematical expressions on CPUs and GPUs
Core Features: Efficient Tensor Operations, Support For Multi-Dimensional Arrays, Tensor Decomposition & Factorization Methods, Integration With Other Python Scientific Computing Libraries
General Tags: Python Library, Tensor Operations, Scientific Computing
AI Description: PyTensor is a Python library for tensor operations and computations. It provides a high-level interface for handling multi-dimensional arrays and performing various tensor manipulations.

Software Description:
Python-tesseract is an optical character recognition (OCR) tool for python. That is, it will recognize and “read” the text embedded in images. Python-tesseract is a wrapper for Google’s Tesseract-OCR Engine. It is also useful as a stand-alone invocation script to tesseract, as it can read all image types supported by the Pillow and Leptonica imaging libraries, including jpeg, png, gif, bmp, tiff, and others. 
Description Source: https://pypi.org/project/pytesseract/
Core Features: Optical Character Recognition (Ocr), Simple Python Integration, Supports Multiple Languages
General Tags: Ocr, Text Recognition, Image Processing
AI Description: Pytesseract is a Python wrapper for Google's Tesseract-OCR Engine. It allows for easy integration of Tesseract OCR functionality in Python scripts.

Software Description:
The pytest framework makes it easy to write small, readable tests, and can scale to support complex functional testing for applications and libraries. 
Description Source: https://docs.pytest.org/en/8.0.x/
Core Features: Support For Fixtures, Parameterized Testing, Support For Test Discovery, Detailed Test Reports, Plugin Architecture For Extensibility
General Tags: Testing, Python, Framework
AI Description: Pytest is a testing framework that makes it easy to write simple and scalable tests in Python. It is a popular testing framework used for testing Python programs and libraries.

Software Description: Runs tests multiple times to expose flakiness.
Core Features: Detection Of Flaky Tests, Running Tests Multiple Times, Analysis Of Test Results
General Tags: Pytest Plugin, Test Automation, Flaky Test Detection
AI Description: pytest-flakefinder is a Pytest plugin that helps in detecting flaky tests by running them multiple times and analyzing the results. It identifies tests that fail intermittently due to non-deterministic behavior.

Software Description: pytest plugin to re-run tests to eliminate flaky failures.
Core Features: Automatic Rerun Of Failed Test Cases, Enhanced Test Reliability, Customizable Rerun Settings
General Tags: Software Testing, Python Libraries, Programming Tools
AI Description: pytest-rerunfailures is a plugin for the pytest testing framework that automatically reruns failed test cases to improve test reliability.

Software Description: pytest plugin to support parallelism across multiple machines. Shards tests based on a hash of their test name enabling easy parallelism across machines, suitable for a wide variety of continuous integration services. Tests are split at the finest level of granularity, individual test cases, enabling parallelism even if all of your tests are in a single file (or even single parameterized test method).
Core Features: Parallel Test Execution, Distributed Test Load Across Multiple Workers, Improved Test Run Performance
General Tags: Pytest, Testing, Parallelization
AI Description: pytest-shard is a pytest plugin that allows test execution to be split across multiple workers for faster test runs. It enables parallel test execution by distributing the test load among several processes.

Software Description:
The pytest-xdist plugin extends pytest with new test execution modes, the most used being distributing tests across multiple CPUs to speed up test execution. 
Description Source: https://pypi.org/project/pytest-xdist/
Core Features: Parallel Test Execution, Distributed Testing, Load Balancing For Tests, Support For Running Tests Across Multiple Cpus/Machines
General Tags: Pytest, Testing, Distributed Computing, Parallel Execution
AI Description: pytest-xdist is a plugin for pytest that extends it with distributed testing capabilities. It allows for parallel execution of tests across multiple CPUs on the same machine or multiple machines, potentially reducing the overall test suite execution time.

Software Description:
PYTHIA is a program for the generation of high-energy physics collision events, i.e. for the description of collisions at high energies between electrons, protons, photons and heavy nuclei. It contains theory and models for a number of physics aspects, including hard and soft interactions, parton distributions, initial- and final-state parton showers, multiparton interactions, fragmentation and decay. It is largely based on original research, but also borrows many formulae and other knowledge from the literature. As such it is categorized as a general-purpose Monte Carlo event generator. 
Description Source: https://pythia.org/
Core Features: Event generation for high-energy collisions, implementation of hard scattering models, simulation of hadron collisions.
General Tags: Event Generation, High-Energy Collisions, Theoretical Physics, Particle Physics
AI Description: Pythia is a software package for event generation for high-energy collisions, implementing a number of hard scattering models for hadron collisions. It is commonly used in theoretical physics and high-energy physics research.

Software Description:
Python is an interpreted, interactive, object-oriented programming language. It incorporates modules, exceptions, dynamic typing, very high level dynamic data types, and classes. It supports multiple programming paradigms beyond object-oriented programming, such as procedural and functional programming. Python combines remarkable power with very clear syntax. It has interfaces to many system calls and libraries, as well as to various window systems, and is extensible in C or C++. It is also usable as an extension language for applications that need a programmable interface. Finally, Python is portable: it runs on many Unix variants including Linux and macOS, and on Windows. 
Description Source: https://docs.python.org/3/faq/general.html#what-is-python
Core Features:
1. Easy-to-learn syntax
2. Interpreted nature
3. Dynamic typing
4. Extensive standard library
5. Supports object-oriented, imperative, functional, and procedural programming
6. Cross-platform compatibility
7. Large community support
8. Extensible and customizable
9. Used for web development, data analysis, artificial intelligence, automation, and more.
General Tags: Programming Language, Interpreted Language, High-Level Language

Software Description: Taking a hint from the similarly-named Java Cryptography Architecture, QCA aims to provide a straightforward and cross-platform crypto API, using Qt datatypes and conventions. QCA separates the API from the implementation, using plugins known as Providers. The advantage of this model is to allow applications to avoid linking to or explicitly depending on any particular cryptographic library. This allows one to easily change or upgrade crypto implementations without even needing to recompile the application! QCA should work everywhere Qt does, including Windows/Unix/MacOSX.
Core Features:
1. Boolean minimization: QCA uses Boolean algebra to reduce complex data sets into simpler forms for analysis.
2. Truth tables and logical operations: It generates truth tables to represent the relationships between variables and performs logical operations on them.
3. Consistency and coverage analysis: QCA evaluates the consistency and coverage of configurations of conditions related to outcomes.
4. Calibration and fuzzy set analysis: It allows for fuzzy set analysis to account for cases where conditions are not strictly present or absent.
5. Interpretation and visualization: QCA provides tools for interpreting results and visualizing complex relationships between variables.
General Tags: Qualitative Data Analysis, Comparative Analysis, Social Sciences
AI Description: QCA (Qualitative Comparative Analysis) is a comparative analytical method primarily used in the social sciences to analyze data sets involving categorical variables. It is a method for studying the relationships between the presence and absence of conditions and an outcome of interest.

Core Features: Code & Categorize Qualitative Data, Organize & Manage Qualitative Data, Analyze Qualitative Data For Patterns & Themes, Visualize & Present Qualitative Data Results
General Tags: Qualitative Data Analysis, Data Management, Research Tool
AI Description: QCAT is a software tool for managing and analyzing qualitative data. It is specifically designed to assist researchers in the coding, categorizing, and organizing of qualitative data such as text, images, audio, and video files.

Q-Chem is an ab initio quantum chemistry software package for fast and accurate simulations of molecular systems, including electronic and molecular structure, reactivities, properties, and structure. 
Description Source: https://www.q-chem.com/

QD is a double-double and quad-double package for Fortran and C++. It includes numeric types of twice the precision of the IEEE double (32 digits), and four times the precision of the IEEE double (64 digits), along with basic arithemtic operations and common transcendental functions. 
Description Source: https://github.com/highprecision/QD/blob/main/README
Core Features:
1. Arithmetic operations with quaternions and dual numbers
2. Calculus operations such as differentiation and integration
3. Linear algebra operations
4. High performance computing capabilities
General Tags: Library, Numerical Computation, Quaternions, Dual Numbers

Quantum ESPRESSO is an integrated suite of Open-Source computer codes for electronic-structure calculations and materials modeling at the nanoscale. It is based on density-functional theory, plane waves, and pseudopotentials. 
Description Source: https://www.quantum-espresso.org/

QEMU is a generic and open source machine emulator and virtualizer. 
Description Source: https://www.qemu.org/
Core Features: Full System Emulation, Virtualization Support, Dynamic Translation, User-Mode Emulation, Snapshots, Live Migration
General Tags: Virtualization, Emulation, System Development
AI Description: QEMU is a generic and open-source machine emulator and virtualizer that supports executing different operating systems and programs on a host operating system. It provides full system simulation, allowing users to run virtual machines with various architectures (x86, ARM, PowerPC, etc.) on a wide range of host platforms. QEMU can be used for various purposes such as development, testing, debugging, and virtualization.

AI Description: QGIS is a free and open-source cross-platform desktop geographic information system (GIS) application that supports viewing, editing, and analysis of geospatial data.

Software Description:
Qhull computes the convex hull, Delaunay triangulation, Voronoi diagram, halfspace intersection about a point, furthest-site Delaunay triangulation, and furthest-site Voronoi diagram. The source code runs in 2-d, 3-d, 4-d, and higher dimensions. Qhull implements the Quickhull algorithm for computing the convex hull. It handles roundoff errors from floating point arithmetic. It computes volumes, surface areas, and approximations to the convex hull. 
Description Source: http://www.qhull.org/
Core Features: 1. Computes convex hulls, Delaunay triangulations, and Voronoi diagrams. 2. Supports point location, mesh generation, intersection, and distance queries. 3. Runs in 2D, 3D, 4D, and higher dimensions. 4. Interfaces with other libraries and visualization tools.
General Tags: Computational Geometry, Libraries, Mesh Generation, Geometry Processing
AI Description: Qhull computes the convex hull, Delaunay triangulation, Voronoi diagram, halfspace intersection about a point, furthest-site Delaunay triangulation, and furthest-site Voronoi diagram.

General Tags: Quantum Mechanics, Computational Physics, Atomic Physics, Molecular Physics
AI Description: R-Matrix is a widely used computational method for solving the Schroedinger's equation in quantum mechanics, particularly in atomic and molecular physics. It is based on the R-matrix theory which divides space into two regions and the wave function into inner and outer regions, allowing the solution of the wave function to be determined separately in each region and then matched at the boundary. This method is commonly used to study electron-ion collisions, atomic photoionization, and other atomic and molecular processes.

AI Description: The r-utf8 package in R provides support for handling UTF-8 character strings, enabling users to efficiently manipulate and process Unicode text data. It offers functions for encoding, decoding, and working with UTF-8 encoded strings, making it easier to work with multilingual text.

Core Features:
1. Includes color palettes that are perceptually uniform and friendly to colorblind individuals.
2. Allows users to easily apply these palettes to their visualizations in R.
3. Provides a range of options for selecting the most suitable color scale for different types of data.
General Tags: Data Visualization, Color Palettes, R Package
AI Description: The R package, viridis, provides a collection of color palettes for R and aims to improve data visualization by providing visually pleasing and colorblind-friendly color scales.

Core Features: Implementation Of Viridis Color Scales For Ggplot2, Perceptually Uniform Color Scales, Colorblind Friendly Palettes, Suitable For Scientific Plots & Visualizations
General Tags: R Package, Color Scales, Data Visualization, Scientific Plots
AI Description: r-viridislite is an R package that provides the 'viridisLite' color scales for the 'ggplot2' package. The package offers color scales that are perceptually uniform, colorblind friendly, and suitable for displaying data in scientific plots and visualizations.

Core Features: Managing R Options Effectively, Facilitating Working Directory Management, Simplifying Resource Manipulation Tasks, Enhancing Coding Workflow In R
General Tags: R Programming, Programming Utilities, Workflow Management
AI Description: The r-withr package is designed to simplify various coding tasks in R by providing utilities for managing R options, working directories, and various resources with ease. It aims to enhance the workflow and efficiency of R programming by offering convenient functions for common operations.

Core Features:
1. File operations: Functions for file manipulation, file organization, and file system interaction.
2. String operations: Tools for string manipulation, formatting, and regular expression handling.
3. List operations: Functions for working with lists, list processing, and list management.
4. Data operations: Utilities for data manipulation, data transformation, and data processing tasks.
5. Miscellaneous functions: Assorted functions for diverse tasks such as text formatting, path handling, and environment management.
General Tags: R Package, Data Manipulation, Utility Functions
AI Description: The r-xfun package is a collection of miscellaneous functions to assist and facilitate various tasks in R programming. It provides a set of utility functions to streamline workflows, enhance productivity, and simplify common programming operations in R.

Core Features:
1. Parsing XML documents to data structures in R.
2. Generation of XML documents from R data structures.
3. Manipulation and transformation of XML data within R.
4. XPath querying support for XML data.
5. Integration with other R packages for data analysis and visualization.
General Tags: R Package, Xml Parser, Data Transformation
AI Description: The r-xml package in R provides tools for parsing and generating XML within the R environment.

Core Features:
1. Parsing of XML and HTML documents.
2. Extraction and manipulation of data from XML/HTML structures.
3. Support for XPath queries.
4. Seamless integration with R environment for data analysis and manipulation.
General Tags: R Package, Xml Parsing, Html Parsing
AI Description: R package providing easy-to-use and efficient XML and HTML parsing capabilities in R.

Core Features:
1. Exporting data frames or matrices to LaTeX and HTML tables
2. Customizing table appearance and formatting
3. Support for adding captions and footnotes
4. Integration with R Markdown for seamless table generation
5. Compatibility with various LaTeX packages for advanced table features
General Tags: R Package, Data Visualization, Table Generation
AI Description: The r-xtable package in R provides an interface for exporting data frames or matrices to LaTeX and HTML tables. It allows users to easily create publication-quality tables for use in research papers, reports, or presentations.

Core Features:
1. Efficient and compact storage of sequence data
2. Optimized operations for large-scale genomic data
3. Support for DNA and RNA sequences
4. Memory-efficient data structure
5. Integrated functionality for sequence manipulation and analysis
General Tags: R Package, Genomic Data, Sequence Analysis
AI Description: r-xvector is an R package that provides a compact and efficient data structure for storing sequences, generally DNA and RNA, with a focus on memory efficiency and a range of operations optimized for large-scale genomic data.

Core Features: Convert R data to YAML format and vice versa, support for pretty-printing YAML output, integration with R environment for seamless data conversion.
General Tags: R Package, Data Conversion, Yaml
AI Description: r-yaml is an R package that provides methods to convert R data to YAML (YAML Ain't Markup Language) and back.

Core Features: Simple & Elegant Variable Assignment, Unpacking Multiple Values From Objects In A Single Statement, Improved Code Readability
General Tags: R Package, Variable Assignment, Code Readability
AI Description: The r-zeallot package in R is designed for elegant variable assignment in R. It allows for unpacking multiple values from objects in a single statement, thus simplifying coding and improving readability.

Core Features: 1. Provides an R interface to zlib, a software library used for data compression. 2. Integrates functionality for handling zlib within BioConductor workflows. 3. Supports various compression and decompression operations.
General Tags: R Package, Bioinformatics, Data Compression
AI Description: r-zlibbioc is an R interface to zlib and a BioConductor package for handling zlib.

Software Description: Racon is consensus module for raw de novo DNA assembly of long uncorrected reads.
Core Features: Error Correction For Long Reads, Utilizes Partially Ordered De Bruijn Graph, Fuzzy Pairwise Aligner For Correction, High Accuracy Correction
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Analysis, Genomics
AI Description: Racon is a consensus module for correcting errors in long reads generated by third-generation sequencing technologies. It utilizes both a partially ordered de Bruijn graph and a fuzzy pairwise aligner to achieve high accuracy error correction.

Core Features: Ragel allows users to define state machines using a concise and readable syntax, supports various output formats such as C, C++, and Java, offers features for specifying actions associated with state transitions, and provides optimization options for generating high-performance code.
General Tags: State Machine Compiler, Domain-Specific Language, Code Generation, Parsing, Compilers
AI Description: Ragel is a domain-specific language and state machine compiler used for creating efficient state machine code in various programming languages. It can be employed for parsing, scanning, and code generation tasks.

Software Description: Ragout is a tool for chromosome-level scaffolding using multiple references.
Core Features: Reference-Assisted Genome Assembly, Reconstruction Of Genomic Sequences, Utilizes A Reference Genome & Related Genomes
General Tags: Genome Assembly, Genomic Analysis, Bioinformatics
AI Description: Ragout is a reference-assisted assembly tool that reconstructs a set of genomic sequences using a reference genome and a set of related genomes.

Software Description: Ragtag is a tool for fast reference-guided genome assembly scaffolding.
Core Features: Scaffolding Assemblies To A Reference Genome, Polishing Assemblies Using Reference Genomes, Detecting & Correcting Misassemblies In Genome Assemblies, Evaluating The Quality Of Genome Assemblies
General Tags: Assembly Improvement, Genome Alignment, Assembly Evaluation
AI Description: RagTag is a software tool designed to scaffold, polish, and evaluate assemblies by aligning them to reference genomes. It is particularly useful for improving the quality of genome assemblies and identifying misassemblies.

Core Features:
1. Predicts RNA secondary structure ensemble
2. Statistical sampling approach
3. Generates structures consistent with input sequence
General Tags: Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, RNA Secondary Structure Prediction
AI Description: Randfold is a computational tool for predicting the thermodynamic ensemble of RNA secondary structures. It uses a statistical sampling approach to generate an ensemble of structures consistent with the input sequence.

Software Description:
RapidJSON is a fast JSON parser/generator for C++ with both SAX/DOM style API. 
Description Source: https://github.com/Tencent/rapidjson/
Core Features: Fast Parsing & Generation Of Json Data, Support For Both Sax & Dom Parsing Styles, Memory Efficient Design, No External Dependencies, Conforms To Json Standards, Utf-8 Encoding Support
General Tags: Json, C++, Parser, Generator, Sax, Dom, Memory Efficient
AI Description: RapidJSON is a fast JSON parser and generator for C++ with both SAX/DOM styles. It is designed to be highly memory efficient and is self-contained with no external dependencies.

Software Description:
RAPIDS is a collection of open source software libraries and APIs that gives you the ability to execute end-to-end data science and analytics pipelines entirely on NVIDIA GPUs using familiar PyData APIs. 
Description Source: https://rapids.ai/learn-more/#about
Core Features: 1. Accelerated data preprocessing, feature engineering, machine learning, and graph analytics. 2. Integration with popular data science and machine learning tools like scikit-learn, XGBoost, and Dask. 3. Support for multi-GPU deployment. 4. Seamless integration with Apache Arrow for efficient data interchange.
General Tags: Data Science, Analytics, Gpu Computing
AI Description: RAPIDS is a suite of open-source software libraries and APIs built on NVIDIA CUDA for executing end-to-end data science and analytics pipelines entirely on GPUs. It allows for faster processing and analysis of big data.

Software Description:
RAPIDS is a collection of open source software libraries and APIs that gives you the ability to execute end-to-end data science and analytics pipelines entirely on NVIDIA GPUs using familiar PyData APIs. 
Description Source: https://rapids.ai/learn-more/#about
RapMap is a testing ground for ideas in quasi-mapping and selective alignment.
Core Features:
1. Pseudoalignment-based mapping for fast mapping speeds.
2. Achieves high sensitivity and specificity in RNA-seq read mapping.
3. Supports various input formats such as FASTQ and FASTA.
4. Provides a user-friendly interface for easy execution and result interpretation.
General Tags: RNA-Seq, Read Mapping, Transcript Mapping
AI Description: RapMap is a fast and accurate software for mapping RNA-seq reads to reference transcripts. It leverages pseudoalignment-based mapping to achieve high mapping speeds while maintaining high sensitivity and specificity.

Core Features: Read & Write Geospatial Raster Datasets, Access Metadata & Geospatial Information Of Raster Datasets, Manipulate Raster Data Through Various Functions & Operations, Integration With Other Geospatial Libraries & Tools
General Tags: Python Library, Geospatial Data, Raster Data, Gdal, Remote Sensing
AI Description: Rasterio is a Python library for reading and writing geospatial raster datasets. It is built on the capabilities of the GDAL (Geospatial Data Abstraction Library) and provides easy access to the functionalities for opening, reading, and writing geospatial raster data formats.

Software Description: Rasusa: Randomly subsample sequencing reads to a specified coverage.
Core Features: Generation Of Random Subsamples From Sequencing Data, Creation Of Statistically Independent Subsets Of Reads, Quality Control Of Raw Sequencing Data
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Sequence Analysis, Quality Control
AI Description: Rasusa (Random Subsample) is a tool for generating random subsamples from sequencing data. It allows users to create statistically independent subsets of reads from raw data for downstream analysis and quality control.

Software Description: Raven-assembler is a de novo genome assembler for long uncorrected reads.

RAxML-NG is a phylogenetic tree inference tool which uses maximum-likelihood (ML) optimality criterion. Its search heuristic is based on iteratively performing a series of Subtree Pruning and Regrafting (SPR) moves, which allows to quickly navigate to the best-known ML tree. 
Description Source: https://github.com/amkozlov/raxml-ng
Core Features:
1. Fast and efficient computation of maximum likelihood phylogenetic trees
2. Uses a rapid bootstrap algorithm for rapid analysis of large datasets
3. Supports a wide range of substitution models and phylogenetic models
4. Can handle both nucleotide and amino acid sequence data
5. Provides options for branch length optimization, among other tree features
General Tags: Phylogenetics, Evolutionary Biology, Bioinformatics
AI Description: RAxML (Randomized Axelerated Maximum Likelihood) is a software for phylogenetic analysis and inference of evolutionary trees. It is widely used for maximum likelihood-based phylogenetic tree estimation.

Software Description: Raxml-ng is a phylogenetic tree inference tool which uses maximum-likelihood (ML) optimality criterion.
Core Features:
1. Fast and efficient maximum likelihood phylogenetic tree estimation.
2. Supports multiple substitution models, rate heterogeneity, and partitioned models.
3. Parallel processing capabilities for high-performance computing.
4. Handles large datasets with thousands of sequences.
5. Incorporates advanced algorithms for rapid tree search and bootstrapping.
General Tags: Phylogenetics, Evolutionary Biology, Bioinformatics
AI Description: RAxML-NG (RAxML Next Generation) is a fast and accurate phylogenetic inference tool that implements maximum likelihood methods for large-scale phylogenetic tree estimation. It is designed to efficiently analyze large datasets with thousands of taxa and can handle diverse types of evolutionary models.

Software Description: Ray is a fast and simple framework for building and running distributed applications.

Rclone is a command-line program to manage files on cloud storage. It is a feature-rich alternative to cloud vendors' web storage interfaces. Over 70 cloud storage products support rclone including S3 object stores, business & consumer file storage services, as well as standard transfer protocols. 
Description Source: https://rclone.org/
Core Features: Rclone offers features such as file synchronization, file transfer, and file management across multiple cloud storage services. It supports a wide range of cloud storage providers including Google Drive, Amazon S3, Dropbox, Microsoft OneDrive, and more. It also provides encryption, bandwidth control, and checksum verification capabilities.
General Tags: Cloud Storage, File Synchronization, Command-Line Tool
AI Description: Rclone is a command-line program to manage files on cloud storage. It is a powerful tool that supports various cloud storage services and allows users to sync files between different storage locations.

Software Description:
RDFLib is a Python library for working with RDF, a simple yet powerful language for representing information. 
Description Source: https://github.com/RDFLib/rdflib
Core Features: Creating Rdf Graphs, Parsing Rdf Data, Modifying Rdf Graphs, Serializing Rdf Data, Querying Rdf Graphs
General Tags: Rdf, Python Library
AI Description: RDFLib is a Python library for working with RDF (Resource Description Framework) data. It allows users to create, parse, modify, serialize, and query RDF graphs.

Software Description:
RDKit is a collection of cheminformatics and machine-learning software written in C++ and Python. 
Description Source: https://github.com/rdkit/rdkit
Core Features: Some core features of RDKit include molecular fingerprinting, substructure searching, chemical similarity calculations, molecular property prediction, molecular similarity clustering, chemical reaction handling, 2D and 3D molecular visualization, and descriptor calculation.
General Tags: Cheminformatics, Molecular Modeling, Cheminformatics Toolkit
AI Description: RDKit is an open-source toolkit for cheminformatics that provides a wide range of functionality for cheminformatics, including molecular modeling, cheminformatics, and machine learning tools.

Software Description:
RE2 is a fast, safe, thread-friendly alternative to backtracking regular expression engines like those used in PCRE, Perl, and Python. It is a C++ library. 
Description Source: https://github.com/google/re2
Core Features: High-Performance Regular Expression Library, Thread-Friendly & Safe, Efficient & Scalable, Optimized Using Automata Theory For Linear-Time Matching Algorithms
General Tags: Regular Expression, Library, Performance, Thread-Safe
AI Description: RE2 is a fast, safe, thread-friendly, and efficient regular expression library. It provides better performance than many widely used regular expression libraries by using automata theory, generating linear-time matching algorithms.

Software Description:
re2c is a free and open-source lexer generator for C/C++, Go and Rust with a focus on generating fast code. It compiles regular expression specifications to deterministic finite automata and encodes them in the form of conditional jumps in the target language. This approach is generally faster than table-based lexers, and the generated code is easier to debug and understand. 
Description Source: https://re2c.org/
Core Features: Efficient Generation Of Lexer/Scanner Programs, Translation Of Regular Expressions Into Dfa, Compilation Into C/C++ Code, Support For Various Lexing/Scanning Tasks
General Tags: Lexer, Scanner, Regular Expressions, Dfa
AI Description: re2c is a tool for writing fast and flexible lexer/scanner programs. It translates regular expressions into deterministic finite automata (DFA) and compiles them into C/C++ code. This allows for efficient lexical analysis of input streams.

Software Description: The GNU Readline library provides a set of functions for use by applications that allow users to edit command lines as they are typed in. Both Emacs and vi editing modes are available. The Readline library includes additional functions to maintain a list of previously-entered command lines, to recall and perhaps reedit those lines, and perform csh-like history expansion on previous commands.
Core Features:
1. Emacs and vi editing modes for command line editing.
2. History manipulation features like searching, recalling, and editing previous commands.
3. Customizable key bindings and configuration options.
4. Support for completion of filenames, variable names, and commands.
5. Input and output redirection capabilities within the command line interface.
General Tags: Gnu, Command Line Interface, Interactive Programs, Line Editing, History Manipulation
AI Description: GNU Readline is a free software library that provides line-editing and history capabilities for interactive programs with a command-line interface. It allows users to edit command lines as they are typed in, recall and re-edit previous input, and perform basic character manipulations.

Core Features: 1. Provides command line editing capabilities for applications. 2. Supports both Emacs and vi editing modes. 3. Allows users to edit command lines as they are typed in using standard keystrokes.
General Tags: Software Development, Library, Command Line Editing
AI Description: The readline library provides a set of functions for use by applications that allow users to edit command lines as they are typed in. Both Emacs and vi editing modes are available. The default editing mode is Emacs, but this can be changed when the application is run. In Emacs mode, the command line can be edited using the standard Emacs keystrokes.

Software Description: Reapr is a tool that evaluates the accuracy of a genome assembly using mapped paired end reads.
Core Features:
1. Genome assembly evaluation using various metrics.
2. Error correction tools to improve assembly quality.
3. Visualization of assembly errors and corrections.
4. Compatible with various assembly formats.
5. Command-line interface for easy usage.
General Tags: Genome Assembly, Assembly Evaluation, Error Correction, Bioinformatics
AI Description: Reapr is a software tool for genome assembly evaluation and improvement, specifically designed to work with de novo assemblies. It provides evaluation metrics to identify errors in assemblies and offers tools to correct these errors for improved genome assembly quality.

Software Description: Rebaler is a program for conducting reference-based assemblies using long reads.
Core Features: Performance Evaluation Of De Novo Genome Assemblers, Comparison With A Reference Genome, Statistical Analysis Of Assembly Quality, Visualizations For Easy Interpretation
General Tags: Genome Assembly, De Novo Assembly, Assembly Evaluation, Bioinformatics
AI Description: rebaler is a software tool for evaluating the performance of de novo genome assemblers by comparing their results against a reference genome. It provides detailed statistics and visualizations to assess the quality of the assembly.

Software Description: The reciprocal smallest distance (RSD) algorithm accurately infers orthologs between pairs of genomes by considering global sequence alignment and maximum likelihood evolutionary distance between sequences.
Core Features: The software calculates the reciprocal smallest distance between lattice points in crystallography, aiding in the analysis of crystal structures and understanding the symmetry of crystal lattices.
General Tags: Crystallography, Reciprocal Lattice, Distance Calculation
AI Description: reciprocal_smallest_distance is a software tool used for calculating the shortest distance between reciprocal lattice points in crystallography.

Software Description: Recycler is a tool designed for extracting circular sequences from de novo assembly graphs.
Core Features:
1. Corrects errors in nanopore reads
2. Utilizes linked reads for error correction
3. Improves genome assembly accuracy
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Hpc Tools
AI Description: Recycler is a tool designed for the error correction of nanopore reads using linked reads. It employs a method that combines short and long reads to enhance genome assembly accuracy.

Software Description:
Redis is an open-source, in-memory data store used by millions of developers as a cache, vector database, document database, streaming engine, and message broker. 
Description Source: https://redis.io/
Core Features:
1. In-memory data store
2. Support for various data structures
3. Persistence options
4. Pub/Sub messaging system
5. Lua scripting
6. Built-in replication
General Tags: Database, Cache, Message Broker
AI Description: Redis is an open-source, in-memory data structure store that can be used as a database, cache, and message broker. It supports various data structures such as strings, hashes, lists, sets, sorted sets with range queries, bitmaps, hyperloglogs, geospatial indexes with radius queries, and streams.

Software Description:
Redis-Py is the Python interface to the Redis key-value store. 
Description Source: https://github.com/redis/redis-py
Core Features: Provides A Python Interface To Interact With Redis Databases, Supports Key-Value Operations Such As Set, Get, Delete, & Increment, Allows For Working With Redis Data Structures Like Lists, Sets, Sorted Sets, & Hashes, Offers Pipeline Support For Executing Multiple Commands In A Single Round Trip To The Server, Provides Pub/Sub Functionality For Implementing Messaging Patterns
General Tags: Python Library, Database Interaction, In-Memory Data Store, Data Persistence
AI Description: redis-py is a Python client library for Redis, a popular in-memory data store. It allows Python developers to easily interact with a Redis database to store and retrieve data.

Software Description:
ReFrame is a powerful Python framework for writing and running portable regression tests and benchmarks for HPC systems. 
Description Source: https://github.com/reframe-hpc/reframe
Core Features: Functional Testing Framework, Support For Hpc Systems, Python Library
General Tags: Hpc, Python Library, Testing Framework
AI Description: ReFrame is a Python library for writing tests for High Performance Computing (HPC) systems. It provides a functional testing framework designed to support a variety of different HPC systems.

Software Description: Regtools are tools that integrate DNA-seq and RNA-seq data to help interpret mutations in a regulatory and splicing context.
Core Features: Manipulation Of Sequence Alignments & Variant Call Files, Filtering, Sorting, & Comparing Genomic Data, Annotating Genomic Annotations, Command-Line Tool & Python Library
General Tags: Sequence Alignment, Variant Calling, Genomic Data, High-Throughput Sequencing
AI Description: Regtools is a command-line tool and Python library for manipulating sequence alignments (SAM/BAM/CRAM), variant call files (VCF/BCF) and genomic annotations in the standard genomic file formats. It provides various utilities for filtering, sorting, comparing, and annotating genomic data to assist in the analysis of high-throughput sequencing data.

Software Description:
RELION (for REgularised LIkelihood OptimisatioN) is a stand-alone computer program for Maximum A Posteriori refinement of (multiple) 3D reconstructions or 2D class averages in cryo-electron microscopy. It is developed in the research group of Sjors Scheres at the MRC Laboratory of Molecular Biology. 
Description Source: https://github.com/3dem/relion
Core Features: Key features of Relion include particle extraction, 2D and 3D classification, image processing, refinement, and reconstruction. It is widely used for high-resolution structure determination of macromolecular complexes.
General Tags: Cryo-Em, Image Processing, 3D Reconstruction, Macromolecular Complexes
AI Description: Relion is a stand-alone computer program that employs an empirical Bayesian approach to refinement of (multiple) 3D reconstructions or 2D class averages in electron cryo-microscopy (cryo-EM).

Software Description:
REMORA (REsource MOnitoring for Remote Applications) provides a simple interface to gather important system utilization data while running on HPC systems. 
Description Source: https://tacc.utexas.edu/research/tacc-research/remora/
Core Features: Parallel & Distributed Computing, Task Distribution, Dependency Management, Lightweight & Extensible, Python Library
General Tags: Python Library, Parallel Computing, Distributed Computing
AI Description: Remora is a lightweight and extensible Python library for parallel and distributed computing workflows. It simplifies the process of distributing tasks across multiple workers and managing dependencies in a distributed environment.

Software Description: RepeatMasker is a program that screens DNA sequences for interspersed repeats and low complexity DNA sequences.
Core Features: Identification Of Interspersed Repeats, Screening Of Low Complexity DNA Sequences, Detection Of Transposons & Retroviruses, Annotation & Masking Of Repetitive Elements
General Tags: Genomics, Bioinformatics, Sequence Analysis, Repeat Detection
AI Description: RepeatMasker is a program that screens DNA sequences for interspersed repeats and low complexity DNA sequences. It can be used to identify repetitive elements, such as transposons and retroviruses, in genomic sequences.

Software Description: RepeatModeler is a de novo transposable element (TE) family identification and modeling package.
Core Features: De Novo Identification Of Repetitive Elements, Classification & Analysis Of Repeat Sequences, Building Consensus Models Of Repeat Families, Integration Of Multiple Software Tools & Scripts
General Tags: Genomics, Bioinformatics, Repeat Sequences, De Novo Identification
AI Description: RepeatModeler is a tool for de novo identification, classification, and analysis of repetitive elements in genomic sequences. It combines several software packages and custom Perl scripts to build consensus models of repeat families from repeat sequences present in a genome.

Software Description: RepeatScout is a tool to discover repetitive substrings in DNA.
Core Features:
1. De novo repeat identification
2. Classification of repetitive sequences
3. Discovery of novel repetitive elements
4. Identification of potential transposable elements
5. Generation of consensus sequences for repeats
General Tags: Genomics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology
AI Description: RepeatScout is a computational tool designed for the identification and classification of repetitive sequences in genomic data. It utilizes de novo repeat detection algorithms to discover novel repetitive elements within DNA sequences.

Software Description: ResFinder identifies acquired antimicrobial resistance genes in total or partial sequenced isolates of bacteria.
Core Features: Identification Of Acquired Antimicrobial Resistance Genes, Analysis Of Whole-Genome Sequencing Data, Comparison Of Input Genome Sequences To A Database Of Known Resistance Genes, Prediction Of Antimicrobial Resistance
General Tags: Bioinformatics
AI Description: ResFinder is a web-based tool developed by the Center for Genomic Epidemiology for identification of acquired antimicrobial resistance genes in whole-genome sequencing data of bacterial isolates. It helps in predicting acquired antimicrobial resistance by comparing the input genome sequences to a set of known resistance genes.

Software Description: RevBayes -- Bayesian phylogenetic inference using probabilistic graphical models and an interactive language.
Core Features: RevBayes provides a flexible and customizable environment for specifying complex phylogenetic models, performing Bayesian inference using Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) algorithms, and incorporating various evolutionary models and priors.
General Tags: Phylogenetics, Bayesian Inference, Evolutionary Biology
AI Description: RevBayes is a probabilistic programming framework for Bayesian inference of phylogenetic trees and evolutionary parameters.

Software Description: rich-cli is a command line toolbox for fancy output in the terminal.
Core Features: Rich provides rich syntax highlighting, render images and tables, emojis, markdown and ASCII art rendering, and text formatting capabilities to create stylish and visually appealing text-based user interfaces in the terminal.
General Tags: Python Library, Terminal Formatting, Text-Based Ui
AI Description: Rich is a Python library for rich text and beautiful formatting in the terminal.

Core Features: Read & Write Geospatial Raster Data, Integration With Xarray For Data Analysis & Manipulation, Projection Handling & Coordinate Transformations, Metadata Management For Geospatial Datasets
General Tags: Python Library, Geospatial Data, Raster Data, Data Processing
AI Description: rioxarray is a Python package that extends xarray to add geospatial capabilities by making use of rasterio for I/O operations with raster data. It enables reading and writing spatial raster data with ease and integrates seamlessly with xarray for analysis and manipulation of these geospatial datasets.

Software Description:
Rising is a high-performance data loading and augmentation library for 2D and 3D data completely written in PyTorch. Our goal is to provide a seamless integration into the PyTorch Ecosystem without sacrificing usability or features. 
Description Source: https://rising.readthedocs.io/en/stable/getting_started.html
Core Features: Key features of RISING include system modeling, requirement management, architecture design, simulation and analysis, verification and validation, and documentation generation. It offers a set of tools and libraries to support the entire systems engineering lifecycle.
General Tags: Systems Engineering, Automation, Modularity, Reusability, Maintainability
AI Description: RISING (Rapidly Installed Systems Engineering) is an open-source systems engineering tool that focuses on automating the system development process. It provides a framework for designing, integrating, and verifying complex systems with an emphasis on modularity, reusability, and maintainability.

Core Features: Readline Wrapper For Command Line Interfaces, Command History Support, Persistent History Across Sessions, Line Editing & Tab Completion
General Tags: Command Line Interface, Readline, Line Editing, Tab Completion
AI Description: rlwrap is a readline wrapper that uses the GNU readline library to allow the editing of keyboard input for any command. It provides command history, persistent history, line editing, and tab completion capabilities for command line interfaces.

Software Description: Rmats is a computational tool to detect differential alternative splicing events from RNA-Seq data.
Core Features: Detection Of Differential Alternative Splicing, Statistical Analysis Of RNA-Seq Data, Identification Of Splicing Events Across Conditions
General Tags: RNA-Seq, Alternative Splicing, Transcriptomics, Bioinformatics
AI Description: RMATS (RNA-Seq Multivariate Analysis of Transcript Splicing) is a computational tool used for detecting differential alternative splicing from RNA-Seq data. It performs statistical analysis to identify differential splicing events between two or more biological conditions.

Software Description: Rmats2sashimiplot produces a sashimiplot visualization of rMATS output.
