Core Features: 1. Visualization of alternative splicing events identified by rMATS. 2. Interactive and customizable plots for better data exploration. 3. Integration with rMATS output files for seamless analysis workflow. 4. Support for various file formats commonly used in RNA-Seq data analysis.
General Tags: RNA-Seq, Alternative Splicing, Data Visualization, Bioinformatics
AI Description: rmats2sashimiplot is a software tool used for visualizing RNA-Seq data analysis results, particularly in the context of alternative splicing events. It is designed to provide detailed and interactive visual representations of splicing events identified by rMATS, a widely used differential alternative splicing analysis tool.

Software Description: RNAIndel calls coding indels from tumor RNA-Seq data and classifies them as somatic, germline, and artifactual. RNAIndel supports GRCh38 and 37.
Core Features: 1. Prediction of RNA editing sites in plant organelle genomes. 2. Machine learning algorithms for site identification. 3. Utilizes sequence features for accurate predictions.
General Tags: Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Machine Learning
AI Description: rnaindel is a computational tool for predicting RNA editing sites in plant organelle genomes. It utilizes machine learning algorithms to identify potential RNA editing sites based on sequence features.

Core Features: Preprocessing Of RNA-Seq Data, Quality Control Of Gene Expression Data, Differential Expression Analysis, Visualization Of RNA-Seq Results
General Tags: Python Library, RNA Sequencing Data, Gene Expression Analysis, Data Visualization
AI Description: rnalysis is a Python library designed for the analysis of RNA sequencing data. It provides functions for processing and analyzing gene expression data obtained from RNA-Seq experiments. rnalysis simplifies the preprocessing, quality control, differential expression analysis, and visualization of RNA-Seq data.

Software Description: RNApeg is an RNA junction calling, correction, and quality-control package.
Core Features: Predicting 3D RNA Structures From Sequence, Utilizes Deep Learning Techniques, No Requirement For Template Structures
General Tags: RNA Structure Prediction, Deep Learning Tool
AI Description: rnapeg is a tool for predicting 3D RNA structures from sequence alone using deep learning.

Software Description: Rnaquast is a quality assessment tool for de novo transcriptome assemblies.
Core Features: Quality Assessment Of De Novo Transcriptome Assemblies, Comparison To A Reference Genome, Evaluation Of Completeness, Correctness, & Compatibility, Generation Of Detailed Quality Reports
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Transcriptome Analysis, Quality Assessment, Genomics
AI Description: RNAQuast is a quality assessment tool for de novo transcriptome assembly pipelines. It evaluates the quality of transcriptome assemblies by comparing them to a reference genome and measures various metrics to assess the completeness, correctness, and compatibility of the assembly.

Software Description:
RNAView identifies base pairs that are formed in nucleic acid structures and classifies them according to the system of Leontis and Westhof. The software presented here was originally described in Yang, H., Jossinet, F., Leontis, N., Chen, L., Westbrook, J., Berman, H.M., Westhof, E. (2003). 
Description Source: https://github.com/rcsb/RNAView
Core Features: Interactive Visualization Of RNA Secondary Structures, Analysis Of Structural Properties Of RNA Molecules, Customization Options For Viewing & Annotating RNA Structures, Exporting Capabilities For Images & Data Files
General Tags: RNA Secondary Structure, Visualization Tool, Bioinformatics
AI Description: RNAview is a software tool for visualizing RNA secondary structures. It provides an interactive graphical interface for users to explore and analyze RNA molecules' structural properties.

Software Description: Roary is a high speed stand alone pan genome pipeline, which takes annotated assemblies in GFF3 format (produced by Prokka) and calculates the pan genome.
Core Features:
1. Identification of core and accessory genes in prokaryotic pan-genomes
2. Scalable for analyzing thousands of genomes
3. Produce highly accurate results
4. Generates visualizations to aid in the interpretation of results
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Genomics, Pan-Genome Analysis, Prokaryotic Genomes
AI Description: Roary is a high-speed stand-alone tool for detecting core genes from prokaryotic pan-genomes. It is particularly useful for performing fast pan-genome analyses of thousands of prokaryotic genomes.

Core Features:
1. Simplifies the process of incorporating ROCm into CMake-based projects.
2. Provides CMake module files for building with ROCm libraries and tools.
3. Supports the integration of HIP and HCC compilers in CMake projects.
4. Facilitates the seamless use of ROCm tools and libraries in CMake workflows.
General Tags: Rocm, Cmake, Hip Compiler, Hcc Compiler
AI Description: ROCm CMake is an open-source set of CMake modules designed to facilitate building software with the ROCm ecosystem. It provides CMake configurations and utilities to enable ROCm development and integration of HIP and HCC compilers into projects.

Core Features: Monitoring Gpu Parameters Such As Temperature, Power Usage, Fan Speed, & Clock Speeds, Managing Power Profiles For Optimized Performance, Controlling Fan Speed To Maintain Optimal Cooling, Adjusting Frequency & Voltage Settings For Power Efficiency, Viewing Detailed Gpu Information & Metrics
General Tags: Gpu Management, Performance Monitoring, System Management Interface, Amd Radeon, Rocm
AI Description: rocm-smi is a command-line program that allows users to monitor and manage AMD Radeon Open Compute (ROCm) System Management Interface (SMI) enabled GPUs. It provides detailed information about the current state of the GPUs and enables users to manage various aspects of the GPUs such as power management, fan speed control, temperature monitoring, and more.

Core Features:
1. GPU-accelerated computing using ROCm platforms
2. High-performance runtime system
3. Support for parallel processing tasks on AMD GPUs
4. Efficient execution of applications on GPU architectures
General Tags: Gpu-Accelerated Computing, Parallel Processing, Amd Gpus
AI Description: The ROCR Runtime (ROCR) is a runtime system designed for GPU-accelerated computing using ROCm platforms. It provides a high-performance environment for executing applications on AMD GPUs for parallel processing tasks.

Core Features: 1. Abstraction layer for ROCm tools and libraries to communicate with the ROCr driver. 2. Facilitates communication and coordination between different components in the ROCm ecosystem. 3. Helps in managing memory, kernel execution, context, and other GPU operations. 4. Enhances the portability and compatibility of ROCm software across different hardware platforms.
General Tags: Rocm, Gpu, Abstraction Layer, Compatibility
AI Description: The roct-thunk-interface is a component of the ROCm project that provides a thin abstraction layer for various ROCm tools and libraries to interact with the ROCr driver.

Software Description:
ROOT is a framework for data processing, born at CERN, at the heart of the research on high-energy physics. Every day, thousands of physicists use ROOT applications to analyze their data or to perform simulations. 
Description Source: https://root.cern/about/
Core Features:
1. Data manipulation and analysis tools
2. Visualization capabilities for 2D and 3D plots
3. Statistical analysis functions
4. Storage solutions for large datasets
5. Support for parallel processing and distributed computing
General Tags: Data Analysis, Visualization, High-Energy Physics, Data Manipulation, Statistical Analysis
AI Description: ROOT is an open-source data analysis framework used by high-energy physics (HEP) experiments. It provides a range of tools for data manipulation, visualization, statistical analysis, and storage. ROOT is written in C++ and offers a scripting language called ROOT/CINT that allows for quick prototyping and interactive analysis.

Software Description:
RSEM is a software package for estimating gene and isoform expression levels from RNA-Seq data. The RSEM package provides an user-friendly interface, supports threads for parallel computation of the EM algorithm, single-end and paired-end read data, quality scores, variable-length reads and RSPD estimation. 
Description Source: https://github.com/deweylab/RSEM
Core Features: Estimation Of Gene & Isoform Expression Levels From RNA-Seq Data, Calculation Of Transcript Abundances Using Expectation-Maximization Algorithm, Support For Various RNA-Seq Data Formats, Includes Programs For Building Reference Indices & Performing Transcript Abundance Estimation
General Tags: RNA-Seq, Transcriptomics, Gene Expression, Bioinformatics
AI Description: RSEM (RNA-Seq by Expectation Maximization) is a software package for estimating gene and isoform expression levels from RNA-Seq data. It quantifies the abundances of transcripts by calculating maximum likelihood estimates based on the Expectation-Maximization algorithm.

Software Description: Rseqc is package provides a number of useful modules that can comprehensively evaluate high throughput sequence data especially RNA-seq data.
Core Features: Key features include gene body coverage, read distribution over gene model, read distribution around transcription start site, read distribution around transcription termination site, coverage uniformity and more.
General Tags: RNA-Seq, Quality Control, Gene Expression Analysis
AI Description: RSeQC provides a number of standalone modules to check quality of RNA-Seq experiments, from raw data to the final result.

Software Description:
RStudio is an integrated development environment (IDE) for the R and Python. It includes a console, syntax-highlighting editor that supports direct code execution, and tools for plotting, history, debugging and workspace management. 
Description Source: https://posit.co/products/open-source/rstudio/
Core Features: Integrated Development Environment For The R Programming Language, Code Editor With Syntax Highlighting & Code Completion, Integrated Console For Interactive R Sessions, Data Visualization & Plotting Capabilities, Package Management & Integration With Cran, Project Management Features, Support For Rmarkdown For Reproducible Research
General Tags: Ide, Statistical Computing, Data Visualization, Programming
AI Description: RStudio is an integrated development environment (IDE) for R, a programming language and environment widely used for statistical computing and graphics. RStudio provides an intuitive and productive user interface for R, allowing users to efficiently write, execute, and debug R code.

Core Features: 1. Supports YAML 1.2 2. Round-trip parsing to preserve comments and formatting 3. Compatibility with PyYAML 4. Comprehensive documentation
General Tags: Yaml, Parser, Dumper, Python
AI Description: ruamel.yaml is a YAML 1.2 loader/dumper package for Python. It is a superset of the PyYAML library and it includes round-trip parsing (which allows for preserving comments and formatting when loading and then emitting the YAML data).

Software Description:
Ruby is a dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity. It has an elegant syntax that is natural to read and easy to write. 
Description Source: https://www.ruby-lang.org/en/
Core Features: Some core features of Ruby include object-oriented programming, mixins, blocks, and closures. It also has a strong focus on developer happiness and has a rich ecosystem of libraries and frameworks.
General Tags: Programming Language, Scripting Language, Web Development
AI Description: Ruby is a dynamic, object-oriented programming language focused on simplicity and productivity. It has an elegant syntax that is easy to read and write, making it a popular choice for web development and scripting.

Software Description: Run-dbcan is a standalone tool of http://bcb.unl.edu/dbCAN2/
Core Features:
1. Automatic annotation of CAZymes from metagenomic data
2. Integration of multiple tools and databases for prediction and classification of CAZymes
3. Classification of CAZymes into different families based on sequence homology and conserved domains
4. User-friendly interface for running the pipeline and obtaining annotation results
5. Customization options for adjusting parameters and databases for annotation
General Tags: Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, Metagenomics
AI Description: run_dbcan is a computational pipeline for the automatic annotation of carbohydrate-active enzymes (CAZymes) from metagenomic data. It integrates various tools and databases to predict CAZymes and classify them into different families based on sequence homology and conserved protein domains.

Software Description: rush is a tool similar to GNU parallel and gargs. rush borrows some idea from them and has some unique features, e.g., supporting custom defined variables, resuming multi-line commands, more advanced embeded replacement strings.
Core Features: Support For Parallel Computing, Distributed Computing Capabilities, High-Performance Computing Focus
General Tags: Programming Language, High-Performance Computing, Parallel Computing, Distributed Computing
AI Description: Rush is a programming language designed for high-performance computing with a focus on parallel and distributed computing.

Software Description:
Rust is a low-level language that provides direct access to hardware and memory. It's used to write operation systems or microcontroller applications. Rust is well-suited for embedded and bare-metal development. 
Description Source: https://www.rust-lang.org/
Core Features: Memory Safety Without Garbage Collection, Concurrency Without Data Races, Minimal Runtime, Low-Level Control Like C, Strong Type System, Pattern Matching, Traits For Code Reuse, Cargo - The Package Manager & Build System
General Tags: Programming Language, System Programming, Concurrency
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Delta: https://docs.ncsa.illinois.edu/systems/delta/en/latest/user_guide/software.html 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/ 
Ookami: https://www.stonybrook.edu/commcms/ookami/support/faq/software_on_ookami
AI Description: Rust is a multi-paradigm system programming language focused on safety, speed, and concurrency.

Software Description: Sage is a proteomics search engine - a tool that transforms raw mass spectra from proteomics experiments into peptide identificatons via database searching & spectral matching.
Core Features: Wide Range Of Mathematics Functionalities, Python-Based Interface, Integration Of Multiple Open-Source Packages, Symbolic & Numerical Computation Capabilities, Data Analysis & Visualization Tools
General Tags: Mathematics, Computer Science
AI Description: SageMath is an open-source mathematical software system that integrates the power of many existing open-source packages into a common Python-based interface. It provides modern tools for algebra, number theory, calculus, symbolic and numerical mathematics, data analysis, and visualization.

Software Description: Salmon is a tool for quantifying the expression of transcripts using RNA-seq data.
Core Features: Salmon uses selective alignment of RNA-sequencing reads against a quasi index of the known transcripts to quickly determine the compatibility of the reads with the transcripts, and to quantify the abundance of the transcripts.To quantify expression levels, Salmon employs a two-phase inference procedure that is highly robust, accurate, and is faster than most other tools available.
General Tags: RNA-Seq, Transcript Expression Quantification
AI Description: Salmon is a wicked-fast program to provide quantification of transcript expression from RNA-seq data.

Software Description: Sambamba is a high performance highly parallel robust and fast tool (and library), written in the D programming language, for working with SAM and BAM files.
Core Features:
1. Sorting BAM files with minimal memory usage.
2. Merging BAM files efficiently.
3. Indexing and querying BAM files quickly.
4. Parallel processing for improved performance.
5. Support for various operations on SAM/BAM files.
General Tags: Sam/Bam Files, High-Performance Tool, Parallel Processing, Genomics
AI Description: Sambamba is a high-performance tool and library for working with SAM/BAM files. It provides efficient and parallel processing of SAM and BAM files for tasks such as sorting, merging, indexing, and querying, with a focus on speed and reduced memory footprint.

Software Description: Samblaster is a tool to mark duplicates and extract discordant and split reads from sam files.
Core Features:
1. Mark duplicates in SAM/BAM/CRAM files.
2. Extract discordant and split read alignments.
3. Utilizes information from SAM flags for accurate alignment categorization.
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Hpc Tools
AI Description: Samblaster is a tool designed to mark duplicates and obtain discordant and split read alignments from SAM, BAM, or CRAM files, leveraging information from the SAM flags to accurately categorize the alignment information.

Software Description: Samclip is a tool to filter SAM file for soft and hard clipped alignments.
Core Features: Adapter trimming, read mapping, quality control, NGS data analysis
General Tags: Ngs, Sequencing, Bioinformatics
AI Description: Samclip is a software for adapter trimming and mapping of sequencing reads for various NGS applications.

Software Description: Samplot is a command line tool for rapid, multi-sample structural variant visualization.
Core Features: Visualization Of Structural Variants, Support For Short- & Long-Read Sequencing Data, Publication-Quality Plots, Customizable Plots
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Genomics, Structural Variants, Data Visualization
AI Description: Samplot is a Python package for creating publication-quality plots of structural variants identified from short- and long-read sequencing data. It provides a flexible and customizable framework for visualizing structural variations in genomic data.

Software Description:
SAM (Sequence Alignment/Map) format is a generic format for storing large nucleotide sequence alignments. SAM Tools provide various utilities for manipulating alignments in the SAM format, including sorting, merging, indexing and generating alignments in a per-position format. 
Description Source: https://samtools.sourceforge.net/
Core Features:
1. Efficient manipulation of SAM/BAM files
2. Sorting and indexing of sequence alignments
3. Merging, filtering, and converting between different file formats
4. Detection of and working with various flags in the alignment data
5. Calculation of various statistics, such as depth, alignment quality, and mapping coverage
General Tags: Sequence Analysis, Genomics, Bioinformatics
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Anvil: https://www.rcac.purdue.edu/software/samtools 
Bridges-2: https://www.psc.edu/resources/software/samtools 
Expanse: https://www.sdsc.edu/support/user_guides/expanse.html#modules 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/
AI Description: Samtools is a suite of programs for interacting with high-throughput sequencing data generated in sequence alignment/map (SAM) format, such as those produced by the Short Read Mapping (SHRiMP) or Burrows-Wheeler Aligner (BWA) aligners. It allows various operations on SAM/BAM files, including indexing, sorting, merging, and manipulating sequence alignments.

Core Features:
1. Detection of memory errors such as buffer overflows, memory leaks, and uninitialized memory access.
2. Identification of data races to ensure thread safety and consistency in parallel applications.
3. Improved debugging capabilities for HPC codes to boost overall program stability and efficiency.
General Tags: Memory Errors, Data Races, Hpc Applications
AI Description: sanitizers4hpc is a toolset designed for detecting and removing memory errors and data races in high-performance computing (HPC) applications. It offers various sanitizers to enhance the reliability and performance of parallel programs.

Software Description:
Sanity Tool includes a group of generic and machine-specific tests that are used to evaluate the correctness of a user's account configurations. 
Description Source: https://tacc.utexas.edu/research/tacc-research/sanity-tool/
Core Features: Automated Code Quality Checks, Identifying Potential Issues & Bugs, Improving Code Reliability, Enforcing Coding Standards, Integration With Continuous Integration (Ci) Pipelines
General Tags: Software Quality Assurance, Code Analysis, Automated Testing, Continuous Integration
AI Description: Sanitytool is a software tool designed for ensuring the sanity and quality of software code by performing various checks and validations. It helps in identifying potential issues, bugs, and vulnerabilities in the codebase, ensuring a higher level of code quality and reliability.

Software Description:
ScaFaCoS is a library of scalable fast coulomb solvers. This is a network project of German research groups working on a unified parallel library for various methods to solve electrostatic (and gravitational) problems in large particle simulations. 
Description Source: http://www.scafacos.de/
Core Features: Key features of SCAFACOS include analyzing and visualizing single-cell signaling data, identifying clonal subpopulations within a cell population, assessing clonal diversity and evolution over time, and elucidating the impact of signaling pathways on clonal outcomes.
General Tags: Computational Tool, Single-Cell Analysis, Signaling Pathways, Clonal Dynamics
AI Description: SCAFACOS (Single-Cell Analysis Framework for Assessing Clonal Outcomes of Signaling) is a computational tool designed for analyzing single-cell signaling data and inferring clonal outcomes in cellular systems. It is specifically tailored for studying cellular heterogeneity and clonal dynamics in response to signaling pathways.

Software Description:
ScaLAPACK is a library of high-performance linear algebra routines for parallel distributed memory machines. ScaLAPACK solves dense and banded linear systems, least squares problems, eigenvalue problems, and singular value problems. 
Description Source: https://www.netlib.org/scalapack/
Core Features: Parallel Algorithms For Dense Linear Algebra Operations, Optimized For Distributed Memory Architectures, Support For Blas (Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms), Matrix Factorizations, Linear Equation Solving, Least Squares Problems, Highly Efficient & Scalable For Large Matrices, Used In Scientific Computing & High-Performance Computing Applications
General Tags: Linear-Algebra, Numerical-Computing, Distributed-Computing, Parallel-Computing
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Bridges-2: https://www.psc.edu/resources/software/scalapack 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/ 
Ookami: https://www.stonybrook.edu/commcms/ookami/support/faq/software_on_ookami
AI Description: ScaLAPACK (Scalable LAPACK) is a parallel version of LAPACK (Linear Algebra PACKage) for distributed memory machines. It is designed to efficiently solve large-scale problems in numerical linear algebra using parallelism.

Software Description:
Scalasca is a software tool that supports the performance optimization of parallel programs by measuring and analyzing their runtime behavior. The analysis identifies potential performance bottlenecks – in particular those concerning communication and synchronization – and offers guidance in exploring their causes. 
Description Source: https://www.scalasca.org/
Core Features:
1. Performance analysis of parallel applications
2. Identifying performance bottlenecks
3. Scalable and usable performance data
4. Optimizing parallel application performance
5. Supports MPI applications
6. Visualization of performance data
General Tags: Performance Analysis, Parallel Applications, Performance Optimization, Mpi Applications, Visualization
AI Description: Scalasca is a software toolset for analyzing the performance behavior of parallel applications and specifically for identifying potential performance bottlenecks. It assists users in optimizing the performance of their parallel applications by providing scalable and usable performance data.

Software Description: Scanpy is a scalable toolkit for analyzing single-cell gene expression data built jointly with anndata.
Core Features: Quality Control Of Single-Cell Data, Preprocessing & Normalization Of Gene Expression Data, Dimension Reduction & Visualization Techniques, Clustering Of Cell Populations, Trajectory Inference For Cell Development Processes, Differential Gene Expression Analysis, Integration Of Single-Cell Data With Other Omics Datasets
General Tags: Single-Cell RNA Sequencing Analysis, Bioinformatics, Data Visualization, Machine Learning
AI Description: Scanpy is a scalable toolkit for analyzing single-cell gene expression data. It provides a wide range of functionalities for quality control, preprocessing, visualization, clustering, trajectory inference, differential expression testing, and integration with other omics data.

Software Description: scArches is a package to integrate newly produced single-cell datasets into integrated reference atlases.
Core Features: Single-Cell RNA Velocity Analysis, Scalable Toolkit, Prediction Of Cell State Transitions, Identification Of Dynamically Changing Genes
General Tags: Single-Cell RNA Sequencing, Python Toolkit, Bioinformatics
AI Description: scarches is a scalable toolkit for single-cell RNA velocity analysis in Python. It enables efficient analysis of large-scale single-cell RNA sequencing data to predict cell state transitions and identify dynamically changing genes.

Software Description: scGen is a generative model to predict single-cell perturbation response across cell types, studies and species.
Core Features: Generates Bulk-Level Transcriptomic Profiles From Scrna-Seq Data, Predicts Gene Expression Influenced By Genetic & Environmental Factors, Bridges Resolution Gap Between Single-Cell & Bulk-Level Omics Data, Utilizes Deep Learning Techniques For Modeling Gene Expression
General Tags: Single-Cell RNA-Sequencing, Bulk-Level Transcriptomic Profiles, Deep Learning, Gene Expression Prediction
AI Description: scGen is a deep learning framework for generating bulk-level transcriptomic profiles from single-cell RNA-sequencing data. It predicts the influence of genetic and environmental factors on gene expression at a population-level, bridging the resolution gap between single-cell and bulk-level omics data.

Core Features: Schrodinger software includes molecular docking, molecular dynamics simulations, quantum mechanics calculations, virtual screening, protein-ligand interaction analysis, and property prediction for small molecules and biomolecules.
General Tags: Molecular Simulations, Quantum Chemistry, Drug Discovery, Materials Research
AI Description: Schrodinger is a leading provider of advanced molecular simulations and quantum chemistry software for Life Sciences and Materials Research. The software suite offers a wide range of tools for drug discovery and materials science applications.

Core Features: Manipulation Of Biological Sequence Data, Phylogenetic Tree Analysis, Metadata Handling, Sequence Alignment, Statistical Analysis For Biological Data
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Python Library, Biological Data Analysis, Sequence Analysis
AI Description: scikit-bio is a Python library for bioinformatics that provides tools for biological data manipulation, analysis, and visualization. It offers functionality for working with biological sequence data, phylogenetic trees, and related metadata.

Software Description:
scikit-build is a Python build system for CPython C/C++/Fortran/Cython extensions using CMake. The scikit-build package is fundamentally just glue between the setuptools Python module and CMake. 
Description Source: https://scikit-build.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
Core Features:
1. Simplified generation of CMake-based build systems for Python extensions.
2. Integrated support for compiling and packaging C++, C, Fortran, and Cython code with Python packages.
3. Seamless integration with setuptools, enabling easy building and distribution of packages.
General Tags: Python Library, Build System, Cmake Integration
AI Description: Scikit-build is an improved build system generator for CPython C/C++/Fortran/Cython extensions. It provides better support for CMake and enables you to easily build Python packages containing C++, C, Fortran, or Cython code.

Software Description:
scikit-cuda provides Python interfaces to many of the functions in the CUDA device/runtime, CUBLAS, CUFFT, and CUSOLVER libraries distributed as part of NVIDIA’s CUDA Programming Toolkit, as well as interfaces to select functions in the CULA Dense Toolkit. 
Description Source: https://scikit-cuda.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
Core Features: Provides Python Interface To Nvidia'S Cuda Api For Gpu Programming, Supports Gpu-Accelerated Linear Algebra Operations & Numerical Algorithms, Allows For Seamless Integration Of Cuda Code Within Python Programs, Enables Faster Computation For Large-Scale Numerical Tasks
General Tags: Python Library, Gpu Programming, Numerical Algorithms, Linear Algebra, Cuda Api
AI Description: scikit-cuda is a Python library that provides a Python interface to Nvidia's CUDA parallel computation API. It aims to make GPU programming more accessible to Python developers by providing GPU-accelerated linear algebra operations and other numerical algorithms.

Core Features: - Functional Data Representation, - Functional Data Visualization, - Preprocessing Techniques For Functional Data, - Modeling Tools For Functional Data Analysis
General Tags: Functional Data Analysis, Python Library, Data Analysis, Machine Learning
AI Description: scikit-fda is a Python library designed for Functional Data Analysis (FDA) in the context of Scikit-learn. It provides tools for data representation, visualization, preprocessing, and modeling with functional data.

Software Description: Scikit-image is an open-source image processing library for Python that provides a collection of algorithms for segmentation, geometric transformations, color space manipulation, analysis, filtering, morphology, and more. It's designed to integrate seamlessly with other Python libraries such as NumPy and SciPy for scientific computing tasks.
Core Features: Image Processing Algorithms, Feature Extraction, Segmentation Techniques, Color Space Manipulation, Filters & Edge Detection
General Tags: Image Processing, Python Library
AI Description: scikit-image is an open-source image processing library for the Python programming language that is designed to work with NumPy arrays. It provides a collection of algorithms for image processing, segmentation, feature extraction, and more.

Research Field: Computer & Information Sciences, Artificial Intelligence & Intelligent Systems
Software Description: Scikit-learn is an open-source machine learning library for Python, known for its simplicity and accessibility. It provides a wide range of supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, as well as tools for model fitting, data preprocessing, model selection, and evaluation.
Core Features: Supervised Learning, Unsupervised Learning, Dimensionality Reduction, Model Selection, Preprocessing Data
General Tags: Machine Learning, Python Library
AI Description: Scikit-learn is a machine learning library for the Python programming language. It features various classification, regression, and clustering algorithms including support vector machines, random forests, gradient boosting, k-means, and DBSCAN, among others. Scikit-learn is designed to interoperate with the Python numerical and scientific libraries NumPy and SciPy.

Research Field: Computer & Information Sciences, Other Computer & Information Sciences
Software Description:
SciPy is a collection of mathematical algorithms and convenience functions built on NumPy . It adds significant power to Python by providing the user with high-level commands and classes for manipulating and visualizing data. 
Description Source: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy-1.8.0/tutorial/general.html
Core Features: Numerical Integration & Optimization, Linear Algebra Operations, Interpolation & Curve Fitting, Statistics & Signal Processing, Image Processing, Sparse Matrix Operations
General Tags: Scientific Computing, Numerical Algorithms, Python Library, Data Analysis, Signal Processing
AI Description: SciPy is an open-source Python library that is used for scientific and technical computing. It provides efficient algorithms for numerical integration, optimization, linear algebra, interpolation, and more. SciPy builds on NumPy arrays for high-performance array operations and adds modules for statistics, signal processing, image processing, and other scientific computing tasks.

Core Features: 1. Includes a wide range of mathematical functions and numerical routines for scientific computing. 2. Offers tools for optimization, integration, interpolation, Fourier transforms, linear algebra, and more. 3. Supports efficient data structures and arrays for computational tasks. 4. Integrates seamlessly with other Python scientific computing libraries like NumPy and Matplotlib.
General Tags: Scientific Computing, Mathematical Functions, Numerical Routines, Optimization, Linear Algebra
AI Description: scipy_tamu is a software library that provides various scientific computing tools and algorithms tailored for research and educational purposes.

Research Field: Computer & Information Sciences, Other Computer & Information Sciences
Software Description:
SciPy is a collection of mathematical algorithms and convenience functions built on NumPy . It adds significant power to Python by providing the user with high-level commands and classes for manipulating and visualizing data. 
Description Source: https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy-1.8.0/tutorial/general.html
Core Features:
1. Numerical processing tools
2. Optimization algorithms
3. Statistical functions and distributions
4. Interpolation and integration methods
5. Signal processing techniques
6. Linear algebra and sparse matrix operations
General Tags: Scientific Computing, Numerical Processing, Statistics, Optimization, Signal Processing
AI Description: The scipy-bundle is a comprehensive collection of scientific computing tools built on top of the SciPy library. It includes a wide range of modules and packages for numerical processing, optimization, statistics, integration, interpolation, signal processing, and more.

Software Description: Scirpy is a scalable python-toolkit to analyse T cell receptor (TCR) or B cell receptor (BCR) repertoires from single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) data. It seamlessly integrates with the popular scanpy library and provides various modules for data import, analysis and visualization.
Core Features: Analysis Of B Cell & T Cell Receptor Repertoires, Integration With Single-Cell RNA Sequencing Data, Clonotyping & V(D)J Gene Usage Analysis, Diversity & Similarity Metrics, Identification Of Clonally Related Cells
General Tags: Python Library, Single-Cell Analysis, Immune Receptor Profiling
AI Description: scirpy is a Python-based toolkit for single-cell immune receptor profiling analysis. It provides a comprehensive set of tools for the analysis of B cell and T cell receptor repertoires in single-cell RNA sequencing data.

Core Features: Quality Control Of Single-Cell Datasets, Dimensionality Reduction Techniques, Clustering Algorithms, Visualization Tools For Single-Cell Data, Interpretation Of Single-Cell Data
General Tags: Single-Cell Analysis, Data Visualization, Bioinformatics, Python Library
AI Description: scnic is a Python package designed for the analysis, visualization, and interpretation of single-cell data.

Software Description:
SCons is an Open Source software construction tool. Think of SCons as an improved, cross-platform substitute for the classic Make utility with integrated functionality similar to autoconf/automake and compiler caches such as ccache. In short, SCons is an easier, more reliable and faster way to build software. 
Description Source: https://scons.org/
Core Features: Automated Build Scripts, Dependency Analysis, Parallel Builds, Cross-Platform Support, Extensibility Through Python Scripts
General Tags: Build Tool, Software Construction, Automation, Python
AI Description: SCons is an open-source software construction tool implemented in Python. It is designed to replace traditional build tools like Make with a more powerful and flexible build system.

Software Description: The Score-P measurement infrastructure is a highly scalable and easy-to-use tool suite for profiling, event tracing, and online analysis of HPC applications.
Core Features: 1. Instrumentation and measurement of parallel and distributed applications. 2. Performance analysis and profiling capabilities. 3. Scalability analysis and tuning support. 4. Integration with different HPC tools and frameworks. 5. Trace-based performance analysis.
General Tags: Software, Performance Measurement, Parallel Computing, Distributed Computing
AI Description: Score-P is a performance measurement infrastructure designed to analyze and optimize the performance of parallel and distributed applications. It provides a set of measurement and analysis tools to assess the performance, scalability, and behavior of parallel applications.

Software Description:
The Score-P measurement infrastructure is a highly scalable and easy-to-use tool suite for profiling, event tracing, and online analysis of HPC applications. Score-P supports analyzing C, C++ and Fortran applications that make use of multi processing (MPI, SHMEM), thread parallelism (OpenMP, PThreads) and accelerators (CUDA, OpenCL, OpenACC) and combinations. It works in combination with Periscope, Scalasca, Vampir, and Tau. 
Description Source: https://www.vi-hps.org/projects/score-p

SCOTCH is a software package and libraries for graph, mesh and hypergraph partitioning, static mapping, and sparse matrix block ordering. Its purpose of Scotch is to apply graph theory, with a divide and conquer approach, to scientific computing problems such as graph and mesh partitioning, static mapping, and sparse matrix ordering, in application domains ranging from structural mechanics to operating systems or bio-chemistry. The SCOTCH distribution is a set of programs and libraries which implement the static mapping and sparse matrix reordering algorithms developed within the SCOTCH project. 
Description Source: https://packages.gentoo.org/packages/sci-libs/scotch
Core Features: Scotch provides high-quality partitioning and ordering methods for optimizing data distribution and minimizing communication overhead in parallel computing. It offers capabilities for partitioning both graphs and meshes, with algorithms that aim to balance workloads, minimize edge cuts, and optimize memory usage.
General Tags: Graph Partitioning, Mesh Partitioning, Parallel Computing, Distributed Memory
AI Description: Scotch is a software package and library for graph and mesh partitioning, ordering, and clustering. It is designed to efficiently distribute data and computations across distributed memory parallel computers.

Software Description: Scvelo is a scalable toolkit for RNA velocity analysis in single cells.
Core Features: 1. Trajectory inference and visualization for single-cell genomics data. 2. Velocity estimation to determine the direction and speed of gene expression changes in individual cells. 3. Reconstruction of RNA velocity field to infer cell state transitions and developmental trajectories. 4. Tools for exploring and plotting RNA velocity dynamics in single-cell data.
General Tags: Single-Cell Genomics, Dynamical Systems, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology
AI Description: scvelo is a Python package for the analysis and interpretation of dynamical systems measured in single-cell genomics data. It provides a toolkit for studying and understanding the dynamical nature of cell differentiation processes.

Software Description: scvi-tools (single-cell variational inference tools) is a package for end-to-end analysis of single-cell omics data primarily developed and maintained by the Yosef Lab at UC Berkeley.
Core Features: Deep Probabilistic Modeling, Batch Effect Correction, Clustering, Differential Expression Analysis, Visualization Tools
General Tags: Single-Cell RNA-Seq, Data Analysis, Genomics, Bioinformatics
AI Description: scvi-tools is a comprehensive toolbox for deep probabilistic modeling, batch effect correction, clustering, differential expression, and visualization in single-cell RNA-seq data analysis. It provides a flexible and scalable framework for integrating multiple data modalities and capturing uncertainty in high-dimensional genomics data.

Software Description: SDL: Simple DirectMedia Layer, a cross-platform multimedia library
Core Features: Cross-platform support, low-level access to audio, graphics, and input devices, hardware acceleration, support for OpenGL and Direct3D, easy to use API for multimedia applications, used in a wide range of software and games.
General Tags: Development, Game Development, Multimedia, Library
AI Description: Simple DirectMedia Layer is a cross-platform development library designed to provide low-level access to audio, keyboard, mouse, joystick, and graphics hardware via OpenGL and Direct3D. It is used by video playback software, emulators, and popular games including Stardew Valley, Undertale, and more.

Software Description:
Simple DirectMedia Layer is a cross-platform development library designed to provide low level access to audio, keyboard, mouse, joystick, and graphics hardware via OpenGL and Direct3D. 
Description Source: https://www.libsdl.org/
Core Features: Cross-Platform Support, Low-Level Access To Audio, Keyboard, Mouse, Joystick, & Graphics Hardware, Hardware-Accelerated 2D Graphics Rendering
General Tags: Development, Multimedia, Graphics, Input-Output
AI Description: Simple DirectMedia Layer is a cross-platform development library designed to provide low level access to audio, keyboard, mouse, joystick, and graphics hardware via OpenGL and Direct3D. It is used by video playback software, emulators, and popular games including Valve's Steam.

Research Field: Computer & Information Sciences, Other Computer & Information Sciences, Engineering & Technology, Other Engineering & Technologies, Training, Infrastructure & Instrumentation
Core Features: High-Performance Computing Resources, Data Storage Solutions, Software Tools, Consulting Services, Training Programs
General Tags: Supercomputing, Research Support, Data Analytics, Cyberinfrastructure
AI Description: SDSC (San Diego Supercomputer Center) is an organized research unit of the University of California, San Diego that provides cyberinfrastructure resources and services to researchers in the fields of computational science, data analytics, bioinformatics, and more. SDSC supports a wide range of scientific disciplines by offering high-performance computing resources, data storage solutions, software tools, consulting services, and training programs.

Core Features:
1. Built-in themes for styling matplotlib graphics
2. Visualizing univariate and bivariate data
3. Plotting linear regression models
4. Plotting statistical summaries
5. Flexible and customizable plots
General Tags: Python Library, Data Visualization, Statistical Graphics
AI Description: Seaborn is a Python data visualization library based on matplotlib. It provides a high-level interface for creating attractive and informative statistical graphics.

Software Description: Segalign is a scalable GPU system for pairwise whole genome alignments based on LASTZ's seed-filter-extend paradigm.
Core Features:
1. Alignment of biological sequences
2. Comparison of multiple sequences
3. Visualization of sequence alignments
4. Editing capabilities for alignments
General Tags: Alignment, Comparison, Visualization, Biological Sequences
AI Description: SegAlign is a software tool for alignment, comparison, and visualization of biological sequences with flexible editing capabilities.

Core Features: Provides Pre-Trained Segmentation Models, Modular Api For Building Custom Segmentation Models, Supports Various Backbones Such As Resnet, Mobilenet, Efficientnet, Offers Easy Model Deployment In Keras & Tensorflow
General Tags: Semantic Segmentation, Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Image Processing
AI Description: Segmentation Models is an open-source library for semantic segmentation models that provides pre-trained models, scripts, and modular API for building custom segmentation models.

Software Description: Seidr is community gene network inference and exploration toolkit.
Core Features: Estimation Of Relatedness Coefficients, Estimation Of Inbreeding Coefficients, Support For Large-Scale Genomic Data, Efficient & Scalable Algorithms
General Tags: Genomics, Relatedness, Inbreeding, Computational Biology
AI Description: Seidr is a software package designed for the efficient and scalable estimation of relatedness and inbreeding coefficients from large-scale genomic data.

Software Description:
SentencePiece is an unsupervised text tokenizer and detokenizer mainly for Neural Network-based text generation systems where the vocabulary size is predetermined prior to the neural model training. SentencePiece implements subword units (e.g., byte-pair-encoding (BPE) [Sennrich et al.]) and unigram language model [Kudo.]) with the extension of direct training from raw sentences. 
Description Source: https://github.com/google/sentencepiece
Core Features: SentencePiece allows for effective tokenization and detokenization of text data, with the ability to encode/decode text to/from input sequences. It is designed for use in Neural Network-based text generation systems to optimize vocabulary size and model performance. SentencePiece supports various tokenization strategies such as unigram language model, BPE (Byte Pair Encoding), WordPiece, and more. It also offers subword regularization and reversible tokenization.
General Tags: Text Tokenizer, Neural Network, Text Generation
AI Description: SentencePiece is an unsupervised text tokenizer and detokenizer mainly for Neural Network-based text generation systems where the vocabulary size greatly affects the model performance.

Software Description: Sepp stands for SATé-Enabled Phylogenetic Placement and addresses the problem of phylogenetic placement for meta-genomic short reads.
Core Features: Phylogenetic Placement Of Short DNA Reads, Reference Alignment-Based Alignment Method, Efficient & Accurate Placement Algorithm
General Tags: Phylogenetics, DNA Alignment, Phylogenetic Placement
AI Description: SEPP (Satz per Partial Parsimony) is a software tool for aligning short DNA reads to a reference alignment in phylogenetic studies. It employs a phylogenetic placement strategy to assign reads to the reference tree in a computationally efficient manner.

Software Description: SeqCode is a family of applications designed to develop high-quality images and perform genome-wide calculations from high-throughput sequencing experiments.
Core Features: Identification Of Coding Sequences In Prokaryotic Genomes, Utilizes Comparative Genomics Methods, Accurate Prediction Of Protein-Coding Genes, Detection Of Functional Elements
General Tags: Genomics, Prokaryotic Genomes, Coding Sequences, Comparative Genomics, Gene Prediction
AI Description: SeqCode is a software tool designed for identifying coding sequences in prokaryotic genomes using a comparative genomics approach. It helps in accurately predicting protein-coding genes and functional elements.

Software Description: Seqkit is a rapid tool for manipulating fasta and fastq files.
Core Features: Manipulate Sequences In Fasta/Fastq Format, Filtering, Splitting, & Removing Duplicates, Format Conversion & Sequence Extraction, Efficient Handling Of Large-Scale Sequencing Data
General Tags: Sequence Manipulation, Fasta, Fastq
AI Description: SeqKit is a cross-platform, ultrafast, and handy sequenced data manipulation toolkit. It allows users to quickly manipulate sequences in fasta/fastq format, including filtering, splitting, removing duplicates, converting formats, and extracting sequences. SeqKit is designed to be efficient and user-friendly for handling large-scale sequencing data.

Software Description: Seqyclean is used to pre-process NGS data in order to prepare for downstream analysis.
Core Features: Fastq Preprocessing, Quality Filtering, Adapter Trimming, Ngs Data Optimization
General Tags: Ngs Data, Quality Control, Preprocessing, Bioinformatics
AI Description: SeqyClean is a tool for fastq preprocessing and quality filtering optimized for Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) data. It provides various modules for read filtering, quality control, and adapter trimming to improve the quality of sequencing data before downstream analysis.

Software Description:
The serf library is a high performance C-based HTTP client library built upon the Apache Portable Runtime (APR) library. 
Description Source: https://serf.apache.org/
Core Features: Decentralized Cluster Membership, Failure Detection, Event Broadcasting, Key/Value Storage, High Availability
General Tags: Cluster Management, Orchestration, Decentralized System
AI Description: Serf is a decentralized solution for cluster membership, failure detection, and orchestration. It is lightweight and highly available, providing a mechanism for event broadcasting and key/value storage.

Software Description:
The settarg module works with Lmod to help developers manage their compiled software projects. It does so by making it easy to switch between optimized or debug builds; change compiler or other modules; and let the build system know about the changes. The secret of settarg is that it consolidates the state of a build into one environment variable called $TARG. 
Description Source: https://lmod.readthedocs.io/en/latest/310_settarg.html
Core Features: Setting Target-Specific Optimizations In Compilers, Improving Performance Of Compiled Code, Command-Line Interface For Ease Of Use
General Tags: Compilers, Optimization, Performance Enhancement, Command-Line Tool
RP Software Documentation:
Aces: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/aces/ 
Bridges-2: https://www.psc.edu/resources/software/settarg 
Delta: https://docs.ncsa.illinois.edu/systems/delta/en/latest/user_guide/software.html 
Faster: https://hprc.tamu.edu/software/faster/ 
Stampede3: https://tacc.utexas.edu/use-tacc/software-list/
Version Info:
Aces: Settarg
Bridges-2: Settarg
Delta: Settarg
Faster: Settarg
Jetstream: Settarg
AI Description: Settarg is a command-line utility designed for setting target specific optimizations in C/C++ compilers. It helps in specifying optimization flags tailored for a particular CPU architecture to improve performance.

Software Description: Easily download, build, install, upgrade, and uninstall Python packages
Core Features: Project Metadata Specification, Dependency Declaration, Package Distribution Creation, Integration With Pip For Installation
General Tags: Python Packaging, Package Management, Dependency Management
AI Description: Setuptools is a package development process library designed to facilitate packaging Python projects. It allows developers to specify project metadata, declare project dependencies, and create distributable packages that can be easily installed using the Python package manager, pip.

Software Description: setuptools-rust is a plugin for setuptools to build Rust Python extensions implemented with PyO3 or rust-cpython.
Core Features:
1. Integration of Rust code into Python projects.
2. Simplified build and distribution of Rust packages.
3. Seamless communication between Python and Rust components.
4. Improved cross-language development workflow.
5. Enhanced performance and flexibility for projects requiring Rust functionality.
General Tags: Python Library, Build System, Rust Integration
AI Description: Setuptools-Rust is a Python library that extends the Setuptools build system, allowing you to build and distribute Rust packages from Python projects seamlessly. It simplifies the integration of Rust code into Python projects, making cross-language development easier and more efficient.

Software Description: Shadow is a network simulation tool used for modeling, testing, and analyzing complex network infrastructures and protocols. It allows researchers and network engineers to emulate various network scenarios, evaluate performance, and study the behavior of networks under different conditions.
Core Features: Versatile Network Simulator, Efficient & Scalable Simulation Framework, Powerful Scripting Engines For Automating Complex Simulations
General Tags: Network Simulation, Scripting, Simulation Framework
AI Description: Shadow is a versatile network simulator that is designed with the aim of providing not only an efficient and scalable simulation framework but also powerful and flexible scripting engines to automate complex simulations.

Software Description:
SHAP (SHapley Additive exPlanations) is a game theoretic approach to explain the output of any machine learning model. It connects optimal credit allocation with local explanations using the classic Shapley values from game theory and their related extensions. 
Description Source: https://shap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
Core Features:
1. Provides unified approach for explaining machine learning models.
2. Utilizes Shapley values from cooperative game theory for local feature attributions.
3. Supports various model types including tree-based models, deep learning models, and more.
4. Helps understand the impact of individual features on model predictions.
5. Enables model interpretability and transparency for better decision making.
General Tags: Explainability, Interpretability, Machine Learning, Model Explanation
AI Description: SHAP (SHapley Additive exPlanations) is a unified approach to explain the output of any machine learning model. It connects game theory with local explanations, attributing the impact of each feature on a model's predictions.

Software Description: SHAPEIT4 is a fast and accurate method for estimation of haplotypes (aka phasing) for SNP array and high coverage sequencing data.
Core Features: Fast & Accurate Haplotype Phasing, New Exact Fragment Inference Algorithm, Efficient For Large Cohorts, Captures Long-Range Phasing Information
General Tags: Phasing, Haplotype, Genomics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology
AI Description: SHAPEIT4 is a fast and accurate method for haplotype phasing based on a haplotype model similar to that used in SHAPEIT2. It adopts a new exact fragment inference algorithm that scales linearly with the effective number of haplotypes, making it highly efficient for large cohorts. SHAPEIT4 also includes a novel model that captures long-range phasing information through a conditional random field.

Software Description: SHAPEIT5 is a software package to estimate haplotypes in large genotype datasets (WGS and SNP array).
Core Features: Genomic Data Phasing, Inferring Haplotypes From Genotype Data, Determining Parental Origin Of Alleles On Homologous Chromosomes
General Tags: Genomics, Data Phasing, Haplotype Inference
AI Description: Shapeit5 is a software package for phasing genomic data, which refers to the process of determining the parental origin of alleles on homologous chromosomes. It is commonly used in genetic studies to infer haplotypes from genotype data.

Software Description: Shapely is a BSD-licensed Python package for manipulation and analysis of planar geometric objects. It is based on the widely deployed GEOS (the engine of PostGIS) and JTS (from which GEOS is ported) libraries.
Core Features: Creation Of Geometric Objects Like Points, Lines, & Polygons, Geometric Operations Like Intersection, Union, & Buffering, Spatial Analysis Functions Such As Distance Measurements & Polygon Splitting, Support For Manipulating & Analyzing Geometric Shapes In 2D Space
General Tags: Python Library, Geospatial Analysis, Geometric Objects
AI Description: Shapely is a Python library for manipulation and analysis of planar geometric objects. It is based on the widely deployed GEOS (the engine of PostGIS) and JTS (from which GEOS is ported) libraries.

Core Features: Real-Time Collaboration On Documents & Files, File Sharing & Storage, Version Control For Tracking Changes, Communication Tools For Team Collaboration, Access Control & Permission Management
General Tags: Collaboration Platform, Cloud-Based Software, File Sharing, Communication, Version Control
AI Description: Shared is a cloud-based collaboration platform that allows users to share files, documents, and information with team members or external collaborators. It provides a centralized location for real-time collaboration, file storage, version control, and communication.

Software Description: Shasta is a software for de novo assembly from Oxford Nanopore reads.
Core Features: Optimized For Long Noisy Reads From Pacbio & Oxford Nanopore Technologies, Efficiently Assembles Highly Accurate Contigs, Handles High Error Rates Commonly Found In Third-Generation Sequencing Data
General Tags: Genome Assembly, Long-Read Sequencing, Bioinformatics
AI Description: Shasta is a long-read assembler designed for PacBio and Oxford Nanopore data. It efficiently assembles long noisy reads into highly accurate contigs and is optimized for high error rates commonly found in third-generation sequencing technologies.

Software Description: Shigeifinder is a tool that is used to identify differentiate Shigella/EIEC using cluster-specific genes and identify the serotype using O-antigen/H-antigen genes.
Core Features: Some core features of ShigeiFinder include differential gene expression analysis, identification of gene-gene interactions, visualization of gene networks, and statistical analysis of gene expression patterns.
General Tags: Single-Cell RNA-Seq, Gene Expression, Interaction Analysis, Bioinformatics
AI Description: ShigeiFinder is a software tool for identifying significant gene expression interactions from single-cell RNA-seq data.

Software Description: Shorah is an open source project for the analysis of next generation sequencing data.
Shortstack is a tool for comprehensive annotation and quantification of small RNA genes.
Core Features:
1. Small RNA sequencing data analysis
2. MicroRNA and small RNA profiling
3. Differential expression analysis
4. Novel small RNA discovery
5. Plant species focus
General Tags: Small RNA Sequencing, Microrna Analysis, Plant Species
AI Description: ShortStack is a computational pipeline for analyzing small RNA sequencing data, particularly from plant species. It facilitates the discovery and profiling of microRNAs and other small RNAs.

Software Description: Shovill is a tool to assemble bacterial isolate genomes from Illumina paired-end reads.
Core Features: 1. De novo assembly of bacterial genomes 2. Trimming and polishing of assemblies 3. Quality assessment of assembled genomes
General Tags: De Novo Assembly, Bacterial Genomes, Assembly Pipeline
AI Description: Shovill is a de novo assembly pipeline for bacterial genomes that utilizes SPAdes to perform assembly and a variety of other tools to perform trimming, polishing, and quality assessment.

Software Description: Sicer is a clustering approach for identification of enriched domains from histone modification ChIP-Seq data.
Core Features:
1. Identifies broad regions of enrichment in ChIP-Seq data.
2. Utilizes a spatial clustering algorithm for improved accuracy.
3. Capable of handling large datasets efficiently.
4. Provides statistical analysis of identified domains.
5. Offers visualization options for better interpretation of results.
General Tags: Chip-Seq, Bioinformatics, Genomics
AI Description: SICER (Spatial clustering for Identification of ChIP-Enriched Regions) is a tool used for the identification of enriched domains from ChIP-Seq data. It is specifically designed to detect broad regions of enrichment, which is particularly useful for analyzing histone modification data.

Software Description: Sicer2 is the redesigned and improved ChIP-seq broad peak calling tool SICER.
Core Features: Identification Of Enriched Domains In Chip-Seq Data, Accurate Detection Of Broad Domains Of Histone Modifications, Analysis Of Chromatin States, Visualization Of Enrichment Profiles
General Tags: Chip-Seq Analysis, Epigenetics, Genomics, Bioinformatics
AI Description: SICER2 is a software tool used for identifying enriched domains from histone modification ChIP-Seq data. It is designed to accurately detect broad domains of histone modifications and chromatin states.

Software Description:
SIESTA (Spanish Initiative for Electronic Simulations with Thousands of Atoms) is both a method and its computer program implementation (Fortran 95), to perform efficient electronic structure calculations and ab initio molecular dynamics simulations of molecules and solids. 
Description Source: https://www.simuneatomistics.com/products/siesta-code/
Core Features: Siesta offers various features including optimized algorithms for linear-scaling calculations, parallelization, support for various exchange-correlation functionals, electronic transport calculations, and support for magnetic systems.
General Tags: Electronic Structure Calculations, Density-Functional Theory, Materials Science
AI Description: Siesta is a computer program that performs electronic structure calculations based on density-functional theory. It is especially designed for tight-binding and ab-initio calculations in materials science.

Software Description: SignalP predicts the presence and location of signal peptide cleavage sites in amino acid sequences from different organisms: Gram-positive prokaryotes, Gram-negative prokaryotes, and eukaryotes
SignalP predicts the presence and location of signal peptide cleavage sites in amino acid sequences from different organisms: Gram-positive prokaryotes, Gram-negative prokaryotes, and eukaryotes
Simug is a general-purpose genome simulator.
Core Features:
1. Intuitive interface for model building
2. Simulation capabilities to visualize system behavior
3. Educational tool for understanding dynamic systems
4. Analysis tools for interpreting simulation results
General Tags: Simulation Software, Educational Software, Modeling & Analysis
AI Description: SimUG is a simulation software designed for educational purposes that enables users to create and analyze dynamic models. It provides a user-friendly interface for building simulation models and running simulations to visualize the behavior of the system.

Software Description: SingleM is a tool for profiling shotgun metagenomes.
Core Features: Assembly Of Individual Microbial Genomes From Metagenomic Data, Annotation Of Microbial Genomes, Variant Calling Within Microbial Populations
General Tags: Microbial Genomics, Metagenomics, Genome Assembly, Variant Calling
AI Description: SingleM is a standalone toolkit for microbial population genomics that enables the assembly, annotation, and variant calling of individual microbial genomes from metagenomes.

Software Description:
Apptainer, formerly known as Singularity, is an open-source container platform designed to create portable and reproducible environments for scientific computing. It allows users to package applications, their dependencies, and data in a single container that can be run consistently across different computing environments. 
Description Source: https://apptainer.org/
Core Features: Creation Of Lightweight & Secure Containers, Support For Container Mobility & Reproducibility, Integration With Existing Container Ecosystems, Ability To Run Unmodified Linux Applications, Enhanced Security Features
General Tags: Containerization, Scientific Computing, Hpc, Research
AI Description: Singularity is an open-source container platform designed to create, run, and manage containers for scientific and high-performance computing (HPC) workloads. It focuses on providing secure and portable environments for researchers and developers.

Software Description:
Singularity is a widely-adopted open source container platform that implements a unique security model to mitigate privilege escalation risks, and provides a format to capture a complete application environment into a single file. Sylabs provides licensing for SingularityPRO, enterprise level support, professional services, cloud functionality, and value-added plugins for Singularity container platform. 
Description Source: https://sylabs.io/singularity-pro/
Core Features: Creation & Management Of Containers, Support For Hpc Environments, Isolated Application Environments, Flexible & Scalable Solution
General Tags: Container Platform, Hpc, High-Performance Computing
AI Description: SingularityPro is a container platform that allows users to create, deploy, and manage containers for high-performance computing (HPC) environments. It is designed to provide users with a flexible and scalable solution for running applications in isolated environments.

Software Description:
SIONlib is a library for writing and reading binary data to/from several thousands of processors into one or a small number of physical files. For parallel access to files only the open and close functions are collective while writing and reading file can be done asynchronously. 
Description Source: https://apps.fz-juelich.de/jsc/sionlib/docu/index.html
Core Features: 1. Supports reading and writing data in HDF5 format. 2. Enables efficient management of metadata associated with scientific datasets. 3. Facilitates manipulation and processing of multidimensional data arrays. 4. Offers a user-friendly I/O interface for seamless data access.
General Tags: I/O Interface, Scientific Data, Hdf5 Files
AI Description: Sionlib is a library that provides an I/O interface for scientific data stored in self-describing Hierarchical Data Format (HDF5) files, often used in high-performance computing applications. It offers functionalities for reading and writing data, metadata management, and dataset manipulation, making it a valuable tool for handling complex scientific data structures.

Software Description: SKA (Split Kmer Analysis) is a toolkit for prokaryotic (and any other small, haploid) DNA sequence analysis using split kmers.
Core Features: The SKA will enable scientists to address fundamental questions in astrophysics, cosmology, and astrobiology, providing insights into the origins and nature of the universe. It will have a wide field of view, high sensitivity, and high resolution, allowing for detailed studies of a wide range of celestial objects and phenomena.
General Tags: Astronomy, Telescope, Radio Astronomy
AI Description: The Square Kilometre Array (SKA) is a next-generation radio telescope project that aims to be the world's largest and most sensitive radio telescope, with an unprecedented level of detail and speed in observing the universe.

Software Description: Skewer is a fast and accurate adapter trimmer for paired-end reads.
Core Features: Adapter Trimming, Paired-End Reads Processing, Quality Score Analysis, High Sensitivity & Specificity
General Tags: Ngs Analysis, Bioinformatics, Sequence Data Processing, Adapter Trimming
AI Description: Skewer is a fast and accurate adapter trimmer for next-generation sequencing paired-end reads. It analyzes the patterns of quality scores at the ends of reads and identifies the beginning of the adapter sequences with high sensitivity and specificity.

Software Description: Slamdunk is a novel, fully automated software tool for automated, robust, scalable and reproducible SLAMseq data analysis.
Core Features: Genome Alignment For RNA-Seq Data, Quantification Of Gene Expression Levels, Integration Of Transcriptomics Data, Visualization Tools For Result Interpretation
General Tags: Ngs Data Analysis, RNA-Seq Data Processing, Transcriptomics, Bioinformatics
AI Description: SLAMdunk is a genome alignment-based tool specifically designed for mapping, quantification, and analysis of next-generation sequencing (NGS) data from RNA-seq experiments.

Software Description:
SLEPc (Scalable Library for Eigenvalue Problem Computations) is a software library for the solution of large scale sparse eigenvalue problems on parallel computers. It is an extension of PETSc and can be used for linear eigenvalue problems in either standard or generalized form, with real or complex arithmetic. 
Description Source: https://slepc.upv.es/
Core Features: SLEPc provides efficient and scalable routines for computing eigensolutions of linear eigenvalue problems, including standard and generalized eigenvalue problems. It offers a wide range of algorithms and options for customization and parallelization.
General Tags: Eigenvalue Problems, Sparse Matrices, Parallel Computing
AI Description: SLEPc (Scalable Library for Eigenvalue Problem Computations) is a software library for the solution of large scale sparse eigenvalue problems.

Software Description:
Slurm is an open-source cluster resource management and job scheduling system that strives to be simple, scalable, portable, fault-tolerant, and interconnect agnostic. Slurm currently has been tested only under Linux. 
Description Source: https://github.com/SchedMD/slurm
Core Features: Job scheduling, Resource management, Cluster monitoring, Job prioritization, Fair-share scheduling, Job accounting, Power management
General Tags: Workload Manager, Cluster Management, High-Performance Computing
AI Description: Slurm is an open-source workload manager designed for Linux clusters of all sizes. It provides job scheduling, prioritization, and management capabilities to maximize the efficiency of cluster resources.

Software Description:
When a job scheduled by Slurm starts, it needs to know certain things about how it was scheduled, etc. E.g., what is it's working directory, or what nodes were allocated for it. Slurm passes this information to the job via environmental variables. In addition to being available to your job, these are also used by programs like mpirun to default values. This way, something like mpirun already knows how many tasks to start and on which nodes, without you needing to pass this information explicitly. 
Description Source: https://hpcc.umd.edu/hpcc/help/slurmenv.html
Core Features: Managing Environment Variables For Slurm Job Scripts, Integration With Slurm Job Scheduler, Facilitates Setting Up The Environment For Job Execution
General Tags: Slurm, Job Scheduler, Environment Variables, Linux Clusters
AI Description: slurm-env is a tool that helps manage environment variables for SLURM job scripts. SLURM, which stands for Simple Linux Utility for Resource Management, is an open-source job scheduler for Linux clusters.

Software Description: Smoove simplifies and speeds calling and genotyping SVs for short reads.
Core Features:
1. Detection of large deletions and duplications
2. Utilizes split-read alignments
3. Uses discordant paired-end mappings
4. Genotyping of structural variants
General Tags: Structural Variant Caller, Genome Analysis, Next-Generation Sequencing, Bioinformatics
AI Description: Smoove is a structural variant caller for next-generation sequencing data, specializing in the detection of large deletions and duplications in genomes. It uses split-read alignments and discordant paired-end mappings to identify and genotype structural variants.

Software Description:
The Snakemake workflow management system is a tool to create reproducible and scalable data analyses. Workflows are described via a human readable, Python based language. 
Description Source: https://snakemake.readthedocs.io/en/stable/
Core Features: Workflow Management, Reproducibility, Traceability, Human-Readable Definition, Python-Based Language
General Tags: Workflow Management, Reproducibility, Traceability, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Data Science
AI Description: Snakemake is a workflow management system that aims to improve the reproducibility and traceability of computational workflows. It allows users to define workflows in a human-readable and Python-based domain-specific language.

Software Description: Snap is a semi-HMM-based Nucleic Acid Parser -- gene prediction tool.
Core Features: Efficient Network Representation, Scalable Algorithms For Network Analysis, Support For Various Network Formats, Community Detection & Clustering Algorithms, Node & Link Prediction Methods
General Tags: Network Analysis, Large Networks, Graph Algorithms
AI Description: SNAP (Stanford Network Analysis Platform) is a general purpose, high-performance system for analysis and manipulation of large networks.

Software Description: Snap-aligner(Scalable Nucleotide Alignment Program) is a fast and accurate read aligner for high-throughput sequencing data
Core Features: Efficient Short-Read Alignment To Reference Genomes, High Performance & Sensitivity, Support For Various Sequencing Technologies, Optimized For Speed & Accuracy
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Genomic Data, Short-Read Alignment, Reference Genome, Sequence Analysis
AI Description: Snap-aligner is a fast and accurate short-read aligner for genomic data. It efficiently aligns short DNA sequences to a reference genome, offering high performance and sensitivity for read mapping tasks.

Software Description:
Snappy is a compression/decompression library. It does not aim for maximum compression, or compatibility with any other compression library; instead, it aims for very high speeds and reasonable compression. 
Description Source: https://github.com/google/snappy
Core Features: 1. High-speed compression and decompression. 2. Reasonable compression ratios. 3. Designed for efficiency with big data processing frameworks.
General Tags: Compression, Big Data, Data Processing
AI Description: Snappy is a fast compressor/decompressor for big data. It aims for very high speeds and reasonable compression levels. Snappy is widely used in many large-scale data processing frameworks.

Software Description: Snaptools is a python module for pre-processing and working with snap file.
Core Features: Some of the core features of SnapTools include preprocessing, quality control, dimensionality reduction, batch effect correction, visualization, and downstream analysis of single-cell data.
General Tags: Single-Cell Data, Preprocessing, Dimensionality Reduction, Batch Effect Correction, Visualization, Downstream Analysis
AI Description: SnapTools is a comprehensive software suite designed for the analysis of single-cell data from various technologies.

Software Description: Snippy is a tool for rapid haploid variant calling and core genome alignment.
Core Features: Rapid Haploid Variant Calling, Core Genome Alignments, Bacterial Isolates Analysis
General Tags: Haploid Variant Calling, Core Genome Alignments, Bacterial Isolates
AI Description: Snippy is a tool for rapid haploid variant calling and core genome alignments of bacterial isolates.

Software Description: Snp-dists is a tool to convert a FASTA alignment to SNP distance matrix.
Core Features: Calculates Snp Distances Between Genomes, Works Well With Bacterial Genomes, Identifies Genetic Variations, Useful For Phylogenetic Analysis, Supports Input In Various Formats
General Tags: Genomics, Bioinformatics, Sequence Analysis, Phylogenetics
AI Description: snp-dists is a tool used for calculating SNP distances between genomes. It is particularly useful for analyzing bacterial genomes and identifying genetic variations.

Software Description: Snp-sites is a tool that apidly extracts SNPs from a multi-FASTA alignment.
Core Features: Identification Of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms (Snps), Analysis Of Multi-Fasta Alignments Of DNA Sequences, Output Of Snps In Different Formats For Further Analysis
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Genomics
AI Description: snp-sites is a software tool used for identifying single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) from a multi-FASTA alignment of DNA sequences. It extracts variable sites from the alignment and outputs the SNPs in various formats for downstream analysis.

Software Description: Snpeff is an open source tool that annotates variants and predicts their effects on genes by using an interval forest approach.
Core Features: Variant Annotation, Functional Effect Prediction, Genomic Sequence Analysis
General Tags: Genetic Variants, Annotation, Functional Prediction
AI Description: SnpEff is a genetic variant annotation and functional effect prediction tool designed to annotate and predict the effects of genetic variants within genomic sequences.

Software Description: Snpgenie is a collection of Perl scripts for estimating πN/πS, dN/dS, and gene diversity from next-generation sequencing (NGS) single-nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) variant data.
Core Features: Variant Calling In Ngs Data, Detection Of Snps & Indels, User-Friendly Interface, Variant Annotation
General Tags: Ngs Variant Calling, Snp Detection, Variant Annotation
AI Description: SNPGenie is a computational tool designed for detecting single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) and insertions/deletions (indels) in next-generation sequencing (NGS) data. It provides an intuitive and user-friendly interface for variant calling and annotation.

Software Description: Snphylo is a pipeline to generate a phylogenetic tree from huge SNP data.
Core Features: Processing Large Snp Datasets, Phylogenetic Tree Construction, Support For Various Methods, Efficiency In Tree Building
General Tags: Phylogenetics, Snp Data, Tree Construction, Bioinformatics
AI Description: snphylo is a software package designed for efficient construction of phylogenetic trees from large SNP datasets. It offers a range of features for processing SNP data and generating phylogenetic trees using various methods.

Software Description: Snpsift is a tool used to annotate genomic variants using databases, filters, and manipulates genomic annotated variants.
Core Features: Filtering Genetic Variants In Vcf Files, Annotating Snps, Extracting Specific Variants Based On User-Defined Criteria, Integration With Other Bioinformatics Tools
General Tags: Bioinformatics, Variant Filtering, Genetic Variants, Vcf Files, Snps
AI Description: SNPsift is a software tool used for filtering and annotating genetic variants, particularly single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs), in VCF files. It allows users to perform various operations to identify and extract relevant variants based on specified criteria.

Software Description: Soapdenovo2 is a short-read assembly method to build de novo draft assembly.
Core Features:
1. De novo assembly of short reads
2. Improved scalability and adaptability
3. High-quality assemblies for complex genomes
4. Handles large amounts of data efficiently
5. Capable of detecting various types of variations
General Tags: De Novo Assembly, Short Reads, Illumina Platform
AI Description: SOAPdenovo2 is a standalone de novo assembler specifically designed to assemble short reads generated on the Illumina platform. It is an updated version of SOAPdenovo which includes improvements in scalability, adaptability to different data sizes, and provides high-quality assemblies for complex genomes.

Software Description: SortMeRNA is a local sequence alignment tool for filtering, mapping and clustering.
